translated: The bodhisattvas who have realized the qualities of the tathagatas and possess the vision of the dharma request and praise the definitive meaning of their realization with verses of speech, and the tathagatas are pleased and grant permission.🔽The bodhisattvas request the tathagatas to explain the difficult points of the meaning taught in the root tantra, and the tathagatas grant permission for the bodhisattvas to speak well and explain.

translated: the reply to the request of the tathagatas, which resolves doubts, resolving doubts and abiding in the state of uniformity, becoming silent, the request to clear away the obstruction of doubt regarding the words that resolve doubts and praise through great qualities,

translated: the tathagatas' praise of the words of that request and the clearing away of obstructions without contradiction, the retinue rejoicing in that and the words of praise that are well spoken, the explanation that the vajra master who definitely realizes the meaning of secret mantra should not be abandoned because he is like the teacher,

original: de ltar bstan pas dga' nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bstod pa dang / 'khor dang rgyud kyi don dang / de 'dzin @54b par byed pa'i slob dpon dang slob mar bcas pa la don dang ldan pa'i tshig gis bstod pa dang / rgyud 'di las de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsang ba 'byung zhing gsang ba thams cad kyang 'dir 'dus pas rgyal por gyur pa yin par bstan pa dang /

translated: As such, the teacher and retinue are delighted by the explanation, the bodhisattvas praise, the meaning of the tantra and the retinue, and the master and disciples who uphold it are praised with meaningful words.🔽Since the secret of all tathāgatas arises from this tantra and all secrets are included here, it is taught to be the king.

original: don de dag bshad cing mnyan nas ston pa dang 'khor du bcas pa thams cad rang rang gi sku gsung thugs la zhugs te mnyam pa nyid du dmigs nas cang mi gsung bar gyur pa rnams kyis bstan to //

translated: Those topics are explained and heard, and the teacher and all the retinue enter into their individual bodies, voices, and minds and focus on uniformity.

original: de dag kyang rim par skabs dang sbyar na rgyud 'dir gtso bo dang 'khor la don gyi khyad par med par bstan du zin kyang mtshan gyi khyad par gyi sgo nas shes bya rdzogs ma rdzogs dang / cha lugs kyi sgo nas bla 'og gi khyad par yod cing ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'byung ba'i slob dpon dang slob ma dag kyang 'og nas bla ma la zhu ba'i rag las pa yod par bstan cing /

translated: In order to apply those in sequence, although in this tantra the principal one and the retinue are taught without any difference in meaning, they are to be known by means of the difference in their names, whether the object of knowledge is complete or incomplete, and by means of their attire, whether they are above or below.

original: sngags kyi che ba brjod par bya ba'i don ched du byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis rang gi rtogs tshad nges pa'i don gsol zhing bstod pa bstan to //

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni sngon gyi smon lam dang 'phral gyi dus mkhyen pa'i dbang gis gdul bya ji ltar mos pa'i don mdzad pas dgyes nas gnang ba byin pa bstan to //

translated: The meaning of the secret vehicle is profound and vast, so by explaining it now, the retinue will be satisfied, and in the future, those who will practice mantra will enter by way of confidence in the words and meaning.🔽Since the request is the point of the meaning, the tathāgatas

translated: If the tathagatas also abide in a great number of enumerations, in what kind of family, body, and wisdom do they abide and reign?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad ces smos pas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa 'khor gyi de bzhin gshegs pa til gyi gong bu lta bus sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su gang bar gyur te bzhugs pa rnams so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad ces smos pas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa 'khor gyi de bzhin gshegs pa til gyi gong bu lta bus sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su gang bar gyur te bzhugs pa rnams so //
translated: The phrase all those Tathagatas refers to the Tathagatas of the retinue, such as Vairocana, who fill the Buddha-fields like sesame seeds and are present.

original: 'o na byang chub sems dpa' rnams la ni yon tan mi mnga' 'am zhe na ;
analyzed: 'o na byang chub sems dpa' rnams la ni yon tan mi mnga' 'am zhe na ;
translated: Well, do the Bodhisattvas not have good qualities?

original: chos mthong ba dang ldan pa rnams zhes gsungs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: chos mthong ba dang ldan pa rnams zhes gsungs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The phrase endowed with the vision of the Dharma refers to those who have good qualities.

original: de dag gis ji ltar zhu ba zhus she na /
analyzed: de dag gis ji ltar zhu ba zhus she na /
translated: How did they ask?

original: kye ma kun du bzang po'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gsol zhing bstod pa'i tshul dang bcas par zhus pa'o //🔽da ni tshig de dag rim par 'bru gzhom zhin @56a * //
analyzed: kye ma kun du bzang po'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gsol zhing bstod pa'i tshul dang bcas par zhus pa'o // da ni tshig de dag rim par 'bru gzhom zhin @56a * //
translated: With the words Oh, Samantabhadra! and so on, they asked with a manner of praise.🔽Now, those words will be explained in order, beginning with then.

original: bshad de / de nas zhes bya ba ni aa tha kha lu kha zhes bya ba'i sgras des gong ma'i mjug bsdus nas 'og ma'i mgo 'dren te /
analyzed: bshad de / de nas zhes bya ba ni aa tha kha lu kha zhes bya ba'i sgras des gong ma'i mjug bsdus nas 'og ma'i mgo 'dren te /
translated: The word atha means then, and the word khalu means indeed.

original: rtsa ba'i rgyud bar ma chad par skabs 'brel bar byed pa dang bar chad med par mtshams 'brel ba de nyid bkra shis par ston pa yang yin no //🔽byang chub sems dpa' yang yin la /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rgyud bar ma chad par skabs 'brel bar byed pa dang bar chad med par mtshams 'brel ba de nyid bkra shis par ston pa yang yin no // byang chub sems dpa' yang yin la /
translated: It also shows that the root tantra is auspicious, in that it is connected in terms of the context without interruption, and it is connected in terms of the topic without interruption.

original: sems dpa' chen po yang yin pa'i don dang ldan pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i chos kyi rgyal tshab tu dbang bskur zhing skye ba gcig gis thogs pa ste /
analyzed: sems dpa' chen po yang yin pa'i don dang ldan pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i chos kyi rgyal tshab tu dbang bskur zhing skye ba gcig gis thogs pa ste /
translated: The meaning of “bodhisattva” is that he is endowed with the meaning of “great being.” He is anointed as the future regent of the Dharma, and he is obstructed by only one birth.

original: sa bcu pa'i byang chub sems dpa' byams pa ste /
analyzed: sa bcu pa'i byang chub sems dpa' byams pa ste /
translated: The bodhisattva Maitreya is a bodhisattva on the tenth stage.

original: mi pham pa zhes kyang grags pa'o //
analyzed: mi pham pa zhes kyang grags pa'o //
translated: He is also known as Ajita.

original: sogs kyi sgras ni brjod kyis mi lang ba'i yang brjod kyis mi lang ba'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rdul phra mo snyed kyi byang chub sems dpa' gzhan yang bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs kyi sgras ni brjod kyis mi lang ba'i yang brjod kyis mi lang ba'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rdul phra mo snyed kyi byang chub sems dpa' gzhan yang bsdu'o //
translated: The term “and so on” includes other bodhisattvas equal to the particles of an inexpressible buddha realm.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa 'khor gyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa 'khor gyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams so //
translated: The “tathāgatas” are the retinue tathāgatas such as Vairocana.

original: de rnams kyi yon tan ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dbang dang zhes te /
analyzed: de rnams kyi yon tan ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dbang dang zhes te /
translated: The qualities of those are “the empowerment of all the tathagatas.”🔽It is stated below:

original: 'og nas / dbang gi rnam pa gsum dag tu //
analyzed: 'og nas / dbang gi rnam pa gsum dag tu //
translated: The three types of empowerment

original: rgyud 'di las ni kun du bstan //
analyzed: rgyud 'di las ni kun du bstan //
translated: are taught in this tantra.

original: bum pa'i dbang ni dang po ste //
analyzed: bum pa'i dbang ni dang po ste //
translated: The vase empowerment is the first,

original: gnyis pa la ni gsang ba'i dbang //
analyzed: gnyis pa la ni gsang ba'i dbang //
translated: the second is the secret empowerment,

original: gsum pa shes rab ye shes te //
analyzed: gsum pa shes rab ye shes te //
translated: the third is the wisdom-knowledge empowerment,🔽and likewise the fourth.

original: de ltar de bzhin bzhi pa'o //🔽zhes gsungs pas //
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin bzhi pa'o // zhes gsungs pas //
translated: Thus,

original: phyi nang gsang ba gsum bsdus te //
analyzed: phyi nang gsang ba gsum bsdus te //
translated: the outer, inner, and secret are included.

original: phyi'i dbang bum pa la sogs pa dang // nang gi dbang thabs dang shes rab la sogs pa dang / gsang ba'i dbang yab yum gyi byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: phyi'i dbang bum pa la sogs pa dang // nang gi dbang thabs dang shes rab la sogs pa dang / gsang ba'i dbang yab yum gyi byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: The outer empowerment is the vase empowerment and so on, the inner empowerment is the method and wisdom empowerment and so on, and the secret empowerment is the bodhicitta of the father and mother.

original: de la 'dir ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi zhes smos pas yab yum thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med pa'i bde ba'i sgra dang / lhag pa byang chub sems kyi 'od zer gyis kyo bas phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas yab yum sras dang bcas pa thams cad sku la bsdus nas /
analyzed: de la 'dir ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi zhes smos pas yab yum thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med pa'i bde ba'i sgra dang / lhag pa byang chub sems kyi 'od zer gyis kyo bas phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas yab yum sras dang bcas pa thams cad sku la bsdus nas /
translated: Here, the phrase “all tathāgatas” refers to the sounds of bliss of the nondual method and wisdom of the fathers and mothers, and the light rays of bodhicitta that draw in all the buddhas, fathers and mothers, and their sons in the ten directions and dissolve them into the body.🔽The bodhicitta melts into the essence of bodhicitta and gathers into the secret space, which is the empowerment conferral.

original: lhag pa byang chub sems kyi ngo bor zhu ba gsang ba'i mkha' la 'dus pas dbang bskur ba dang / 'phro 'du de nyid lta bu lus las slar 'thon pa lha mo'i tshogs su gyur pas bdud rtsi'i bum pa thogs nas mgo bor dbang bskur bas rang gi rigs kyi bdag po dbu rgyan du byas pa gtsor smos te /
analyzed: lhag pa byang chub sems kyi ngo bor zhu ba gsang ba'i mkha' la 'dus pas dbang bskur ba dang / 'phro 'du de nyid lta bu lus las slar 'thon pa lha mo'i tshogs su gyur pas bdud rtsi'i bum pa thogs nas mgo bor dbang bskur bas rang gi rigs kyi bdag po dbu rgyan du byas pa gtsor smos te /
translated: The light rays emanate and reabsorb, and the light rays leave the body in the form of a host of goddesses holding vases of elixir. They confer empowerment on the head, and the lord of one’s family is placed on one’s head.

original: des mtshon nas dbang thams cad tshang bar bskur @56b ba'i don dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: des mtshon nas dbang thams cad tshang bar bskur @56b ba'i don dang ldan pa'o //
translated: This is the main empowerment.

original: sku gsung thugs kyi gsang ba bstan pa zhes bya ba ni rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi slad du sngar gsungs pa'am /
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi gsang ba bstan pa zhes bya ba ni rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi slad du sngar gsungs pa'am /
translated: The explanation of the secret of body, speech, and mind is the explanation of the root tantra.

original: 'og 'di nas phyis 'byung ba ltar phyi nang gsang ba dang / thun mong dang zab mor bshad pa'i tshul gyis rgyu'i dbang du byas na pho mo la sogs pa'i rnam par snang ba'i chos thams cad ni lus ngag yid gsum gyi ngo bor grub la /
analyzed: 'og 'di nas phyis 'byung ba ltar phyi nang gsang ba dang / thun mong dang zab mor bshad pa'i tshul gyis rgyu'i dbang du byas na pho mo la sogs pa'i rnam par snang ba'i chos thams cad ni lus ngag yid gsum gyi ngo bor grub la /
translated: Or, as will be explained below, in terms of the cause, all phenomena appearing in the aspect of male and female and so on are established in the essence of body, speech, and mind.

original: der de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gsung thugs rdo rje 'dus pa las /
analyzed: der de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gsung thugs rdo rje 'dus pa las /
translated: From the assembly of the body, speech, and mind of the tathagatas,

original: de'i don gzhan gyis rtogs par mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: de'i don gzhan gyis rtogs par mi nus pa'o //
translated: the meaning of that cannot be realized by others.

original: 'bras bu'i dbang du byas na de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gsung thugs rdo rje pho mo la sogs pa'i rnam par snang ba'i chos de dag 'dus pa las gzhan gyis de'i don rtogs par mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i dbang du byas na de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gsung thugs rdo rje pho mo la sogs pa'i rnam par snang ba'i chos de dag 'dus pa las gzhan gyis de'i don rtogs par mi nus pa'o //
translated: In terms of the result, the meaning of that cannot be realized by others from the assembly of those phenomena appearing in the aspect of male and female and so on of the body, speech, and mind of the tathagatas.

original: rgyu 'bras ro gcig pa'i dbang du na chos thams cad ni gsang ba bzhir 'dus la /
analyzed: rgyu 'bras ro gcig pa'i dbang du na chos thams cad ni gsang ba bzhir 'dus la /
translated: In terms of the single taste of cause and result, all phenomena are included in the four secrets.

original: de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gsung thugs kyi gsang bar 'dus la ;
analyzed: de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gsung thugs kyi gsang bar 'dus la ;
translated: It is gathered into the secret of the body, speech, and mind of the tathagatas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gsung thugs kyi gsang ba'i phyag rgya rnam pa bzhir 'dus pa de lta bu'i don ston pas bstan pa thos shing mkhyen pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gsung thugs kyi gsang ba'i phyag rgya rnam pa bzhir 'dus pa de lta bu'i don ston pas bstan pa thos shing mkhyen pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the teaching that shows that it is gathered into the four kinds of seals of the secret of the body, speech, and mind of the tathagatas is the quality of hearing and knowing the teaching.

original: dngos po thams cad kyi dam tshig ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad kyi dam tshig ces bya ba ni /
translated: The “pledge of all things” is as follows.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dbang bskur ba dang ; sku gsung thugs kyi gsang ba bstan pa dang / de ltar bstan pa'i dngos po de dag thams cad kyi mtshan nyid ni mi 'da' ba'i dam tshig 'di ltar mthong ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dbang bskur ba dang ; sku gsung thugs kyi gsang ba bstan pa dang / de ltar bstan pa'i dngos po de dag thams cad kyi mtshan nyid ni mi 'da' ba'i dam tshig 'di ltar mthong ste /
translated: The characteristics of all those things that are taught, such as the empowerment of all tathagatas and the teaching of the secret of body, speech, and mind, are seen in this way as the pledge of non-transgression.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: mtshan mar snang ba thams cad ni sku ji lta ba bzhin mthong /
analyzed: mtshan mar snang ba thams cad ni sku ji lta ba bzhin mthong /
translated: All appearances as signs are seen just as they are in the body.

original: sgrar grag pa thams cad ni gsung ji lta ba bzhin thos /
analyzed: sgrar grag pa thams cad ni gsung ji lta ba bzhin thos /
translated: All sounds that resound are heard just as they are in speech.

original: mtshan ma med pa thams cad ni thugs ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs zhes bya gnyis su na spyi dang khyad par dang rtsa ba dang yan lag dang bza' ba dang bsrung bas bsdus pa'i dngos po thams cad kyi dam tshig ji lta ba bzhin du bsrungs shing
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa thams cad ni thugs ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs zhes bya gnyis su na spyi dang khyad par dang rtsa ba dang yan lag dang bza' ba dang bsrung bas bsdus pa'i dngos po thams cad kyi dam tshig ji lta ba bzhin du bsrungs shing
translated: In another way, the result of having guarded and accomplished the samayas of all things included in the general, the particular, the root, the branches, the things to be eaten, and the things to be guarded

original: bsgrubs pa'i 'bras bu mngon du gyur pas yon tan gyi rnam par grol ba'i rgyan du snang bas brgyan pa'i sku lta bas chog mi shes pa mig gis mthong /
analyzed: bsgrubs pa'i 'bras bu mngon du gyur pas yon tan gyi rnam par grol ba'i rgyan du snang bas brgyan pa'i sku lta bas chog mi shes pa mig gis mthong /
translated: is the appearance of the body that is adorned with the ornaments of the liberation of qualities, which is seen with the eyes and is never satisfied by being seen.

original: tshig gi gsung phan pa ston pas so sor rig pa bzhi dang ldan pa'i chos rgya chen po rna bas thos /
analyzed: tshig gi gsung phan pa ston pas so sor rig pa bzhi dang ldan pa'i chos rgya chen po rna bas thos /
translated: The vast Dharma, which is endowed with the four kinds of correct knowledge, is heard with the ears.

original: don gyi gsung bden pa mtshon pa brjod du med cing zab pa @57a * //
analyzed: don gyi gsung bden pa mtshon pa brjod du med cing zab pa @57a * //
translated: The meaning of the speech is the inexpressible, profound indication of the truth.

original: sems las mi g-yo zhing thugs mnyam pa nyid kyi ngang las mi g-yo ba'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin du sems kyis rtogs nas /
analyzed: sems las mi g-yo zhing thugs mnyam pa nyid kyi ngang las mi g-yo ba'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin du sems kyis rtogs nas /
translated: Having realized the nature of gnosis, which does not move from the mind, and does not move from the state of the sameness of the mind,

original: de lta bu'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa de dag thams cad la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa la sogs pa chos mthong ba dang ldan pa rnams kyis gsol zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de lta bu'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa de dag thams cad la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa la sogs pa chos mthong ba dang ldan pa rnams kyis gsol zhes bya ba ste /
translated: All the Tathagatas, such as Vairocana, who possess such qualities, the Bodhisattva-mahasattva Maitreya and so forth, who are endowed with the vision of Dharma, made a request.

original: de la chos mthong ba dang ldan pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yon tan dang / mu stegs kyi chos dang / nyan thos kyi chos dang / rang rgyal ba'i chos de dag gi sems dang ye shes kyis rtogs pa'i yul du gyur pa'i chos thams cad kyang thogs chags med pa mi dmigs par mthong ba dang /
analyzed: de la chos mthong ba dang ldan pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yon tan dang / mu stegs kyi chos dang / nyan thos kyi chos dang / rang rgyal ba'i chos de dag gi sems dang ye shes kyis rtogs pa'i yul du gyur pa'i chos thams cad kyang thogs chags med pa mi dmigs par mthong ba dang /
translated: Here, being endowed with the vision of Dharma means that the Bodhisattvas, with their minds and wisdom, have realized all phenomena that are the objects of the qualities of the Bodhisattvas, the Dharmas of the tirthikas, the Dharmas of the Sravakas, and the Dharmas of the Pratyekabuddhas, and they see them without obstruction and without reference.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis shes par bya ba'i yul dang / phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched thams cad gzung 'dzin gyi rnam pa dang bral ba dang / kun rdzob tu snang ba thams cad sgyu ma dang smig rgyu la sogs pa lta bur mthong ba dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis shes par bya ba'i yul dang / phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched thams cad gzung 'dzin gyi rnam pa dang bral ba dang / kun rdzob tu snang ba thams cad sgyu ma dang smig rgyu la sogs pa lta bur mthong ba dang /
translated: The objects to be known by bodhisattvas, all the aggregates, constituents and sense fields, are free from the aspects of apprehended object and apprehending subject, and all that appears conventionally is seen as being like illusions, mirages and so forth.

original: sa dang po nas bcu pa'i bar du rtogs par bya ba'i khyad par du gyur pa'i chos de dag thams cad kyang rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs shing mkhyen pa la ni chos mthong ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sa dang po nas bcu pa'i bar du rtogs par bya ba'i khyad par du gyur pa'i chos de dag thams cad kyang rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs shing mkhyen pa la ni chos mthong ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The knowledge and realization of all those special phenomena to be realized from the first to the tenth levels is called “endowed with the vision of phenomena.”

original: ye shes kyis rtogs par gyur pa la gdags par zad kyi mig gi dbang po dang rnam par shes pas mthong ba zer ba la ni mi bzung ngo //
analyzed: ye shes kyis rtogs par gyur pa la gdags par zad kyi mig gi dbang po dang rnam par shes pas mthong ba zer ba la ni mi bzung ngo //
translated: It is simply designated as realization through gnosis, but it should not be taken as being seen by the eye faculty and consciousness.

original: 'o na rtsa ba'i rgyud las ni gleng gzhi'i skabs su ni dam tshig gi rdo rje la sogs pa dang por smos pa las /
analyzed: 'o na rtsa ba'i rgyud las ni gleng gzhi'i skabs su ni dam tshig gi rdo rje la sogs pa dang por smos pa las /
translated: Well, in the root tantra, in the context of the nidāna, the vajra of commitment and so forth are mentioned first.

original: le'u 'di'i skabs su byams pa dang por smos pa ci'i phyir zhe na ;
analyzed: le'u 'di'i skabs su byams pa dang por smos pa ci'i phyir zhe na ;
translated: Why is Maitreya mentioned first in this chapter?

original: smras pa / dam tshig rdo rje la sogs pa ni 'bras bu'i byang chub sems dpa' ye shes las byung zhing gsal ba las skyes pa /
analyzed: smras pa / dam tshig rdo rje la sogs pa ni 'bras bu'i byang chub sems dpa' ye shes las byung zhing gsal ba las skyes pa /
translated: It is said that Vajra of Sacred Pledge and the others are resultant bodhisattvas who have arisen from wisdom and are born from the clear light.

original: rdo rje'i skye mched rnam par dag pa'i sems dpa' yin pas the tshom za ba'i rtog pa mi mnga' la /
analyzed: rdo rje'i skye mched rnam par dag pa'i sems dpa' yin pas the tshom za ba'i rtog pa mi mnga' la /
translated: They are bodhisattvas who are the pure vajra sense bases, so they do not have doubts.

original: byams pa ni rgyud dag pa'i byang chub sems dpa' mtshan nyid kyi theg pa la rgyud sbyangs shing /
analyzed: byams pa ni rgyud dag pa'i byang chub sems dpa' mtshan nyid kyi theg pa la rgyud sbyangs shing /
translated: Maitreya is a bodhisattva of pure continuum who has trained in the vehicle of characteristics.

original: sa bcu'i ye shes mngon du gyur du zin kyang /
analyzed: sa bcu'i ye shes mngon du gyur du zin kyang /
translated: He has actualized the wisdom of the tenth bhumi.

original: 'bras bu rdo rje theg pa la rnam par thar pa zhen par ma sbyangs pas /
analyzed: 'bras bu rdo rje theg pa la rnam par thar pa zhen par ma sbyangs pas /
translated: However, he has not trained in the liberation of the resultant Vajrayana.🔽Therefore, although he has heard the meaning of this tantra, he has doubts about not having actualized it.

original: rgyud 'di'i don thos kyang mngon du ma gyur pa'i the tshom za ba yod pa dag bsal bar 'dod pa'i phyir 'dir smos shing zhu ba por @57b bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: rgyud 'di'i don thos kyang mngon du ma gyur pa'i the tshom za ba yod pa dag bsal bar 'dod pa'i phyir 'dir smos shing zhu ba por @57b bstan pa yin la /
translated: Here, he is taught to be the questioner in order to dispel those doubts.

original: gzhan du na sa bcu'i byang chub sems dpa' byams pas kyang rgyud 'di'i don ma rtogs na gzhan gyis rtogs par gyur pa lta ci smos pas /
analyzed: gzhan du na sa bcu'i byang chub sems dpa' byams pas kyang rgyud 'di'i don ma rtogs na gzhan gyis rtogs par gyur pa lta ci smos pas /
translated: Otherwise, if even Maitreya, a bodhisattva on the tenth ground, had not understood the meaning of this tantra, what need is there to speak of others understanding it?

original: phal gyi spyod yul ma yin pas rab tu gsang bar bstan pa dang / gang zhig 'di la 'jug cing spyod pa'i skal pa yod pa rnams kyis kyang /
analyzed: phal gyi spyod yul ma yin pas rab tu gsang bar bstan pa dang / gang zhig 'di la 'jug cing spyod pa'i skal pa yod pa rnams kyis kyang /
translated: It is also taught that it is extremely secret because it is not the domain of ordinary beings.

original: brtson pa drag pos nan tan du 'bad cing yang nas yang du sri zhu goms par bya ste /
analyzed: brtson pa drag pos nan tan du 'bad cing yang nas yang du sri zhu goms par bya ste /
translated: Those who have the good fortune to engage in and practice this tantra should strive with intense effort and repeatedly cultivate familiarity with it.

original: tshig dang don la the tshom za ba med par bsal dgos par bstan pa yang yin la /
analyzed: tshig dang don la the tshom za ba med par bsal dgos par bstan pa yang yin la /
translated: It is also taught that one must clear away any doubts one may have regarding the words and their meaning.

original: byams pas the tshom med par rtogs su zin kyang /
analyzed: byams pas the tshom med par rtogs su zin kyang /
translated: Even though Maitreya has understood this tantra without any doubt,

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus su nyid mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i tshe rang gi 'khor dam par gyur pa rnams la ngas sngon chos 'di lta bur 'byung bar dkon zhing rtogs par dka' ba las thos te /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus su nyid mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i tshe rang gi 'khor dam par gyur pa rnams la ngas sngon chos 'di lta bur 'byung bar dkon zhing rtogs par dka' ba las thos te /
translated: in the future, when he attains complete buddhahood, he will say to his own retinue, “In the past, I heard that this kind of dharma is rare and difficult to understand.

original: yang dang yang du zhus shing nan tan byas so zhes bstan pa'i sgo nas sngags kyi che ba brjod pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i sngags spyod pa'i skal ba yod pa rnams gsang ba'i man ngag thob pa'i rdo rje slob dpon la yang dang yang du btud cing zhus te man ngag nod dgos par bstan pa yang yin te /
analyzed: yang dang yang du zhus shing nan tan byas so zhes bstan pa'i sgo nas sngags kyi che ba brjod pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i sngags spyod pa'i skal ba yod pa rnams gsang ba'i man ngag thob pa'i rdo rje slob dpon la yang dang yang du btud cing zhus te man ngag nod dgos par bstan pa yang yin te /
translated: The expression again and again indicates the greatness of the mantra, and also indicates that those who have the fortune to practice the mantra in the future should bow again and again to the vajra master who has obtained the secret instructions and request the instructions.

original: don de lta bu'i phyir byams pa dang por smos shing des zhu ba bstan pa yin pa rig par bya'o //
analyzed: don de lta bu'i phyir byams pa dang por smos shing des zhu ba bstan pa yin pa rig par bya'o //
translated: For that reason, it should be understood that Maitreya is mentioned first and that he taught the request.

original: zhu ba'i don gyi dngos po ji lta bu yin par bstan pa yin pa'i phyir na /🔽kyes kun du bzang po yi //
analyzed: zhu ba'i don gyi dngos po ji lta bu yin par bstan pa yin pa'i phyir na / kyes kun du bzang po yi //
translated: In order to demonstrate the actual meaning of the request, it is said:🔽Ahy! The body, speech, and mind

original: sku gsung thugs kyi nges pa yi //🔽rdo rje gsum la kun du ni //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi nges pa yi // rdo rje gsum la kun du ni //
translated: of Samantabhadra,🔽the three vajras,

original: rdo rje gsum ni rnam bzhugs te //🔽zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rdo rje gsum ni rnam bzhugs te // zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: are present as the three vajras.

original: kye ma zhes bya ba ni ngo mtshar rmad du gyur pas ngom pa ste /
analyzed: kye ma zhes bya ba ni ngo mtshar rmad du gyur pas ngom pa ste /
translated: Ahy! is an expression of amazement and wonder.

original: tshig dang don dang rgyu dang 'bras bu la dgongs nas smos pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: tshig dang don dang rgyu dang 'bras bu la dgongs nas smos pa'i tshig go //
translated: The words are mentioned with the intention of word, meaning, cause, and result.🔽Moreover, if explained in common from the perspective of the general

original: de yang spyi'i dbang du byas nas thun mong du bshad na chos thams cad ni dus dang gnas skabs thams cad du kun du bzang po'i rang bzhin du gnas te /
analyzed: de yang spyi'i dbang du byas nas thun mong du bshad na chos thams cad ni dus dang gnas skabs thams cad du kun du bzang po'i rang bzhin du gnas te /
translated: tantra, all phenomena always abide as the nature of Samantabhadra.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sku gsung thugs kyi nges pa yi //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi nges pa yi //
translated: The certainty of body, speech, and mind

original: zhes bya ste gzugs su snang ba thams cad ni skur nges /
analyzed: zhes bya ste gzugs su snang ba thams cad ni skur nges /
translated: Since all appearances of form are ascertained as the body, all sounds

original: sgrar grag pa thams cad ni gsung du nges /
analyzed: sgrar grag pa thams cad ni gsung du nges /
translated: are ascertained as speech, and all memories and thoughts that are🔽inseparable from appearances and sounds are ascertained as the nature🔽of mind, it is said that all phenomena always abide as the nature of

original: snang ba dang grag pa dbyer med pa'i dran rtog thams cad ni thugs kyi rang bzhin du nges pa'i phyir kun du bzang po'i rang bzhin du gnas zhes bya ste /🔽dbyer med cing 'dus ma byas @58a * //
analyzed: snang ba dang grag pa dbyer med pa'i dran rtog thams cad ni thugs kyi rang bzhin du nges pa'i phyir kun du bzang po'i rang bzhin du gnas zhes bya ste / dbyer med cing 'dus ma byas @58a * //
translated: Samantabhadra.🔽Since the meaning of inseparability and unconditioned phenomena

original: pa'i don dang ldan pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: pa'i don dang ldan pa'i phyir na /
translated: are possessed,

original: rdo rje gsum zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: rdo rje gsum zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: it is also called the three vajras.

original: de'i rang bzhin la dus dang gnas skabs kun du de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gsung thugs rdo rje rnam gsum gnas shing /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin la dus dang gnas skabs kun du de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gsung thugs rdo rje rnam gsum gnas shing /
translated: The nature of that [vajra] is the abiding of the three vajras of the body, speech, and mind of the Tathagata at all times and in all situations.

original: skye zhing 'byung ba yang de las 'byung bas na rnam par bzhugs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skye zhing 'byung ba yang de las 'byung bas na rnam par bzhugs zhes bya'o //
translated: Since what is born and arises arises from that, it is called “abiding.”

original: der yang ma zad sems can dus gsum 'byung ba zhes te /
analyzed: der yang ma zad sems can dus gsum 'byung ba zhes te /
translated: Not only that, all sentient beings of the three times arise from that.🔽All sentient beings without exception abide in the essence of that vajra body, speech, and mind.

original: sems can ma lus pa thams cad sku gsung thugs rdo rje de'i ngo bo nyid du gnas te rang gi rang bzhin gyis byang chub rdo rje'i gnas thob pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sems can ma lus pa thams cad sku gsung thugs rdo rje de'i ngo bo nyid du gnas te rang gi rang bzhin gyis byang chub rdo rje'i gnas thob pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Their own nature is called “attaining the state of the vajra of enlightenment.”

original: rtogs pa rdo rje lta bu'i gnas thob pa de las /
analyzed: rtogs pa rdo rje lta bu'i gnas thob pa de las /
translated: From that, the state of the vajra of realization is attained.

original: sangs rgyas rdo rje rdzu 'phrul che //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rdo rje rdzu 'phrul che //
translated: “The vajra buddha with great magic”

original: zhes pa 'di lta bu yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa 'di lta bu yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: means that this will also occur.

original: khyad par gyi dbang du byas nas zab mo ltar bshad na /
analyzed: khyad par gyi dbang du byas nas zab mo ltar bshad na /
translated: In particular, if explained according to the profound [system],

original: ston pa byang chub sems rdo rje ni dus dang gnas skabs kun du bzang por gnas kyi nam yang ngan par mi 'gyur bas na mtshan gyi rnam grangs kun du bzang po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ston pa byang chub sems rdo rje ni dus dang gnas skabs kun du bzang por gnas kyi nam yang ngan par mi 'gyur bas na mtshan gyi rnam grangs kun du bzang po zhes bya ste /
translated: The teacher Bodhisattva Vajra is always good in all times and circumstances and never becomes bad, so he is called Samantabhadra, the name of his family.

original: de'i sku gsung thugs kyi rang bzhin ni nges pa'i mtshan nyid can yin te /
analyzed: de'i sku gsung thugs kyi rang bzhin ni nges pa'i mtshan nyid can yin te /
translated: His nature of body, speech, and mind is of the nature of definitive characteristics.🔽The definitive characteristic of his body is that it is the nature of the dharmakāya, which pervades all phenomena.🔽The definitive characteristic of his speech is that it is the nature of the nirmāṇakāya, which appears in the form of signs.🔽The definitive characteristic of his mind is that it is the nature of the saṃbhogakāya, which is endowed with the major and minor marks.

original: chos kyi sku thams cad la khyab pa'i bdag nyid du zhugs par nges pa gzugs kyi sku mtshan dang dpe byad du ldan pa mtshan ma'i rnam par snang bas nges tshig gi gsung rgya che ba 'gro ba ji ltar 'dul ba bzhin du phan pa'i don ston par
analyzed: chos kyi sku thams cad la khyab pa'i bdag nyid du zhugs par nges pa gzugs kyi sku mtshan dang dpe byad du ldan pa mtshan ma'i rnam par snang bas nges tshig gi gsung rgya che ba 'gro ba ji ltar 'dul ba bzhin du phan pa'i don ston par
translated: The definitive characteristic of his speech is that it is the nature of the nirmāṇakāya, which appears in the form of signs.

original: nges / don gyi gsung zab pa bden pa mtshon pas brjod pa mi mnga' ba'i ngang la bzhugs par nges /🔽thams cad mkhyen pa'i thugs shes bya thams cad kyi mtha' la 'jal bar nges /
analyzed: nges / don gyi gsung zab pa bden pa mtshon pas brjod pa mi mnga' ba'i ngang la bzhugs par nges /🔽thams cad mkhyen pa'i thugs shes bya thams cad kyi mtha' la 'jal bar nges /
translated: The definitive characteristic of his speech is that it is the nature of the nirmāṇakāya, which appears in the form of signs.🔽The definitive characteristic of his speech is that it is the nature of the nirmāṇakāya, which appears in the form of signs.🔽The definitive characteristic of his speech is that it is the nature of the nirmāṇakāya, which appears in the form of signs.🔽The definitive characteristic of his speech is that it is the nature of the nirmāṇakāya, which appears in the form of signs.🔽The definitive characteristic of his speech is that it is the nature of the nirmāṇakāya, which appears in the form of signs.🔽The definitive characteristic of his speech is that it is the nature of the nirmāṇakāya, which appears in the form of signs.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i thugs mnyam pa nyid kyi dang la mi g-yo bar gnas par nges pa'i mtshan nyid can yin te /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i thugs mnyam pa nyid kyi dang la mi g-yo bar gnas par nges pa'i mtshan nyid can yin te /
translated: It is the nature of the three vajras to be unmoving, to abide in the evenness of the nonconceptual mind.

original: 'gro ba gzhan gyi sgo gsum bzhin du ma nges shing mi brtan pa'i mtshan nyid can du gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gro ba gzhan gyi sgo gsum bzhin du ma nges shing mi brtan pa'i mtshan nyid can du gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: It does not abide in the nature of being uncertain and unstable, like the three doors of other beings.

original: de lta bu'i sku gsung thugs de ni rdo rje gsum zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de lta bu'i sku gsung thugs de ni rdo rje gsum zhes bya ste /
translated: That body, speech, and mind are called the three vajras.

original: sku rdo rje lta bur 'dus ma byas pa /
analyzed: sku rdo rje lta bur 'dus ma byas pa /
translated: The vajra body is uncompounded.

original: gsung rdo rje lta bur gzhan du mi 'gyur /
analyzed: gsung rdo rje lta bur gzhan du mi 'gyur /
translated: The vajra speech is unchanging.

original: thugs rdo rje lta bur ye shes lnga dang ldan //
analyzed: thugs rdo rje lta bur ye shes lnga dang ldan //
translated: The vajra mind is endowed with the five wisdoms.

original: sku gsung thugs gsum ga yang rdo rje lta bu'i dang nyid du dbyer med cing mtshan mar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: sku gsung thugs gsum ga yang rdo rje lta bu'i dang nyid du dbyer med cing mtshan mar mi 'gyur /
translated: The body, speech, and mind are indivisible in the vajra nature, and they are not subject to change as a sign.

original: gnyen pos mi shigs pa yin te /
analyzed: gnyen pos mi shigs pa yin te /
translated: They are indestructible by any antidote.

original: de la ni dus dang gnas skabs kun du //
analyzed: de la ni dus dang gnas skabs kun du //
translated: At all times and in all situations,

original: rdo rje gsum ni rnam bzhugs @58b te ;
analyzed: rdo rje gsum ni rnam bzhugs @58b te ;
translated: the three vajras abide.

original: / zhes te dus gsum du gshegs shing phyogs bcur bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sku gsung thugs rdo rje rnam pa gsum yang bzhugs shing gnas te /
analyzed: / zhes te dus gsum du gshegs shing phyogs bcur bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sku gsung thugs rdo rje rnam pa gsum yang bzhugs shing gnas te /
translated: Thus, the three vajras of body, speech, and mind of all the buddhas who have come in the three times and abide in the ten directions are present and abide in the teacher, the bodhisattva Vajra Samantabhadra.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad bzhugs pa'i gnas dang 'byung ba'i rgyur gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad bzhugs pa'i gnas dang 'byung ba'i rgyur gyur pa yin no //
translated: He is the place where all buddhas abide and the cause from which they arise.

original: gnyis su na ston pa byang chub sems rdo rje kun du bzang po de'i sku gsung thugs kyi rang bzhin don dam par mtshan ma med par nges la /
analyzed: gnyis su na ston pa byang chub sems rdo rje kun du bzang po de'i sku gsung thugs kyi rang bzhin don dam par mtshan ma med par nges la /
translated: Second, the teacher, the bodhisattva Vajra Samantabhadra, is the nature of body, speech, and mind. Ultimately, he is ascertained to be without signs.

original: yang dag par kun rdzob tu mtshan ma'i rnam par snang bar nges la /
analyzed: yang dag par kun rdzob tu mtshan ma'i rnam par snang bar nges la /
translated: Conventionally, he is ascertained to appear as the aspect of signs.

original: mtshan ma dang mtshan ma med par dbyer med pas rdo rje gsum gyi ngo bor gnas pa yin la /
analyzed: mtshan ma dang mtshan ma med par dbyer med pas rdo rje gsum gyi ngo bor gnas pa yin la /
translated: Since signs and signlessness are inseparable, he abides as the essence of the three vajras.

original: dus dang gnas skabs kun du de ni phyogs bcu dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas rnams kyi sku gsung thugs rdo rje gsum du yang snang zhing ston te /
analyzed: dus dang gnas skabs kun du de ni phyogs bcu dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas rnams kyi sku gsung thugs rdo rje gsum du yang snang zhing ston te /
translated: At all times and in all situations, he appears as the three vajras of the buddhas of the three times and ten directions.

original: de lta bu'i rnam par bzhugs te gdul bya rnams kyi don mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam par bzhugs te gdul bya rnams kyi don mdzad pa yin no //
translated: Abiding in that way, he acts for the benefit of those to be tamed.

original: 'o na ming dang gzugs kyis bsdus pa'i sems can rnams ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ming dang gzugs kyis bsdus pa'i sems can rnams ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Well then, how is it that sentient beings are included within name and form?

original: sems can dus gsum du 'byung ba zhes te dus gsum du 'byung ba'i sems can thams cad kyang chos nyid ji bzhin pa'i don ma rtogs pa'i dus na sems can du snang bar zad kyi /
analyzed: sems can dus gsum du 'byung ba zhes te dus gsum du 'byung ba'i sems can thams cad kyang chos nyid ji bzhin pa'i don ma rtogs pa'i dus na sems can du snang bar zad kyi /
translated: All sentient beings who appear in the three times are only sentient beings when the meaning of the way things are is not realized.

original: rtogs pa'i dus na thams cad rdo rje'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: rtogs pa'i dus na thams cad rdo rje'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ste /
translated: When realized, all are called “the essence of the vajra.”

original: ye shes rdo rje lta bu'i mtshan nyid can /
analyzed: ye shes rdo rje lta bu'i mtshan nyid can /
translated: The characteristic of the vajra-like pristine consciousness

original: ston pa byang chub sems rdo rje'i ngo bo nyid du dbyer med par gnas te /
analyzed: ston pa byang chub sems rdo rje'i ngo bo nyid du dbyer med par gnas te /
translated: is the teacher, the essence of the vajra of bodhicitta, abiding inseparably.

original: rgyu byang chub kyi snying po can du gnas pa dang / 'bras bu de bzhin gshegs pa'i phyag rgya chen por snang du rung bas na /
analyzed: rgyu byang chub kyi snying po can du gnas pa dang / 'bras bu de bzhin gshegs pa'i phyag rgya chen por snang du rung bas na /
translated: Since the cause is the essence of bodhicitta and the result is suitable to appear as the great mudra of the tathāgatas,🔽therefore,

original: de'i phyir / byang chub rdo rje'i gnas thob pa //
analyzed: de'i phyir / byang chub rdo rje'i gnas thob pa //
translated: the attainment of the stage of vajra awakening

original: zhes bya'o // de las ni sems can du yang snang la gzugs kyi sku rgyun mi 'chad pa yang 'byung bas na /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // de las ni sems can du yang snang la gzugs kyi sku rgyun mi 'chad pa yang 'byung bas na /
translated: Since the continuum of the form body appears as sentient beings and arises without interruption,

original: sangs rgyas rdo rje rdzu 'phrul che //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rdo rje rdzu 'phrul che //
translated: the Buddha is the great vajra miracle.

original: zhes bya ste de lta bu'i don dang ldan pa ston pa byang chub sems rdo rje yin no zhes bstan nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ste de lta bu'i don dang ldan pa ston pa byang chub sems rdo rje yin no zhes bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having explained that the teacher is the vajra of bodhicitta, which possesses such meaning,

original: de ni ston pa des gsungs pa'i chos kyi don brjod pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: de ni ston pa des gsungs pa'i chos kyi don brjod pa'i phyir na /
translated: in order to express the meaning of the Dharma that is taught by that teacher,🔽it is said:

original: ae ma'o shin tu ngo mtshar 'di //🔽ae ma'o dbang po shin tu zhi ;
analyzed: ae ma'o shin tu ngo mtshar 'di // ae ma'o dbang po shin tu zhi ;
translated: Amazing! How amazing!🔽The pacification of the sense organs!

original: / ae ma'o 'khor ba dag gi rgyun //
analyzed: / ae ma'o 'khor ba dag gi rgyun //
translated: Amazing! The continuum of samsara!

original: ae ma'o mchog tu mya ngan 'das //🔽zhes gsungs te 'dir yang thun mong gi dbang du ni tshig gi sgo nas /
analyzed: ae ma'o mchog tu mya ngan 'das // zhes gsungs te 'dir yang thun mong gi dbang du ni tshig gi sgo nas /
translated: Amazing! The supreme transcendence of suffering!

original: ae ma'o zhes ngom zhing don la shin tu ngo mtshar skyes pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: ae ma'o zhes ngom zhing don la shin tu ngo mtshar skyes pa'i tshig ste /
translated: Here, in terms of the common [vehicle], the word “amazing” is a word of amazement and wonder at the meaning.

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pas bsdus pa'i chos @59a * //
analyzed: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pas bsdus pa'i chos @59a * //
translated: The phenomena included in samsara and nirvana.

original: 'di dag gi mtshan nyid ni gcig pa yang ma yin tha dad pa yang ma yin pa ngo mtshar che zhes brjod pa ste /
analyzed: 'di dag gi mtshan nyid ni gcig pa yang ma yin tha dad pa yang ma yin pa ngo mtshar che zhes brjod pa ste /
translated: The characteristic of these is not the same, nor is it different.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: yang dag pa'i kun rdzob tu 'khor ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi mtshan nyid du gnas la /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i kun rdzob tu 'khor ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi mtshan nyid du gnas la /
translated: In the correct relative, samsara is present as the characteristic of being afflicted.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni rnam par byang bcan gyi mtshan nyid du gnas /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni rnam par byang bcan gyi mtshan nyid du gnas /
translated: Nirvana is present as the characteristic of being pure.

original: 'khor ba'i sems can ni 'dus byas shing zag pa can gyi mtshan nyid du gnas la /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i sems can ni 'dus byas shing zag pa can gyi mtshan nyid du gnas la /
translated: Sentient beings of samsara are present as the characteristic of being conditioned and defiled.🔽The tathagatas are present as the characteristic of being unconditioned and undefiled.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni 'dus ma byas shing zag pa med pa'i mtshan nyid du gnas pas gcig pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni 'dus ma byas shing zag pa med pa'i mtshan nyid du gnas pas gcig pa yang ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, they are not the same.

original: sems can gyi chos nyid ji bzhin pa'i don rtogs na 'khor ba nyid mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: sems can gyi chos nyid ji bzhin pa'i don rtogs na 'khor ba nyid mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: If the nature of sentient beings is realized as it is, samsara is nirvana.

original: 'dus byas zag pa can gyi sems can nyid 'dus ma byas zag pa med pa sangs rgyas kyi skur snang ba dang sangs rgyas kyi sku dang ye shes kyis snod bcud kyi dngos po thams cad la khyab pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pas 'khor ba can gyi spyod🔽yul du snang ba'am ;
analyzed: 'dus byas zag pa can gyi sems can nyid 'dus ma byas zag pa med pa sangs rgyas kyi skur snang ba dang sangs rgyas kyi sku dang ye shes kyis snod bcud kyi dngos po thams cad la khyab pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pas 'khor ba can gyi spyod yul du snang ba'am ;
translated: The very nature of conditioned, defiled sentient beings is unconditioned and undefiled, appearing as the buddha body, and the buddha body and gnosis pervade all things in the universe, so the buddha body is the nature of all things.🔽The buddha body is not the same as sentient beings, nor is it different from them.

original: sems can 'khor ba'i spyod yul can du snang yang mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtshan nyid rang la rang chas su yod pas sems can las sangs rgyas su grub pa dang / sangs rgyas nyid sems can du snang bas gcig pa yang ma yin tha dad pa yang ma yin pa ngo mtshar che zhes bya /
analyzed: sems can 'khor ba'i spyod yul can du snang yang mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtshan nyid rang la rang chas su yod pas sems can las sangs rgyas su grub pa dang / sangs rgyas nyid sems can du snang bas gcig pa yang ma yin tha dad pa yang ma yin pa ngo mtshar che zhes bya /
translated: The buddha body is not the same as sentient beings, nor is it different from them.

original: ae ma'o dbang po shin tu zhi //
analyzed: ae ma'o dbang po shin tu zhi //
translated: This is the great wonder.🔽The line “Amazing! The faculties are utterly pure!”

original: zhes bya ba ni don de nyid rtogs par dka'o zhes ngom zhing ngo mtshar ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni don de nyid rtogs par dka'o zhes ngom zhing ngo mtshar ba ste /
translated: expresses amazement at the difficulty of realizing this point.

original: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos gcig pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos gcig pa yang ma yin /
translated: The phenomena of samsara and nirvana are neither the same nor different.

original: tha dad pa yang ma yin pa de ni dbang po'i spyod yul du gyur pa ma yin te /
analyzed: tha dad pa yang ma yin pa de ni dbang po'i spyod yul du gyur pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not different, and so it is not an object of the sense faculties.

original: rnam par shes pas rig par mi nus so ;
analyzed: rnam par shes pas rig par mi nus so ;
translated: It cannot be known by consciousness.

original: / ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: / ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: shin tu 'am rab tu zhi zhing phra ste /🔽mig gis gzugs mthong ba dang / rna bas sgra nyan pa dang / snas dri ba bsnams pa dang / lces ro myong ba dang / lus kyis reg bya reg pa'am /
analyzed: shin tu 'am rab tu zhi zhing phra ste / mig gis gzugs mthong ba dang / rna bas sgra nyan pa dang / snas dri ba bsnams pa dang / lces ro myong ba dang / lus kyis reg bya reg pa'am /
translated: It is extremely or utterly peaceful and subtle.🔽It is not an object that is clearly established, like the eyes seeing forms, the ears hearing sounds, the nose smelling smells, the tongue tasting tastes, the body feeling touchable things,

original: yid kyis gsal bar dpyad pa lta bu'i yul mngon du grub pa med pas de dag spyod yul du bya ba bzhin mi btub pa'am /
analyzed: yid kyis gsal bar dpyad pa lta bu'i yul mngon du grub pa med pas de dag spyod yul du bya ba bzhin mi btub pa'am /
translated: or the mind analyzing clearly. Therefore, it cannot be made into an object of those.

original: 'di la spyod yul thams cad med pa'i phyir na dbang po las 'das par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la spyod yul thams cad med pa'i phyir na dbang po las 'das par bstan pa'o //
translated: Or, because there are no objects in this, it is taught to be beyond the sense faculties.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin med pas zhi zhing phra yang 'khor ba mtshan ma'i rnam pa can rags par snang ba ci'i phyir dbang po'i spyod yul las 'das @59b pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin med pas zhi zhing phra yang 'khor ba mtshan ma'i rnam pa can rags par snang ba ci'i phyir dbang po'i spyod yul las 'das @59b pa yin zhe na /
translated: Since the nature of nirvana is not existent, it is peaceful and subtle. But why is samsara, which appears with the coarse aspects of characteristics, beyond the sense faculties?

original: smras pa / ae ma'o 'khor ba dag gi rgyun //🔽ae ma'o shin tu mya ngan 'das //
analyzed: smras pa / ae ma'o 'khor ba dag gi rgyun // ae ma'o shin tu mya ngan 'das //
translated: It was said:🔽Amazing! The continuum of cyclic existence.🔽Amazing! The complete transcendence of suffering.🔽

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: It is said:🔽Amazing! The continuum of samsara.🔽Amazing! The complete transcendence of suffering.

original: 'khor ba nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga //
analyzed: 'khor ba nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga //
translated: The five appropriated aggregates of samsara

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rgyu rkyen tshogs pa'i dbang gis mi rtag pa rgyun gyi ngo bor gnas pa ma brtags na nyams dga' ba'i ngo bo yod kyang de nyid gtso bor grub pa med de /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rgyu rkyen tshogs pa'i dbang gis mi rtag pa rgyun gyi ngo bor gnas pa ma brtags na nyams dga' ba'i ngo bo yod kyang de nyid gtso bor grub pa med de /
translated: are impermanent by the power of the assembly of causes and conditions of dependent origination. They abide as the essence of a continuum. Although they have an essence that is delightful if not examined, they do not exist as the principal nature.

original: 'khrul pa nyid de ltar snang bar rig na de nyid mya ngan las 'das pa'i ngo bo bas na sku dang ye shes thams cad kyi rang bzhin du bstan pa yin pa'i phyir na dbang po'i spyod yul las 'das zhes bya /
analyzed: 'khrul pa nyid de ltar snang bar rig na de nyid mya ngan las 'das pa'i ngo bo bas na sku dang ye shes thams cad kyi rang bzhin du bstan pa yin pa'i phyir na dbang po'i spyod yul las 'das zhes bya /
translated: If delusion itself is recognized as the appearance of that, it is the essence of the complete transcendence of suffering. Therefore, since it is explained as the nature of all kāyas and pristine consciousnesses, it is called “beyond the domain of the sense organs.”

original: gnyis su na gong ma'i don la bsnyegs te /
analyzed: gnyis su na gong ma'i don la bsnyegs te /
translated: Second, the meaning of the above is pursued.

original: ae ma'o 'khor ba rten 'brel gyi rgyun la gnas pas yul sems tha dad gzung 'dzin du snang ba de sems 'khrul pa yul du snang bas mtshan mar mthong yang /
analyzed: ae ma'o 'khor ba rten 'brel gyi rgyun la gnas pas yul sems tha dad gzung 'dzin du snang ba de sems 'khrul pa yul du snang bas mtshan mar mthong yang /
translated: perceivers is the deluded mind appearing as objects, and therefore seen🔽as signs.

original: sems rang bzhin med par rtogs na yul mtshan mar ma grub pas na /
analyzed: sems rang bzhin med par rtogs na yul mtshan mar ma grub pas na /
translated: However, if the mind is realized to be without any nature, objects are🔽not established as signs.🔽Therefore, the freedom from the percepts and perceivers of objects and🔽mind is nirvana.

original: yul sems gzung 'dzin dang bral ba nyid mya ngan las 'das pa yin pa ngo mtshar che zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yul sems gzung 'dzin dang bral ba nyid mya ngan las 'das pa yin pa ngo mtshar che zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: How amazing!

original: zab mo'i dbang du bya ste bshad na /
analyzed: zab mo'i dbang du bya ste bshad na /
translated: In the profound context, it is explained:

original: ae ma'o shin tu ngo mtshar che zhe'o //
analyzed: ae ma'o shin tu ngo mtshar che zhe'o //
translated: AHA! How extremely amazing!

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What is it?🔽This is the Guhyasamaja Tantra, which teaches that all phenomena are

original: chos thams cad sku gsung thugs kyi rang bzhin las gzhan med par ston pa'i gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud 'di zhe'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad sku gsung thugs kyi rang bzhin las gzhan med par ston pa'i gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud 'di zhe'o //
translated: nothing other than the nature of awakened body, speech, and mind.

original: ci'i phyir 'di la ngo mtshar skye zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'di la ngo mtshar skye zhe na /
translated: Why is this so amazing?

original: dbang po shin tu zhi ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dbang po shin tu zhi ba zhes bya ste /
translated: It is called the extremely peaceful sense organ.

original: mig la sogs pa dbang po lnga'i spyod yul du bab pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i yul 'dod pa'i yon tan rab 'bring tha ma gsum du snang ba thams cad sku gsung thugs rdo rje rnam pa gsum gyi rang bzhin 'dod pa'i yon tan gyi lha mo gzugs kyi
analyzed: mig la sogs pa dbang po lnga'i spyod yul du bab pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i yul 'dod pa'i yon tan rab 'bring tha ma gsum du snang ba thams cad sku gsung thugs rdo rje rnam pa gsum gyi rang bzhin 'dod pa'i yon tan gyi lha mo gzugs kyi
translated: All the objects of the five sense faculties such as form that appear as the three types of desirable qualities—superior, medium, and inferior—are the nature of the three vajras of body, speech, and mind.🔽If one knows them to be the essence of the goddesses of the sense objects such as the goddess of form, one will not be bound by them, but will be liberated and will become powerful.

original: rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i ngo bor rig na nges mi 'ching zhing dbang du gyur pa dang grol bar grub par gyur pas na shin tu zhi zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i ngo bor rig na nges mi 'ching zhing dbang du gyur pa dang grol bar grub par gyur pas na shin tu zhi zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, they are called “very peaceful.”

original: rags par skye ba'i nyon mongs par mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: rags par skye ba'i nyon mongs par mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: One will not give rise to coarse afflictions.

original: shin tu zhi zhing phra bar rig pa'i ye shes su 'gyur te /
analyzed: shin tu zhi zhing phra bar rig pa'i ye shes su 'gyur te /
translated: They will become the pristine consciousness of very peaceful knowledge.

original: de lta bu'i don ston pa 'am ;
analyzed: de lta bu'i don ston pa 'am ;
translated: The meaning of that is taught or

original: don dang ldan pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ngo mtshar che zhes bya'o //
analyzed: don dang ldan pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ngo mtshar che zhes bya'o //
translated: it is called “amazing” because it is the cause of possessing the meaning.

original: 'o na lam dang gnyen po gzhan gyis bsgrub cing ma bcos pas de lta bur bsgoms pas de bzhin du 'grub par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: 'o na lam dang gnyen po gzhan gyis bsgrub cing ma bcos pas de lta bur bsgoms pas de bzhin du 'grub par 'gyur ram /
translated: If one practices in that way through other paths and antidotes, will one be able to meditate in that way and accomplish it?

original: 'gyur na sgom par byed pa po de ji lta bu zhig gis de ltar bsgrub par bya snyam pa'i @60a * //
analyzed: 'gyur na sgom par byed pa po de ji lta bu zhig gis de ltar bsgrub par bya snyam pa'i @60a * //
translated: Therefore,

original: phyir ; ae ma'o 'khor ba dag gi rgyun //
analyzed: phyir ; ae ma'o 'khor ba dag gi rgyun //
translated: Amazing! The continuity of cyclic existence!

original: ae ma'o mchog tu mya ngan 'das //🔽zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: ae ma'o mchog tu mya ngan 'das // zhes gsungs te /
translated: Amazing! Supreme nirvana!

original: ae ma'o zhes pa 'di ni de ltar bsgoms pas 'khor ba'i nyes pa thams cad sel nus par bstan pa la ngom zhing ngo mtshar skye ba ste /
analyzed: ae ma'o zhes pa 'di ni de ltar bsgoms pas 'khor ba'i nyes pa thams cad sel nus par bstan pa la ngom zhing ngo mtshar skye ba ste /
translated: Amazing is an expression of delight and amazement at the teaching that by meditating in that way, one can eliminate all the faults of cyclic existence.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽shes pa rkyen bzhi tshogs pa'i dus na dbang po dang rnam par shes pas kyang yul rnams nyon mongs pa gsum gyi rang bzhin du mthong zhing bskyed la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / shes pa rkyen bzhi tshogs pa'i dus na dbang po dang rnam par shes pas kyang yul rnams nyon mongs pa gsum gyi rang bzhin du mthong zhing bskyed la /
translated: Why is that?🔽When consciousness is in the presence of the four conditions, the sense faculties and consciousness see objects and generate them as having the nature of the three mental afflictions.🔽And the objects and sense faculties plant in the foundation consciousness the habitual tendencies that generate the three mental afflictions from consciousness.

original: yul rnams dang dbang po rnams kyis kyang rnam par shes pa las nyon mongs pa gsum du skyed par byed pa'i bag chags kun gzhi la 'debs pa'i dbang gis 'khor ba'i chos 'byung zhing 'phel bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: yul rnams dang dbang po rnams kyis kyang rnam par shes pa las nyon mongs pa gsum du skyed par byed pa'i bag chags kun gzhi la 'debs pa'i dbang gis 'khor ba'i chos 'byung zhing 'phel bar 'gyur te /
translated: Through the power of that, the phenomena of cyclic existence arise and increase.

original: 'khor ba de yang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rgyu rkyen tshogs pa mi rtag pa rgyun gyi ngo bo las 'bras bu 'byung ba yin pa dang / gong ma lta bur dbang po'i yul du gyur pa thams cad du nyon mongs pa gsum du bskyed pa dang ;
analyzed: 'khor ba de yang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rgyu rkyen tshogs pa mi rtag pa rgyun gyi ngo bo las 'bras bu 'byung ba yin pa dang / gong ma lta bur dbang po'i yul du gyur pa thams cad du nyon mongs pa gsum du bskyed pa dang ;
translated: As above, all objects of the sense organs are generated as the three afflictions.

original: de ltar skye bar byed pa thams cad sku gsung thugs rdo rje gsum du shes par byas nas 'dod pa'i yon tan gyi lha mo gzugs kyi rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i ngo bor rig par byas na bdag gis bdag mchod pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar skye bar byed pa thams cad sku gsung thugs rdo rje gsum du shes par byas nas 'dod pa'i yon tan gyi lha mo gzugs kyi rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i ngo bor rig par byas na bdag gis bdag mchod pa yin te /
translated: Having understood that all that generates in that way is the three vajras of body, speech, and mind, if one understands that the goddesses of the sense objects are the essence of Rūpavajrā, and so on, one offers to oneself.

original: nyon mongs pa de dag gis 'khor ba dang ngan song du mi 'ching zhing rnam par grol ba'i rgyur gyur nas dug gsum rnam par dag pa sku gsum du grub pas bag chags ngan pa bsal te rten 'brel rgyun bcad de /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa de dag gis 'khor ba dang ngan song du mi 'ching zhing rnam par grol ba'i rgyur gyur nas dug gsum rnam par dag pa sku gsum du grub pas bag chags ngan pa bsal te rten 'brel rgyun bcad de /
translated: Since one is not bound in samsara and the lower realms by those afflictions, having become the cause of complete liberation, the three poisons are purified and accomplished as the three kāyas.

original: 'khor ba rgyun bcad nas mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: 'khor ba rgyun bcad nas mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa yin no //
translated: Having cut off the continuum of cyclic existence, it becomes the nature of nirvana.

original: de sgom par byed pa yang 'phags pa'i sa pa gnyen ris su dang po nas bcad pa yod pa yin te /
analyzed: de sgom par byed pa yang 'phags pa'i sa pa gnyen ris su dang po nas bcad pa yod pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, one who cultivates this is an ārya, and one who has severed the continuum from the beginning is a friend.

original: 'khor ba'i chos can rten 'brel gyi rgyu la gnas pa'i sems can gyi nang na yid kyi shas che bas 'dzam bu gling pa'i mi 'di nyid de ltar bsgoms pas de bzhin du 'grub pa yin zhes tshig phyi ma 'dis kyang rtsa ba'i tshig gnyis la rim par🔽sbyar ro// de bas na ae ma'o zhes pa tha ma 'dis ni de ltar 'khor ba nyid mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin du ston pa'am /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i chos can rten 'brel gyi rgyu la gnas pa'i sems can gyi nang na yid kyi shas che bas 'dzam bu gling pa'i mi 'di nyid de ltar bsgoms pas de bzhin du 'grub pa yin zhes tshig phyi ma 'dis kyang rtsa ba'i tshig gnyis la rim par sbyar ro// de bas na ae ma'o zhes pa tha ma 'dis ni de ltar 'khor ba nyid mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin du ston pa'am /
translated: Among sentient beings who are characterized by cyclic existence and abide in the causes of dependent origination, because of the predominance of mind, this very human being of Jambudvīpa, by cultivating in that way, achieves it in that way.🔽This latter phrase also applies in order to the two root phrases.🔽Therefore, this final “Amazing!”

original: de lta bu'i don dang ldan pa'i rgyud 'dis ngo mtshar che zhing rmad du byung ba'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i don dang ldan pa'i rgyud 'dis ngo mtshar che zhing rmad du byung ba'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: teaches that cyclic existence itself is the nature of nirvana, or that this tantra, which has such a meaning, is amazing and marvelous.

original: byang chub sems dpa' byams pa la sogs pas de skad ces gsol ba'i @60b de ma thag tu //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' byams pa la sogs pas de skad ces gsol ba'i @60b de ma thag tu //
translated: The bodhisattvas Maitreya and so forth made this request.

original: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa de dag thams cad kyis byams pa la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de rnams la zhus pa'i lan 'og nas 'byung ba 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa de dag thams cad kyis byams pa la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de rnams la zhus pa'i lan 'og nas 'byung ba 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Then all the tathāgatas, Vairocana and so forth, replied to those bodhisattva mahāsattvas, Maitreya and so forth, with the following words:

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes spyir bos nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes spyir bos nas /
translated: Bodhisattvas, in general,

original: de de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni ston pa byang chub sems rdo rje la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang sems can thams cad kyi rang bzhin bstan pa ste ma nor ba de bzhin du yin no /
analyzed: de de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni ston pa byang chub sems rdo rje la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang sems can thams cad kyi rang bzhin bstan pa ste ma nor ba de bzhin du yin no /
translated: it is so means that the teacher, Bodhicittavajra and so forth, all the tathāgatas and the nature of all sentient beings, is taught as it is, without error.

original: sems dpa' chen po dag / chos thams cad dang rgyud 'di'i yon tan gyi rang bzhin smras pa /
analyzed: sems dpa' chen po dag / chos thams cad dang rgyud 'di'i yon tan gyi rang bzhin smras pa /
translated: The great bodhisattvas, having spoken the nature of the qualities of all phenomena and this tantra,

original: de yang don de kho na bzhin du yin te /
analyzed: de yang don de kho na bzhin du yin te /
translated: that is also exactly the meaning,

original: ma nor ro zhes gsungs pa'i don to //
analyzed: ma nor ro zhes gsungs pa'i don to //
translated: it is said to be without error.

original: de ltar ston pa dang sems can gyi rang bzhin dang chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid kyi 'jal stangs rtsing rim tsam du spyi khyab tu zhus pa la /
analyzed: de ltar ston pa dang sems can gyi rang bzhin dang chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid kyi 'jal stangs rtsing rim tsam du spyi khyab tu zhus pa la /
translated: Thus, having asked in a general way about the teacher, the nature of sentient beings, and the way of evaluating the characteristics of all phenomena,🔽the Bhagavān said, “The extent of your realization through wisdom is like that; it is unerring.”

original: khyed kyi shes rab kyis rtogs pa'i tshad de ltar yin te ma nor ro zhes bka' stsal pa dang / de nas zhes bya ba de ma thag tu bar cis kyang ma chod par byang chub sems dpa' de dag kyang 'dus te byon nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: khyed kyi shes rab kyis rtogs pa'i tshad de ltar yin te ma nor ro zhes bka' stsal pa dang / de nas zhes bya ba de ma thag tu bar cis kyang ma chod par byang chub sems dpa' de dag kyang 'dus te byon nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Then, immediately after that, without any interruption, those bodhisattvas gathered and arrived, and so on.

original: 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba dang 'brel to //
analyzed: 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba dang 'brel to //
translated: This is connected with the phrase “they said this.”

original: yang zhes bya ba ni gong du spyi'i rang bzhin rtsing rim du zhus pa de las gzhan pa'i don zhib tu zhu bar 'dod pa'i tshig ston pa'i phyir na yang zhes smos te /
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba ni gong du spyi'i rang bzhin rtsing rim du zhus pa de las gzhan pa'i don zhib tu zhu bar 'dod pa'i tshig ston pa'i phyir na yang zhes smos te /
translated: Again means that after previously asking in a general way about the nature, they are asking in detail about the meaning of the other topics.

original: 'dus te zhes bya ba ni don zhu bar 'dod pa'i dmigs mthun pa dang / tshig brjod par bya ba'i dag mthun pa dang / lus kyi gus pa bskyed par bya ba'i spyod pa mthun pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus te zhes bya ba ni don zhu bar 'dod pa'i dmigs mthun pa dang / tshig brjod par bya ba'i dag mthun pa dang / lus kyi gus pa bskyed par bya ba'i spyod pa mthun pa'o //
translated: The phrase having assembled means that they had a common purpose in wanting to request the meaning, they had a common purpose in wanting to express the words, and they had a common purpose in wanting to generate the conduct of physical respect.

original: byon nas zhes bya ba ni ring ba na 'dug pa'i 'khor ni nye bar 'dus la /
analyzed: byon nas zhes bya ba ni ring ba na 'dug pa'i 'khor ni nye bar 'dus la /
translated: The phrase having approached means that the retinue that was sitting far away gathered near,

original: nye pa na 'khod pa'i 'khor ni zhabs drung du gtugs pa'o //
analyzed: nye pa na 'khod pa'i 'khor ni zhabs drung du gtugs pa'o //
translated: and the retinue that was sitting near pressed in close.

original: nas zhes bya ba ni de ltar dgongs pa mthun par btud nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: nas zhes bya ba ni de ltar dgongs pa mthun par btud nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The phrase having approached means that they bowed in this way with a common purpose.

original: ci byed ce na /🔽rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad la gsang ba mchog gi mchod pas yang dag par mchod de phyag 'tshal nas zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ci byed ce na / rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad la gsang ba mchog gi mchod pas yang dag par mchod de phyag 'tshal nas zhes bya ste /
translated: What did they do?🔽They made offerings to all those Tathagatas, Vairocana and so forth, with the supreme secret offerings, and they bowed down.

original: phyi nang gsang ba gsum gyi mchod pa bla na yod pa dang / bla na med pas bsdus pa las 'di ni kun gyi spyod yul @61a * //
analyzed: phyi nang gsang ba gsum gyi mchod pa bla na yod pa dang / bla na med pas bsdus pa las 'di ni kun gyi spyod yul @61a * //
translated: This is included in the offerings with and without conceptualization, and the offerings with and without conceptualization are included in the offerings of the outer, inner, and secret, which are both surpassable and unsurpassable.

original: du ma gyur pas thun mong ma yin pa gsang ba'i mchod ba bla na med pa ste /
analyzed: du ma gyur pas thun mong ma yin pa gsang ba'i mchod ba bla na med pa ste /
translated: Since they are not multiple, they are the uncommon, unsurpassed secret offerings.

original: thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med par sbyor ba bde ba'i sgra dang / 'od zer gyi 'phro 'du dang / lhag ba byang chub sems kyi sprin yin la /
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med par sbyor ba bde ba'i sgra dang / 'od zer gyi 'phro 'du dang / lhag ba byang chub sems kyi sprin yin la /
translated: The offerings are the sound of bliss, the union of method and wisdom in non-dual union, the emanation and re-absorption of light rays, and the cloud of transcendent bodhicitta.

original: spyan dang sgeg mo dang gzugs kyi rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i lha mo dang / mchod pa'i rdzas kyi khyad par dang / rigs dang / gzugs dang / dbyibs dang / kha dog mi mthun pa'i rnam pa tha dad pa mang po spros pas /
analyzed: spyan dang sgeg mo dang gzugs kyi rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i lha mo dang / mchod pa'i rdzas kyi khyad par dang / rigs dang / gzugs dang / dbyibs dang / kha dog mi mthun pa'i rnam pa tha dad pa mang po spros pas /
translated: The goddesses such as Locanā, Lāsyā, and Rūpavajrā, the special offering substances, the different aspects of the different families, forms, shapes, and colors are emanated in many different ways.

original: sku gsung thugs kyi rgyud la bstims shing mchod pas mnyes par byas te /
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi rgyud la bstims shing mchod pas mnyes par byas te /
translated: They dissolve into the body, speech, and mind of the deities and please them with offerings.

original: sgo gsum nas gus pa bskyed de thun mong dang zab mo rnam pa gnyis kyi sgo nas 'dud pas phyag 'tshal nas /
analyzed: sgo gsum nas gus pa bskyed de thun mong dang zab mo rnam pa gnyis kyi sgo nas 'dud pas phyag 'tshal nas /
translated: With devotion in body, speech, and mind, they bow down with two types of prostrations, common and profound.

original: tshig mthun par mgrin gcig tu 'di skad ces zhus zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: tshig mthun par mgrin gcig tu 'di skad ces zhus zhes pa'i don to //
translated: With one voice, they say, “This is what we request.”

original: ci kho na skad gsol ba btab cing zhus she na /
analyzed: ci kho na skad gsol ba btab cing zhus she na /
translated: What was it that he requested?

original: ae ma'o shin tu thob dka' 'di //
analyzed: ae ma'o shin tu thob dka' 'di //
translated: Amazing! This is very difficult to attain!

original: byang chub tu ni sgrub pa'i thabs //🔽rgyud rnams phyi ma'i phyi ma yis //
analyzed: byang chub tu ni sgrub pa'i thabs // rgyud rnams phyi ma'i phyi ma yis //
translated: The means of accomplishing enlightenment,🔽the Guhyasamaja Tantra,

original: gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud gsungs pa //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud gsungs pa // zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: was taught by the later and later buddhas.

original: gsol zhing mchis zhes zhus pa'o //🔽de la ae ma'o zhes pa ni shin tu thob par dka' ba'i byang chub tu sgrub pa'i thabs gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud kyi don 'di lta bu bdag cag gis zhu zhing thos par nus pa na ston pa thugs rje che zhing bdag cag skal ba chen po
analyzed: gsol zhing mchis zhes zhus pa'o // de la ae ma'o zhes pa ni shin tu thob par dka' ba'i byang chub tu sgrub pa'i thabs gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud kyi don 'di lta bu bdag cag gis zhu zhing thos par nus pa na ston pa thugs rje che zhing bdag cag skal ba chen po
translated: This is the request, Please teach!

original: dang ldan pa'o zhes ngom zhing ngo mtshar skyes pa'o //
analyzed: dang ldan pa'o zhes ngom zhing ngo mtshar skyes pa'o //
translated: Here, amazing! is the expression of amazement and pride in thinking, We are able to request and hear this kind of meaning of the Guhyasamaja Tantra, the means of accomplishing enlightenment, which is very difficult to attain. The teacher has great compassion and we have great good fortune.

original: shin tu thob dka' zhes bya ba ni sgo gsum nas dka' ba sna tshogs spyod cing /
analyzed: shin tu thob dka' zhes bya ba ni sgo gsum nas dka' ba sna tshogs spyod cing /
translated: It is very difficult to attain means that it is difficult to attain through the three doors, engaging in various austerities.

original: bskal pa grangs med par 'bad kyang rnyed cing thob par mi nus pa'i don gong du bstan pa dang 'og nas 'byung ba 'di zhes bya /
analyzed: bskal pa grangs med par 'bad kyang rnyed cing thob par mi nus pa'i don gong du bstan pa dang 'og nas 'byung ba 'di zhes bya /
translated: The meaning of what was taught above and will be taught below, which cannot be found and obtained even by striving for countless eons, is

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: what?

original: byang chub tu ni sgrub pa'i thabs //
analyzed: byang chub tu ni sgrub pa'i thabs //
translated: The means of accomplishing enlightenment.

original: zhes bya ste byang chub ni zad pa med cing skye ba med pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ste byang chub ni zad pa med cing skye ba med pa ste /
translated: Enlightenment is without exhaustion and without arising.

original: sgrub pa ni rgyu'i don te lus ngag yid gsum sku gsung thugs rdo rje gsum gyi rang bzhin du bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa ni rgyu'i don te lus ngag yid gsum sku gsung thugs rdo rje gsum gyi rang bzhin du bsgom pa'o //
translated: Accomplishment has the meaning of a cause, which is meditating on the body, voice, and mind as the nature of the three vajras of body, speech, and mind.

original: thabs ni rdo rje chog bzhi dang bsnyen sgrub rnam pa bzhi la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: thabs ni rdo rje chog bzhi dang bsnyen sgrub rnam pa bzhi la sogs pa'o //
translated: The means are the four vajra rites, the four branches of familiarization and attainment, and so on.

original: de yang gang las 'byung zhing ston na //🔽rgyud rnams byi ma'i yang phyi ma yis //🔽gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud gsungs pa //
analyzed: de yang gang las 'byung zhing ston na // rgyud rnams byi ma'i yang phyi ma yis // gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud gsungs pa //
translated: Moreover, from what is this taught?🔽The latter of the tantras of the Guhyagarbha🔽teaches the Guhyasamaja Tantra.

original: zhes bya ba 'di las ston te rgyud gsang ba'i rgyud rnams kyi phyi mar gyur pa ni gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud 'di yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di las ston te rgyud gsang ba'i rgyud rnams kyi phyi mar gyur pa ni gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud 'di yin te /
translated: This is taught in this tantra, which is the latter of the tantras of the Guhyagarbha.

original: de la @61b yang gnyis te /
analyzed: de la @61b yang gnyis te /
translated: Moreover, there are two:

original: gsungs pa'i phyi ma ni rnam par snang mdzad sgyu 'phrul dra ba ste /
analyzed: gsungs pa'i phyi ma ni rnam par snang mdzad sgyu 'phrul dra ba ste /
translated: The latter of these is the Magical Net of Vairocana.

original: de ltar ci mngon zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar ci mngon zhe na /
translated: How is this known?🔽It is stated in the head of the tantra:

original: rgyud thams cad kyi phyi ma'i yang phyi ma zhes dbu las gsungs la /
analyzed: rgyud thams cad kyi phyi ma'i yang phyi ma zhes dbu las gsungs la /
translated: The latter of all tantras is the latter of the latter.🔽And it is stated in the feet of the tantra:🔽The great qualities of the vajra master, which are taught in the Guhyasamaja Tantra,

original: gsang ba'i dbang bskur ba rdo rje slob dpon gyi che ba bstan pa gsang ba 'dus pa las 'byung ba bzhin kha ton byas pa zhabs nas 'byung bar mngon no //
analyzed: gsang ba'i dbang bskur ba rdo rje slob dpon gyi che ba bstan pa gsang ba 'dus pa las 'byung ba bzhin kha ton byas pa zhabs nas 'byung bar mngon no //
translated: are recited here.

original: don gyi phyi ma ni sngar gsungs pa'i rgyud du ma 'dus pa'i don 'dir ston cing 'di'i don ni rgyud gzhan du ma gsungs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: don gyi phyi ma ni sngar gsungs pa'i rgyud du ma 'dus pa'i don 'dir ston cing 'di'i don ni rgyud gzhan du ma gsungs pa'i phyir te /
translated: The latter of the meaning is that the meaning of the tantra that was not included in the previous tantras is taught here, and the meaning of this tantra is not taught in other tantras.

original: ci mngon zhe na /
analyzed: ci mngon zhe na /
translated: How is this known?🔽It is known from the statement in the head of the tantra:🔽The name of the secret assembly,

original: dbu las mtshan gsang ba 'dus pa zhes gsungs pa dang / zhabs 'dir rgyud rnams phyi ma'i zhes gsungs pa 'dis mngon no //
analyzed: dbu las mtshan gsang ba 'dus pa zhes gsungs pa dang / zhabs 'dir rgyud rnams phyi ma'i zhes gsungs pa 'dis mngon no //
translated: and from the statement in the feet of the tantra:🔽The tantras are the latter of the latter.

original: de la yang gsum ste /
analyzed: de la yang gsum ste /
translated: This has three parts:

original: sngar ma gsungs pa ston pa dang / sngar gsungs pa kha bskang ba dang / sngar gsungs pa'i the tshom mchod pa bcad pa'i phyir gsungs pa gsum las /
analyzed: sngar ma gsungs pa ston pa dang / sngar gsungs pa kha bskang ba dang / sngar gsungs pa'i the tshom mchod pa bcad pa'i phyir gsungs pa gsum las /
translated: It is said that there are three reasons for teaching the explanatory tantra: to teach what was not previously taught, to supplement what was previously taught, and to resolve doubts about what was previously taught.
