original: 'di ni sngar rtsa ba'i rgyud du the tshom mchod pa bcad pa'i phyir gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sngar rtsa ba'i rgyud du the tshom mchod pa bcad pa'i phyir gsungs pa'o //
translated: This was taught in order to resolve doubts about the root tantra.

original: de ltar gsang ba'i rgyud thams cad kyi don gyi phyi mar gyur pa ni gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud le'u phyed dang bco brgyad bstan pa yan chad do //
analyzed: de ltar gsang ba'i rgyud thams cad kyi don gyi phyi mar gyur pa ni gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud le'u phyed dang bco brgyad bstan pa yan chad do //
translated: Thus, the meaning of all the secret tantras is contained in the Guhyasamaja Tantra, which is taught in eighteen and a half chapters.

original: de'i yang phyi mar gyur pa ni le'u bco brgyad kyi phyed pa 'di la bya ste /
analyzed: de'i yang phyi mar gyur pa ni le'u bco brgyad kyi phyed pa 'di la bya ste /
translated: The meaning of this tantra is contained in the eighteen and a half chapters.

original: gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud gsungs pa zhes pa'i rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i 'khor gyis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la zhus nas gsungs pa'i le'u 'di la bya'o //
analyzed: gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud gsungs pa zhes pa'i rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i 'khor gyis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la zhus nas gsungs pa'i le'u 'di la bya'o //
translated: The Guhyasamaja Tantra was taught by the Tathagatas in response to a request by the retinue of Vairochana and so forth.

original: rtogs dka' de nyid chung bya ste //
analyzed: rtogs dka' de nyid chung bya ste //
translated: The meaning of this chapter is difficult to understand and should be kept secret.

original: zhes bya ba brgyud 'di'i mtshan nyid ni sbas pa gsum gyis sbas shing /
analyzed: zhes bya ba brgyud 'di'i mtshan nyid ni sbas pa gsum gyis sbas shing /
translated: The name of this tantra is concealed by the three concealments.

original: rgyud dkrugs / lung gcus /
analyzed: rgyud dkrugs / lung gcus /
translated: The tantra is tangled, the oral instructions are hidden.

original: man ngag sbas pas drang thad du rtogs par dka' ba de nyid rtogs shing khong du chud par bya 'dod pa ste zhes bya'o //
analyzed: man ngag sbas pas drang thad du rtogs par dka' ba de nyid rtogs shing khong du chud par bya 'dod pa ste zhes bya'o //
translated: It is difficult to understand directly, so it is called “that which is desired to be realized and comprehended.”

original: don de byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis yang nas yang du zhus pa dang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis rim par gsungs pa yang theg pa 'og ma pa ltar bdag 'ba' zhig gi rang phan dang sgos bde ma yin pas na /
analyzed: don de byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis yang nas yang du zhus pa dang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis rim par gsungs pa yang theg pa 'og ma pa ltar bdag 'ba' zhig gi rang phan dang sgos bde ma yin pas na /
translated: That meaning was repeatedly requested by the bodhisattvas, and the tathāgatas taught it in stages. Since it is not the benefit of oneself alone, as in the lower vehicles, or one’s own happiness,

original: sems can rnams la phan bya'i phyir //
analyzed: sems can rnams la phan bya'i phyir //
translated: it is said, “in order to benefit sentient beings.”

original: zhes bya'o de ni zhu ba po byang chub sems dpa' rnams sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba'i sgra dang mthun par grub pa dang / chos 'di yang theg pa chen po yin par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya'o de ni zhu ba po byang chub sems dpa' rnams sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba'i sgra dang mthun par grub pa dang / chos 'di yang theg pa chen po yin par bstan pa'o //
translated: That is the proof that the bodhisattvas who make the request are in accord with the term “great being,” and it also teaches that this dharma is the Mahāyāna.

original: 'o na gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud ni sngar @62a * //
analyzed: 'o na gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud ni sngar @62a * //
translated: Well then, the Guhyasamāja Tantra was taught previously.

original: rim par phye nas rgyang par gsungs zin na /
analyzed: rim par phye nas rgyang par gsungs zin na /
translated: tantra was previously explained in detail.

original: de yang zhu ba de snga ma nor bar gsungs pa'am /
analyzed: de yang zhu ba de snga ma nor bar gsungs pa'am /
translated: Moreover, it is said that the previous request was incorrect, or it🔽may be thought that there is no purpose.

original: dgos pa med pa ma yin nam snyam pa'i don du gang gsungs pa yang dag gsungs pa'i zhes smos te /
analyzed: dgos pa med pa ma yin nam snyam pa'i don du gang gsungs pa yang dag gsungs pa'i zhes smos te /
translated: The phrase “the perfect words” is stated in order to explain that🔽the words and meanings of the root tantra that were previously

original: rtsa ba'i rgyud gang yin pa de'i tshig dang don gong du sngar gsungs pa yang phyin ci log tu ma gyur cing yang dag par ma nor bar gsungs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rgyud gang yin pa de'i tshig dang don gong du sngar gsungs pa yang phyin ci log tu ma gyur cing yang dag par ma nor bar gsungs pa'i phyir /
translated: explained above are not distorted and are perfectly unmistaken.🔽Even though the perfect qualities are complete, if the words and🔽meanings are not measured, and there is doubt, the protector is🔽requested to remove the obstacles of those who make offerings and

original: yon tan dam pa phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa yin na yang de dag gi tshig don dang mi 'jal ba dang / the tshom za ba mchod pa mchis pa rnams kyi gegs bsal ba dang / chung zad lus pa mchis pa bshad par mgon po khyed la gsol zhing mchis te zhu dgos zhes pa'i don ston to //
analyzed: yon tan dam pa phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa yin na yang de dag gi tshig don dang mi 'jal ba dang / the tshom za ba mchod pa mchis pa rnams kyi gegs bsal ba dang / chung zad lus pa mchis pa bshad par mgon po khyed la gsol zhing mchis te zhu dgos zhes pa'i don ston to //
translated: to explain what remains a little.

original: de ltar zhus pa'i de ma thag tu yang 'khor gyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa ma lus pa de dag thams cad kyi zhu ba po'i byang chub sems dpa' de rnams la lan 'og nas 'byung ba 'di skad ces bka' stsal to
analyzed: de ltar zhus pa'i de ma thag tu yang 'khor gyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa ma lus pa de dag thams cad kyi zhu ba po'i byang chub sems dpa' de rnams la lan 'og nas 'byung ba 'di skad ces bka' stsal to
translated: As soon as such a request was made, all the retinue tathāgatas, Vairocana and so forth, without exception, spoke to those bodhisattvas who were requesting as follows:

original: // gang zhe na /🔽gang zhig rgyud 'di rtogs dka' ba //
analyzed: // gang zhe na / gang zhig rgyud 'di rtogs dka' ba //
translated: What is that?🔽Those who wish to understand

original: de dag thams cad zhu 'dod pa //
analyzed: de dag thams cad zhu 'dod pa //
translated: all that is difficult to realize in this tantra,

original: legs so legs so byang chub che //
analyzed: legs so legs so byang chub che //
translated: it is excellent, excellent, great enlightenment!

original: legs so legs so yon tan gnas //
analyzed: legs so legs so yon tan gnas //
translated: It is excellent, excellent, abode of qualities!

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: rigs kyi bu pho mo gang zhig su yang rung bas tshig dang don gang zhig rgyud 'di'i nang nas rtogs shing khong du chud par dka' ba de dag thams cad ma lus pa kun rtogs shing khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu pho mo gang zhig su yang rung bas tshig dang don gang zhig rgyud 'di'i nang nas rtogs shing khong du chud par dka' ba de dag thams cad ma lus pa kun rtogs shing khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Any son or daughter of good family, whoever they may be, for the sake of understanding and realizing all that is difficult to realize in this tantra,

original: zhu ba dang zhu bar 'dod pa la yang legs pa yin na /
analyzed: zhu ba dang zhu bar 'dod pa la yang legs pa yin na /
translated: it is excellent to request and wish to request.

original: byang chub sems dpa' chen po khyed lta bus zhus pa ni shin tu yang legs pa'o zhes dgyes shing zhu bar gnang ba byin cing skabs phye ba ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chen po khyed lta bus zhus pa ni shin tu yang legs pa'o zhes dgyes shing zhu bar gnang ba byin cing skabs phye ba ste /
translated: The reply to the request is the permission to ask, which is the opening of the opportunity, and is given with the statement, It is very good that you, great bodhisattvas, have asked.

original: de la legs so zhes smos pa dang po ni byang chub sems dpa' khyed rnams rdo rje theg pa gsang ba'i rgyud la mos pa skye zhing 'jug pa legs so zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de la legs so zhes smos pa dang po ni byang chub sems dpa' khyed rnams rdo rje theg pa gsang ba'i rgyud la mos pa skye zhing 'jug pa legs so zhes pa ste /
translated: The first good is the statement, It is good that you bodhisattvas have generated interest in and are engaged in the secret Vajrayāna.

original: sngon nas sbyangs pas 'brel ba'i 'phro yod par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sngon nas sbyangs pas 'brel ba'i 'phro yod par bstan pa'o //
translated: This indicates that there is a continuity of training from the past.

original: legs so zhes gsungs pa gnyis pa ni thos pa de la the tshom za ba'i rtog pa skyes pa yang legs so zhes te /
analyzed: legs so zhes gsungs pa gnyis pa ni thos pa de la the tshom za ba'i rtog pa skyes pa yang legs so zhes te /
translated: The second good is the statement, It is good that you have generated the thought of doubt about that which you have heard.

original: des ni sngags la rnam par sbyangs ba'i shes rab kun dang thun mong ma yin pa yod par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: des ni sngags la rnam par sbyangs ba'i shes rab kun dang thun mong ma yin pa yod par bstan pa'o //
translated: This indicates that you have the wisdom that is not shared with all those who have trained in mantra.

original: legs so zhes bya ba gsum pa ni the tshom de dag bsal ba'i don zhu ba yang legs so @62b zhes pa ste /
analyzed: legs so zhes bya ba gsum pa ni the tshom de dag bsal ba'i don zhu ba yang legs so @62b zhes pa ste /
translated: The third good is the statement, It is good that you have asked to have those doubts resolved.

original: des ni sngags kyi nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i skal ba yod par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: des ni sngags kyi nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i skal ba yod par bstan pa'o //
translated: This shows that they have the fortune to become liberated through mantra.

original: legs so zhes bya ba bzhi pa ni sems can rnams la phan pa'i phyir zhus pa yang legs so zhes pa ste /
analyzed: legs so zhes bya ba bzhi pa ni sems can rnams la phan pa'i phyir zhus pa yang legs so zhes pa ste /
translated: The fourth excellent is that it is excellent that you have requested for the sake of sentient beings.

original: des ni theg pa 'og ma pa rnams las khyad par du bstan pa'o //
analyzed: des ni theg pa 'og ma pa rnams las khyad par du bstan pa'o //
translated: This shows the distinction from those of the lower vehicles.

original: byang chub che zhes pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams la thun mong gi sgo nas spyir pos pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: byang chub che zhes pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams la thun mong gi sgo nas spyir pos pa'i tshig go //
translated: The great enlightenment is a term that generally refers to the bodhisattvas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes brjod pa'i don to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes brjod pa'i don to //
translated: It means bodhisattva mahāsattva.

original: yon tan nges zhes bya ba ni khyed kyis zhus nas nged kyis bshad pa'i rgyud dam /
analyzed: yon tan nges zhes bya ba ni khyed kyis zhus nas nged kyis bshad pa'i rgyud dam /
translated: The definite qualities are the tantra that you have requested and the meaning of the tantra that I will explain.

original: rgyud kyi don 'di ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gsung thugs kyi rgyud la mnga' ba'i che ba'i yon tan thams cad kyi 'byung gnas su gyur pa yin no zhes kyang bstan la /
analyzed: rgyud kyi don 'di ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gsung thugs kyi rgyud la mnga' ba'i che ba'i yon tan thams cad kyi 'byung gnas su gyur pa yin no zhes kyang bstan la /
translated: This is also taught to be the source of all the great qualities that exist in the tantras of the body, speech, and mind of the tathāgatas, both mundane and supramundane.

original: che ba'i yon tan de dag dang ldan pa'i rgyud 'di 'byung ba'i gnas ni khyed zhu ba po dang / nged ston pa po gnyis ka yin pas zhus pa'i ched du bshad par bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: che ba'i yon tan de dag dang ldan pa'i rgyud 'di 'byung ba'i gnas ni khyed zhu ba po dang / nged ston pa po gnyis ka yin pas zhus pa'i ched du bshad par bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is taught that it should be explained for the purpose of request.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis de skad ces bka' stsal zhing gnang ba byin pa de ma thag tu /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis de skad ces bka' stsal zhing gnang ba byin pa de ma thag tu /
translated: As soon as the tathagatas had spoken in that way and given their permission,

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa la sogs pa de dag thams cad sems rab tu dga' ba skyes nas de'i rtags sngon legs par sbyangs shing spyad pa las grub pa'i 'bras bu spyan padma'i 'dab ma rangs pa lta bu za ma zim
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa la sogs pa de dag thams cad sems rab tu dga' ba skyes nas de'i rtags sngon legs par sbyangs shing spyad pa las grub pa'i 'bras bu spyan padma'i 'dab ma rangs pa lta bu za ma zim
translated: all the bodhisattva mahasattvas, such as Maitreya, were overjoyed. The sign of that is that their eyes, which are like the petals of a fully opened lotus, are not half-closed.

original: tsam du phye ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: tsam du phye ba ma yin gyi /
translated: They are not half-closed, but fully open.

original: legs par gdangs te mig mi 'dzums par 'bad nas zhal du blta ba ni spyan rgyas pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: legs par gdangs te mig mi 'dzums par 'bad nas zhal du blta ba ni spyan rgyas pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Looking with eyes that are wide open, without blinking, is called “wide eyes.”

original: de ltar bltas nas yang dang yang du zhes bya ba ni bsnan pa'i don te /
analyzed: de ltar bltas nas yang dang yang du zhes bya ba ni bsnan pa'i don te /
translated: Looking in that way, again and again, is a term of addition.

original: lan gsum du phyag 'tshal ba yin la snga ma las mi 'dra ba'i mtshan nyid du ston pa ste /
analyzed: lan gsum du phyag 'tshal ba yin la snga ma las mi 'dra ba'i mtshan nyid du ston pa ste /
translated: This is the third prostration, and it is taught to be different from the previous ones.

original: lus kyis phyag 'tshal ba'i dus na ngag dang sems kyi sgo nas kyang phyag 'tshal bar bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: lus kyis phyag 'tshal ba'i dus na ngag dang sems kyi sgo nas kyang phyag 'tshal bar bstan pa yin te /
translated: When one prostrates with the body, it is taught that one should also prostrate with the voice and mind.

original: lus gus pa dang / ngag sri zhu dang / sems dad pa bskyed pa yin no //
analyzed: lus gus pa dang / ngag sri zhu dang / sems dad pa bskyed pa yin no //
translated: One should generate respect with the body, courtesy with the voice, and faith with the mind.

analyzed: bya ba'i rgyud las ni /

analyzed: 'dod chags zhes bgyi ba 'dod pa dang 'dun pa bskyed pa khams gsum gyi lus dang longs spyod la chags pa la bgyi na /
translated: If desire means generating desire and longing for the bodies and enjoyments of the three realms,

original: 'di'i skabs su ji lta bu la bgyi ba lags zhes zhus pa ni nyi shu gcig pa'o //🔽phrag dog ces bgyi ba gzhan gyi phun sum tshogs pa dag bdag la yod la /
analyzed: 'di'i skabs su ji lta bu la bgyi ba lags zhes zhus pa ni nyi shu gcig pa'o // phrag dog ces bgyi ba gzhan gyi phun sum tshogs pa dag bdag la yod la /
translated: in this context, what is it? is the twenty-first question.🔽 If jealousy means mental disturbance thinking, May I have others' excellence,

original: gzhan la med pa'am yang na mnyam par gyur na snyam nas sems 'khrugs pa la bgyi na /
analyzed: gzhan la med pa'am yang na mnyam par gyur na snyam nas sems 'khrugs pa la bgyi na /
translated: but may they not have mine, or thinking, May I be equal to them,

original: 'di'i skabs su ji lta bu la bgyi ba lags zhes zhus pa ni nyi shu gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i skabs su ji lta bu la bgyi ba lags zhes zhus pa ni nyi shu gnyis pa'o //
translated: in this context, what is it? is the twenty-second question.

original: rdo rje'i sngags ni ji ltar lags zhes pa ni sku gsung thugs rdo rje dang / de bskyed pa'i sngags ni ji lta bu lags zhes pa'am //
analyzed: rdo rje'i sngags ni ji ltar lags zhes pa ni sku gsung thugs rdo rje dang / de bskyed pa'i sngags ni ji lta bu lags zhes pa'am //
translated: As for what is the vajra mantra? it means what is the mantra that generates the vajra of body, speech, and mind?

original: gnyis su na sku gsung thugs ye shes rdo rje lta bu las skyes pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi lha 'di rnams kyi bskyed pa dang bzlas pa'i sngags ni ji lta bu lags zhes zhus pa ni nyi shu gsum pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis su na sku gsung thugs ye shes rdo rje lta bu las skyes pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi lha 'di rnams kyi bskyed pa dang bzlas pa'i sngags ni ji lta bu lags zhes zhus pa ni nyi shu gsum pa'o //
translated: Second, the mantra of creation and recitation of these deities of the maṇḍala born from the vajra of the gnosis of enlightened body, speech, and mind is of what kind?

original: gzhung gzhan las ni 'gyod pa med pa la dga' ba zhes mchi /
analyzed: gzhung gzhan las ni 'gyod pa med pa la dga' ba zhes mchi /
translated: In other texts, it is called “the joy of being without regret.”

original: 'di las ni zhe sdang dga' ma zhes bya ba la sogs par yang gsungs na /
analyzed: 'di las ni zhe sdang dga' ma zhes bya ba la sogs par yang gsungs na /
translated: Here, it is also called “the consort of anger,” and so on.

original: 'di'i skabs su dga' ma zhes bya ba'i don ji lta bu lags zhes zhus pa ni nyi shu bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i skabs su dga' ma zhes bya ba'i don ji lta bu lags zhes zhus pa ni nyi shu bzhi pa'o //
translated: In this context, what is the meaning of the term “consort”?

original: rgyud yongs kyi mtshan nyid kyis ni gleng gzhi la phun sum tshogs pa zhes mchi /
analyzed: rgyud yongs kyi mtshan nyid kyis ni gleng gzhi la phun sum tshogs pa zhes mchi /
translated: The definition of a tantra is “the basis of the perfect.”

original: de bzhin du rigs dang dpal dang 'byor pa la sogs pa kun la yang phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgrar 'jug /'dir le'u dang po las kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i btsun mo'i mchog phun sum tshogs pa zhes gsungs na /
analyzed: de bzhin du rigs dang dpal dang 'byor pa la sogs pa kun la yang phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgrar 'jug /'dir le'u dang po las kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i btsun mo'i mchog phun sum tshogs pa zhes gsungs na /
translated: Similarly, the term “perfect” is used for all the clans, glories, riches, and so on. Here, in the first chapter, it is also said, “the perfect supreme queen of the tathāgatas.”

original: 'di'i skabs su phun sum tshogs pa zhes bgyi ba ji ltar bshad ces zhus pa ni nyi shu lnga pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i skabs su phun sum tshogs pa zhes bgyi ba ji ltar bshad ces zhus pa ni nyi shu lnga pa'o //
translated: The twenty-fifth question is, At this time, what is explained as 'perfection'?

original: 'di la khro ba chen po bcu 'byung ba la le'u dang por khro bo bzhi smos pa'i mtshan gshin rje mthar phyin zhes pa'i don /
analyzed: 'di la khro ba chen po bcu 'byung ba la le'u dang por khro bo bzhi smos pa'i mtshan gshin rje mthar phyin zhes pa'i don /
translated: Here, the ten great wrathful ones arise. In the first chapter, four wrathful ones are mentioned. The meaning of the name Yamântaka is as follows.

original: ci'i phyir gshin rje mthar phyin zhes bya ba lags zhes zhus pa ni nyi shu drug pa'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir gshin rje mthar phyin zhes bya ba lags zhes zhus pa ni nyi shu drug pa'o //
translated: The twenty-sixth question is, Why is it called 'Yamântaka'?

original: shes rab mthar phyin zhes bya ba don ji lta bu lags zhes zhus pa ni nyi shu bdun pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab mthar phyin zhes bya ba don ji lta bu lags zhes zhus pa ni nyi shu bdun pa'o //
translated: The twenty-seventh question is, What is the meaning of 'perfection of wisdom'?🔽The twenty-eighth question is, What is the meaning of 'Padmanântaka' for Hayagrîva?

original: rta mgrin la padma mthar phyin zhes bgyi ba'i don ji lta bu lags zhes zhus pa ni nyi shu brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: rta mgrin la padma mthar phyin zhes bgyi ba'i don ji lta bu lags zhes zhus pa ni nyi shu brgyad pa'o //
translated: The twenty-ninth question is, What is the meaning of 'Vighnân-taka' for Amrtakundali?🔽The thirtieth question is, What is the meaning of 'Vajranântaka' for Acala?🔽The thirty-first question is, What is the meaning of 'Vajranântaka' for Takkirāja?🔽The thirty-second question is, What is the meaning of 'Vajranântaka' for Niladanda?

original: bdud rtsi 'khyil pa la bgegs mthar phyin pa zhes bgyi ba'i don ji lta bu lags @65a * //🔽zhes zhus pa ni nyi shu dgu pa'o //
analyzed: bdud rtsi 'khyil pa la bgegs mthar phyin pa zhes bgyi ba'i don ji lta bu lags @65a * // zhes zhus pa ni nyi shu dgu pa'o //
translated: The thirty-third question is, What is the meaning of 'Vajranântaka' for Aparajita?🔽The thirty-fourth question is, What is the meaning of 'Vajranântaka' for Ucchuşma?

original: phyogs bcu dus bzhi'i mgon po kun gyis sam /
analyzed: phyogs bcu dus bzhi'i mgon po kun gyis sam /
translated: The thirty-fifth question is, What is the meaning of 'Vajranântaka' for Sumbharaja?🔽The thirty-sixth question is, What is the meaning of 'Vajranântaka' for Mahâbala?🔽The thirty-seventh question is, What is the meaning of 'Vajranântaka' for Takkirāja?🔽The thirty-eighth question is, What is the meaning of 'Vajranântaka' for Niladanda?🔽The thirty-ninth question is, What is the meaning of 'Vajranântaka' for Aparajita?🔽The fortieth question is, What is the meaning of 'Vajranântaka' for Ucchuşma?

original: dkyil 'khor 'di'i mgon po rnams kyis dus dang gnas skabs kun du 'gro ba rnams kyi don spyod pa'i tshul dang rnam pa ji ltar spyod pa lags zhes zhus pa ni sum cu pa'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor 'di'i mgon po rnams kyis dus dang gnas skabs kun du 'gro ba rnams kyi don spyod pa'i tshul dang rnam pa ji ltar spyod pa lags zhes zhus pa ni sum cu pa'o //
translated: In what way do the lords of this mandala always act for the benefit of beings?

original: sngags spyod pa'am sngags kyi spyod pa dur khrod kyi rgyan cha thogs nas drag shul gyi spyod pas sgrub ces mchi na sgo gsum sbyor ba ji ltar bgyis la spyad par bgyi zhes zhus pa ni sum cu gcig pa'o //
analyzed: sngags spyod pa'am sngags kyi spyod pa dur khrod kyi rgyan cha thogs nas drag shul gyi spyod pas sgrub ces mchi na sgo gsum sbyor ba ji ltar bgyis la spyad par bgyi zhes zhus pa ni sum cu gcig pa'o //
translated: If one practices the mantra or the mantra practice, wearing the ornaments of the charnel ground, and accomplishes through wrathful conduct, how should one engage in the practice with the three doors?

original: bzlas brjod bgyi ba'i thabs kyang rdo rje bzlas pa 'ba' zhig tu bya zhes kyang mchi /
analyzed: bzlas brjod bgyi ba'i thabs kyang rdo rje bzlas pa 'ba' zhig tu bya zhes kyang mchi /
translated: It is also said, The method of recitation is only vajra recitation.🔽 If it is also said, The recitation of the four families, and so on, how should one understand the method?

original: rigs bzhi'i bzlas brjod pa la sogs par yang gsung na thabs ji ltar 'tshal bar bgyi zhes zhus pa ni so gnyis pa'o zhes bya ba'i sgras phyag rgya la rgyas 'debs pa zhes mchi ba mchis na /
analyzed: rigs bzhi'i bzlas brjod pa la sogs par yang gsung na thabs ji ltar 'tshal bar bgyi zhes zhus pa ni so gnyis pa'o zhes bya ba'i sgras phyag rgya la rgyas 'debs pa zhes mchi ba mchis na /
translated: The phrase sealing with the mudra is mentioned.

original: 'di'i skabs su rgyas 'debs zhes bgyi ba'i don ji ltar 'tshal bar bgyi zhes zhus pa ni so gsum pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i skabs su rgyas 'debs zhes bgyi ba'i don ji ltar 'tshal bar bgyi zhes zhus pa ni so gsum pa'o //
translated: In this context, what is the meaning of sealing?

original: gzhung gzhan las chos kyi dbyings dang de bzhin gshegs pa nyid la chos kyi 'byung gnas zhes mchi /
analyzed: gzhung gzhan las chos kyi dbyings dang de bzhin gshegs pa nyid la chos kyi 'byung gnas zhes mchi /
translated: In other scriptures, the dharmadhātu and the Tathāgata are called the “source of phenomena.”

original: nam mkha' dang / gzhal yas khang dang / gsang ba'i mkha' dbyings la yang chos kyi 'byung gnas zhes mchi na /
analyzed: nam mkha' dang / gzhal yas khang dang / gsang ba'i mkha' dbyings la yang chos kyi 'byung gnas zhes mchi na /
translated: Space, the celestial mansion, and the secret space element are also called the “source of phenomena.”

original: 'di'i skabs gdal bgyi ba lags zhes zhus pa ni so bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i skabs gdal bgyi ba lags zhes zhus pa ni so bzhi pa'o //
translated: In this context, what is meant by pervading?

original: mtshan nyid kyi theg pa las ni sdom pa zhes mchi la /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi theg pa las ni sdom pa zhes mchi la /
translated: In the vehicle of characteristics, it is called a “vow,”

original: sngags kyi thog pa las ni dam tshig ces bshad na /
analyzed: sngags kyi thog pa las ni dam tshig ces bshad na /
translated: and in the vehicle of mantra, it is explained as a “samaya.”

original: 'di'i skabs su sdom pa zhes bshad pa'i don ji lta bu lags zhes zhus pa ni so lnga pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i skabs su sdom pa zhes bshad pa'i don ji lta bu lags zhes zhus pa ni so lnga pa'o //
translated: In this context, what is the meaning of explaining it as a vow?

original: dug gsum ma spangs pas ni bdag gzhan la gnod cing ngan song du ltung ba'i rgyu lags na /
analyzed: dug gsum ma spangs pas ni bdag gzhan la gnod cing ngan song du ltung ba'i rgyu lags na /
translated: Since the three poisons are not abandoned, they are the cause of harming oneself and others and falling into the lower realms.

original: gsang sngags kyi gzhung gis dug gsum spyad pas 'grub pa dang / sems can gyi don du 'gyur zhes mchi na /
analyzed: gsang sngags kyi gzhung gis dug gsum spyad pas 'grub pa dang / sems can gyi don du 'gyur zhes mchi na /
translated: If it is said that the texts of the secret mantra are accomplished by practicing the three poisons, and that they are for the benefit of sentient beings,

original: 'di'i skabs su don ji ltar 'tshal bar bgyi zhes zhus pa ni so drug pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i skabs su don ji ltar 'tshal bar bgyi zhes zhus pa ni so drug pa'o //
translated: in this context, how should the meaning be understood?

original: dkyil 'khor gzhung gzhan las chos kyi sku yang mchi /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gzhung gzhan las chos kyi sku yang mchi /
translated: In other texts of the maṇḍala, there is the dharmakāya,

original: gzugs kyi sku dang / rdul tshon du bris pa dang / rnal 'byor pas bsgom pa la yang mchi /
analyzed: gzugs kyi sku dang / rdul tshon du bris pa dang / rnal 'byor pas bsgom pa la yang mchi /
translated: and there is the rūpakāya, which is drawn with colored powders, and which is meditated upon by the yogin.🔽In the Candragarbha,

original: zla gsang las ni /
analyzed: zla gsang las ni /
translated: it is said:🔽The suchness of oneself, equipoise,🔽and likewise, the suchness of the deity,

original: bdag nyid de nyid mnyam gzhag dang // de bzhin lha yi de nyid dang // sngags dang phyag rgya'i de nyid ni //
analyzed: bdag nyid de nyid mnyam gzhag dang // de bzhin lha yi de nyid dang // sngags dang phyag rgya'i de nyid ni //
translated: the suchness of mantra and mudrā,

original: de yis dkyil 'khor mchog tu 'gyur //
analyzed: de yis dkyil 'khor mchog tu 'gyur //
translated: by that, the maṇḍala is supreme.🔽In the Yoga,

original: zhes gsungs // sbyor ba las ni /
analyzed: zhes gsungs // sbyor ba las ni /
translated: it is said:

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi byang chub sems //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi byang chub sems //
translated: The bodhicitta of all buddhas

original: bla na med @65b par rtogs par 'gyur //
analyzed: bla na med @65b par rtogs par 'gyur //
translated: is realized as unsurpassed.

original: rgyal bas gsungs pa'i ye shes gang //
analyzed: rgyal bas gsungs pa'i ye shes gang //
translated: The wisdom taught by the Victor

original: de ni dkyil 'khor snying por gsungs //
analyzed: de ni dkyil 'khor snying por gsungs //
translated: is said to be the essence of the maṇḍala.

original: zhes gsungs na 'di'i skabs su dkyil 'khor zhes bgyi ba'i don ji ltar lags zhes zhus pa ni so bdun pa'o //
analyzed: zhes gsungs na 'di'i skabs su dkyil 'khor zhes bgyi ba'i don ji ltar lags zhes zhus pa ni so bdun pa'o //
translated: What is the meaning of mandala in this context?

original: phyag rgya yang 'jig rten pa'i rgyal po la sogs pa la'ang mchis ;
analyzed: phyag rgya yang 'jig rten pa'i rgyal po la sogs pa la'ang mchis ;
translated: The seal is also found in worldly kings and so on.

original: / sngags kyi rgyud las kyang phyag rgya lus la dgod pa dang / dkyil 'khor la dgod pa dang / yum la dgod pa dang / gzhan gyi lus la bkod nas srung ba la sogs pa'i thabs mang por 'byung ba mchis na 'di'i skabs su gang la bgyi /
analyzed: / sngags kyi rgyud las kyang phyag rgya lus la dgod pa dang / dkyil 'khor la dgod pa dang / yum la dgod pa dang / gzhan gyi lus la bkod nas srung ba la sogs pa'i thabs mang por 'byung ba mchis na 'di'i skabs su gang la bgyi /
translated: In the tantras of mantra, there are many methods such as arranging the seal on the body, arranging it in the mandala, arranging it on the consort, and arranging it on the body of another for protection and so on. In this context, what is it?

original: ji ltar dgod ces zhus pa ni so brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar dgod ces zhus pa ni so brgyad pa'o //
translated: How is it arranged?

original: me tog kyang gzhung kha cig las ni chu las skyes pa dang / thang las skyes pa dang / ri las skyes pa dang / autpala dang / padma dang / ku mu da la sogs pa /
analyzed: me tog kyang gzhung kha cig las ni chu las skyes pa dang / thang las skyes pa dang / ri las skyes pa dang / autpala dang / padma dang / ku mu da la sogs pa /
translated: As for the flower, in some texts it is said to be born from water, born from land, born from mountains, blue lotus, lotus, kumuda, and so on.

original: ming dang gzugs dang dri dang kha dog la sogs pa dag la mchi /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs dang dri dang kha dog la sogs pa dag la mchi /
translated: Name, form, smell, color, and so on.

original: kha cig tu khrag la yang me tog ces mchi //
analyzed: kha cig tu khrag la yang me tog ces mchi //
translated: In some places, blood is also called flower.

original: kha cig las ni phyag rgya la yang me tog ces mchin /
analyzed: kha cig las ni phyag rgya la yang me tog ces mchin /
translated: Some texts also call the consort a “flower.”

original: 'di'i skabs su don ji lta bu la 'tshal bar bgyi zhes zhus pa ni so dgu pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i skabs su don ji lta bu la 'tshal bar bgyi zhes zhus pa ni so dgu pa'o //
translated: The fortieth question is, “What is the meaning of this section?”

original: mchod rten yang /
analyzed: mchod rten yang /
translated: A stūpa

original: mdo sde las ni sangs rgyas mang po lhan cig tu tshogs pa'i gnas la yang mchi //
analyzed: mdo sde las ni sangs rgyas mang po lhan cig tu tshogs pa'i gnas la yang mchi //
translated: is also mentioned in the sūtras as the place where many buddhas gather.

original: sku gsung thugs kyi gzugs brnyan la yang mchi /
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi gzugs brnyan la yang mchi /
translated: It is also a representation of the enlightened body, speech, and mind.

original: dge ba bcu nas byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos rgyu dang 'bras bu dang lam gyis brgyan pa'i ngo bo chos kyi sku'i gzugs brnyan /
analyzed: dge ba bcu nas byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos rgyu dang 'bras bu dang lam gyis brgyan pa'i ngo bo chos kyi sku'i gzugs brnyan /
translated: It is a representation of the dharmakāya, the essence adorned with the causes, results, and paths of the buddhadharmas, such as the ten virtues and the aspects of awakening.

original: gdan dang / khri dang / 'phang dang / bum rten dang / bum pa dang / kha khyer dang / 'khor lo dang ; gdugs dang / tog gis brgyan pa la yang mchi /
analyzed: gdan dang / khri dang / 'phang dang / bum rten dang / bum pa dang / kha khyer dang / 'khor lo dang ; gdugs dang / tog gis brgyan pa la yang mchi /
translated: It is also adorned with a seat, a throne, a platform, a base, a vase, a lip, wheels, parasols, and victory banners.

original: gdan bzhi pa las ni sgrogs pa drug gi mchod rten zhes bya ba /
analyzed: gdan bzhi pa las ni sgrogs pa drug gi mchod rten zhes bya ba /
translated: The Caturdevīparipṛcchā says that a stūpa is called “the stūpa of the six proclamations.”

original: zur bcu gnyis bang rim bzhi 'khor lo bcu bdun yod pa /
analyzed: zur bcu gnyis bang rim bzhi 'khor lo bcu bdun yod pa /
translated: It has twelve corners, four terraces, and seventeen wheels.

original: khams gsum gyi gzugs brnyan la mchod gnas thams cad bzhugs par yang rtag par 'byung na /
analyzed: khams gsum gyi gzugs brnyan la mchod gnas thams cad bzhugs par yang rtag par 'byung na /
translated: If it is always the case that all the abodes of worship are present in the reflections of the three realms,

original: 'di'i skabs su don ji lta bu la shes par bgyi zhes zhus pa ni bzhi bcu pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i skabs su don ji lta bu la shes par bgyi zhes zhus pa ni bzhi bcu pa'o //
translated: what is the meaning of the question in the fortieth chapter, “What should be understood in this context?”

original: gsang ba'i snying po las ni /
analyzed: gsang ba'i snying po las ni /
translated: In the Secret Nucleus,

original: gzhi tshad med pa'i ye shes kyi 'khor lo la ba la zhes gzhal yas khang gi gzhi la bshad /
analyzed: gzhi tshad med pa'i ye shes kyi 'khor lo la ba la zhes gzhal yas khang gi gzhi la bshad /
translated: it is explained that the “base” (bala) in the “wheel of immeasurable gnosis of the base” is the base of the immeasurable palace.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams la yang mchi /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams la yang mchi /
translated: It also refers to the deities of the maṇḍala.

original: @66a * // 'jam dpal las ni shes rab 'khor lo zhes mchi ste gzhal yas khang la yang bgyi /
analyzed: @66a * // 'jam dpal las ni shes rab 'khor lo zhes mchi ste gzhal yas khang la yang bgyi /
translated: In the Mañjuśrī’s Magical Web, it says “wheel of wisdom,” which can refer to the immeasurable palace.

original: gnas skabs kha cig tu lha'i thugs kar sgom pa la bgyi ba la 'byung /
analyzed: gnas skabs kha cig tu lha'i thugs kar sgom pa la bgyi ba la 'byung /
translated: In some contexts, it refers to the meditation on the heart of the deity.🔽In some texts,

original: gzhung kha cig las ni /
analyzed: gzhung kha cig las ni /
translated: it says,

original: dkyil 'khor la ni dkyil 'khor bshad //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor la ni dkyil 'khor bshad //
translated: “The maṇḍala is explained as the maṇḍala.

original: de nyid dam tshig yin par bshad //🔽ces kyang 'byung /
analyzed: de nyid dam tshig yin par bshad //🔽ces kyang 'byung /
translated: That itself is explained as the samaya.”

original: 'khor ba'i 'khor lo dang / nyon mongs pa'i 'khor lo dang / chos kyi 'khor lo zhes kyang bshad na 'di'i skabs su don ji lta bu la shes par bgyi zhes zhus pa ni bzhi bcu gcig pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i 'khor lo dang / nyon mongs pa'i 'khor lo dang / chos kyi 'khor lo zhes kyang bshad na 'di'i skabs su don ji lta bu la shes par bgyi zhes zhus pa ni bzhi bcu gcig pa'o //
translated: If the wheel of samsara, the wheel of afflictions, and the wheel of Dharma are also explained, what should be understood in this context? This is the forty-first question.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyis bskyed pa dang / ye shes sems dpa' spyan drang ba la sogs pa'i sngags kyang rnam pa mang por phye nas bstan pa mchis na /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyis bskyed pa dang / ye shes sems dpa' spyan drang ba la sogs pa'i sngags kyang rnam pa mang por phye nas bstan pa mchis na /
translated: If the mantras for generating through samadhi, invoking the wisdom being, and so forth are also taught with many divisions,

original: 'di'i skabs su spyan drang ba la sogs pa sngags kyi thabs ji ltar lags zhes zhus pa ni bzhi bcu gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i skabs su spyan drang ba la sogs pa sngags kyi thabs ji ltar lags zhes zhus pa ni bzhi bcu gnyis pa'o //
translated: In this context, what is the method of the mantras for invoking and so forth? This is the forty-second question.

original: dbyings nas bskul ba dang / gnas nas bskul ba dang / gdul bya'i don la thugs dam bskul ba'i bye brag mang du mchis na /

analyzed: chos thams cad sku gsung thugs rdo rje rnam pa gsum du 'dus par bstan pa ste /
translated: This shows that all phenomena are included in the three vajras of enlightened body, speech and mind.

original: de'i don sgo gsum mnyam pa nyid du bzhag pas rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i don sgo gsum mnyam pa nyid du bzhag pas rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: 'on byang chub sems dpa'i sgo gsum de bzhin gshegs pa'i sgo gsum la mnyam par gzhag ci dgos she na /
translated: But why should the bodhisattvas rest in the equality of the tathagatas' three doors?

analyzed: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'am sems can dang sangs rgyas so so ma yin tha mi dad na byang chub @68a * //

analyzed: sems dpa' dang de bzhin gshegs pa mnyam zhing dbyer med par lta smos kyang ci dgos te so so ma yin tha mi dad par bstan pa'o //

original: de lta yin na byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa la chos zhu ba dang nyan ci dgos she na /
analyzed: de lta yin na byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa la chos zhu ba dang nyan ci dgos she na /

original: don dam par de ltar yin yang kun rdzob tu shes rab dang ye shes la khyad par che bas rtogs tshab che chung la khyad par yod par bstan pa dang / don dam par shes rab dang ye shes la khyad par med du zin kyang ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'gro ba gzhan la grags shing de dag gis shes pa'i rgyud ma byang ba spyad par bya ba dang /
analyzed: don dam par de ltar yin yang kun rdzob tu shes rab dang ye shes la khyad par che bas rtogs tshab che chung la khyad par yod par bstan pa dang / don dam par shes rab dang ye shes la khyad par med du zin kyang ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'gro ba gzhan la grags shing de dag gis shes pa'i rgyud ma byang ba spyad par bya ba dang /
translated: Although this is so ultimately, on the relative level, there is a great difference between wisdom and primordial wisdom, and so it is taught that there is a difference in the degree of realization.🔽And although ultimately there is no difference between wisdom and primordial wisdom, in the future, in order to purify the mind streams of other beings, who are renowned in the world, and in order to purify the mind streams of bodhisattvas, who have not yet purified their mind streams, the different approaches to the gateway of the bodhisattvas’ liberation are taught.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa 'jug pa'i sgo mi mthun pa dag gi rgyud spyang bar bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyang sngar bstan pa bzhin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa 'jug pa'i sgo mi mthun pa dag gi rgyud spyang bar bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyang sngar bstan pa bzhin te /

original: de'i phyir na 'di ltar bstan pa la 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir na 'di ltar bstan pa la 'gal ba med do //
translated: Therefore there is no contradiction in teaching in this way.

original: mdor na mnyam pa nyid rtogs pa mngon du gyur pa'i ngang la gnas pas mnyam pa nyid ji lta ba'i don bstan nas ma rtogs pa'i gdul bya rnams mnyam pa nyid la dgod pa'i thabs su bstan pa ste /

translated: In brief, the meaning of the teaching is the realization of equality, and the method of teaching is to establish disciples who have not realized equality in equality.

analyzed: mnyam pa nyid du bstan pa'i don yang rdo rje'i theg pa 'di nyid do // 'dir byang chub sems dbang po zhes smos pa'ang dper na /
translated: The meaning of the teaching of equality is this very Vajra Vehicle.

original: lha dang mi la sogs pa skye dgu'i gtso bo rnams la dbang po zhes zer ba dang / 'dra bar /

analyzed: byams pa la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' smos pa 'di dag kyang /
translated: The bodhisattvas mentioned here, such as Maitreya,

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' brjod kyis mi lang ba'i yang brjod kyis mi lang ba rnams kyi gtso bor gyur pa yin pas 'di skad ces smos so //
translated: are the most important among the bodhisattvas who are beyond measure.

original: rgya chen po zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rgya chen po zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The term “vast” refers to

analyzed: chos thams cad sku gsung thugs rdo rje rnam pa gsum du 'dus pa'i don ston pa ni rgyud 'di yin pas sam /

analyzed: gnyis su ni shin tu zab pa'i don ston pas tshig rgya chen po'o //

analyzed: gsum du ni don rnam pa bdun dang ldan pas rgya che ba ste /

translated: The vastness of the attitude, since the request is made out of a desire to benefit all sentient beings; the vastness of the accumulation, since the request is made with a nonconceptual mind and with reference to the meaning of nonapprehending; the vastness of realization, since the request is made with reference to the meaning of the inclusion of all phenomena within the three vajras of enlightened body, speech, and mind;

translated: Since they requested the meaning of attaining non-abiding nirvana, it is vast in nature. Since they requested the method of attaining buddhahood in one lifetime, it is vast in time. translated: Since they requested the accomplishment of the body, speech, and mind that are the nature of the five families and five pristine consciousnesses, it is vast in result.

analyzed: de lta bu'i don nyon cig ces bka' stsal pa'o //

analyzed: zhu ba dang / bka' stsal pa'i don yang sku gsung thugs su 'dus la /
translated: The meaning of the request and the reply is included in body, speech,🔽and mind.🔽Moreover, although they appear individually in the correct relative🔽truth, they are inseparable in the essence of the ultimate body, speech, and

analyzed: de yang yang dag pa'i kun rdzob tu so sor snang yang don dam pa'i sku gsung thugs kyi ngo bor dbyer med pa @69a * //

analyzed: chos nyan par 'dod pa'i phyir g-yeng ba med cing bag dang ldan par byas nas gnas pa'i don to // de nas de bzhin gshegs pa de dag ces bya ba ni de ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams cang mi gsung ba'i de ma thag tu de nas 'khor gyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa de dag thams cad rang rang gi thugs rnam

analyzed: dang po // gsang ba zhes bgyi ji ltar lags //

analyzed: sku gsung @69b thugs ni rnam pa gsum /

analyzed: zhes gsungs te theg pa dang rgyud gzhan las gsang ba'i sgra mang por bstan pa yod na yang 'o skol cag sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la ston ba byang chub sems rdo rjes bka' stsal ba'i rgyud 'di'i bzhed kyis ni de dag la mi

analyzed: bya'i / gang la zhe na /

analyzed: de la thun mong gi gsang ba bzhi ni / rgyu dang 'bras bu gsang ba dang lta ba dang spyod pa gsang ba'o //

translated: The result is the accomplishment of the three bodies and the five families. The impure aggregates, elements, and sense bases are accomplished as the maṇḍala of the male and female deities.

original: lta ba dang spyod pa gsang ba ni /
analyzed: lta ba dang spyod pa gsang ba ni /
translated: The secret of the view and conduct is as follows:

original: pho mo thabs dang shes rab tu bsgoms nas de'i 'byung ba lhag pa byang chub sems kyi rang bzhin du rtogs par byas pa dang / lus las byung ba'i dri ma lnga bdud rtsi lngar byin gyis brlabs pa dang / lcags kyu rnam pa lnga yum lngar byin gyis brlabs nas /
analyzed: pho mo thabs dang shes rab tu bsgoms nas de'i 'byung ba lhag pa byang chub sems kyi rang bzhin du rtogs par byas pa dang / lus las byung ba'i dri ma lnga bdud rtsi lngar byin gyis brlabs pa dang / lcags kyu rnam pa lnga yum lngar byin gyis brlabs nas /
translated: The five scents that arise from the body are empowered as the five amṛtas, and the five hooks are empowered as the five mothers.

original: de dag ye shes bdud rtsi'i ngo bor zhu ba bdag gis rol cing gzhan la mchod na /
analyzed: de dag ye shes bdud rtsi'i ngo bor zhu ba bdag gis rol cing gzhan la mchod na /
translated: Having enjoyed the dissolution of those into the essence of the elixir of timeless awareness and offered them to others,

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i sku tshe dang nad med bde mchog dar la bab pa dang / 'dod pa bzhin du 'gro ba dang 'ong ba la sogs pa 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i sku tshe dang nad med bde mchog dar la bab pa dang / 'dod pa bzhin du 'gro ba dang 'ong ba la sogs pa 'grub pa'o //
translated: one will accomplish the body of Vajrasattva, longevity, freedom from illness, the best of youth, and the ability to go and come as one wishes.

original: zab mo'i gsang ba gsum ni /
analyzed: zab mo'i gsang ba gsum ni /
translated: The three profound secrets

original: sku gsung thugs rdo rje gsang ba gsum la bya ste /
analyzed: sku gsung thugs rdo rje gsang ba gsum la bya ste /
translated: are the three secrets of the vajra body, speech, and mind.

original: de yang phyi'i dbang du bya ste de yang bshad na /
analyzed: de yang phyi'i dbang du bya ste de yang bshad na /
translated: If one explains them from the perspective of the outer empowerment,

original: chos thams cad sna tshogs pa'i rnam par snang ba ni sku /
analyzed: chos thams cad sna tshogs pa'i rnam par snang ba ni sku /
translated: the appearance of all phenomena in various forms is the body.

original: de nyid mtshan ma'i rnam pas dben pa ni gsung /
analyzed: de nyid mtshan ma'i rnam pas dben pa ni gsung /
translated: The absence of those in signified forms is speech.

original: mtshan ma dang mtshan ma med pa gnyis su med pa ni thugs /
analyzed: mtshan ma dang mtshan ma med pa gnyis su med pa ni thugs /
translated: The nonduality of attributes and the absence of attributes is mind.

original: de ltar yin pa'i don ma gsang bzhin du gzhan gyis rig pa'i spyod yul du mi 'gyur ba ni gsang ba /
analyzed: de ltar yin pa'i don ma gsang bzhin du gzhan gyis rig pa'i spyod yul du mi 'gyur ba ni gsang ba /
translated: The meaning of that is not concealed, but it is not an object of knowledge for others.

original: chos thams cad der 'dus pas na 'dus pa'o //🔽nang gi dbang @70a * //
analyzed: chos thams cad der 'dus pas na 'dus pa'o // nang gi dbang @70a * //
translated: Since all phenomena are included in that, it is the tantra.

original: du bya ste bshad na /
analyzed: du bya ste bshad na /
translated: The inner empowerment is explained as follows:

original: lus kyi bsgul bskyod thams cad phyag rgyar snang ba ni sku'i gsang ba /
analyzed: lus kyi bsgul bskyod thams cad phyag rgyar snang ba ni sku'i gsang ba /
translated: All movements of the body appear as mudra, which is the secret of the body.

original: ngag gi smra brjod thams cad sngags su gyur ba ni gsung gi gsang ba /
analyzed: ngag gi smra brjod thams cad sngags su gyur ba ni gsung gi gsang ba /
translated: All speech and expression becomes mantra, which is the secret of speech.

original: sems kyi dran rtog thams cad ting nge 'dzin du mkhyen pa ni thugs kyi gsang ba'o //
analyzed: sems kyi dran rtog thams cad ting nge 'dzin du mkhyen pa ni thugs kyi gsang ba'o //
translated: All thoughts and memories of the mind are known as samadhi, which is the secret of the mind.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzad spyod thams cad der 'dus pa de'i don rgyud 'dir 'dus par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzad spyod thams cad der 'dus pa de'i don rgyud 'dir 'dus par bstan pa'o //
translated: Since all the deeds and conduct of the tathagatas are included in that, the meaning of that is included in this tantra.

original: gsang ba'i dbang du bshad pa ni /
analyzed: gsang ba'i dbang du bshad pa ni /
translated: The secret empowerment is explained as follows:

original: ston pa byang chub sems rdo rje yab yum phyag rgya rnam pa bzhi dang ldan pa gnyis su med pa'i tshul du bzhugs pa /
analyzed: ston pa byang chub sems rdo rje yab yum phyag rgya rnam pa bzhi dang ldan pa gnyis su med pa'i tshul du bzhugs pa /
translated: The teacher is the vajra of bodhichitta, male and female in union, abiding in the manner of nonduality with the four mudras.

original: nyan thos chags pa spangs pa dang / 'jig rten pa chags pa rang dgar spyod pa gnyi ga'i don byed nus kyang de dag gi spyod yul du mi 'gyur ba ni sku'i gsang ba /
analyzed: nyan thos chags pa spangs pa dang / 'jig rten pa chags pa rang dgar spyod pa gnyi ga'i don byed nus kyang de dag gi spyod yul du mi 'gyur ba ni sku'i gsang ba /
translated: The secret of the body is that although he is able to benefit both the shravakas, who have abandoned attachment, and the worldly, who indulge in attachment, they are not within his sphere of activity.

original: de'i dus na yab yum so so'i sbyor ba'i brda dang gsang ba'i se gol gyis bde ba'i sgra dang / lhag pa'i byang chub sems kyi 'od zer las gsung yig 'bru'i sngags kyi 'phro 'du 'byung ba ni gsung gi gsang ba /
analyzed: de'i dus na yab yum so so'i sbyor ba'i brda dang gsang ba'i se gol gyis bde ba'i sgra dang / lhag pa'i byang chub sems kyi 'od zer las gsung yig 'bru'i sngags kyi 'phro 'du 'byung ba ni gsung gi gsang ba /
translated: The secret of speech is that at that time, from the secret finger snap of the individual union of the male and female, the sound of bliss and the light rays of the bodhichitta arise as the emanation and gathering of the mantra syllables of speech.

original: de ltar rol pa mdzad pa las yab kyi lhag pa byang chub kyi sems sa bon zla ba lta bur 'khyil pa dang / yum gyi gsang ba'i byang chub kyi sems mtshan dang ba bcag pa'i khu ba lta bur 'bar ba gnyis 'dres pa las ye shes lnga'i 'od zer 'phro zhing gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor bskyed la /
analyzed: de ltar rol pa mdzad pa las yab kyi lhag pa byang chub kyi sems sa bon zla ba lta bur 'khyil pa dang / yum gyi gsang ba'i byang chub kyi sems mtshan dang ba bcag pa'i khu ba lta bur 'bar ba gnyis 'dres pa las ye shes lnga'i 'od zer 'phro zhing gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor bskyed la /
translated: From the performance of this play, the father's seminal essence, which is the excess of bodhicitta, gathers like a moon, and the mother's secret bodhicitta blazes like the essence of the menstrual discharge. From the union of those two, the five gnoses radiate as light rays and generate the secret mandala.

original: ma reg pa nyer thogs su gnas pa ni thugs kyi gsang ba'o //
analyzed: ma reg pa nyer thogs su gnas pa ni thugs kyi gsang ba'o //
translated: The secret of mind is that [the bodhicitta] abides without touching the secret lotus.

original: 'bring du phye nas rgyud kyi don la sbyar nas bshad na /
analyzed: 'bring du phye nas rgyud kyi don la sbyar nas bshad na /
translated: The medium division is the explanation applied to the meaning of the tantra.

original: chos kyi sku mtshan ma med pa'i ngang la bzhugs na yang /
analyzed: chos kyi sku mtshan ma med pa'i ngang la bzhugs na yang /
translated: Although the dharmakāya is present in the state without signs,

original: gzugs kyi sku mtshan ma tha dad pa'i rnam par snang bas 'gro ba gang la mos pa'i skur ston pa dang / gsang ba'i theg pas 'dul ba rnams la yum gyi bha ga la gnyis su med pa'i tshul du bzhugs pa ni sku'i gsang ba /
analyzed: gzugs kyi sku mtshan ma tha dad pa'i rnam par snang bas 'gro ba gang la mos pa'i skur ston pa dang / gsang ba'i theg pas 'dul ba rnams la yum gyi bha ga la gnyis su med pa'i tshul du bzhugs pa ni sku'i gsang ba /
translated: the nirmāṇakāya appears in the form of different signs, and the saṃbhogakāya is the form that is shown to those to be tamed by the secret vehicle.

original: gsung brjod pa med pa'i ngang las mi g-yo bzhin sgra tha dad pas theg pa so so gang gis 'dul ba'i chos ston pa dang / gsang ba nges par 'byung ba'i gdul bya la rgyud 'di'i don 'chad par mdzad pa ni gsung gi gsang ba /
analyzed: gsung brjod pa med pa'i ngang las mi g-yo bzhin sgra tha dad pas theg pa so so gang gis 'dul ba'i chos ston pa dang / gsang ba nges par 'byung ba'i gdul bya la rgyud 'di'i don 'chad par mdzad pa ni gsung gi gsang ba /
translated: The secret of speech is that without moving from the state of inexpressible speech, he teaches the Dharma with different sounds that tame each individual vehicle.

original: thugs rnams par mi rtog pa'i ngang las mi g-yo yang ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo mang po la snyoms par @70b 'jug cing /
analyzed: thugs rnams par mi rtog pa'i ngang las mi g-yo yang ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo mang po la snyoms par @70b 'jug cing /
translated: The secret of mind is that without moving from the state of nonconceptual mind, he enters into meditative equipoise on many doors of samādhi.

original: cho 'phrul dang / rnam par 'phrul pa tha dad par ston pa dang / 'dod chags chen po'i tshul zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug cing rgyud 'di'i lha dang dkyil 'khor 'thon par mdzad pa ni thugs kyi gsang ba'o //
analyzed: cho 'phrul dang / rnam par 'phrul pa tha dad par ston pa dang / 'dod chags chen po'i tshul zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug cing rgyud 'di'i lha dang dkyil 'khor 'thon par mdzad pa ni thugs kyi gsang ba'o //
translated: He displays different miracles and emanations, and he enters into meditative equipoise on the samādhi called “the method of great desire” and so on, and he emanates the deities and maṇḍalas of this tantra.

original: der ni yang dag pa'i kun rdzob tu snang ba dang / don dam pa'i sku gsung thugs gnyi ga 'dus pas ni 'dus pa'o //
analyzed: der ni yang dag pa'i kun rdzob tu snang ba dang / don dam pa'i sku gsung thugs gnyi ga 'dus pas ni 'dus pa'o //
translated: There, the secret of body is the gathering of the two: the appearance of the correct relative and the ultimate body, speech, and mind.

original: 'o na gong du thun mong dang zab mo'i dbang du byas nas bshad pa'i gsang ba'i sgra de dag phyir ji ltar 'dus shes na /
analyzed: 'o na gong du thun mong dang zab mo'i dbang du byas nas bshad pa'i gsang ba'i sgra de dag phyir ji ltar 'dus shes na /
translated: Now, if one asks how those secret sounds explained above in terms of the common and profound are included in the outer,

original: de ltar bstan pa'i don phyag rgya rnam pa bzhir 'dus te /
analyzed: de ltar bstan pa'i don phyag rgya rnam pa bzhir 'dus te /
translated: the meaning of that explanation is included in the four types of seals.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: If one asks how,

original: sku'i gsang ba thams cad ni sku phyag rgya chen por 'dus so //
analyzed: sku'i gsang ba thams cad ni sku phyag rgya chen por 'dus so //
translated: all the secrets of body are included in the great seal of body.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If one asks why,

original: sku'i spyod pa tha dad par snang ba de dag thams cad de'i khyad par las byung ba'i phyir 'dus kyang de nyid du 'dus so //
analyzed: sku'i spyod pa tha dad par snang ba de dag thams cad de'i khyad par las byung ba'i phyir 'dus kyang de nyid du 'dus so //
translated: all those appearances of different activities of body are included in that, because they arise from its particularities.

original: gsung gi gsang ba thams cad ni chos kyi phyag rgyar 'dus te ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gsung gi gsang ba thams cad ni chos kyi phyag rgyar 'dus te ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: All the secrets of speech are included in the doctrine seal. If one asks why,

original: don gyi gsung zab pa dang / chag gi gsung rgya che bar gnyi ga gsung chos kyi phyag rgya'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don gyi gsung zab pa dang / chag gi gsung rgya che bar gnyi ga gsung chos kyi phyag rgya'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: both the profound meaning speech and the extensive verbal speech are the entity of the doctrine seal of speech.

original: thugs kyi gsang ba thams cad ni dam tshig gi phyag rgyar 'dus te /
analyzed: thugs kyi gsang ba thams cad ni dam tshig gi phyag rgyar 'dus te /
translated: All the secrets of mind are included in the pledge seal.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If one asks why,

original: dam tshig gi phyag rgya nyid ting nge 'dzin gyi bye brag mtshon pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi rtags kyang dam tshig gi phyag rgyar snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dam tshig gi phyag rgya nyid ting nge 'dzin gyi bye brag mtshon pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi rtags kyang dam tshig gi phyag rgyar snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The pledge seal itself is a particular meditative stabilization, and the sign of meditative stabilization also appears as the pledge seal.

original: lta spyod gnyis kyi gsang ba thams cad ni las kyi phyag rgyar 'dus te /
analyzed: lta spyod gnyis kyi gsang ba thams cad ni las kyi phyag rgyar 'dus te /
translated: All the secrets of view and conduct are included in the action seal.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: phrin las la dmigs nas ni lta ba 'byung la /
analyzed: phrin las la dmigs nas ni lta ba 'byung la /
translated: The view arises in dependence on the observation of activity.

original: lta ba la dmigs nas ni spyod pa la 'jug ste /
analyzed: lta ba la dmigs nas ni spyod pa la 'jug ste /
translated: Conduct is engaged in in dependence on the observation of the view.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i phrin las thams cad ni lta spyod zung du 'brel cing ya char ma gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i phrin las thams cad ni lta spyod zung du 'brel cing ya char ma gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The reason is that all the activities of the transcendent lords are a union of view and conduct, and are not one-sided.

original: la la na re /🔽sku'i gsang ba thams cad ni thugs ye shes las skye bas dam tshig gi phyag rgyar 'dus la /
analyzed: la la na re / sku'i gsang ba thams cad ni thugs ye shes las skye bas dam tshig gi phyag rgyar 'dus la /
translated: Some say:🔽All the secrets of body are included in the pledge seal, because they arise from the wisdom mind.

original: gsung gi gsang ba thams cad ni sku la brten te 'byung bas phyag rgya chen por 'dus pa'o //
analyzed: gsung gi gsang ba thams cad ni sku la brten te 'byung bas phyag rgya chen por 'dus pa'o //
translated: All the secrets of speech are included in the great seal, because they arise in dependence on the body.

original: thugs kyi gsang ba thams cad ni phrin las kyi dbang gis skyobs las kyi phyag rgyar 'dus so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: thugs kyi gsang ba thams cad ni phrin las kyi dbang gis skyobs las kyi phyag rgyar 'dus so zhes zer ro //
translated: All the secrets of mind are included in the activity consort through the empowerment of activity.

original: 'o na thun mong gi gsang ba bzhi sku gsung thugs su ji ltar bsdu zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na thun mong gi gsang ba bzhi sku gsung thugs su ji ltar bsdu zhe na /
translated: If one asks, “How are the four common secrets included in body, speech, and mind?”

original: lhag pa byang chub sems rnam pa gnyis ni thugs su bsdu /
analyzed: lhag pa byang chub sems rnam pa gnyis ni thugs su bsdu /
translated: The two types of bodhicitta, which are superior, are included in mind.

original: dug gsum dang dug lnga yang sems las byung ba yi @71a * //
analyzed: dug gsum dang dug lnga yang sems las byung ba yi @71a * //
translated: The three poisons and the five poisons also arise from the mind,

original: pas thugs su bsdu /
analyzed: pas thugs su bsdu /
translated: so they are included in mind.

original: phung po lnga dang / rdo sol la sogs pa sgrub rdzas su brjod pa rnams skur bsdu //
analyzed: phung po lnga dang / rdo sol la sogs pa sgrub rdzas su brjod pa rnams skur bsdu //
translated: The five aggregates, the substances for accomplishment such as the five nectars, and so on, are included in body.

original: brjod pa'i sgra ni gsung du bsdu /
analyzed: brjod pa'i sgra ni gsung du bsdu /
translated: The sounds of expression are included in speech.

original: gzugs sgra dbyer med pa'am /
analyzed: gzugs sgra dbyer med pa'am /
translated: Form and sound are inseparable,

original: gzugs med pa ni thugs su bsdu /
analyzed: gzugs med pa ni thugs su bsdu /
translated: or formlessness is included in mind.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i phung po dang khams dang skye mched /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i phung po dang khams dang skye mched /
translated: The method of inclusion of the aggregates, elements, and sense bases with and without outflows

original: zag pa med pa dkyil 'khor du bsgom pa'i bsdu thabs kyang tshul de bzhin du rig par bya'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: zag pa med pa dkyil 'khor du bsgom pa'i bsdu thabs kyang tshul de bzhin du rig par bya'o zhes zer ro //
translated: and the method of inclusion of the meditation on the maṇḍala should be understood in the same way.”

original: tshig nyung zhing don gsal ba la dga' ba rnams kyi don du theg pa'i spyi lugs la dgongs nas mdor bsdus te bshad na /
analyzed: tshig nyung zhing don gsal ba la dga' ba rnams kyi don du theg pa'i spyi lugs la dgongs nas mdor bsdus te bshad na /
translated: For those who delight in few words and clear meaning, the general system of the vehicles is intended and explained in brief.

original: phyi'i tshul du na sku'i gsang ba ni mtshan dang dpe byad /
analyzed: phyi'i tshul du na sku'i gsang ba ni mtshan dang dpe byad /
translated: In the outer way, the secret of the body is the major and minor marks.

original: gsung gi gsang ba ni dbyangs tha dad pa /
analyzed: gsung gi gsang ba ni dbyangs tha dad pa /
translated: The secret of speech is the different melodies.

original: thugs kyi gsang ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo 'bum phrag tha dad pa ste /
analyzed: thugs kyi gsang ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo 'bum phrag tha dad pa ste /
translated: The secret of the mind is the different doors of samādhi.

original: de dag 'gro ba tha dad pa'i don du ston pa yin du zin kyang gdul bya las ma dag pa rnams kyis mthong zhing thos kyang de dag gis don go bar mi nus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag 'gro ba tha dad pa'i don du ston pa yin du zin kyang gdul bya las ma dag pa rnams kyis mthong zhing thos kyang de dag gis don go bar mi nus pa'i phyir /
translated: Although those are taught for the purpose of different migrating beings, since those to be tamed with impure karma cannot understand the meaning even though they see and hear them,

original: rang bzhin gyis gsang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis gsang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: they are called “secret by nature.”

original: 'dus pa zhes bya ba ni snang ba ni thams cad skur 'dus sgrar grag pa thams cad gsung du 'dus /
analyzed: 'dus pa zhes bya ba ni snang ba ni thams cad skur 'dus sgrar grag pa thams cad gsung du 'dus /
translated: As for “assembly,” all appearances are assembled in the kāya; all sounds that resound are assembled in speech;

original: sems kyi dran rtog thams cad thugs su 'dus te /
analyzed: sems kyi dran rtog thams cad thugs su 'dus te /
translated: and all thoughts of the mind are assembled in the mind.

original: rgyud dbu zhabs kyi spyi'i don yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyud dbu zhabs kyi spyi'i don yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The general meaning of the tantra from beginning to end should be understood in that way.

original: nang gi tshul du gsang ba ni 'jig rten na snang ba'i pho mor grags pa'i lus ngag yid gsum dang mi bskyod pa yab yum gyi sku gsung thugs dbyer med pa la bya'o //
analyzed: nang gi tshul du gsang ba ni 'jig rten na snang ba'i pho mor grags pa'i lus ngag yid gsum dang mi bskyod pa yab yum gyi sku gsung thugs dbyer med pa la bya'o //
translated: The inner way of secret is that the body, speech, and mind renowned in the world as male and female are inseparable from the body, speech, and mind of Akṣobhya and his consort.

original: 'dus pa ni de yang sa bon zla ba lta bu'i ngang du 'dus pa la bya'o //
analyzed: 'dus pa ni de yang sa bon zla ba lta bu'i ngang du 'dus pa la bya'o //
translated: The gathering is that the seed syllables gather into the state of the moon.

original: gsang ba'i tshul ni /
analyzed: gsang ba'i tshul ni /
translated: The way of secret is as follows:

original: gsang ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku gsung thugs rdo rje'i snying po ste sa bon zla ba lta bu la bya /🔽'dus pa ni /
analyzed: gsang ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku gsung thugs rdo rje'i snying po ste sa bon zla ba lta bu la bya / 'dus pa ni /
translated: The secret is the essence of the vajra body, speech, and mind of all tathāgatas, which is the seed syllables in the form of a moon.

original: de las sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sku gsung thugs che ba'i yon tan 'dus pa'o //
analyzed: de las sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sku gsung thugs che ba'i yon tan 'dus pa'o //
translated: The gathering is that the great qualities of the body, speech, and mind of all buddhas gather from that.

original: 'o na rnal 'byor pa'i skabs su ji ltar sbyar zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na rnal 'byor pa'i skabs su ji ltar sbyar zhe na /
translated: Well then, how is that applied in the context of the practitioner?

original: de yang gong ma dang mthun /
analyzed: de yang gong ma dang mthun /
translated: That is the same as above.

original: lus ngag yid gsum sku gsung thugs su sbyar ba dang / yab yum byang chub sems dkar dmar 'dres pa la bya ste /
analyzed: lus ngag yid gsum sku gsung thugs su sbyar ba dang / yab yum byang chub sems dkar dmar 'dres pa la bya ste /
translated: The body, speech, and mind are applied to the body, speech, and mind, and the white and red bodhicitta of the father and mother are applied to the gathering of the great qualities of the body, speech, and mind of all buddhas.

original: tshul gong ma bzhin du sbyar ba la bya'o //
analyzed: tshul gong ma bzhin du sbyar ba la bya'o //
translated: The way of applying that is the same as above.

original: spyir ma h'a yo ga'i lugs kyi gsang ba ni //
analyzed: spyir ma h'a yo ga'i lugs kyi gsang ba ni //
translated: In general, the secret in the system of Mahayoga

original: yab yum la sogs pa lha thams cad kyi sku gsung thugs 'dus pa ni byang chub sems @71b dkar dmar rnam gnyis gsang ba'i mkha' la 'dres pa'i ngang du lha thams cad 'dus pa'o //

translated: Thus, the perfection of conceptualization is taught to be the attainment of the characteristics of the perfection of qualities, the maṇḍala of the three vajras of body, speech, and mind, the empowerment conferred there, the samādhi of meditating on that, the purification of the mind through samādhi,

analyzed: 'di bzhin du rgyas par ston pa ma yin pas na sangs rgyas ma lus pa kun gyi ston pa'i chos thams cad ni gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud 'dir 'dus pas na 'dus pa zhes bya la /

analyzed: de dag gi gtan tshigs kyang rtsa ba'i rgyud bshad pa'i slad du zhib cing rgyas bar bkral zin mod kyi 'on kyang rtsa ba'i rgyud thos shing rnam par bshad pa chen po dag gis bsdus pa'i glegs bam mthong ba'i skal ba med pa rnams kyis rgyud phyi ma
translated: the later tantra,

analyzed: skabs 'dir yang cung zad bkrol zhing dbye ba byas pa yin no //

analyzed: drang thad du brtags nas nan sbyor byas te bshad par zad do //

translated: In that chapter, the pledges of realization of the ultimate are taught, as well as the pledges of the five families that arise from the realization of the ultimate, and the amazing qualities of the bodhisattvas who have dispelled doubts about the ultimate.

original: le'u de gnyis 'brel to //
analyzed: le'u de gnyis 'brel to //

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /

translated: Even if the disciples have the characteristics taught in the fifth chapter, they will not be able to have faith in the meaning of this teaching on the equality of phenomena.

original: sems de'i ngo bor gnas pa las gzhan du mi 'da' ba ni le'u dgu pa las don dam par rtogs pa'i dam tshig la gnas pa de yin la /
analyzed: sems de'i ngo bor gnas pa las gzhan du mi 'da' ba ni le'u dgu pa las don dam par rtogs pa'i dam tshig la gnas pa de yin la /
translated: However, the one who abides in the essence of that mind and does not go beyond it is abiding in the pledge of realization of the ultimate taught in the ninth chapter.

original: don dam pa'i dam tshig las byung ba'i rigs lnga'i dam tshig bsrungs na dug gsum dang dug lnga nyid sku gsung thugs rdo rje dang / rigs lnga ye shes lnga'i ngang du rnam par dag pas dug gsum ma spangs par dngos su spyad pas 'grub par 'gyur bas na de'i phyir na de gnyis 'brel to //
