translated: If one guards the pledges of the five families that arise from the ultimate pledge, then the three poisons and the five poisons themselves are purified in the state of the three vajras of body, speech, and mind and the five families and five pristine awarenesses. Therefore, one will become accomplished by directly engaging in the three poisons without abandoning them. Thus, those two are related.

original: de bas na theg pa 'di'i bzhed kyis dngos grub thams cad ni gsang ba'i rdo rje slob dpon la rag las pas /
analyzed: de bas na theg pa 'di'i bzhed kyis dngos grub thams cad ni gsang ba'i rdo rje slob dpon la rag las pas /
translated: Therefore, according to the assertion of this vehicle, all powers depend on the secret vajra master.

original: rdo rje slob dpon de ni rdo rje sems dpa' dang 'dra bas thugs dang 'gal bar byas na 'grub par mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: rdo rje slob dpon de ni rdo rje sems dpa' dang 'dra bas thugs dang 'gal bar byas na 'grub par mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: Since that vajra master is like Vajrasattva, if one acts in a way that contradicts his or her mind, one will not become accomplished.

original: ngan song du 'gro bar gsungs kyi rigs ngan la sogs pa de dag sngar mi dge ba spyad du zin kyang /
analyzed: ngan song du 'gro bar gsungs kyi rigs ngan la sogs pa de dag sngar mi dge ba spyad du zin kyang /
translated: It is said that they will go to the lower realms, but even if they have previously engaged in nonvirtue,

original: chos 'di'i gzhung las dad pa gting nas g-yos nas 'jug na 'grub par nges par gsungs te /
analyzed: chos 'di'i gzhung las dad pa gting nas g-yos nas 'jug na 'grub par nges par gsungs te /
translated: it is taught that if they enter this Dharma system with faith that is deeply stirred, they will definitely achieve [awakening].

original: de ni gsang sngags rdo rje theg pa'i rgyud 'di thabs rgya che la sgo yangs par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni gsang sngags rdo rje theg pa'i rgyud 'di thabs rgya che la sgo yangs par bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is because this tantra of the Vajra Vehicle of Mantra teaches that the methods are vast and the doors are open.

original: le'u de gnyis dang / bcu bdun pa dang bcu gsum pa zhes bya ba 'dir 'brel te /
analyzed: le'u de gnyis dang / bcu bdun pa dang bcu gsum pa zhes bya ba 'dir 'brel te /
translated: The two chapters and this one called “The Thirteenth” are connected.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: le'u bcu bdun pa las /
analyzed: le'u bcu bdun pa las /
translated: In the seventeenth chapter it says:

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sku gsung thugs rdo rje'i dam tshig dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / nyan thos dang / tshangs pa dang / ma h'a de ba dang / brgya byin dang / gnod sbyin dang / gnod sbyin mo la sogs pa'i @73b dam tshig dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sku gsung thugs rdo rje'i dam tshig dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / nyan thos dang / tshangs pa dang / ma h'a de ba dang / brgya byin dang / gnod sbyin dang / gnod sbyin mo la sogs pa'i @73b dam tshig dang /
translated: The commitments of the vajra body, speech, and mind of all buddhas, and the commitments of pratyekabuddhas, śrāvakas, Brahmā, Maheśvara, Indra, yakṣas, yakṣiṇīs, and so on,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod ba lus sems kyi sdom pa dang / sgrub pa thams cad kyi sdom pa la sogs pa dang / rdo rje slob dpon gyi yon tan bshad nas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod ba lus sems kyi sdom pa dang / sgrub pa thams cad kyi sdom pa la sogs pa dang / rdo rje slob dpon gyi yon tan bshad nas /
translated: The conduct of the Tathagata is the vows of body and mind, the vows of all the practices, and so forth, and the qualities of the vajra master are explained.

original: de la sku gsung thugs kyi dngos grub gnas par bstan pa dang / kha zas byin gyis brlab pa dang ; sku gsung thugs rdo rje'i mchod pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mchod pa gsang ba dang / bsnyen sgrub rnam pa bzhi byed pa'i dus su nyam chung na gzi byin bskyed pa dang /
analyzed: de la sku gsung thugs kyi dngos grub gnas par bstan pa dang / kha zas byin gyis brlab pa dang ; sku gsung thugs rdo rje'i mchod pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mchod pa gsang ba dang / bsnyen sgrub rnam pa bzhi byed pa'i dus su nyam chung na gzi byin bskyed pa dang /
translated: The attainments of body, speech and mind are taught to abide in that, and the consecration of food, the offerings of vajra body, speech and mind, the secret offerings of all the Tathagatas, and when one is weak during the four parts of the service and attainment, the generation of splendor,

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi dkyil 'khor bskyed pa dang / slob ma dbang bskur ba dang / aa dza na dang khrag drang ba la sogs pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi dkyil 'khor bskyed pa dang / slob ma dbang bskur ba dang / aa dza na dang khrag drang ba la sogs pa 'byung ste /
translated: the generation of the mandala of meditative stabilization, the initiation of the disciple, the extraction of the essence of the a-ja-na, blood and so forth, are taught.

original: le'u lnga par gsungs pa'i mchan nyid dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pas /
analyzed: le'u lnga par gsungs pa'i mchan nyid dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pas /
translated: The yogin who possesses the very annotations taught in the fifth chapter,

original: le'u dgu pa las gsungs pa'i rigs lnga'i dam tshig bsrung zhing de kho na nyid kyi dam tshig la gnas pa rtog pa'i the tshom bcad nas dug gsum ma spangs par spyad pas 'grub par lta ba de'i nang du /
analyzed: le'u dgu pa las gsungs pa'i rigs lnga'i dam tshig bsrung zhing de kho na nyid kyi dam tshig la gnas pa rtog pa'i the tshom bcad nas dug gsum ma spangs par spyad pas 'grub par lta ba de'i nang du /
translated: The view that one will succeed by keeping the pledges of the five families as taught in the ninth chapter, by abiding in the pledge of reality, by resolving doubts, and by engaging in the three poisons without rejecting them,

original: le'u bcu bdun pa'i nyan thos dang rang rgyal ba'i dam tshig la sogs pa dang / bsnyen pa'i yan lag bzhi'i sdom pa la sogs pa'ang 'dus la /
analyzed: le'u bcu bdun pa'i nyan thos dang rang rgyal ba'i dam tshig la sogs pa dang / bsnyen pa'i yan lag bzhi'i sdom pa la sogs pa'ang 'dus la /
translated: includes the pledges of the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas taught in the seventeenth chapter, as well as the vows of the four branches of familiarization.

original: dam tshig dang sdom pa thams cad kyang rigs lnga'i dam tshig gi yan lag tu gyur pa yin pas rtsa ba dang / yan lag gi dam tshig dang ldan pas kha zas byin gyis brlab cing bdag gis bza' ba dang / gzhan la mchod pa dang /
analyzed: dam tshig dang sdom pa thams cad kyang rigs lnga'i dam tshig gi yan lag tu gyur pa yin pas rtsa ba dang / yan lag gi dam tshig dang ldan pas kha zas byin gyis brlab cing bdag gis bza' ba dang / gzhan la mchod pa dang /
translated: Since all pledges and vows are branches of the pledges of the five families, one who possesses the root and branch pledges should bless the food and eat it, offer it to others, and eat it with the pride of being the deity.

original: ting nge 'dzin bsgom zhing slob ma dbang bskur ba dang / las dang grub pa gang 'dod pa brtsam pa dang / de'i dus nyam chung na gzi byin bskyed dgos pas na /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin bsgom zhing slob ma dbang bskur ba dang / las dang grub pa gang 'dod pa brtsam pa dang / de'i dus nyam chung na gzi byin bskyed dgos pas na /
translated: When you are meditating on samādhi, when you are bestowing empowerments on disciples, when you are beginning any activity or spiritual accomplishment, and when you are weak at those times, you need to generate brilliance.🔽

original: de'i phyir dgu pa dang bcu bdun par 'brel te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dgu pa dang bcu bdun par 'brel te /
translated: The ninth chapter is related to the seventeenth chapter because one must meditate on samādhi, confer empowerment on disciples, begin whatever activities and accomplishments are desired, and if one is weak at that time, one must generate charisma.

original: bcu bdun pa de dang le'u bcu gsum pa der 'brel te /
analyzed: bcu bdun pa de dang le'u bcu gsum pa der 'brel te /
translated: The seventeenth chapter is related to the thirteenth chapter.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bcu gsum pa las sku gsung thugs kyi bzlas pa dang / rigs lnga'i bzlas pa dang / khro bo'i bzlas pa dang / de bzhin du rigs gsum dang / gti mug dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang gi bzlas pa dang / ma ning gi bzlas pa dang /
analyzed: bcu gsum pa las sku gsung thugs kyi bzlas pa dang / rigs lnga'i bzlas pa dang / khro bo'i bzlas pa dang / de bzhin du rigs gsum dang / gti mug dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang gi bzlas pa dang / ma ning gi bzlas pa dang /
translated: In the thirteenth chapter, the recitation of body, speech, and mind, the recitation of the five families, the recitation of the wrathful ones, and likewise, the recitation of the three families, ignorance, desire, and hatred, the recitation of the neuters,

original: de'i dus kyi gzungs dang / rigs lnga'i dkyil 'khor gyi bye brag dang / las rnam bzhi dang / de'i lha dang / drag po'i las kyi dmigs pa dang / @74a * //
analyzed: de'i dus kyi gzungs dang / rigs lnga'i dkyil 'khor gyi bye brag dang / las rnam bzhi dang / de'i lha dang / drag po'i las kyi dmigs pa dang / @74a * //
translated: the dhāraṇī at that time, the distinctions of the maṇḍala of the five families, the four activities, the deities of that, the visualization of wrathful activities,🔽and so on, are explained.

original: bdag gzhan bsrung ba dang / chu'i rdzu 'phrul dang / rgya mtsho rkang pas gnon pa dang / pha rol rgol ba'i dpung thams cad gnon pa dang / dgra rmongs par bya ba dang / grong khyer gyi nad bsal ba dang / 'gro ba 'dul thabs kyi ting nge 'dzin dang /
analyzed: bdag gzhan bsrung ba dang / chu'i rdzu 'phrul dang / rgya mtsho rkang pas gnon pa dang / pha rol rgol ba'i dpung thams cad gnon pa dang / dgra rmongs par bya ba dang / grong khyer gyi nad bsal ba dang / 'gro ba 'dul thabs kyi ting nge 'dzin dang /
translated: protecting oneself and others, the miracle of water, stepping with one's foot on the ocean, subduing all opposing armies, confusing enemies, dispelling the disease of a city, the concentration of the method of subduing migrating beings,

original: srung ba'i 'khor lo dang / khro bo bcu'i cha lugs rnams ston te /
analyzed: srung ba'i 'khor lo dang / khro bo bcu'i cha lugs rnams ston te /
translated: and displaying the forms of the ten wrathful ones.

original: le'u bcu bdun pa'i sdom pa dang / dam tshig la gnas pa'i ting nge 'dzin bsgom zhing slob ma dbang bskur ba dang / las dang sgrub pa gang 'dod pa brtsam pa dang bza' ba de yang le'u bcu gsum pa nas 'byung ba'i bzlas brjod bya ba'i thabs dang /
analyzed: le'u bcu bdun pa'i sdom pa dang / dam tshig la gnas pa'i ting nge 'dzin bsgom zhing slob ma dbang bskur ba dang / las dang sgrub pa gang 'dod pa brtsam pa dang bza' ba de yang le'u bcu gsum pa nas 'byung ba'i bzlas brjod bya ba'i thabs dang /
translated: The summary of the seventeenth chapter is meditating on the concentration of abiding in the samaya, conferring empowerment on the disciples, and beginning whatever activities and practices are desired.

original: gzungs dang rigs lnga'i dkyil 'khor gyi bye brag dang / las bzhi'i thab dang / lha dang drag po'i las kyi dmigs pa la sogs pa shes par bya ba la brten na gang 'dod pa sgrub pa'i bye brag thams cad kyang 'grub la /
analyzed: gzungs dang rigs lnga'i dkyil 'khor gyi bye brag dang / las bzhi'i thab dang / lha dang drag po'i las kyi dmigs pa la sogs pa shes par bya ba la brten na gang 'dod pa sgrub pa'i bye brag thams cad kyang 'grub la /
translated: If one knows the dhāraṇīs, the distinctions of the maṇḍalas of the five families, the hearth of the four activities, the deity, and the visualization of wrathful activity, and so on, all the various desired accomplishments will be achieved.

original: de dag sgrub pa'i thabs kyang de nyid las gsal bar sngon la /
analyzed: de dag sgrub pa'i thabs kyang de nyid las gsal bar sngon la /
translated: The method of accomplishing those is clearly explained in the tantra itself.

original: rigs so so'i dam tshig dang / bzlas brjod kyi thabs dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / don de lta bu dang ldan na dug gsum ma spangs pa sku gsung thugs dang / dug lnga'am mtshams med pa lnga las spyad pa rigs dang mi dge pa bcu spyad pas de nyid gnas su dag pa khro bo bcur 'grub par 'gyur bar bstan pa yin pas na de'i phyir na de ltar 'brel to //
analyzed: rigs so so'i dam tshig dang / bzlas brjod kyi thabs dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / don de lta bu dang ldan na dug gsum ma spangs pa sku gsung thugs dang / dug lnga'am mtshams med pa lnga las spyad pa rigs dang mi dge pa bcu spyad pas de nyid gnas su dag pa khro bo bcur 'grub par 'gyur bar bstan pa yin pas na de'i phyir na de ltar 'brel to //
translated: Since the pledges of each family, the method of recitation, samādhi, and such topics are possessed, the three poisons are not abandoned, and the body, speech, and mind are accomplished. Since the five poisons or the five heinous acts are practiced, the ten nonvirtues are practiced, and those are purified in their own place, the ten wrathful ones are accomplished.

original: de ltar le'u lnga pa dang dgu par 'brel /
analyzed: de ltar le'u lnga pa dang dgu par 'brel /
translated: Thus, the fifth and ninth chapters are connected.

original: dgu pa dang bcu bdun par 'brel /
analyzed: dgu pa dang bcu bdun par 'brel /
translated: The ninth and seventeenth chapters are connected.

original: bcu bdun pa dang bcu gsum pa'i don du 'brel pa yin te /
analyzed: bcu bdun pa dang bcu gsum pa'i don du 'brel pa yin te /
translated: The seventeenth and thirteenth chapters are related in meaning.

original: de ni ston ba byang chub sems rdo rjes 'o skol 'khor gyi sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la sgrub pa chen po bstan pa yin par rig par bya'o zhes pa'i don te /
analyzed: de ni ston ba byang chub sems rdo rjes 'o skol 'khor gyi sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la sgrub pa chen po bstan pa yin par rig par bya'o zhes pa'i don te /
translated: The meaning of that is: “One should understand that this is the teaching of the great practice by the teacher Bodhicittavajra to us, the retinue of buddhas and bodhisattvas.”

original: de la sgrub pa zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu gang dang gang sgrub pa de'i rgyu'i don du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de la sgrub pa zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu gang dang gang sgrub pa de'i rgyu'i don du shes par bya'o //
translated: In that regard, “practice” should be understood as the cause of accomplishing any result.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Similarly,🔽the fourth, the sixteenth,🔽the eighth, the twelfth,

original: bzhi pa dang ni bcu drug dang // brgyad pa de bzhin bcu gnyis dang // brtul zhugs sdom pa sgrub pa ni //
analyzed: bzhi pa dang ni bcu drug dang // brgyad pa de bzhin bcu gnyis dang // brtul zhugs sdom pa sgrub pa ni //
translated: the practice of the vow of conduct,

original: slob dpon spyi yi las yin no //
analyzed: slob dpon spyi yi las yin no //
translated: are the general activities of the master.

original: zhes smos te de la le'u bcu gsum pa dang bzhi par 'brel te /
analyzed: zhes smos te de la le'u bcu gsum pa dang bzhi par 'brel te /
translated: The thirteenth and fourth chapters are related.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: le'u bzhi pa las ni thugs kyi dkyil 'khor bshad par gsol ba btab @74b nas dkyil 'khor gyi slob dpon gyi tshad dang / thugs kyi dkyil 'khor gyi tshad dang / dbyibs su ldan par thig btab nas lha dgod pa dang / der ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor spyan drangs la mchod pa dang /
analyzed: le'u bzhi pa las ni thugs kyi dkyil 'khor bshad par gsol ba btab @74b nas dkyil 'khor gyi slob dpon gyi tshad dang / thugs kyi dkyil 'khor gyi tshad dang / dbyibs su ldan par thig btab nas lha dgod pa dang / der ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor spyan drangs la mchod pa dang /
translated: The maṇḍala of gnosis is invited there, and offerings are made.

original: slob ma dbang bskur ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: slob ma dbang bskur ba 'byung ste /
translated: The disciples are empowered.

original: le'u lnga pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: le'u lnga pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i sgrub pa'o //
translated: The characteristics of the accomplishment are in the fifth chapter.

original: le'u dgu'i rigs lnga'i dam tshig dang / le'u bcu bdun pa sku gsung thugs rdo rje'i dam tshig dang / dam tshig gi yan lag dang / sgrub pa thams cad kyi sdom pa tshang bar bsrung ba des las bzhi brtsam pa dang / dngos grub che phra thams cad sgrub na le'u bcu bdun pa las sku gsung thugs kyi dngos grub rdo rje slob dpon la gnas zhes 'byung ba dang /
analyzed: le'u dgu'i rigs lnga'i dam tshig dang / le'u bcu bdun pa sku gsung thugs rdo rje'i dam tshig dang / dam tshig gi yan lag dang / sgrub pa thams cad kyi sdom pa tshang bar bsrung ba des las bzhi brtsam pa dang / dngos grub che phra thams cad sgrub na le'u bcu bdun pa las sku gsung thugs kyi dngos grub rdo rje slob dpon la gnas zhes 'byung ba dang /
translated: If one who has protected them in this way begins the four activities and achieves all the great and small feats, then the great and small feats of body, speech and mind are achieved from the vajra master, as it says in chapter 17.

original: slob dpon gyi yon tan yang de nyid las 'byung bas /
analyzed: slob dpon gyi yon tan yang de nyid las 'byung bas /
translated: The qualities of the vajra master are also found in that chapter.

original: de lta bu'i mtshan nyid can gyis dkyil 'khor bri ba dang mchod pa dang dbang bskur ba byas la /
analyzed: de lta bu'i mtshan nyid can gyis dkyil 'khor bri ba dang mchod pa dang dbang bskur ba byas la /
translated: Therefore, one who has these characteristics should draw the mandala, make offerings and confer empowerment.

original: gdod gang 'dod pa'i dngos grub bsgrub par bya dgos pas na de'i phyir na de ltar 'brel to //
analyzed: gdod gang 'dod pa'i dngos grub bsgrub par bya dgos pas na de'i phyir na de ltar 'brel to //
translated: Then, one must achieve whatever feat one desires.

original: le'u bzhi pa de dang bcu drug par 'brel te /
analyzed: le'u bzhi pa de dang bcu drug par 'brel te /
translated: Chapter 4 is related to chapter 16.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bcu drug pa las gsung gi dkyil 'khor bri zhing lha dgod pa dang / thig dang tshon rtsi byin gyis brlab pa dang / mchod pa'i dus dang ; rmad du byung ba'i gtor ma bsham pa'i thabs dang / sbyin sreg bya ba dang / lha'i byin rlabs dbab cing slob ma dkyil 'khor du gzhug pa'i cho ga dang /
analyzed: bcu drug pa las gsung gi dkyil 'khor bri zhing lha dgod pa dang / thig dang tshon rtsi byin gyis brlab pa dang / mchod pa'i dus dang ; rmad du byung ba'i gtor ma bsham pa'i thabs dang / sbyin sreg bya ba dang / lha'i byin rlabs dbab cing slob ma dkyil 'khor du gzhug pa'i cho ga dang /
translated: the mandala of speech, the consecration of the lines and colors, the time of offerings, the method of arranging the marvelous bali offerings, the fire puja, the descent of the blessings of the deities, the ritual for inducting the disciples into the mandala,

original: dbang bskur ba'i bum pa dang / dbang bskur ba'i thabs kyi cho ga dang / dam tshig rnam pa bzhi dbog pa dang / gsang ba'i dbang bskur ba dang / gzungs dang bdud rtsi rnam pa lnga sgrub cing byin gyis brlab pa dang / sgrub pa la 'jug pa'i dus su bkres skom gyi gdung ba bsal ba dang /
analyzed: dbang bskur ba'i bum pa dang / dbang bskur ba'i thabs kyi cho ga dang / dam tshig rnam pa bzhi dbog pa dang / gsang ba'i dbang bskur ba dang / gzungs dang bdud rtsi rnam pa lnga sgrub cing byin gyis brlab pa dang / sgrub pa la 'jug pa'i dus su bkres skom gyi gdung ba bsal ba dang /
translated: the vase for conferring empowerment, the ritual method for conferring empowerment, bestowing the four kinds of samayas, the secret empowerment, accomplishing and consecrating the five elixirs, and dispelling the torment of hunger and thirst at the time of engaging in practice.

original: mngag gzhug sgrub pa dang / 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa dbang du bya ba dang / lha mo skul byed ma dang / dzambha la dang / gnod sbyin mo sgrub pa dang / rig pa'i brtul zhugs spyad pa'i yum dang / kha zas dang /
analyzed: mngag gzhug sgrub pa dang / 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa dbang du bya ba dang / lha mo skul byed ma dang / dzambha la dang / gnod sbyin mo sgrub pa dang / rig pa'i brtul zhugs spyad pa'i yum dang / kha zas dang /
translated: the accomplishment of service, the subjugation of mundane and supramundane [beings], the accomplishment of the goddess Bhṛkuṭī, Jambhala, and yakṣiṇīs, the mother who practices the conduct of knowledge, food,

original: sdom pa dang / yum byin gyis brlab pa la sogs pa bstan te /
analyzed: sdom pa dang / yum byin gyis brlab pa la sogs pa bstan te /
translated: vows, the consecration of the mother, and so on are explained.

original: le'u bzhi pa ltar dkyil 'khor bri ba dang / dbang bskur ba dang / @75a * //
analyzed: le'u bzhi pa ltar dkyil 'khor bri ba dang / dbang bskur ba dang / @75a * //
translated: As in chapter 4, the explanation of the maṇḍala to be drawn, the empowerment to be conferred,

original: mchod par bya bar bstan pa la yang /
analyzed: mchod par bya bar bstan pa la yang /
translated: and the offering to be made

original: thig tshon byin gyis brlab cing lha dgod pa'i thabs shes pa dang / mchod pa bya ba'i dus shes pas rmad du byung ba'i gtor ma dang / sbyin sreg gis lha tshim par mchod la /
analyzed: thig tshon byin gyis brlab cing lha dgod pa'i thabs shes pa dang / mchod pa bya ba'i dus shes pas rmad du byung ba'i gtor ma dang / sbyin sreg gis lha tshim par mchod la /
translated: is also the knowledge of the method of consecrating the lines and colors and the method of arranging the deities, and the knowledge of the time of making offerings, satisfying the deities with the amazing bali and homa.

original: gdod slob ma dkyil 'khor du bcug la lha'i byin rlabs phab ste /
analyzed: gdod slob ma dkyil 'khor du bcug la lha'i byin rlabs phab ste /

original: sdig pa de dag da ltar dngos su spyod kyang sgrib cing nyes par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdig pa de dag da ltar dngos su spyod kyang sgrib cing nyes par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: even though one is presently engaging in those negativities, one will not be obscured or harmed.

original: de'i phyir dang por smos pa'i lnga pa bcu gcig pa'i 'jug tu tha mar yang brjod pas ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir dang por smos pa'i lnga pa bcu gcig pa'i 'jug tu tha mar yang brjod pas ni /
translated: Therefore, the first five are mentioned first, and the last is also mentioned in the eleventh.

original: bcu gcig pa dang lnga pa ste //
analyzed: bcu gcig pa dang lnga pa ste //
translated: Thus, the eleventh and the fifth are mentioned.🔽There means having a remainder,

original: zhes bya'o de la ste zhes bya ba ni lhag ma can gyi tshig ste /
analyzed: zhes bya'o de la ste zhes bya ba ni lhag ma can gyi tshig ste /
translated: and is connected to the phrase

original: dngos grub zhing gi mtshan ma ni //🔽zhes bya ba la bsnyegs pa'o //
analyzed: dngos grub zhing gi mtshan ma ni // zhes bya ba la bsnyegs pa'o //
translated: the sign of the field of powers.

original: de la dngos grub ni dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams kyi rgyud lam mnga' ba dang / byin rlabs las 'byung ba'i che ba'i yon tan no //
analyzed: de la dngos grub ni dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams kyi rgyud lam mnga' ba dang / byin rlabs las 'byung ba'i che ba'i yon tan no //
translated: Therein, power is the possession of the path of the continuum of the deities of the mandala, and the great qualities that arise from the blessing.

original: zhing ni rnal 'byor pa ste de'i rgyud la 'phags pa'i che ba'i yon tan skye bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: zhing ni rnal 'byor pa ste de'i rgyud la 'phags pa'i che ba'i yon tan skye bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The field is the yogi, and the great qualities of the noble ones arise in his continuum.

original: de lta bu'i dngos grub dang dngos grub zhing gi mtshan ma zhes bya ba mtshan ma dang rtags ni don gcig ste /🔽bdun pa nas lnga pa zhes bya ba'i bar du bstan pa'am /
analyzed: de lta bu'i dngos grub dang dngos grub zhing gi mtshan ma zhes bya ba mtshan ma dang rtags ni don gcig ste / bdun pa nas lnga pa zhes bya ba'i bar du bstan pa'am /
translated: Such a power and the sign of the field of power are called a sign and a mark, which have the same meaning.🔽It is taught from the seventh to the fifth,

original: lnga pa zhes bya ba yan chad kun la bya'o //
analyzed: lnga pa zhes bya ba yan chad kun la bya'o //
translated: or it is to be applied to all from the fifth onward.

original: gnyis su na dngos grub ni bcu gcig pa yan chad las 'byung ba'i don la bya la /
analyzed: gnyis su na dngos grub ni bcu gcig pa yan chad las 'byung ba'i don la bya la /
translated: Second, the “accomplishment” is the meaning that occurs in the eleventh chapter.

original: dngos grub de dag skye ba'i zhing ni le'u lnga pa las gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i gdul bya la bya'o //
analyzed: dngos grub de dag skye ba'i zhing ni le'u lnga pa las gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i gdul bya la bya'o //
translated: The “field” from which those accomplishments arise is the disciple who possesses the characteristics taught in the fifth chapter.

original: de'i rtags dang mtshan ma ni le'u'i 'brel ba'i mtshams sbyar ba'i tshig dang yi ge rnams la bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rtags dang mtshan ma ni le'u'i 'brel ba'i mtshams sbyar ba'i tshig dang yi ge rnams la bya'o //
translated: The “signs and marks” are the words and syllables that connect the chapter.

original: de lta bur bstan pa de dag la ni dngos su ming bsnyen pa'i sgrub pa'i sdom pa'o zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de lta bur bstan pa de dag la ni dngos su ming bsnyen pa'i sgrub pa'i sdom pa'o zhes bya ste /
translated: Those topics that are taught like that are the actual “summary of the means of approach and attainment.”

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dper na 'phags pa'i chos thams cad gang bsgrubs kyang dam tshig dang sdom pa sngon du 'gro bas @79a * //
analyzed: dper na 'phags pa'i chos thams cad gang bsgrubs kyang dam tshig dang sdom pa sngon du 'gro bas @79a * //
translated: For example, all of the ārya dharmas are accomplished by means of the preliminaries of samaya and vows.

original: gzhi bzung nas de la brten te bsgrubs na 'grub par 'gyur ba dang 'dra bar bsnyen pa byang chub kyi sems kyi rang bzhin lhar bsgom pa dang / sgrub pa sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje dang ye shes sems dpa' lus la 'god na de yan chad du bstan pa'am khyad par du bdun pa nas bcu gcig pa'i bar du bsten pa'i tshig don gyi 'brel pa de dag sngon du gsal bar yid la byas pa🔽las bstan te /
analyzed: gzhi bzung nas de la brten te bsgrubs na 'grub par 'gyur ba dang 'dra bar bsnyen pa byang chub kyi sems kyi rang bzhin lhar bsgom pa dang / sgrub pa sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje dang ye shes sems dpa' lus la 'god na de yan chad du bstan pa'am khyad par du bdun pa nas bcu gcig pa'i bar du bsten pa'i tshig don gyi 'brel pa de dag sngon du gsal bar yid la byas pa las bstan te /
translated: Just as it is necessary to rely on a basis and then practice in dependence upon that in order to accomplish [the result], likewise, if one meditates on the deity, which is the nature of the awakening mind of the approach, and one places the vajra body, speech, and mind and the gnosis being in the body, then the connection between the words and meanings of the approach and practice up to this point, or in particular, from the seventh up to the eleventh, must be clearly visualized in the mind.

original: gzod bsnyen sgrub kyi don bsgom dgos pa'i phyir na de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gzod bsnyen sgrub kyi don bsgom dgos pa'i phyir na de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The meaning of the approach and practice is meditated upon after that.🔽From here on, in order to demonstrate the connection of the tantra and the connection of the chapters, the summary of the seventeenth chapter is applied.

original: 'di nas mar ni rgyud kyi 'brel pa le'u bcu bdun gyi bsnor mtshams kyi 'phen sdud sbyar ba de'i yon tan bstan pa'i phyir na /🔽dul ba gdul dka' zhi ba yi //
analyzed: 'di nas mar ni rgyud kyi 'brel pa le'u bcu bdun gyi bsnor mtshams kyi 'phen sdud sbyar ba de'i yon tan bstan pa'i phyir na / dul ba gdul dka' zhi ba yi //
translated: The qualities of that are taught:🔽In order to engage🔽all sentient beings,🔽who are difficult to tame,

original: sems can rnams la gzhug pa la //
analyzed: sems can rnams la gzhug pa la //
translated: in the pacification of the mind,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa kun gyi las //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa kun gyi las //
translated: the activity of all tathāgatas🔽is explained in the tantra.

original: tshar gcod pa dang phan 'dogs nus //
analyzed: tshar gcod pa dang phan 'dogs nus //
translated: Capable of annihilating and benefiting.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pas 'brel ba rnam la bdun dang ldan par ston te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pas 'brel ba rnam la bdun dang ldan par ston te /
translated: Thus, it is related to the sevenfold.

original: de la dul ba ni byang chub sems dpa' gdul dka' ba ni 'jig rten pa'i lha chen po rnams zhi ba ni nyan thos de lta bu dul ba gdul dka' zhi ba'i ngang tshul can gyi gdul bya rnams dang / tha mal ba'i sems can rnams gsang ba'i theg pa'i don la gzud pa la nus pa can du 'gyur bas na gsang ba'i theg pa las 'khrungs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa kun gyi phrin las te /
analyzed: de la dul ba ni byang chub sems dpa' gdul dka' ba ni 'jig rten pa'i lha chen po rnams zhi ba ni nyan thos de lta bu dul ba gdul dka' zhi ba'i ngang tshul can gyi gdul bya rnams dang / tha mal ba'i sems can rnams gsang ba'i theg pa'i don la gzud pa la nus pa can du 'gyur bas na gsang ba'i theg pa las 'khrungs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa kun gyi phrin las te /
translated: Among them, the bodhisattvas are difficult to tame, the great worldly gods are peaceful, and the śrāvakas are of such a nature. The ordinary beings are capable of being introduced to the meaning of the secret vehicle. Therefore, it is the activity of all the tathāgatas born from the secret vehicle.

original: des ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: des ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: bsnyen sgrub bzhi dang ldan pa'i drag po'i phrin las kyis lha chen po la sogs pa tshar gcod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang nyan thos dang sems can de dag la phan 'dogs par nus pas te /
analyzed: bsnyen sgrub bzhi dang ldan pa'i drag po'i phrin las kyis lha chen po la sogs pa tshar gcod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang nyan thos dang sems can de dag la phan 'dogs par nus pas te /
translated: It is capable of annihilating the great gods and so on with wrathful activity endowed with the four: approach, accomplishment, and so on; and it is capable of benefiting the bodhisattvas, śrāvakas, and sentient beings.

original: de ni sems can gyi khams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i phrin las su 'brel bar bstan pa ste dang po'o //
analyzed: de ni sems can gyi khams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i phrin las su 'brel bar bstan pa ste dang po'o //
translated: That is the connection between the realm of sentient beings and the activity of the Tathagata, the first.

original: de nyid kyi phyir na /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir na /
translated: Therefore,🔽like generation and connection with the stages,

original: bskyed dang rim par 'brel ba dang / bsnyen dang rdo rje go cha bzhin //
analyzed: bskyed dang rim par 'brel ba dang / bsnyen dang rdo rje go cha bzhin //
translated: like service and the four vajra armors,

original: dngos grub 'brel ba thun mong ste //🔽de bzhin gzhung las mchog tu 'gyur //
analyzed: dngos grub 'brel ba thun mong ste // de bzhin gzhung las mchog tu 'gyur //
translated: the connection with powers is common,

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: and likewise, in the scriptures, it is supreme.

original: de la bskyed pa ni phra ba las rags par phra ba bskyed pas te /
analyzed: de la bskyed pa ni phra ba las rags par phra ba bskyed pas te /
translated: Therein, generation is from the subtle to the coarse, generating the subtle.

original: ting nge 'dzin dang 'phro 'du'i rim pas sku phyag rgya chen por bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang 'phro 'du'i rim pas sku phyag rgya chen por bskyed pa'o //
translated: It is the generation of the great seal of the body by the stages of samadhi and emanation and reabsorption.

original: rim par 'brel pa zhes bya ba ni phyag rgya chen por @79b bsgoms pa de dang bsnyen sgrub yan lag rnam pa bzhi rim par bsgom pa dang 'brel ba'o //
analyzed: rim par 'brel pa zhes bya ba ni phyag rgya chen por @79b bsgoms pa de dang bsnyen sgrub yan lag rnam pa bzhi rim par bsgom pa dang 'brel ba'o //
translated: Connection with the stages is the connection with the meditation of the four branches of service and attainment in stages with that meditation on the great seal.

original: bsnyen dang rdo rje cho ga bzhin //
analyzed: bsnyen dang rdo rje cho ga bzhin //
translated: Like service and the four vajra armors,

original: zhes bya ba ni bsnyen pa lha sgom pa de yang rdo rje cho ga rnam pa bzhis bsgom ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bsnyen pa lha sgom pa de yang rdo rje cho ga rnam pa bzhis bsgom ste /
translated: that service, the meditation on the deity, is also meditated on by the four vajra armors.

original: bsnyen pas mtshon nas yan lag bzhi ka tshang bar bstan pa de dang rdo rje'i cho ga bzhi ji lta ba bzhin du ldan par bsgoms pas de ni dngos grub rnam pa gnyis dang 'brel te /
analyzed: bsnyen pas mtshon nas yan lag bzhi ka tshang bar bstan pa de dang rdo rje'i cho ga bzhi ji lta ba bzhin du ldan par bsgoms pas de ni dngos grub rnam pa gnyis dang 'brel te /
translated: The four branches of approach and close approach are complete, and since one meditates in accordance with the four vajra rites, one is connected with the two types of feats.

original: de yang dngos grub 'brel ba thun mong ste zhes pa ni thun mong gi dngos grub dang 'brel bar bstan la /
analyzed: de yang dngos grub 'brel ba thun mong ste zhes pa ni thun mong gi dngos grub dang 'brel bar bstan la /
translated: Further, the statement “one is connected with the common feats” indicates that one is connected with the common feats.

original: de bzhin gzhung las mchog tu 'gyur //
analyzed: de bzhin gzhung las mchog tu 'gyur //
translated: The statement “one is also connected with the supreme in this treatise” indicates that one is connected with the supreme feat taught in this treatise Guhyasamaja.

original: zhes bya ba ni thun mong gi dngos grub bsnyen sgrub bzhi dang / cho ga rnam pa bzhi dang / thun mong gi dngos grub 'brel pa de bzhin du /🔽gzhung gsang ba 'dus pa 'di nyid las mchog gi dngos grub tu gsungs pa de dang 'brel bar yang 'gyur ro zhes bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni thun mong gi dngos grub bsnyen sgrub bzhi dang / cho ga rnam pa bzhi dang / thun mong gi dngos grub 'brel pa de bzhin du /🔽gzhung gsang ba 'dus pa 'di nyid las mchog gi dngos grub tu gsungs pa de dang 'brel bar yang 'gyur ro zhes bstan te /
translated: The common feats are the four branches of approach and close approach, the four rites, and the connection with the common feats.

original: 'di ni 'brel pa gnyis pa ste bsnyen sgrub rnam pa bzhi dang ldan pa'i lhar bskyed pa dang / dngos grub rnam pa gnyis dang 'brel ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'brel pa gnyis pa ste bsnyen sgrub rnam pa bzhi dang ldan pa'i lhar bskyed pa dang / dngos grub rnam pa gnyis dang 'brel ba'o //
translated: This is the second connection: generating the deity endowed with the four branches of familiarization and attainment, and connected with the two kinds of spiritual powers.🔽The connection of the maṇḍala and the observances,

original: dkyil 'khor brtul zhugs 'brel ba dang // gzhung dang slob dpon ldan pa yi //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor brtul zhugs 'brel ba dang // gzhung dang slob dpon ldan pa yi //
translated: endowed with the scriptures and the master,🔽the disciples are ripened

original: bla ma rnams kyi sngags lam gyis //🔽slob ma rnams ni yongs su smin //
analyzed: bla ma rnams kyi sngags lam gyis // slob ma rnams ni yongs su smin //
translated: by the path of mantra of the gurus.

original: zhes bya bas ni dkyil 'khor ni mandala zhes bya ba'i sgras man ni snying po dal ni len pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni dkyil 'khor ni mandala zhes bya ba'i sgras man ni snying po dal ni len pa ste /
translated: The maṇḍala is called a maṇḍala because the term maṇḍala means “to take up” and maṇḍala means “to take up the essence.”

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi snying po len cing 'dzin pas na dkyil 'khor te /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi snying po len cing 'dzin pas na dkyil 'khor te /
translated: Since it takes up and holds the essence of unsurpassed awakening, it is a maṇḍala.🔽The three maṇḍalas of body, speech, and mind, along with their branches,

original: rgyud 'di las sku gsung thugs kyi dkyil 'khor rnam pa gsum yan lag dang bcas pa /
analyzed: rgyud 'di las sku gsung thugs kyi dkyil 'khor rnam pa gsum yan lag dang bcas pa /
translated: are explained in this tantra.

original: phyi nang gsang ba gsum gyis bsdus pa der gsal ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs /
analyzed: phyi nang gsang ba gsum gyis bsdus pa der gsal ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs /
translated: The maṇḍala is included in the outer, inner, and secret maṇḍalas.

original: nyan thos kyi spyod pa btul nas rig ma dang ldan par zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi spyod pa btul nas rig ma dang ldan par zhugs pa ste /
translated: The disciples enter into the maṇḍala endowed with the knowledge consort after subduing the conduct of the śrāvakas.

original: de nyid lha mo rig ma mo //
analyzed: de nyid lha mo rig ma mo //
translated: That is the goddess, the knowledge woman.

original: zhes pa dang mi 'brel ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa dang mi 'brel ba'i don to //
translated: This means that it is not related.

original: de lta bu'i dkyil 'khor dang brtul zhugs su 'brel bar bstan pa de ni 'brel ba gsum pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i dkyil 'khor dang brtul zhugs su 'brel bar bstan pa de ni 'brel ba gsum pa'o //
translated: The teaching that such a mandala is related to the observances is the third relation.

original: gzhung dang slob dpon zhes bya ba ni rgyud gsang ba 'dus pa'i le'u bco brgyad tshang ba'i zhugs //
analyzed: gzhung dang slob dpon zhes bya ba ni rgyud gsang ba 'dus pa'i le'u bco brgyad tshang ba'i zhugs //
translated: The text and the master are the complete eighteen chapters of the Guhyasamaja Tantra.

original: rdo rje slob dpon gnyis gcig gi yon tan gcig gis mtshon par byed pas /
analyzed: rdo rje slob dpon gnyis gcig gi yon tan gcig gis mtshon par byed pas /
translated: The two vajra masters are indicated by the qualities of each other.

original: gzhung dang rdo rje slob dpon du 'brel bar bstan to de ni 'brel pa bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: gzhung dang rdo rje slob dpon du 'brel bar bstan to de ni 'brel pa bzhi pa'o //
translated: The text and the vajra master are taught to be related. That is the fourth relation.

original: bla ma rnams zhes bya ba ni @80a * //
analyzed: bla ma rnams zhes bya ba ni @80a * //
translated: The gurus are

original: gsang sngags kyi don nges par ston par nus pa'i rdo rje slob dpon te /
analyzed: gsang sngags kyi don nges par ston par nus pa'i rdo rje slob dpon te /
translated: the vajra masters who are able to teach the meaning of the mantra.

original: rnams zhes bya ba ni rgyal po dang rgyal theb dang skar ma la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnams zhes bya ba ni rgyal po dang rgyal theb dang skar ma la sogs pa'o //
translated: The word “all” refers to kings, ministers, astrologers, and so forth.

original: de lta bu'i bla ma rnams kyi zhal nas gsungs pa'i rdo rje theg pa ma nor bar bstan pa'i don gyis gzhan 'khor ba las sgrol bar byed pas sngags lam gyis zhes bya /
analyzed: de lta bu'i bla ma rnams kyi zhal nas gsungs pa'i rdo rje theg pa ma nor bar bstan pa'i don gyis gzhan 'khor ba las sgrol bar byed pas sngags lam gyis zhes bya /
translated: The path of mantra is so called because it liberates others from cyclic existence by means of the unerring teachings of the Vajrayana that come from the mouths of such gurus.

original: des ci byed ce na /
analyzed: des ci byed ce na /
translated: What does it do?

original: slob ma rnams ni yongs su smin //
analyzed: slob ma rnams ni yongs su smin //
translated: It ripens disciples.

original: zhes bya ste dkyil 'khor du bcug pa dang dam tshig phog pa dang / lung byin pa dang / dbang bskur ba dang / chos bshad pas mi khom pa'i gnas spangs shing /
analyzed: zhes bya ste dkyil 'khor du bcug pa dang dam tshig phog pa dang / lung byin pa dang / dbang bskur ba dang / chos bshad pas mi khom pa'i gnas spangs shing /
translated: By inducting disciples into the mandala, bestowing the pledges, giving the oral transmissions, conferring the initiations, and explaining the teachings, they abandon the states that lack leisure and

original: lha dang mi'i bde ba las brgyud nas rig 'dzin gyi sa dang / rdo rje theg pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i go 'phang thob bar byed pas slob dpon dang slob ma 'brel bar bstan pa ste /
analyzed: lha dang mi'i bde ba las brgyud nas rig 'dzin gyi sa dang / rdo rje theg pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i go 'phang thob bar byed pas slob dpon dang slob ma 'brel bar bstan pa ste /
translated: attain the state of a knowledge-bearer, and then the state of a buddha in the Vajrayana.

original: 'brel ba lnga pa'o //
analyzed: 'brel ba lnga pa'o //
translated: This is the fifth connection.

original: shin tu brtul zhugs dbang bskur ba'i //
analyzed: shin tu brtul zhugs dbang bskur ba'i //
translated: The disciple who is initiated into the practice of the highest tantra

original: slob ma bzang po bdag nyid che //
analyzed: slob ma bzang po bdag nyid che //
translated: is a good disciple, a great being.

original: sangs rgyas byang chub sems dpa' yis //
analyzed: sangs rgyas byang chub sems dpa' yis //
translated: The buddhas and bodhisattvas

original: bstan pa yongs su sgrol ba yis //
analyzed: bstan pa yongs su sgrol ba yis //
translated: The one who is completely liberated from the teaching.

original: zhes bya ba lta ba yangs shing spyod pa rlabs che bas theg pa 'og pa la mi mos shing gsang ba'i don la 'jug par mos pa'i skal ba dang ldan pa'i shin tu brtul zhugs che ba la ni shes rab ye shes la sogs pas dbang bskur ba'i🔽snod yin pas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba lta ba yangs shing spyod pa rlabs che bas theg pa 'og pa la mi mos shing gsang ba'i don la 'jug par mos pa'i skal ba dang ldan pa'i shin tu brtul zhugs che ba la ni shes rab ye shes la sogs pas dbang bskur ba'i snod yin pas /
translated: Thus, the one who is endowed with the good fortune of being devoted to the profound view and vast conduct, and who is devoted to entering the secret meaning, is a suitable vessel for the empowerment of the gnosis of the wisdom consort and so on.

original: brtul zhugs can dang dbang bskur bar 'brel bar bstan pa ste /
analyzed: brtul zhugs can dang dbang bskur bar 'brel bar bstan pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the one who is endowed with the good fortune of being devoted to the secret vehicle is taught to be connected with the one who is empowered.

original: de ni 'brel ba drug pa'o //
analyzed: de ni 'brel ba drug pa'o //
translated: This is the sixth connection.

original: theg pa gzhan la dga' ba dang / 'jungs shing se sna che ba la sogs pa'i nyes pa dang bral zhing gsang ba'i theg pa la mos pa'i blo'i nges pa thob cing shes rab dang snying rjer ldan pa ni slob ma bzang po rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes sam //
analyzed: theg pa gzhan la dga' ba dang / 'jungs shing se sna che ba la sogs pa'i nyes pa dang bral zhing gsang ba'i theg pa la mos pa'i blo'i nges pa thob cing shes rab dang snying rjer ldan pa ni slob ma bzang po rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes sam //
translated: The good disciple is the one who is free from the faults of delighting in other vehicles, stinginess, great avarice, and so on, who has attained the certainty of the mind that is devoted to the secret vehicle, and who is endowed with wisdom and compassion.

original: shes rab dang snying rje'i bdag nyid du gyur cing pha rol tu phyin pa man chad las dpag pas che zhes bya //
analyzed: shes rab dang snying rje'i bdag nyid du gyur cing pha rol tu phyin pa man chad las dpag pas che zhes bya //
translated: He is endowed with wisdom and compassion, and is greater than the perfections and so forth.

original: de lta bu'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa de ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' 'tshang rgya bar lung bstan pa'am /
analyzed: de lta bu'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa de ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' 'tshang rgya bar lung bstan pa'am /
translated: He is endowed with such characteristics, and is predicted to become a Buddha or Bodhisattva,

original: chos bstan pas ngan song dang 'khor ba las yongs su rnam pa grol bar 'gyur bar bstan pa ste de ni 'brel pa bdun pa'o //
analyzed: chos bstan pas ngan song dang 'khor ba las yongs su rnam pa grol bar 'gyur bar bstan pa ste de ni 'brel pa bdun pa'o //
translated: or is taught to be completely liberated from the lower realms and cyclic existence through the teaching of the Dharma. This is the seventh connection.

original: de ltar rgyud kyi 'brel pa le'u bsnor mtshams kyi 'phen sdud sbyar bas yon @80b tan dang ldan par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar rgyud kyi 'brel pa le'u bsnor mtshams kyi 'phen sdud sbyar bas yon @80b tan dang ldan par bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the connection of the tantra is shown to be endowed with good qualities by connecting the projection and summary of the chapters.

original: la la na re /
analyzed: la la na re /
translated: Some say:

original: dngos grub zhing ni le'u brgyad pa las ri rtse la sogs pa'i gnas su gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: dngos grub zhing ni le'u brgyad pa las ri rtse la sogs pa'i gnas su gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The field of spiritual powers is taught in the eighth chapter as a place such as the peak of a mountain,

original: mtshan ma ni le'u bco lnga pa las rmi lam bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: mtshan ma ni le'u bco lnga pa las rmi lam bstan pa yin te /
translated: and the signs are taught in the fifteenth chapter as dreams.

original: le'u dang por ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pas ri rtse la sogs par bsgoms na dngos grub ji lta bu 'thob bar rmi lam du 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: le'u dang por ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pas ri rtse la sogs par bsgoms na dngos grub ji lta bu 'thob bar rmi lam du 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: with samadhi, one will have a dream of what kind of siddhi will be attained.

original: dul ba dang gdul dka' ba dang zhi ba la phan gdags pa ni spyir 'byung /
analyzed: dul ba dang gdul dka' ba dang zhi ba la phan gdags pa ni spyir 'byung /
translated: Taming and difficult to tame and benefiting the peaceful is in general.

original: tshar gcad pa ni le'u bcu bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: tshar gcad pa ni le'u bcu bzhi pa'o //
translated: Annihilation is in the fourteenth chapter.

original: bskyed dang rim par 'brel pa ni le'u dang po'o //
analyzed: bskyed dang rim par 'brel pa ni le'u dang po'o //
translated: Generation and related stages are in the first chapter.

original: bsnyen pa rdo rje cho ga bzhi ni le'u bcu gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: bsnyen pa rdo rje cho ga bzhi ni le'u bcu gnyis pa'o //
translated: The four vajra rituals of approach are in the twelfth chapter.

original: dngos grub thun mong ni le'u brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: dngos grub thun mong ni le'u brgyad pa'o //
translated: Common siddhis are in the eighth chapter.

original: mchog tu gyur pa'i dngos grub ni le'u bcu gcig pa'o //
analyzed: mchog tu gyur pa'i dngos grub ni le'u bcu gcig pa'o //
translated: Supreme siddhis are in the eleventh chapter.

original: dkyil 'khor brtul zhugs 'brel ba ni le'u bcu bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor brtul zhugs 'brel ba ni le'u bcu bzhi pa'o //
translated: Related mandala conduct is in the fourteenth chapter.

original: gzhung dang slob dpon ni le'u bcu bdun pa'o //
analyzed: gzhung dang slob dpon ni le'u bcu bdun pa'o //
translated: The treatise and the master are in the seventeenth chapter.

original: bla ma rnams kyi sngags lam gyis ;
analyzed: bla ma rnams kyi sngags lam gyis ;
translated: By the mantra path of the gurus,

original: slob ma rnams ni yongs su smin //
analyzed: slob ma rnams ni yongs su smin //
translated: the disciples are fully ripened.

original: zhes bya ba ni le'u drug pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni le'u drug pa'o //
translated: This is the sixth chapter.

original: shin tu brtul zhugs dbang bskur ba //
analyzed: shin tu brtul zhugs dbang bskur ba //
translated: The empowerment of extremely strict conduct.

original: la sogs pa'i tshig bzhi ni le'u bcu drug pa ste /
analyzed: la sogs pa'i tshig bzhi ni le'u bcu drug pa ste /
translated: The four words “and so on” refer to the sixteenth chapter.🔽If one says that those topics and those chapters are related, that is contradictory.

original: tshig gi don de dag dang le'u de dag tu 'brel to zhes zer na 'gal te ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: tshig gi don de dag dang le'u de dag tu 'brel to zhes zer na 'gal te ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: le'u rnams tshang ba'i 'brel ba sngar bstan nas /
analyzed: le'u rnams tshang ba'i 'brel ba sngar bstan nas /
translated: Having previously taught the complete relationship of the chapters,🔽the qualities of those chapters and the concise meaning of the tantra are taught as the general meaning of the beginning and end of the tantra.

original: de dag gi yon tan dang mdor bsdus te rgyud mgo gzhug gi spyi'i don du bstan par zad kyi le'u bstan par zad kyi le'u re re'i 'grel pa dang tshig re re'i 'grel par byas nas bstan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi yon tan dang mdor bsdus te rgyud mgo gzhug gi spyi'i don du bstan par zad kyi le'u bstan par zad kyi le'u re re'i 'grel pa dang tshig re re'i 'grel par byas nas bstan pa ma yin no //
translated: However, the commentary is not taught by commenting on each chapter and commenting on each word.

original: de ltar yin du zin na ni dbu zhugs kyi le'u rnams tshar ba dang 'brel bar ston par 'os la /
analyzed: de ltar yin du zin na ni dbu zhugs kyi le'u rnams tshar ba dang 'brel bar ston par 'os la /
translated: If that were the case, it would be appropriate to teach the relationship of the chapters of the beginning and end of the tantra.

original: le'u re re'i nang nas don rnam pa mang po dag 'byung bas de dag tshang bar ston par 'os na ma bstan la /
analyzed: le'u re re'i nang nas don rnam pa mang po dag 'byung bas de dag tshang bar ston par 'os na ma bstan la /
translated: Since many topics arise from each chapter, it would be appropriate to teach them completely, but they are not taught.

original: 'dir brjod pa'i don de dag shas cher le'u re re'i nang nas kyang ston pa las 'dir bstan pa'i tshig nyung shes dang le'u de rnams su gyur ba mi rigs pa'i phyir na 'gal bar mthong bas bdag gis ni snga ma bzhin du go ba 'thad par mthong
analyzed: 'dir brjod pa'i don de dag shas cher le'u re re'i nang nas kyang ston pa las 'dir bstan pa'i tshig nyung shes dang le'u de rnams su gyur ba mi rigs pa'i phyir na 'gal bar mthong bas bdag gis ni snga ma bzhin du go ba 'thad par mthong
translated: Therefore, seeing that there is a contradiction, I see it as reasonable to understand it as before.

original: nas de skad bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: nas de skad bshad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, I have explained it in that way.

original: zhus tshig bzhi pa //
analyzed: zhus tshig bzhi pa //
translated: The fourth line of the request:

original: 'di yi sbyor ba ji ltar lags //
analyzed: 'di yi sbyor ba ji ltar lags //
translated: How is its practice?

original: zhes zhus pa'i lan ni //
analyzed: zhes zhus pa'i lan ni //
translated: The answer:

original: thabs dang shes rab snyoms 'jug pa //🔽sbyor ba zhes su @81a * //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab snyoms 'jug pa // sbyor ba zhes su @81a * //
translated: The union of method and wisdom

original: bshad pa yin /
analyzed: bshad pa yin /
translated: Is explained as the practice.

original: gang zhig dngos med shes rab ste //
analyzed: gang zhig dngos med shes rab ste //
translated: That which is non-entity is wisdom,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid thabs yin no //🔽zhes gsungs so //🔽zhi gnas dang lhag mthong cha mnyam pa zung du 'brel pa'am /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid thabs yin no // zhes gsungs so // zhi gnas dang lhag mthong cha mnyam pa zung du 'brel pa'am /
translated: And its own characteristic is method.🔽It is not to be taken as the union of shamatha and vipashyana in equal parts,

original: mtshan ma dang mtshan ma med par 'brel pa la mi bya ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma dang mtshan ma med par 'brel pa la mi bya ste /
translated: Or as the union of sign and signlessness.

original: thogs chags med pa'i ye shes kyi gzugs brnyan yab thabs kyi phyag rgyar snang ba dang / chos nyid spros pa dang bral ba'i gzugs brnyan shes rab yum gyi skur snang ba gnyis cha snyoms par 'jug pa'am /
analyzed: thogs chags med pa'i ye shes kyi gzugs brnyan yab thabs kyi phyag rgyar snang ba dang / chos nyid spros pa dang bral ba'i gzugs brnyan shes rab yum gyi skur snang ba gnyis cha snyoms par 'jug pa'am /
translated: The reflection of unobstructed pristine consciousness appears as the seal of the method of the father, and the reflection of the dharmatā free from proliferation appears as the body of the mother of wisdom.

original: zung du 'brel par gnas pa la //
analyzed: zung du 'brel par gnas pa la //
translated: The union of the two is

original: sbyor ba zhes su bshad pa yin //
analyzed: sbyor ba zhes su bshad pa yin //
translated: explained as the union.

original: zhes te dbyer med pa 'am mnyam par sbyor ba'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes te dbyer med pa 'am mnyam par sbyor ba'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “union” is the indivisibility or equality of the two.

original: de nyid kyi don gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: de nyid kyi don gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir na /
translated: In order to clearly demonstrate that meaning,

original: gang zhig dngos med shes rab ste //
analyzed: gang zhig dngos med shes rab ste //
translated: the nonentity is wisdom.

original: zhes bya ba gang zhig lha mo'i cha lugs su snang yang me long gi gzugs brnyan nam 'ja' tshon gyi kha dog ltar gsal la rang bzhin med de mchan ma'i dngos po spangs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gang zhig lha mo'i cha lugs su snang yang me long gi gzugs brnyan nam 'ja' tshon gyi kha dog ltar gsal la rang bzhin med de mchan ma'i dngos po spangs pa ste /
translated: Although appearing in the aspect of a goddess, like the reflection in a mirror or the color of a rainbow, it is clear but without nature, free from the entity of a reflection.

original: rgyud 'dir dkyil 'khor du 'khod pa'i lha mo m'a ma k'i la sogs pa la bya'o //
analyzed: rgyud 'dir dkyil 'khor du 'khod pa'i lha mo m'a ma k'i la sogs pa la bya'o //
translated: In this tantra, it refers to the goddesses of the maṇḍala, such as Māmakī, and so on.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi dbus kyi gtso bo nas sgo srung gi khro bo yan chad kyi so so rang rang gi ye shes kyi rnam par grol ba'i sgor gyur pa'i rigs dang sku mdog dang phyag mchan dang / rgyan dang cha lugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid so so nas gsal zhing bsnyen sgrub yan lag bzhi dang ldan pa'i gzugs 'dzin par snang ba ni thabs yin no //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi dbus kyi gtso bo nas sgo srung gi khro bo yan chad kyi so so rang rang gi ye shes kyi rnam par grol ba'i sgor gyur pa'i rigs dang sku mdog dang phyag mchan dang / rgyan dang cha lugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid so so nas gsal zhing bsnyen sgrub yan lag bzhi dang ldan pa'i gzugs 'dzin par snang ba ni thabs yin no //
translated: The method is the appearance of the forms of the principal figures of the mandala, from the principal figure in the center to the wrathful gatekeepers, each with their individual characteristics of family, color, hand implements, ornaments, costumes, and so on, which are the doors to the aspect of liberation of their individual exalted wisdoms, and which hold the forms of the four branches of approach and accomplishment.

original: yab yum de dag kyang don dbyings dang ye shes dbyer med pa la dgongs nas rtags yab yum thabs dang shes rab kyang dbyer med par 'khril ba la sbyor ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yab yum de dag kyang don dbyings dang ye shes dbyer med pa la dgongs nas rtags yab yum thabs dang shes rab kyang dbyer med par 'khril ba la sbyor ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Those fathers and mothers are inseparable method and wisdom, the sign of the inseparable basic space of phenomena and wisdom.

original: rgyud kyi don la sbyar nas bshad na /
analyzed: rgyud kyi don la sbyar nas bshad na /
translated: When explained in terms of the meaning of the tantra,

original: gzhan gyi don du bstan pa kun gyis rig cing bsod nams kyi tshogs su 'gyur ba mtshan ma'i shas che bar byung ba ni thabs so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don du bstan pa kun gyis rig cing bsod nams kyi tshogs su 'gyur ba mtshan ma'i shas che bar byung ba ni thabs so //
translated: the method is the appearance of the forms of the principal figures of the mandala, from the principal figure in the center to the wrathful gatekeepers, each with their individual characteristics of family, color, hand implements, ornaments, costumes, and so on, which are the doors to the aspect of liberation of their individual exalted wisdoms, and which hold the forms of the four branches of approach and accomplishment.🔽The method is the appearance of the forms of the principal figures of the mandala, from the principal figure in the center to the wrathful gatekeepers, each with their individual characteristics of family, color, hand implements, ornaments, costumes, and so on, which are the doors to the aspect of liberation of their individual exalted wisdoms, and which hold the forms of the four branches of approach and accomplishment.

original: ngo bo nyid rang bzhin med pa ye shes kyi tshogs kyi ngo bor 'gyur ba rang gis rig cing mtshan ma med pa shas cher ston pa ni shes rab tu shes par bya /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid rang bzhin med pa ye shes kyi tshogs kyi ngo bor 'gyur ba rang gis rig cing mtshan ma med pa shas cher ston pa ni shes rab tu shes par bya /
translated: The wisdom accumulation is to be understood as the teaching that emphasizes the absence of characteristics.

original: de yang zung du 'brel cing dbyer med de gcig gi ngang du gcig tshang bas sbyor ba zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang zung du 'brel cing dbyer med de gcig gi ngang du gcig tshang bas sbyor ba zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, they are united and inseparable, with one being included in the other.

original: spyi'i lugs su sbyar na /
analyzed: spyi'i lugs su sbyar na /
translated: The general system is as follows.

original: so so @81b rang rang gi mtshan nyid dang ldan par snang ba ni thabs de rang bzhin med par rtogs pa ni shes rab /
analyzed: so so @81b rang rang gi mtshan nyid dang ldan par snang ba ni thabs de rang bzhin med par rtogs pa ni shes rab /
translated: The appearance of the individual characteristics is the method. The realization that those are without inherent nature is the wisdom.🔽Moreover, the method appears as the characteristics of the wisdom that is without inherent nature, and the wisdom is realized to be without inherent nature in the appearance of the characteristics of the method.

original: de yang shes rab rang bzhin med pa las thabs mtshan nyid reg pa can du snang ba dang / thabs mtshan nyid reg pa can du snang ba nyid rang bzhin med par rtogs te dbyer med par rig pa la sbyor ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de yang shes rab rang bzhin med pa las thabs mtshan nyid reg pa can du snang ba dang / thabs mtshan nyid reg pa can du snang ba nyid rang bzhin med par rtogs te dbyer med par rig pa la sbyor ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The inseparability of those is called “the union.”

original: da ni zhus tshig lnga pa /
analyzed: da ni zhus tshig lnga pa /
translated: Now, the fifth reply to the questions is

original: rgyud ces bya ba ji ltar lags //
analyzed: rgyud ces bya ba ji ltar lags //
translated: “What is a tantra?”

original: zhes zhus pa'i lan du /
analyzed: zhes zhus pa'i lan du /
translated: The reply is🔽“The method and wisdom are inseparable.”

original: de la rgyud ni rnam gsum ste /
analyzed: de la rgyud ni rnam gsum ste /
translated: The tantra is threefold:

original: gzhi dang rang bzhin dag dang ni //
analyzed: gzhi dang rang bzhin dag dang ni //
translated: The basis, the nature,

original: bye brag tu ni bsdu bar bya //
analyzed: bye brag tu ni bsdu bar bya //
translated: and the collection.

original: gzhi dag dang ni thabs dag gis //🔽rnam gsum rgyud kyi don du bsgrubs //
analyzed: gzhi dag dang ni thabs dag gis // rnam gsum rgyud kyi don du bsgrubs //
translated: The basis and the method

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te //
translated: are established as the meaning of the three tantras.

original: de la rgyud ces bya ba ni gsang ba 'dus pa dbu zhabs tshang ba spyi'i ming du shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de la rgyud ces bya ba ni gsang ba 'dus pa dbu zhabs tshang ba spyi'i ming du shes par bya ste /
translated: The tantra is the general name of the entire Guhyasamāja Tantra from beginning to end.

original: de ni rgyud dkrugs lung gcus man ngag sbas pa'i mtshan nyid can yin la /
analyzed: de ni rgyud dkrugs lung gcus man ngag sbas pa'i mtshan nyid can yin la /
translated: It has the characteristic of a tantra that is mixed, twisted, and hidden.

original: de ltar yin du zin kyang dkyil 'khor dang / sgrub pa dang / phrin las che phra la sogs pa gang dang dgos pa'i don thams cad rgyun chags su breng ma chad par ston pas na rgyud du grags zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar yin du zin kyang dkyil 'khor dang / sgrub pa dang / phrin las che phra la sogs pa gang dang dgos pa'i don thams cad rgyun chags su breng ma chad par ston pas na rgyud du grags zhes bya ste /
translated: However, since all the meanings of the purposes, such as the maṇḍala, the sādhana, and the great and small activities, are taught without interruption, it is known as a tantra.

original: gong ma ni rgyud dngos kyi mtshan nyid la bya la /
analyzed: gong ma ni rgyud dngos kyi mtshan nyid la bya la /
translated: The former is the characteristic of the actual tantra,

original: 'og ma ni de las byung ba'i don gyi dngos po la bya'o ;
analyzed: 'og ma ni de las byung ba'i don gyi dngos po la bya'o ;
translated: and the latter is the actual meaning that arises from that.

original: / de yang lung gzhan las ni zhal nas rgyun chags su gsungs pa dang / sdud pa po la sogs pa rim par brgyud pa dang / 'gro ba rnams kyi rgyud sbyar ba'i ched du bstan pa'i phyir dang rgyud ces bya bar bshad do //
analyzed: / de yang lung gzhan las ni zhal nas rgyun chags su gsungs pa dang / sdud pa po la sogs pa rim par brgyud pa dang / 'gro ba rnams kyi rgyud sbyar ba'i ched du bstan pa'i phyir dang rgyud ces bya bar bshad do //
translated: Moreover, it is called a tantra because it is taught in a continuous manner from the mouth of the Buddha, it is a lineage of compilers and so forth, and it is a teaching for the sake of applying to the mindstreams of transmigrating beings.

original: de yang dpe thags dang 'dra ste /🔽breng ma chad pa dang ; dgos pa tshang ba dang / ltag 'og dkrugs pa dang / gos su drub ba dang sbyar te /
analyzed: de yang dpe thags dang 'dra ste / breng ma chad pa dang ; dgos pa tshang ba dang / ltag 'og dkrugs pa dang / gos su drub ba dang sbyar te /
translated: It is also like a cloth,🔽in terms of the continuity of the syllables, the completeness of the purpose, the mixing of the order, and the weaving of the cloth.🔽The continuity of the syllables is like the continuity of the threads, the completeness of the purpose is like the completeness of the loom, the mixing of the order is like the mixing of the warp and weft, and the weaving of the cloth is like the weaving of the cloth.

original: snal ma breng ma chad pa ltar yi ge breng ma chad pa dang / thags shing dgos pa tshang ba ltar gang zag sgrub pa'i cha rkyen dang / dam tshig dang / dkyil 'khor dang / dbang dang / sgrub pa dang / las dang mchod pa rnams rgyud la tshang ba'i phyir dang /
analyzed: snal ma breng ma chad pa ltar yi ge breng ma chad pa dang / thags shing dgos pa tshang ba ltar gang zag sgrub pa'i cha rkyen dang / dam tshig dang / dkyil 'khor dang / dbang dang / sgrub pa dang / las dang mchod pa rnams rgyud la tshang ba'i phyir dang /
translated: The completeness of the tantra is like the completeness of the loom, because the conditions for accomplishing the person, the pledges, the maṇḍala, empowerment, practice, activities, and offerings are complete in the tantra.

original: snas khyer ba'i 'dul bu lta 'og 'khrugs pa bzhin du rgyud kyi don dkrugs nas gsungs pa'i phyir dang / thags la sogs pa'i gos su 'grub pa bzhin du /
analyzed: snas khyer ba'i 'dul bu lta 'og 'khrugs pa bzhin du rgyud kyi don dkrugs nas gsungs pa'i phyir dang / thags la sogs pa'i gos su 'grub pa bzhin du /
translated: Because the meaning of the tantra is taught in a confused way, like a child's alphabet book that is carried around by the nose, and because it is accomplished as cloth and so forth,

original: cha rkyen de dag gis sgrub bar gyur na /
analyzed: cha rkyen de dag gis sgrub bar gyur na /
translated: if it is accomplished by those conditions,

original: @82a * // sangs rgyas su 'grub pa dang / bzhir ldan pas rgyud ces bya'o //
analyzed: @82a * // sangs rgyas su 'grub pa dang / bzhir ldan pas rgyud ces bya'o //
translated: it is called a tantra because it is accomplished as a buddha and because it has four parts.

original: de la rgyud ni rnam gsum ste //
analyzed: de la rgyud ni rnam gsum ste //
translated: Tantra is threefold.

original: zhes bya ba de ltar rgyud kyi nges tshig bstan pa de la rgyud mgo mjug spyi'i don nam mtshan nyid ni rnam pa gsum du shes par bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba de ltar rgyud kyi nges tshig bstan pa de la rgyud mgo mjug spyi'i don nam mtshan nyid ni rnam pa gsum du shes par bya ste /
translated: Thus, the definition of tantra having been taught in that way, the general meaning or characteristic of the beginning and end of the tantra should be understood in three aspects.

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: gzhi dang ; rang bzhin dang / bye brag tu bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhi dang ; rang bzhin dang / bye brag tu bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: The basis, the nature, and the specific should be included.

original: de yang rgyud kyi don la sbyar te bshad na /
analyzed: de yang rgyud kyi don la sbyar te bshad na /
translated: Moreover, when explained by applying it to the meaning of the tantra,

original: gzhi ni le'u dang po la bya /
analyzed: gzhi ni le'u dang po la bya /
translated: the basis is the first chapter.

original: rang bzhin dag ces ba ni le'u gnyis pa nas rdzogs pa'i bar te /
analyzed: rang bzhin dag ces ba ni le'u gnyis pa nas rdzogs pa'i bar te /
translated: The nature is from the second chapter up to the conclusion.

original: rgyud 'di mgo gzhug gi don mtha' dag la bya'o //
analyzed: rgyud 'di mgo gzhug gi don mtha' dag la bya'o //
translated: The general meaning of the beginning and end of this tantra is all of the meaning.

original: bye brag bya ba ni rgyud le'u re re'i nang nas kyang dkyil 'khor dang / dbang dang / phrin las dang / sgrub thabs mi mthun pa'i bye brag rnam pa du mar so sor ston pa'o //
analyzed: bye brag bya ba ni rgyud le'u re re'i nang nas kyang dkyil 'khor dang / dbang dang / phrin las dang / sgrub thabs mi mthun pa'i bye brag rnam pa du mar so sor ston pa'o //
translated: The specific activities are the many different individual teachings within each chapter of the tantra, such as the maṇḍala, empowerment, activity, and the sādhana.

original: bsdu bar bya zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bsdu bar bya zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The summary is as follows:

original: mang por ston pa de dag mdor bsdu na rnam pa de gsum du bsdus la bstan par bya ba'am /
analyzed: mang por ston pa de dag mdor bsdu na rnam pa de gsum du bsdus la bstan par bya ba'am /
translated: Having taught many topics, those three topics should be summarized and taught.

original: gnyis su 'og nas 'byung ba 'di ltar bsdu bar bya ste /
analyzed: gnyis su 'og nas 'byung ba 'di ltar bsdu bar bya ste /
translated: Or, as it occurs below, the summary is as follows:

original: ji ltar zhe na /🔽de ltar bstan pa de yang /🔽gzhi dag dang ni thabs dag gis //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na / de ltar bstan pa de yang / gzhi dag dang ni thabs dag gis //
translated: How is that?🔽That teaching is also established as the meaning of the tantra in three topics

original: rnam gsum rgyud kyi don du sgrub //
analyzed: rnam gsum rgyud kyi don du sgrub //
translated: through the pure basis and the pure method.

original: rang bzhin rang bzhin med pa'i rgyu //
analyzed: rang bzhin rang bzhin med pa'i rgyu //
translated: The cause is the nature and the naturelessness;

original: de bzhin 'bras bu bsdu ba med //🔽ces gsungs pas /
analyzed: de bzhin 'bras bu bsdu ba med // ces gsungs pas /
translated: the result is the same, without inclusion.

original: dang por rgyu las phyi ma 'bras bur byas nas de yang rang bzhin med par ston pa ste /
analyzed: dang por rgyu las phyi ma 'bras bur byas nas de yang rang bzhin med par ston pa ste /
translated: Having made the former cause into the latter result, that is also taught to be natureless.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: gzhi dag ces pa ni le'u dang pos rgyu byas nas ni le'u gnyis pa sogs pa'i rgyud tshang bar 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gzhi dag ces pa ni le'u dang pos rgyu byas nas ni le'u gnyis pa sogs pa'i rgyud tshang bar 'byung ngo //
translated: The pure basis is the first chapter, and the complete tantra arises from the second chapter onward, having been caused by the first chapter.

original: de ltar gzhi'i le'u dang po dag dang rang bzhin du brjod pa'i le'u gnyis pa la sogs pa ni ming gi rnam grangs thabs zhes brjod de rgyu'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar gzhi'i le'u dang po dag dang rang bzhin du brjod pa'i le'u gnyis pa la sogs pa ni ming gi rnam grangs thabs zhes brjod de rgyu'i don to //
translated: As such, the first chapter, the pure basis, and the second chapter, the nature, and so on, are called synonyms, method, which is the meaning of cause.

original: gzhi dag dang ni thabs dag gis //
analyzed: gzhi dag dang ni thabs dag gis //
translated: The pure basis and the pure method

original: rgyu byas pa las byung ba ni //
analyzed: rgyu byas pa las byung ba ni //
translated: are the three aspects that arise from the cause.

original: rnam pa gsum zhes bya ste sku gsung thugs rnam pa gsum gyi don ston pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum zhes bya ste sku gsung thugs rnam pa gsum gyi don ston pa ste /
translated: The three aspects are the three topics of body, speech, and mind.

original: sngar le'u dang po las gzhi zhes bya ba dang / le'u gnyis pa man chad la rang bzhin zhes bya ba dang / de dag gi don gyi mtshan nyid ston pa la bye brag ces bya ba dang / de gsum gyis rgyu byas nas sku gsung thugs kyi dkyil 'khor bri ba dang /
analyzed: sngar le'u dang po las gzhi zhes bya ba dang / le'u gnyis pa man chad la rang bzhin zhes bya ba dang / de dag gi don gyi mtshan nyid ston pa la bye brag ces bya ba dang / de gsum gyis rgyu byas nas sku gsung thugs kyi dkyil 'khor bri ba dang /
translated: The first chapter is called the basis, the second chapter and below are called the nature, the characteristics of the meaning of those are called the distinctions, and the maṇḍalas of body, speech, and mind are drawn from the three causes.

original: dbang bskur ba dang / sgrub pa dang / las brtsam pa la sogs pa'i don de ltar bstan pa ni rgyud kyi don du sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs su bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: dbang bskur ba dang / sgrub pa dang / las brtsam pa la sogs pa'i don de ltar bstan pa ni rgyud kyi don du sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs su bstan pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of the consecration, the practice, the beginning of the rite, and so on, is taught in this way. This is taught as the proof of the meaning of the tantra.

original: @82b de la rang bzhin te rgyud kyi don gyis ni rang bzhin med pa rdo rje theg pa mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa sgrub pa'i rgyu byed pa ste /
analyzed: @82b de la rang bzhin te rgyud kyi don gyis ni rang bzhin med pa rdo rje theg pa mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa sgrub pa'i rgyu byed pa ste /
translated: The meaning of the tantra is the nature, which is the cause of accomplishing the non-abiding nirvana of the Vajrayana, which is without nature.

original: rgyud kyi don gyis ni rgyu mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni 'bras bur gzhag go //
analyzed: rgyud kyi don gyis ni rgyu mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni 'bras bur gzhag go //
translated: By the meaning of the tantra, non-abiding nirvana is posited as the result.

original: 'o na rgyud kyi don ni rang bzhin med na yang bsdu ba yang yod de /
analyzed: 'o na rgyud kyi don ni rang bzhin med na yang bsdu ba yang yod de /
translated: If one asks, If the meaning of the tantra is without nature, is there also a summary?

original: sku gsung thugs kho nar bsdu bar snang na /
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kho nar bsdu bar snang na /
translated: It appears that the summary is only of the body, speech, and mind.

original: 'bras bu thob pa de la bsdu ba yod dam med ce na //
analyzed: 'bras bu thob pa de la bsdu ba yod dam med ce na //
translated: If one asks, Is there a summary of the attainment of the result or not?

original: de bzhin 'bras bu bsdu ba med //
analyzed: de bzhin 'bras bu bsdu ba med //
translated: The result is also without summary.

original: ces bya ste rgyud kyi don rang bzhin med pa bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa la yang rang bzhin med par mthun la /
analyzed: ces bya ste rgyud kyi don rang bzhin med pa bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa la yang rang bzhin med par mthun la /
translated: Just as the meaning of the tantra is without nature, nirvana is also in accord with being without nature.

original: rgyud la bsdu ba yod kyang mya ngan las 'das pa la ni 'bras bu bsdu ba med do //
analyzed: rgyud la bsdu ba yod kyang mya ngan las 'das pa la ni 'bras bu bsdu ba med do //
translated: Although there is a compilation in the tantra, there is no compilation of the result in nirvana.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rgyud la rang bzhin med kyang lha dang / dkyil 'khor dang / phrin las thams cad kyi mtshan nyid 'byed cing so sor gsal bar ston dgos pas bsdu ba yod la /
analyzed: rgyud la rang bzhin med kyang lha dang / dkyil 'khor dang / phrin las thams cad kyi mtshan nyid 'byed cing so sor gsal bar ston dgos pas bsdu ba yod la /
translated: Although there is no nature in the tantra, since it is necessary to distinguish and clarify the characteristics of all the deities, mandalas, and activities, there is a compilation.

original: 'bras bu mya ngan las 'das pa ni rang bzhin nam mkha' lta bu la thams cad nas thams cad du kun la khyab pa'i bdag nyid du gnas pas de'i phyir rang bzhin dang 'bras bu gnyig phyogs gcig tu bsdu zhing dpyad du med ce'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu mya ngan las 'das pa ni rang bzhin nam mkha' lta bu la thams cad nas thams cad du kun la khyab pa'i bdag nyid du gnas pas de'i phyir rang bzhin dang 'bras bu gnyig phyogs gcig tu bsdu zhing dpyad du med ce'o //
translated: Since the result, nirvana, exists as the nature that pervades all without exception, everywhere, and always in the nature of space, therefore, the nature and the result are not analyzed or compiled into one category.

original: lha'i rang bzhin la sbyar te bshad na /
analyzed: lha'i rang bzhin la sbyar te bshad na /
translated: When applied to the nature of the deity,

original: gzhi zhes bya ba ni dbyings dang ye shes gnyis su med pa'i che ba'i yon tan thams cad 'byung ba'i gnas dang rten pa'i gzhir gyur pa ste /
analyzed: gzhi zhes bya ba ni dbyings dang ye shes gnyis su med pa'i che ba'i yon tan thams cad 'byung ba'i gnas dang rten pa'i gzhir gyur pa ste /
translated: the “basis” is the source and the basis of support for all the great qualities of the nondual dhātu and pristine consciousness.

original: rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po'o //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po'o //
translated: It is the great vajra holder.

original: rang bzhin ni rtags thabs dang shes rab zung du 'brel pa ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin ni rtags thabs dang shes rab zung du 'brel pa ste /
translated: The nature is the union of the means and wisdom signs.

original: lha thams cad spyi'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: lha thams cad spyi'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: This is the general characteristic of all deities.

original: bye brag ni dbus kyi gtso bo nas sgo ba la thug pa'i bar gyi sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / lha mo dang / sems ma dang / khro bo dang / khro mo'i rnam par snang ba'i mi mthun pa'i bye brag ste /
analyzed: bye brag ni dbus kyi gtso bo nas sgo ba la thug pa'i bar gyi sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / lha mo dang / sems ma dang / khro bo dang / khro mo'i rnam par snang ba'i mi mthun pa'i bye brag ste /
translated: The particulars are the various differences in the appearance of the buddhas, bodhisattvas, goddesses, female buddhas, wrathful ones, and wrathful females, from the principal one in the center to the gatekeepers.

original: de ni rgyud 'dir mdor bsdus la bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni rgyud 'dir mdor bsdus la bstan par bya'o //
translated: This will be taught in brief in this tantra.

original: ji ltar bsdu zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar bsdu zhe na /
translated: How is it summarized?

original: gzhi dag ste rdo rje chen po dang / thabs dag ste thabs de gtsor smos pas thabs dang shes rab zung du 'brel par yang ston la /
analyzed: gzhi dag ste rdo rje chen po dang / thabs dag ste thabs de gtsor smos pas thabs dang shes rab zung du 'brel par yang ston la /
translated: The basis is pure, that is, the great vajra, and the means is pure. Since that means is mentioned as the main point, it also teaches the union of means and wisdom.

original: de nyid rgyur yang 'dren pas rdo rje 'dzin chen po dang thabs dang shes rab zung du 'brel pa dag gis rgyu byas pa las byung ba'i 'bras bu ni rnam gsum zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid rgyur yang 'dren pas rdo rje 'dzin chen po dang thabs dang shes rab zung du 'brel pa dag gis rgyu byas pa las byung ba'i 'bras bu ni rnam gsum zhes bya ste /
translated: Since that is also referred to as the cause, the result that arises from the cause of the union of the great vajra holder and the union of means and wisdom is called the “triply qualified result.”

original: sku gsung thugs kyi dkyil 'khor phyi nang gsang ba gsum gyis bsdus @83a * //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi dkyil 'khor phyi nang gsang ba gsum gyis bsdus @83a * //
translated: The mandalas of enlightened body, speech, and mind are subsumed within the outer, inner, and secret aspects.🔽

original: pa'i lha dang lha mo'i rnam par snang ba yin te /
analyzed: pa'i lha dang lha mo'i rnam par snang ba yin te /
translated: The appearances of the forms of deities and goddesses are subsumed within the outer, inner, and secret maṇḍalas of body, speech, and mind.
