original: gong du gzhi dang / rang bzhin dang / bye brag tu bstan pas rgyu byas pa gsum dang / 'bras bu sku gsung thugs kyi dkyil 'khor phyi nang gsang ba gsum du bsdus nas de ltar bstan pa de ni rgyud kyi don du sgrub ces bya ste /
analyzed: gong du gzhi dang / rang bzhin dang / bye brag tu bstan pas rgyu byas pa gsum dang / 'bras bu sku gsung thugs kyi dkyil 'khor phyi nang gsang ba gsum du bsdus nas de ltar bstan pa de ni rgyud kyi don du sgrub ces bya ste /
translated: The three topics of the basis, nature, and distinctions above are the three causes, and the result is subsumed within the outer, inner, and secret maṇḍalas of body, speech, and mind.

original: rgyud kyi nges tshig dang don dang ldan pa'i gtan tshigs bsgrub pa ched du gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyud kyi nges tshig dang don dang ldan pa'i gtan tshigs bsgrub pa ched du gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The statement “the meaning of tantra is established” is said for the purpose of establishing the definition and meaning of tantra.

original: gnyis su na sgrub ces pas rgyud 'dren te sku gsung thugs kyi dkyil 'khor du snang ba'i lha de dag ni rgyud 'byung ba'i don du gsung rgyur gnas pa yin no zhes kyang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis su na sgrub ces pas rgyud 'dren te sku gsung thugs kyi dkyil 'khor du snang ba'i lha de dag ni rgyud 'byung ba'i don du gsung rgyur gnas pa yin no zhes kyang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: “Tantra” is also derived from the word “to lead,” because those deities that appear in the maṇḍalas of body, speech, and mind abide as the tantra that is to be explained.

original: rang bzhin med pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba /
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba /
translated: The Cause That Lacks Intrinsic Nature

original: lha'i rang bzhin nyid rang bzhin med par gnas pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi lha thams cad bskyed pa'i rgyu byed pa dang / de ltar rgyu rang bzhin med pa bzhin du 'bras bu dkyil 'khor gyi lha snang ba yang rang bzhin med de gong bu lta bur ma grub pas bsdu ba med ces bya'o//
analyzed: lha'i rang bzhin nyid rang bzhin med par gnas pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi lha thams cad bskyed pa'i rgyu byed pa dang / de ltar rgyu rang bzhin med pa bzhin du 'bras bu dkyil 'khor gyi lha snang ba yang rang bzhin med de gong bu lta bur ma grub pas bsdu ba med ces bya'o//
translated: Just as the cause is without intrinsic nature, the appearance of the resultant mandala deities is also without intrinsic nature, and since they are not established like a lump, they are said to be “without collection.”

original: gnyis su na rgyud dang lha gnyis kyang gcig gi rgyud gcig 'gyur zhing gcig gi 'bras zur gcig gnas te /
analyzed: gnyis su na rgyud dang lha gnyis kyang gcig gi rgyud gcig 'gyur zhing gcig gi 'bras zur gcig gnas te /
translated: In another way, the tantra and the deity are one continuum, and one result abides in one part.

original: rgyu gang yin pa rang bzhin med pa nus mthu can du gyur pa las 'bras bu 'grub pa /
analyzed: rgyu gang yin pa rang bzhin med pa nus mthu can du gyur pa las 'bras bu 'grub pa /
translated: From the cause, which is without intrinsic nature and has the power to do so, the result is accomplished.

original: de yang rang bzhin med pa ste gong bu lta bur bsdu ba med de /
analyzed: de yang rang bzhin med pa ste gong bu lta bur bsdu ba med de /
translated: That is also without intrinsic nature, and since it is not collected like a lump,

original: kun rdzob tu snang zhing brjod du yod kyang don dam par brjod du med cing mi dmigs par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu snang zhing brjod du yod kyang don dam par brjod du med cing mi dmigs par bstan pa yin no //
translated: it is taught that although it appears and can be expressed conventionally, ultimately it is inexpressible and unobservable.

original: 'o na rgyu rang bzhin med pa las 'bras bu rang bzhin med pa skyer btub bam zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na rgyu rang bzhin med pa las 'bras bu rang bzhin med pa skyer btub bam zhe na /
translated: Well then, can an effect that lacks intrinsic existence arise from a cause that lacks intrinsic existence?

original: sgyu 'phrul las /
analyzed: sgyu 'phrul las /
translated: The Magical Net of Manjushri states:

original: ae ma'o ngo mtshar rmad kyi chos //
analyzed: ae ma'o ngo mtshar rmad kyi chos //
translated: Amazing, wondrous Dharma!

original: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kun gyi gsang //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kun gyi gsang //
translated: The secret of all perfect buddhas

original: skye ba med las thams cad skyes //
analyzed: skye ba med las thams cad skyes //
translated: is that everything arises from the unborn

original: skyes pa nyid na skye ba med /
analyzed: skyes pa nyid na skye ba med /
translated: and that, in arising, is unborn.

original: ces gsungs pa'i don gyis ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs dang / ye shes kyi byin rlabs dang / sngags kyi mthu dang / shes rab kyi rtsal dang / sngon gyi smon lam dang // 'phrul gyi thugs rje'i dbang gis de ltar skyer rung bar gsungs so //
analyzed: ces gsungs pa'i don gyis ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs dang / ye shes kyi byin rlabs dang / sngags kyi mthu dang / shes rab kyi rtsal dang / sngon gyi smon lam dang // 'phrul gyi thugs rje'i dbang gis de ltar skyer rung bar gsungs so //
translated: The meaning of this quotation is that it is appropriate to arise in that way through the power of meditative absorption, the blessing of timeless awareness, the power of mantra, the strength of sublime knowing, one’s past aspirations, and the dynamic energy of responsiveness.

original: don dang mtshan nyid de ltar bstan pa'i rgyud de'i nang du ni rigs mang nyung du bstan pa thams cad kyang 'dus par bstan pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: don dang mtshan nyid de ltar bstan pa'i rgyud de'i nang du ni rigs mang nyung du bstan pa thams cad kyang 'dus par bstan pa'i phyir na /
translated: In the tantra that presents the meaning and the characteristics in this way, all the many or few family types that are taught are shown to be subsumed within the following.

original: rigs ni de bzhin lnga dang gsum //
analyzed: rigs ni de bzhin lnga dang gsum //
translated: The family is thus fivefold or threefold,

original: ngo bo gcig dang rigs brgya ste //
analyzed: ngo bo gcig dang rigs brgya ste //
translated: one in essence and a hundredfold.

original: byang chub rdo rje bcas @83b gsungs pa /
analyzed: byang chub rdo rje bcas @83b gsungs pa /
translated: and Bodhyardha

original: de ni rgyud kyi bla mar 'dod //🔽ces gsungs te /
analyzed: de ni rgyud kyi bla mar 'dod // ces gsungs te /
translated: are considered the best of tantras.

original: de la rigs zhes bya ba rang gi ngo bo ni theg pa 'di'i gzhung gis nyon mongs pa nyid gnas su dag pa la bzhed de /
analyzed: de la rigs zhes bya ba rang gi ngo bo ni theg pa 'di'i gzhung gis nyon mongs pa nyid gnas su dag pa la bzhed de /
translated: In this regard, the essence of what is called “family” is asserted by the scriptures of this vehicle to be the affliction itself purified in its own place.

original: de bzhin bshad pa de la /
analyzed: de bzhin bshad pa de la /
translated: In that regard,

original: lnga ni gti mug la sogs pa nyon mongs pa lnga'i dbang du byas pa'o//
analyzed: lnga ni gti mug la sogs pa nyon mongs pa lnga'i dbang du byas pa'o//
translated: the five are from the perspective of the five afflictions such as delusion.

original: rigs gsum ni dug gsum gyi dbang du byas pa ste /
analyzed: rigs gsum ni dug gsum gyi dbang du byas pa ste /
translated: The three families are from the perspective of the three poisons.

original: yid bzhin nor bu'i rigs dang / dam tshig rdo rje'i rigs gnyis ni rdo rje'i rigs su bsdus pa dang / sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi rigs te gsum mo //
analyzed: yid bzhin nor bu'i rigs dang / dam tshig rdo rje'i rigs gnyis ni rdo rje'i rigs su bsdus pa dang / sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi rigs te gsum mo //
translated: The two families of the wish-fulfilling jewel and the samaya vajra are included in the vajra family, and there are three families: the body, speech, and mind families.

original: ngo bo gcig ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: ngo bo gcig ces bya ba ni /
translated: The one essence

original: rtsa ba'i rgyud las /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rgyud las /
translated: is stated in the Root Tantra:

original: nyon mongs kun gyi rgya mtsho che //🔽zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: nyon mongs kun gyi rgya mtsho che // zhes gsungs te /
translated: The great ocean of all afflictions.

original: rigs gsum dang / lnga dang / brgyar phye ba'i rnam pa med pa rigs thams cad kyi rgyal po 'am gtso bor gyur pa /
analyzed: rigs gsum dang / lnga dang / brgyar phye ba'i rnam pa med pa rigs thams cad kyi rgyal po 'am gtso bor gyur pa /
translated: The aspect that is not divided into three families, five families, or one hundred families is the king or chief of all families.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi spyi gzugs /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi spyi gzugs /
translated: The universal form of all buddhas,

original: ye shes lnga'i ngo bo rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po la bya ste /
analyzed: ye shes lnga'i ngo bo rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po la bya ste /
translated: the great vajra holder, who is the essence of the five pristine awarenesses.

original: sbyor ba'i rgyud las ni rigs thams cad ni rdo rje sems dpa'i rigs so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i rgyud las ni rigs thams cad ni rdo rje sems dpa'i rigs so zhes gsungs so //
translated: The Yoga Tantra states: “All families are the family of Vajrasattva.”

original: rigs brgya zhes bya ba ni sku gsung thugs kyi dbang du bya ba dang / ye shes kyi dbang du bya ba dang / yon tan gyi dbang du byas nas dbye ba'o //
analyzed: rigs brgya zhes bya ba ni sku gsung thugs kyi dbang du bya ba dang / ye shes kyi dbang du bya ba dang / yon tan gyi dbang du byas nas dbye ba'o //
translated: The term “one hundred families” is a division made in terms of body, speech, mind, pristine awareness, and qualities.

original: de la sku gsung thugs kyi dbang du byas nas dbye na /
analyzed: de la sku gsung thugs kyi dbang du byas nas dbye na /
translated: In terms of body, speech, and mind,

original: rtsa ba'i rigs lnga re re la sku gsung thugs gsum de phye ba dang bco lnga //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rigs lnga re re la sku gsung thugs gsum de phye ba dang bco lnga //
translated: each of the five root families is divided into three: body, speech, and mind, making fifteen.

original: sku gsung thugs de re re la ye shes lnga ldan phye ba dang bdun cu rtsa lnga /
analyzed: sku gsung thugs de re re la ye shes lnga ldan phye ba dang bdun cu rtsa lnga /
translated: Each of those body, speech, and mind is divided into the five pristine awarenesses, making seventy-five.

original: rtsa ba'i yab lnga la ye shes kyi yum yon tan gyi rgyan du gyur pa yum lnga dang 'khril te /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i yab lnga la ye shes kyi yum yon tan gyi rgyan du gyur pa yum lnga dang 'khril te /
translated: The five root male deities are embraced by the five female deities, who are the consorts of pristine awareness and the ornaments of qualities.

original: de rnams la spyir bsdus na brgya tham par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rnams la spyir bsdus na brgya tham par 'gyur ro //
translated: In general, those deities total one hundred.

original: ye shes kyi dbang du byas nas dbye na /
analyzed: ye shes kyi dbang du byas nas dbye na /
translated: If classified in terms of pristine awareness,

original: rigs lnga re re la ye shes lnga lngar phye na nyi shu rtsa lnga /
analyzed: rigs lnga re re la ye shes lnga lngar phye na nyi shu rtsa lnga /
translated: there are twenty-five, since each of the five families is classified in terms of the five pristine awarenesses.

original: de re re la sku gsung thugs gsum gsum du phye na gsum phrag nyi shu rtsa lnga la bdun cu rtsa lnga /
analyzed: de re re la sku gsung thugs gsum gsum du phye na gsum phrag nyi shu rtsa lnga la bdun cu rtsa lnga /
translated: If each of those is classified in terms of the three bodies, speech, and mind, there are seventy-five, since there are twenty-five sets of three.

original: de la spyir brtsi na brgya thams pa'o //
analyzed: de la spyir brtsi na brgya thams pa'o //
translated: If one counts them in general, there are one hundred.

original: yon tan gyi dbang du dbye na rigs lnga /
analyzed: yon tan gyi dbang du dbye na rigs lnga /
translated: If classified in terms of qualities, there are five families.

original: de re re la sku gsung thugs yon tan phrin las lnga lnga ste nyi shu rtsa lnga ste /
analyzed: de re re la sku gsung thugs yon tan phrin las lnga lnga ste nyi shu rtsa lnga ste /
translated: Each of those is classified in terms of the five bodies, speech, mind, qualities, and activities, making twenty-five.

original: de re re la ye shes kyi yum lha mo 'dod pa'i yon tan chos nyid kyi rgyan du gyur pa'i lha mo bzhi dang ldan pas de ltar spyir brgya tham pa'o //
analyzed: de re re la ye shes kyi yum lha mo 'dod pa'i yon tan chos nyid kyi rgyan du gyur pa'i lha mo bzhi dang ldan pas de ltar spyir brgya tham pa'o //
translated: Each of those is endowed with the four goddesses of the consorts of pristine awareness, the goddesses of the qualities of desire that are the ornaments of reality, making one hundred in general.

original: de ltar dbye ba mi mthun par byas nas ming gsum du 'dogs pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar dbye ba mi mthun par byas nas ming gsum du 'dogs pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If the classifications are made in that way, why are they designated by three names?🔽The root

original: rtsa ba @84a * //
analyzed: rtsa ba @84a * //
translated: The root🔽🔽

original: rigs lnga yin par 'dra na yang de la sku gsung thugs su phye ba la btags pa'i sku gsung thugs gtsor byas pa'i dbang du bshad pa'o //
analyzed: rigs lnga yin par 'dra na yang de la sku gsung thugs su phye ba la btags pa'i sku gsung thugs gtsor byas pa'i dbang du bshad pa'o //
translated: Although they are all alike in being the five families, they are explained in terms of the principal ones, which are the body, speech, and mind families, which are designated on the basis of the division into body, speech, and mind.

original: gnyis pa rtsa ba'i rigs lnga re re las lnga lngar phye ba na ye shes gtsor byas nas bshad pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa rtsa ba'i rigs lnga re re las lnga lngar phye ba na ye shes gtsor byas nas bshad pa'o //
translated: Second, when each of the five root families is divided into five, they are explained in terms of the principal gnosis.

original: 'dod pa lnga rigs lngar bshad nas lha mo bzhi'i tshom bu nyi shu rtsa lngas bskor bar bstan pa ni yon tan gtsor byas pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa lnga rigs lngar bshad nas lha mo bzhi'i tshom bu nyi shu rtsa lngas bskor bar bstan pa ni yon tan gtsor byas pa'o //
translated: When the five desires are explained as the five families, and the four goddesses are taught to be surrounded by twenty-five clusters, that is explained in terms of the principal qualities.

original: de'i phyir na dbye ba mi mthun par byas nas ming gsum du btags pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir na dbye ba mi mthun par byas nas ming gsum du btags pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, the three names are designated on the basis of the different divisions.

original: spyir de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang / de dag gi sku gsung thugs dang yon tan dang phrin las mtha' yas pa'i phyir na rig kyang mtha' yas so zhes bshad do //
analyzed: spyir de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang / de dag gi sku gsung thugs dang yon tan dang phrin las mtha' yas pa'i phyir na rig kyang mtha' yas so zhes bshad do //
translated: In general, since the tathāgatas and their limitless body, speech, mind, qualities, and activities are limitless, the families are also explained as limitless.

original: byang chub rdo rje bcas gsungs pa //
analyzed: byang chub rdo rje bcas gsungs pa //
translated: The Vajra of Awakening said:

original: zhes bya ba ni de ltar rgyud kyi don rigs kyi dbye ba byang chub rdo rje'i mtshan nyid dang bcas pa'am //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de ltar rgyud kyi don rigs kyi dbye ba byang chub rdo rje'i mtshan nyid dang bcas pa'am //
translated: Thus, the meaning of the tantra is taught by Bodhichittavajra, who is the one who has the divisions of the tantra and the characteristics of Vajra of Awakening.

original: byang chub sems rdo rjes rgyud dbu zhags dgos pa tshang ba don dang bcas par gsungs pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems rdo rjes rgyud dbu zhags dgos pa tshang ba don dang bcas par gsungs pa /
translated: Or, the tantra is taught by Bodhichittavajra, who is the one who has the complete meaning of the tantra, which is the head of the tantras, and the purpose.

original: rgyu dang rang bzhin dang / 'bras bu bar mi 'chad par ston pa'i rtsa ba'i rgyud la ni rgyud kyi bla ma zhes bya bar 'dod la /
analyzed: rgyu dang rang bzhin dang / 'bras bu bar mi 'chad par ston pa'i rtsa ba'i rgyud la ni rgyud kyi bla ma zhes bya bar 'dod la /
translated: The root tantra, which teaches the cause, nature, and result without interruption, is asserted to be the “supreme tantra.”

original: gnyis su na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi the tshom gcad pa'i don du 'khor gyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis bshad pa 'di ni rgyud bla ma'i rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi phyi ma gsungs pas gsang rgyud phyi ma zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gnyis su na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi the tshom gcad pa'i don du 'khor gyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis bshad pa 'di ni rgyud bla ma'i rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi phyi ma gsungs pas gsang rgyud phyi ma zhes bya ste /
translated: Moreover, this explanation by the tathagatas of the retinue for the sake of cutting through the doubts of the bodhisattvas is the latter of the root tantra of the Supreme Tantra, and is called the “latter secret tantra.”

original: 'dis 'khor gyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis bshad par snang yang /
analyzed: 'dis 'khor gyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis bshad par snang yang /
translated: Although this appears to be an explanation by the tathagatas of the retinue,

original: byang chub sems rdo rje'i mthu dang byin rlabs rtsa ba'i rgyud dang phyi mar bcas pa bshad par snang ba yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems rdo rje'i mthu dang byin rlabs rtsa ba'i rgyud dang phyi mar bcas pa bshad par snang ba yin te /
translated: The root tantra and the continuation tantra appear to explain the power and blessing of the vajra mind of awakening.

original: rgyud phyi ma 'di yang rgyud thams cad kyi bla mar 'dod de /
analyzed: rgyud phyi ma 'di yang rgyud thams cad kyi bla mar 'dod de /
translated: This continuation tantra is also asserted to be the guru of all tantras.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gsang ba'i rgyud thams cad kyi don dang / dgongs pa thams cad 'grel par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsang ba'i rgyud thams cad kyi don dang / dgongs pa thams cad 'grel par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because it explains the meaning of all secret tantras and the intention of all tantras.

original: da ni zhus tshig drug pa /
analyzed: da ni zhus tshig drug pa /
translated: Now, in response to the sixth question,

original: de nyid kho na rnam pa du gsungs zhes bya ba'i lan du /
analyzed: de nyid kho na rnam pa du gsungs zhes bya ba'i lan du /
translated: “How many kinds of thatness are taught?”

original: de kho na nyid rigs lngar gsungs zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de kho na nyid rigs lngar gsungs zhes bya ste /
translated: it is said, “Thatness is taught as the five families.”

original: de kho na nyid ces bya ba ni 'gyur ba med cing so so na gnas pa la bya ste /
analyzed: de kho na nyid ces bya ba ni 'gyur ba med cing so so na gnas pa la bya ste /
translated: Thatness is called “unchanging” and “abiding in its own place.”

original: de yang rgyud so so'i bzhed kyis rnam pa gzhan dang gzhan du 'byed cing ston pa mang du yod na /
analyzed: de yang rgyud so so'i bzhed kyis rnam pa gzhan dang gzhan du 'byed cing ston pa mang du yod na /
translated: There are many divisions and presentations of thatness in the assertions of individual tantras.

original: 'di'i skabs su ni nyon mongs pa lnga la bya ste /
analyzed: 'di'i skabs su ni nyon mongs pa lnga la bya ste /
translated: In this context, thatness is the five afflictions.

original: de nyid gnas su rnam par dag pa ma rtogs sems can gyi rgyud @84b la yod pa'i dus na ni dri ma can du bcas pas 'khor ba'i chos thams cad skyed par byed pa'i ngo bo las gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'i so na gnas la de nyid gnas🔽su rnam par dag par rtogs te /
analyzed: de nyid gnas su rnam par dag pa ma rtogs sems can gyi rgyud @84b la yod pa'i dus na ni dri ma can du bcas pas 'khor ba'i chos thams cad skyed par byed pa'i ngo bo las gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'i so na gnas la de nyid gnas su rnam par dag par rtogs te /
translated: When it exists in the mind stream of sentient beings who have not realized that suchness is pure in its place, it is associated with stains and remains as it is, without changing from its essence that gives rise to all the phenomena of samsara.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rgyud la yod pa'i dus na ni rnam pa gang gi ngo bor yang mi rtogs par gnas la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rgyud la yod pa'i dus na ni rnam pa gang gi ngo bor yang mi rtogs par gnas la /
translated: When it exists in the mind stream of a tathāgata, it remains without being realized as any kind of essence.

original: de nyid kyis gzung 'dzin la sogs pa'i nyes pa 'joms pa dang / mtha' gnyis pa la sogs pa'i skyon zil gyis gnon pa dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / sems can gyi don la chags pa dang / thams cad kun la phan gdags pa'i sbyor ba bdag gcig pus bya bar 'dod pa'i phrag dog chen po'i so la gnas pa'i sku dang ye shes la sogs pa mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos thams cad skyed par byed pa'i ngo bor gnas pa las gzhan du mi
analyzed: de nyid kyis gzung 'dzin la sogs pa'i nyes pa 'joms pa dang / mtha' gnyis pa la sogs pa'i skyon zil gyis gnon pa dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / sems can gyi don la chags pa dang / thams cad kun la phan gdags pa'i sbyor ba bdag gcig pus bya bar 'dod pa'i phrag dog chen po'i so la gnas pa'i sku dang ye shes la sogs pa mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos thams cad skyed par byed pa'i ngo bor gnas pa las gzhan du mi
translated: Since it is the nature that generates all phenomena of nirvāṇa, such as the kāyas, pristine consciousnesses, and so on, it is called “the sole unique bindu.”🔽Since it is the nature that generates all phenomena of nirvāṇa, such as the kāyas, pristine consciousnesses, and so on, it is called “the sole unique bindu.”

original: 'gyur bas na de kho na nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: 'gyur bas na de kho na nyid ces bya ste /
translated: Since it is the nature that generates all phenomena of nirvāṇa, such as the kāyas, pristine consciousnesses, and so on, it is called “the sole unique bindu.”🔽Since it is the nature that generates all phenomena of nirvāṇa, such as the kāyas, pristine consciousnesses, and so on, it is called “the sole unique bindu.”🔽Since it is the nature that generates all phenomena of nirvāṇa, such as the kāyas, pristine consciousnesses, and so on, it is called “the sole unique bindu.”

original: rigs zhes bya pa'i rang gi ngo bo dang / rigs lnga zhes bya bar gsungs pa yang de nyid de dag gi mtshan nyid rgyas par sngar bshad zin to //🔽zhus tshig bdun pa /
analyzed: rigs zhes bya pa'i rang gi ngo bo dang / rigs lnga zhes bya bar gsungs pa yang de nyid de dag gi mtshan nyid rgyas par sngar bshad zin to // zhus tshig bdun pa /
translated: Since it is the nature that generates all phenomena of nirvāṇa, such as the kāyas, pristine consciousnesses, and so on, it is called “the sole unique bindu.”🔽Since it is the nature that generates all phenomena of nirvāṇa, such as the kāyas, pristine consciousnesses, and so on, it is called “the sole unique bindu.”

original: de bzhin gsang ba rnam pa du //
analyzed: de bzhin gsang ba rnam pa du //
translated: Since it is the nature that generates all phenomena of nirvāṇa, such as the kāyas, pristine consciousnesses, and so on, it is called “the sole unique bindu.”🔽Since it is the nature that generates all phenomena of nirvāṇa, such as the kāyas, pristine consciousnesses, and so on, it is called “the sole unique bindu.”

original: zhes bya ba'i lan du /🔽gsang ba zhes ni rigs gsum mo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i lan du /🔽gsang ba zhes ni rigs gsum mo //
translated: Since it is the nature

analyzed: zhes bya ba ste nyon mongs pa lnga nyid gnas su rnam par dag pa sku gsung thugs rdo rje rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Thus, the five afflictions themselves are the three vajras of enlightened body, speech, and mind, which are totally pure in their own place.

original: de nyid rigs gsum du grags pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid rigs gsum du grags pa'o //
translated: Those are renowned as the three buddha families.

original: zhus tshig brgyad pa /
analyzed: zhus tshig brgyad pa /
translated: The eighth question:

original: gsang chen zhes bgyi ji ltar lags //
analyzed: gsang chen zhes bgyi ji ltar lags //
translated: What is called the great secret?

original: zhes bya ba'i lan du /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i lan du /
translated: The reply:

original: gsang chen yang ni rigs kyi lha //
analyzed: gsang chen yang ni rigs kyi lha //
translated: The great secret is the family deity.

original: zhes bya ba ste chos thams cad la khyab pa'i bdag nyid sku gsung thugs rdo rje rnam pa gsum gyi gzhi /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste chos thams cad la khyab pa'i bdag nyid sku gsung thugs rdo rje rnam pa gsum gyi gzhi /
translated: The great secret is the basis of the three vajras of enlightened body, speech, and mind, which are the nature that pervades all phenomena.

original: sku dang ye shes thams cad kyi spyi gzugs su gyur pa rdo rje 'dzin chen po la bya'o //
analyzed: sku dang ye shes thams cad kyi spyi gzugs su gyur pa rdo rje 'dzin chen po la bya'o //
translated: It is the great vajra holder, the universal form of all the bodies and pristine consciousnesses.

original: ci'i phyir de skad ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de skad ce na /
translated: Why is it called that?

original: sku gsungs thugs kyi gsang ba'i yang dngos gzhir gyur pas 'di'i rang bzhin gyi don rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa 'khor gyi de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis kyang rtogs par mi spyod de /

translated: The nature of that is not realized by the retinue of all the tathāgatas, such as Vairocana, and so on.

original: gsang ba de dag pas kyang che sa gsang bar gyur pa'i phyir na gsangs chen zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gsang ba de dag pas kyang che sa gsang bar gyur pa'i phyir na gsangs chen zhes bya ste /
translated: Since those secrets are even greater than the great, they are called “great secret.”

original: ye shes phun sum tshogs pa las grub pa'i lha /
analyzed: ye shes phun sum tshogs pa las grub pa'i lha /
translated: The deity is accomplished from the perfection of pristine consciousness.

original: rig pa'i @85a * //
analyzed: rig pa'i @85a * //
translated: The deity of vidyā

original: lha mo dang ldan pa las rigs thams cad skye zhing 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: lha mo dang ldan pa las rigs thams cad skye zhing 'byung ba'o //
translated: is endowed with the vidyā devī, from whom all the buddha families are born and arise.

original: zhus tshig dgu pa /
analyzed: zhus tshig dgu pa /
translated: The ninth reply:

original: dam pa rnam pa du zhig mchis //
analyzed: dam pa rnam pa du zhig mchis //
translated: “How many kinds of sublime ones are there?”

original: zhes bya ba'i lan du /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i lan du /
translated: The reply:

original: dam pa zhes bya rigs brgya'o //
analyzed: dam pa zhes bya rigs brgya'o //
translated: “The so-called sublime ones are the one hundred families.”

original: zhes bya ste 'jig rten pa'i rigs dang / phyi ma yan chad kyi rigs las dpags shing dam par gyur pas rigs khyad par can zhes bya /
analyzed: zhes bya ste 'jig rten pa'i rigs dang / phyi ma yan chad kyi rigs las dpags shing dam par gyur pas rigs khyad par can zhes bya /
translated: Since the mundane families and the families of the future are classified as sublime, they are called “special families.”

original: dngos rigs lnga las rigs brgyar 'phros pa rnams la bya'o //
analyzed: dngos rigs lnga las rigs brgyar 'phros pa rnams la bya'o //
translated: They are the emanations of the five classes of entities into one hundred families.

original: zhus tshig bcu pa /
analyzed: zhus tshig bcu pa /
translated: The tenth reply:

original: byang chub sems ni ji ltar lags //
analyzed: byang chub sems ni ji ltar lags //
translated: “What is the bodhicitta?”

original: zhes pa'i lan du /
analyzed: zhes pa'i lan du /
translated: The reply:

original: skye 'gag med pa zhi ba yi //
analyzed: skye 'gag med pa zhi ba yi //
translated: “The nonarising, unceasing, peaceful

original: dngos po dngos med mi zad gtso //
analyzed: dngos po dngos med mi zad gtso //
translated: primal matter of nonexhaustible nonentity

original: stong nyid snying rje tha dad min //
analyzed: stong nyid snying rje tha dad min //
translated: is not different from emptiness and compassion.

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bshad do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bshad do //
translated: This is explained as the bodhisattva.

original: zhes bya ba ste gdod ma nas ma skyes pas tha mar 'gag pa med pa /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste gdod ma nas ma skyes pas tha mar 'gag pa med pa /
translated: Since it is primordially unborn, it does not cease in the end.

original: rang bzhin gyis spros pa nye bar zhi ba /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis spros pa nye bar zhi ba /
translated: It is by nature the pacification of elaborations.

original: skye ba med pas rtag par lta ba'i dngos po ma grub /
analyzed: skye ba med pas rtag par lta ba'i dngos po ma grub /
translated: Since it is unborn, the entity of the view of permanence is not established.

original: 'gag pa med pas chad par lta ba'i dngos po med pa ma grub ste /
analyzed: 'gag pa med pas chad par lta ba'i dngos po med pa ma grub ste /
translated: Since it is unceasing, the entity of the view of annihilation is not established.

original: chos nyid stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo rtag chad dang skye 'gag gi mthar thug pa'i zad pa med pa sangs rgyas 'jig rten du byung yang rung ma byung yang rung /
analyzed: chos nyid stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo rtag chad dang skye 'gag gi mthar thug pa'i zad pa med pa sangs rgyas 'jig rten du byung yang rung ma byung yang rung /
translated: The essence of the emptiness of dharmatā is not exhausted in the extremes of permanence and annihilation, arising and ceasing. Whether a buddha appears in the world or not,

analyzed: rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i ngo bor gnas pas chos thams cad kyi bdag nyid dam gtso bor gyur pa'o //
translated: it exists as the essence of natural purity. Therefore, it is the nature or principal of all phenomena.

original: de lta bu de yang stong pa byang chub chad pa thugs rje chen po'i rlan dang bral ba ma yin pas na /
analyzed: de lta bu de yang stong pa byang chub chad pa thugs rje chen po'i rlan dang bral ba ma yin pas na /
translated: That suchness is not empty of the moisture of great compassion.

original: stong nyid snying rje tha dad min //
analyzed: stong nyid snying rje tha dad min //
translated: Emptiness and compassion are not separate.

original: zhes bya ste stong pa'i chos nyid de la rang bzhin gyis mi dmigs pa'i thugs rje chen po'i shugs dang ldan pas chos nyid stong pa nyid kyis gar khyab par mi dmigs pa'i thugs rjes khyab la /
analyzed: zhes bya ste stong pa'i chos nyid de la rang bzhin gyis mi dmigs pa'i thugs rje chen po'i shugs dang ldan pas chos nyid stong pa nyid kyis gar khyab par mi dmigs pa'i thugs rjes khyab la /
translated: Wherever emptiness pervades, compassion pervades.

original: thugs rje de nyid kyang stong pa nyid kyi bdag nyid du gnas pas /
analyzed: thugs rje de nyid kyang stong pa nyid kyi bdag nyid du gnas pas /
translated: And that compassion itself abides in the nature of emptiness.🔽Emptiness and compassion are not separate, but abide as a unity.

original: stong pa nyid dang snying rje so som yin tha mi dad par gnas pa de la byang chub sems dpa' zhes bshad ces bya ste /🔽byang chub sems su bshad pa yang de yin la dpa' bar bshad pa yang de yin te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang snying rje so som yin tha mi dad par gnas pa de la byang chub sems dpa' zhes bshad ces bya ste / byang chub sems su bshad pa yang de yin la dpa' bar bshad pa yang de yin te /
translated: This is what is called “the bodhisattva.”

original: de ltar yang mngon par byang chub pa'i rgyud las //
analyzed: de ltar yang mngon par byang chub pa'i rgyud las //
translated: The Tantra of Actual Enlightenment says:

original: byang chub nam mkha'i mtshan nyid de //
analyzed: byang chub nam mkha'i mtshan nyid de //
translated: Enlightenment has the character of space.

original: rtog pa thams cad spangs pa yin //
analyzed: rtog pa thams cad spangs pa yin //
translated: It is free from all conceptual thoughts.

original: gang zhig don de thob 'dod pa //
analyzed: gang zhig don de thob 'dod pa //
translated: Those who wish to attain that

original: sems dpa' zhes ni de phyir bya //
analyzed: sems dpa' zhes ni de phyir bya //
translated: Are therefore called “heroes of enlightenment.”

original: zhes gsungs te stong @85b pa nyid ni don dam pa byang chub sems de thob par 'dod pa ni mi dmigs pa'i snying rje chen pos 'gro ba'i don mi gtong ba ste /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te stong @85b pa nyid ni don dam pa byang chub sems de thob par 'dod pa ni mi dmigs pa'i snying rje chen pos 'gro ba'i don mi gtong ba ste /
translated: Emptiness is the ultimate awakening mind.

original: kun rdzob byang chub kyi sems te dpa' ba yang de nyid do //
analyzed: kun rdzob byang chub kyi sems te dpa' ba yang de nyid do //
translated: The desire to attain it is the relative awakening mind.

original: da ni zhus tshig bcu gcig pa //
analyzed: da ni zhus tshig bcu gcig pa //
translated: Now, the eleventh topic of the request:

original: de bzhin rig pa'i skyes bu ci //
analyzed: de bzhin rig pa'i skyes bu ci //
translated: What is the person of awareness?

original: zhes bya ba'i lan du ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i lan du ;
translated: The reply:

original: rang gi lus ngag yid rdo rje la mi phyed pa'i ngo bo ste /
analyzed: rang gi lus ngag yid rdo rje la mi phyed pa'i ngo bo ste /
translated: The vajra of one’s body, speech, and mind is indivisible in essence.

original: rig par bcas par ldan pa ni //
analyzed: rig par bcas par ldan pa ni //
translated: Endowed with awareness,

analyzed: rig pa'i skyes bu zhes su bshad // ces bya ba ste rnal 'byor pa'i lus ngag yid gsum de bzhin gshegs pa'am //
translated: This is explained as the person of awareness.

original: rang gi yi dam gyi lha sku gsung thugs rdo rje rnam pa gsum gyi ngag du dbyer mi phyed pa'i ngo bor gnas pa ste /
analyzed: rang gi yi dam gyi lha sku gsung thugs rdo rje rnam pa gsum gyi ngag du dbyer mi phyed pa'i ngo bor gnas pa ste /
translated: The body, speech, and mind of the yogin are the thus-gone ones or the body, speech, and mind of one’s chosen deity, indivisible in essence from the three vajras.

original: de dang rig par bcas bya ba //
analyzed: de dang rig par bcas bya ba //
translated: This is endowed with awareness.

original: rang gi yum rig pa'i lha mo shes rab ma dang bcas par gnas shing gnyis su med pa'i rol pa'i bde ba dang ldan pa la rig pa'i skyes bu zhes su bshad ces bya ste /
analyzed: rang gi yum rig pa'i lha mo shes rab ma dang bcas par gnas shing gnyis su med pa'i rol pa'i bde ba dang ldan pa la rig pa'i skyes bu zhes su bshad ces bya ste /
translated: He abides with his consort, the goddess of awareness, Prajna, and he possesses the bliss of nondual play. He is called the “being of awareness.”

original: rig pa ni shes rab ma ste /
analyzed: rig pa ni shes rab ma ste /
translated: Awareness is Prajna, the goddess.

original: lha mo de'i skyes bur gyur pas na rig pa'i skyes bu zhes bya bar bshad de /
analyzed: lha mo de'i skyes bur gyur pas na rig pa'i skyes bu zhes bya bar bshad de /
translated: Since he is the being of that goddess, he is called the “being of awareness.”

original: lha la sbyar na rigs lnga so so rang rang gi yum dang ldan pa /
analyzed: lha la sbyar na rigs lnga so so rang rang gi yum dang ldan pa /
translated: If applied to the deities, it means that each of the five families is endowed with their own individual consorts.

original: rnal 'byor pa la sbyar na de dag gi rjes su sgrub pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa rigs kyi yum dad ldan par gnas pa la bya'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa la sbyar na de dag gi rjes su sgrub pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa rigs kyi yum dad ldan par gnas pa la bya'o //
translated: If applied to the yogi, it means that the yogi who abides in the samadhi of accomplishment that follows them is endowed with the consort of the family.

original: zhus tshig bcu gnyis pa /
analyzed: zhus tshig bcu gnyis pa /
translated: The twelfth reply to a question

original: de la rdo rje 'dzin pa ci //
analyzed: de la rdo rje 'dzin pa ci //
translated: What is the vajra holder in that?

original: zhes pa'i lan ni /
analyzed: zhes pa'i lan ni /
translated: The reply:

original: rgyud lnga dag gi sems dag ni //
analyzed: rgyud lnga dag gi sems dag ni //
translated: The pure minds of the five lineages

original: rdo rje zhes su bstan pa yin //
analyzed: rdo rje zhes su bstan pa yin //
translated: Are taught to be the vajra.

original: gzung zhes bya ba 'dzin par bshad //
analyzed: gzung zhes bya ba 'dzin par bshad //
translated: What is called “grasping” is explained as “holding.”

original: rnam shes rdo rje 'dzin par 'das //
analyzed: rnam shes rdo rje 'dzin par 'das //
translated: Vajra holder is consciousness.

original: zhes bya ste lam rgyud lngas bsdus pa'i sems can rnams kyi sems rang bzhin gyis ma skyes par rtogs nas gzung 'dzin gyi dri ma'i bag chags rnam par dag pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ste lam rgyud lngas bsdus pa'i sems can rnams kyi sems rang bzhin gyis ma skyes par rtogs nas gzung 'dzin gyi dri ma'i bag chags rnam par dag pa ni /
translated: Thus, having realized that the minds of sentient beings included in the five paths and the five lineages are essentially unarisen, the habitual tendencies of the stains of percepts and perceivers are totally purified.

original: rdo rje zhes su bstan pa yin //
analyzed: rdo rje zhes su bstan pa yin //
translated: That is taught to be the vajra.

original: zhes te ye shes rdo rje lta bu de yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: zhes te ye shes rdo rje lta bu de yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: That is the vajra-like wisdom.

original: de'i phyir na yul chos nyid la ni gzung ba zhes bya la /
analyzed: de'i phyir na yul chos nyid la ni gzung ba zhes bya la /
translated: Therefore, the object, dharmatā, is called “the apprehended.”

original: de rtogs par byed ba'i ye shes la ni 'dzin pa zhes bya bar bshad de /🔽rnam shes rdo rje 'dzin par 'das //
analyzed: de rtogs par byed ba'i ye shes la ni 'dzin pa zhes bya bar bshad de / rnam shes rdo rje 'dzin par 'das //
translated: The wisdom that realizes that is called “the apprehender.”

original: zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ste /
translated: It is said, “Consciousness is the vajra holder.”

original: rnam par shes pa rnam par dag pa ye shes rdo rje lta bur gyur pas chos nyid kyi don 'dzin par 'das zhes sgrar brjod pa /🔽dbyings dang ye shes gnyis su med pa la ni /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa rnam par dag pa ye shes rdo rje lta bur gyur pas chos nyid kyi don 'dzin par 'das zhes sgrar brjod pa / dbyings dang ye shes gnyis su med pa la ni /
translated: Since pure consciousness becomes like a vajra wisdom, it is said to “hold” the meaning of dharmatā.🔽Nondual dhātu and wisdom

original: rnam shes @86a * //
analyzed: rnam shes @86a * //
translated: is explained as “consciousness

original: rdo rje 'dzin par 'das //🔽zhes bya bar bshad do //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin par 'das // zhes bya bar bshad do //
translated: is the vajra holder.”

original: la la na re /
analyzed: la la na re /
translated: Some say:

original: gzung zhes bya ba 'dzin par 'das //
analyzed: gzung zhes bya ba 'dzin par 'das //
translated: “The apprehended is the vajra holder.”

original: zhes bya ba phyi gzung ba'i yul zhes bya ba ni gud na yod ba ma yin te /🔽'dzin pa'i sems nyid yul yod par rtog pa'i bag chags yul du snang ba yin te ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba phyi gzung ba'i yul zhes bya ba ni gud na yod ba ma yin te / 'dzin pa'i sems nyid yul yod par rtog pa'i bag chags yul du snang ba yin te ;
translated: The so-called external apprehended objects do not exist separately.🔽The mind that apprehends them is the habitual tendency of the thought of the existence of objects appearing as objects.

original: dngos su 'dzin pa'i sems nyid yul gyi rnam par snang ba yin no //
analyzed: dngos su 'dzin pa'i sems nyid yul gyi rnam par snang ba yin no //
translated: The mind that actually apprehends them appears in the aspect of objects.

original: da la rang bzhin med pa ni chos kyi dbyings /
analyzed: da la rang bzhin med pa ni chos kyi dbyings /
translated: The absence of inherent nature is the dharmadhatu.🔽The mind that is not established as an entity is called the wisdom of vidya.

original: sems dngos por ma grub pa ni rig pa'i ye shes zhes bya ba de lta bu'i don 'dzin cing yang nas yang du goms par byed pa la ni 'das zhes bya /
analyzed: sems dngos por ma grub pa ni rig pa'i ye shes zhes bya ba de lta bu'i don 'dzin cing yang nas yang du goms par byed pa la ni 'das zhes bya /
translated: The one who apprehends such a meaning and accustoms himself to it again and again is called a yogi.

original: la la na re don dam par rang bzhin med pas yod par sgro 'dogs pa'i mtha' bsal /
analyzed: la la na re don dam par rang bzhin med pas yod par sgro 'dogs pa'i mtha' bsal /
translated: Some say that because there is no inherent nature in the ultimate, the extreme of the superimposition of existence is eliminated.

original: yang dag pa'i kun rdzob tu sku gsung thugs mtshan ma med pa'i rnam par gsal bas med par skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' bsal /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i kun rdzob tu sku gsung thugs mtshan ma med pa'i rnam par gsal bas med par skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' bsal /
translated: Because the kayas, the pure relative, manifest in the aspect of signless body, speech, and mind, the extreme of the deprecation of nonexistence is eliminated.

original: de ltar gsal ba nyid rang gi ngo bos stong ste /
analyzed: de ltar gsal ba nyid rang gi ngo bos stong ste /
translated: As such, clarity itself is empty of its own essence.

original: mtshan ma med pa'i ngang las ma g-yos /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i ngang las ma g-yos /
translated: It does not move from the state of signlessness.

original: mtshan ma dang mtshan ma med pa gnyis su med pas dbu ma tsam du yang mi gnas pas 'das zhes bya /
analyzed: mtshan ma dang mtshan ma med pa gnyis su med pas dbu ma tsam du yang mi gnas pas 'das zhes bya /
translated: Since it is neither with nor without signs, it does not even abide as a mere middle.

original: zhus tshig bcu gsum pa /
analyzed: zhus tshig bcu gsum pa /
translated: The thirteenth line of the root tantra states:

original: dzi na dzik ni ji ltar lags //
analyzed: dzi na dzik ni ji ltar lags //
translated: What is jinajik?

original: zhes bya ba'i lan du /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i lan du /
translated: The reply is:

original: yod med dbus las 'das pas na //
analyzed: yod med dbus las 'das pas na //
translated: Since it transcends the middle between existence and nonexistence,

original: 'byung dang 'byung las gyur ba 'byung //
analyzed: 'byung dang 'byung las gyur ba 'byung //
translated: it arises from the elements and the elements that arise from it.

original: sems can thams cad kun gyi gzugs //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kun gyi gzugs //
translated: The form of all sentient beings

original: skyes pas rgyal ba dzi na dzik //🔽ces gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: skyes pas rgyal ba dzi na dzik // ces gsungs pa ste /
translated: is the victor, jinajik.

original: don dam par rang bzhin med pa ni nam mkha'i dbyings lta bu /
analyzed: don dam par rang bzhin med pa ni nam mkha'i dbyings lta bu /
translated: The ultimate absence of inherent nature is like the realm of space.

original: so so'i skye bos dngos po dang mtshan mar yod pa lta ba dang / mu stegs kha cig bdag rtag pa ther zug tu lta ba dang / nyan thos rdul phrar ba rdzas su yod pa dang / sems tsam de sems zhes pa skad cig ma don dam par yod par lta ba'i mtha' bsal te /
analyzed: so so'i skye bos dngos po dang mtshan mar yod pa lta ba dang / mu stegs kha cig bdag rtag pa ther zug tu lta ba dang / nyan thos rdul phrar ba rdzas su yod pa dang / sems tsam de sems zhes pa skad cig ma don dam par yod par lta ba'i mtha' bsal te /
translated: The view of ordinary beings is that things exist as entities and signs, some tīrthikas view the self as permanent and enduring, śrāvakas view subtle particles as substantially existent, and Cittamātra views mind as ultimately existent.

original: yod pa yang ma yin yang dag pa'i kun rdzob tu sku gsung thugs phyag rgya'i dkyil 'khor mtshan ma'i rnam par gsal bas so so'i skye bo mtha' chad par lta ba dang / mu stegs chad par lta bas las dang 'bras bu dang / 'jig rten 'di dang pha rol med par lta ba'i mtha' bsal te med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: yod pa yang ma yin yang dag pa'i kun rdzob tu sku gsung thugs phyag rgya'i dkyil 'khor mtshan ma'i rnam par gsal bas so so'i skye bo mtha' chad par lta ba dang / mu stegs chad par lta bas las dang 'bras bu dang / 'jig rten 'di dang pha rol med par lta ba'i mtha' bsal te med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not nonexistent because the extreme of the tīrthika view of annihilation is eliminated—that is, the view that karma and its result and this world and the next do not exist.

original: de ltar @86b gsal ba tsam na de nyid rang gi ngo bos stong ste /
analyzed: de ltar @86b gsal ba tsam na de nyid rang gi ngo bos stong ste /
translated: As such, when there is mere manifestation, that itself is empty by nature.

original: mtshan ma med pa'i ngang las ma g-yos //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i ngang las ma g-yos //
translated: It does not move from the state of signlessness.

original: mtshan ma dang mtshan ma med pa gnyis su med pas yod med gnyis kyi dbus tsam du yang mi gnas pas na /
analyzed: mtshan ma dang mtshan ma med pa gnyis su med pas yod med gnyis kyi dbus tsam du yang mi gnas pas na /
translated: Since sign and signlessness are nondual, it does not abide in the middle, which is a mere nonexistence.

original: yod med dbus las 'das zhes bya //
analyzed: yod med dbus las 'das zhes bya //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “beyond existence, nonexistence, and the middle.”

original: don dam par de lta bu'i ngo bor gnas su zin kyang yang dag pa'i kun rdzob tu gang gi ngo bor yang mi gnas pa'i ngang las /
analyzed: don dam par de lta bu'i ngo bor gnas su zin kyang yang dag pa'i kun rdzob tu gang gi ngo bor yang mi gnas pa'i ngang las /
translated: Although ultimately it abides in such a nature, in the correct relative, it does not abide in any nature.

original: 'byung dang 'byung las gyur pa 'byung //
analyzed: 'byung dang 'byung las gyur pa 'byung //
translated: From that state, the elements and the derivative elements arise.

original: zhes bya ste rgyur byas pa'i 'byung ba bzhi 'byung bas na 'byung zhes bya /
analyzed: zhes bya ste rgyur byas pa'i 'byung ba bzhi 'byung bas na 'byung zhes bya /
translated: Since the four primary elements are the cause, they are called the elements.

original: 'byung ba de las gyur pa ni 'bras bu'i gzugs bcu gcig 'byung par gyur pas 'byung zhes bya /
analyzed: 'byung ba de las gyur pa ni 'bras bu'i gzugs bcu gcig 'byung par gyur pas 'byung zhes bya /
translated: Since the eleven resultant forms arise from those elements, they are called the elements.

original: sems can thams cad ma lus pa'i kun gyi gzugs su grub pa yin la /
analyzed: sems can thams cad ma lus pa'i kun gyi gzugs su grub pa yin la /
translated: They are the form that is established as the body of all sentient beings without exception.

original: de rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa don dam par chos nyid las mi g-yo la //
analyzed: de rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa don dam par chos nyid las mi g-yo la //
translated: Since they do not waver from the dharmatā ultimately, they are pure by nature.

original: kun rdzob tu gzugs kyi sku phyag rgya chen por snang ba /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu gzugs kyi sku phyag rgya chen por snang ba /
translated: The mahāmudrā of the form body appears in the relative.

original: sku dang ye shes kyi bdag nyid du 'grub pa'i phyag rgya chen po 'thon cing snang ba las skyes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sku dang ye shes kyi bdag nyid du 'grub pa'i phyag rgya chen po 'thon cing snang ba las skyes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Since the mahāmudrā that is established as the nature of the body and pristine consciousnesses arises and appears, it is called “arisen.”

original: yod med dang rtag chad du lta ba'i mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i sems can du lta ba'i ngan rtog las rgyal zhing sgro skur rnam pa gnyis dang bral ba'i don dang ldan pa'i phyir na rgyal ba dzi na dzik ces bya'o ;
analyzed: yod med dang rtag chad du lta ba'i mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i sems can du lta ba'i ngan rtog las rgyal zhing sgro skur rnam pa gnyis dang bral ba'i don dang ldan pa'i phyir na rgyal ba dzi na dzik ces bya'o ;
translated: Since it is endowed with the meaning free from the extremes of the views of existence and nonexistence, permanence and annihilation, and the bad views of the true existence of sentient beings, it is called the Victor Jinajik.

original: / zhus tshig bcu bzhi pa /
analyzed: / zhus tshig bcu bzhi pa /
translated: The fourteenth reply to a question:

original: rin chen 'dzin pa ji ltar lags //
analyzed: rin chen 'dzin pa ji ltar lags //
translated: How is it to be a holder of jewels?

original: zhes pa'i lan du //
analyzed: zhes pa'i lan du //
translated: The reply:

original: thams cad don kun 'byung bas na //
analyzed: thams cad don kun 'byung bas na //
translated: Because it is the source of all meanings,

original: rin chen sems su bstan pa yin //
analyzed: rin chen sems su bstan pa yin //
translated: It is taught to be the precious mind.

original: tshor ba yis ni nges tshor bas //
analyzed: tshor ba yis ni nges tshor bas //
translated: Because of feeling, it is certain to feel,

original: tshor ba rin chen 'dzin par gsungs //🔽zhes bya ste /
analyzed: tshor ba rin chen 'dzin par gsungs // zhes bya ste /
translated: So feeling is taught to be a holder of jewels.

original: gong ma ltar chos thams cad yod med dbu ma las 'das par rtogs pa'i sems de nyid ye shes kyi rang bzhin du gnas pa'i dus na /
analyzed: gong ma ltar chos thams cad yod med dbu ma las 'das par rtogs pa'i sems de nyid ye shes kyi rang bzhin du gnas pa'i dus na /
translated: As above, when the mind that realizes all phenomena to be beyond existence, nonexistence, and the middle abides in the nature of wisdom,

original: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa thams cad kyi dgos pa'i don ma lus par bya ba btsal mi dgos par 'byung bas na /
analyzed: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa thams cad kyi dgos pa'i don ma lus par bya ba btsal mi dgos par 'byung bas na /
translated: all the purposes of the mundane and supramundane are accomplished without having to search for them.

original: dpe rin po che dang 'dra bar thams cad la mnyam zhing snyoms pa'i sems su bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: dpe rin po che dang 'dra bar thams cad la mnyam zhing snyoms pa'i sems su bstan pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is taught to be a mind that is equal and impartial toward all, like a jewel.

original: dngos po mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes thob pa 'am mnga' ba la bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes thob pa 'am mnga' ba la bya'o //
translated: This refers to the attainment or possession of the wisdom of the equality of things.

original: tshor ba yis chi des tshor ba //
analyzed: tshor ba yis chi des tshor ba //
translated: Because of feeling, it is certain to feel.

original: zhes bya ba tshor ba ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes des rang gi don rig pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba tshor ba ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes des rang gi don rig pa ste /
translated: Feeling is the intuition of equality, which is the intuition of one's own goal.🔽The term feeling is used because it is the intuition of the equality of all things.

original: nges tshor ba zhes bya ba ni @87a * //🔽yon tan gyi rnam pa thams cad dang ldan par rtogs pa'o //🔽de ltar rtogs pa'i don dang ldan pa ni /
analyzed: nges tshor ba zhes bya ba ni @87a * // yon tan gyi rnam pa thams cad dang ldan par rtogs pa'o // de ltar rtogs pa'i don dang ldan pa ni /
translated: The intuition of equality is the intuition of the equality of all things, and it is called feeling because it is the intuition of the equality of all things.🔽The intuition of equality is the intuition of the equality of all things, and it is called feeling because it is the intuition of the equality of all things.🔽The intuition of equality is the intuition of the equality of all things, and it is called feeling because it is the intuition of the equality of all things.

original: tshor ba rin chen 'dzin par bshad //🔽ces bya ba ste /🔽'jig rten pa'i tshor ba rnam pa gsum nyams su myong ba la mi bya'i /
analyzed: tshor ba rin chen 'dzin par bshad // ces bya ba ste / 'jig rten pa'i tshor ba rnam pa gsum nyams su myong ba la mi bya'i /
translated: The intuition of equality is the intuition of the equality of all things, and it is called feeling because it is the intuition of the equality of all things.🔽The intuition of equality is the intuition of the equality of all things, and it is called feeling because it is the intuition of the equality of all things.🔽The intuition of equality is the intuition of the equality of all things, and it is called feeling because it is the intuition of the equality of all things.🔽The intuition of equality is the intuition of the equality of all things, and it is called feeling because it is the intuition of the equality of all things.

original: mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyis rin po che dang 'dra ba'i yon tan 'dzin par byed pa yin no //🔽zhus tshig bco lnga pa /🔽a'a ro li ka ni ji ltar lags //🔽zhes bya ba'i lan du /🔽'dod pa'i mtshan nyid mtshon pa dang // thams cad nas ni thams cad kun //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyis rin po che dang 'dra ba'i yon tan 'dzin par byed pa yin no // zhus tshig bco lnga pa / a'a ro li ka ni ji ltar lags // zhes bya ba'i lan du / 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid mtshon pa dang // thams cad nas ni thams cad kun //
translated: The intuition of equality is the intuition of the equality of all things, and it is called feeling because it is the intuition of the equality of all things.🔽The intuition of equality is the intuition of the equality of all things, and it is called feeling because it is the intuition of the equality of all things.

original: rtsen pa'i mtshan nyid mtshon pas na //🔽a'a ro li ka ces bya bar bshad //
analyzed: rtsen pa'i mtshan nyid mtshon pas na // a'a ro li ka ces bya bar bshad //
translated: The intuition of equality is the intuition of the equality of all things, and it is called feeling because it is the intuition of the equality of all things.🔽The intuition of equality is the intuition of the equality of all things, and it is called feeling because it is the intuition of the equality of all things.🔽The intuition of equality is the intuition of the equality of all things, and it is called feeling because it is the intuition of the equality of all things.

original: ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The intuition of equality is the intuition of the equality of all things, and it is called feeling because it is the

original: yang dag pa'i 'dod chags chen pos chos kyi dbyings la chags pa'i rtags ni chos nyid dam /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i 'dod chags chen pos chos kyi dbyings la chags pa'i rtags ni chos nyid dam /
translated: The sign of being attached to the dharmadhātu with utterly pure great desire is the dharmatā.🔽

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi gzugs brnyan yum ye shes kyi lha mo yul gcig la yang 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga tshang ba'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa la ni 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa zhes bya la /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi gzugs brnyan yum ye shes kyi lha mo yul gcig la yang 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga tshang ba'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa la ni 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa zhes bya la /
translated: The sign of being attached to the dharmadhātu with utterly pure great passion is the characteristic of the dharmatā or the reflection of the dharmadhātu, the goddess of the mother’s pristine consciousness, who possesses the characteristic of the five desirable qualities in a single object.🔽That is called “possessing the characteristic of desire.”

original: de la chags pa med pa'i tshul gyis chags pa la ni mtshon pa zhes bya /
analyzed: de la chags pa med pa'i tshul gyis chags pa la ni mtshon pa zhes bya /
translated: Being attached to that without attachment is called “the symbol.”

original: gnyis su na mtshan nyid dngos la mtshon pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gnyis su na mtshan nyid dngos la mtshon pa zhes bya ste /
translated: In another way, the actual characteristic is called “the symbol.”

original: gong ma lta bu'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i mtshan nyid mtshon nas gzhan la gsal bar byed pa'am//
analyzed: gong ma lta bu'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i mtshan nyid mtshon nas gzhan la gsal bar byed pa'am//
translated: Having symbolized the characteristic that possesses the aforementioned qualities, it is clarified for others.

original: gzhan gyis mthong bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis mthong bar byed pa'o //
translated: Or, it is seen by others.

original: de lta bu'i lha mo de la dus dang rnam pa thams cad nas thams cad kun du rtsen cing mi 'bral par byed pa'i mtshan nyid can te /
analyzed: de lta bu'i lha mo de la dus dang rnam pa thams cad nas thams cad kun du rtsen cing mi 'bral par byed pa'i mtshan nyid can te /
translated: That kind of goddess is always and in every way the characteristic of one who plays without separation.

original: don de lta bu la chags shing gzhan gyi spyod yul du gsal bar dbab par bya'i phyir mtshon cing ston par byed pas ni /
analyzed: don de lta bu la chags shing gzhan gyi spyod yul du gsal bar dbab par bya'i phyir mtshon cing ston par byed pas ni /
translated: In order to reveal that meaning to others, it is indicated and shown.

original: a'a ro li ka ces bya bar bshad //
analyzed: a'a ro li ka ces bya bar bshad //
translated: Thus, it is explained as “Ārolik.”

original: ces bya ste de lta bu'i ngang la gnas pas thugs rje chen po'i rang bzhin du 'byung bas 'gro ba'i don ji lta ba bzhin du mdzad de /
analyzed: ces bya ste de lta bu'i ngang la gnas pas thugs rje chen po'i rang bzhin du 'byung bas 'gro ba'i don ji lta ba bzhin du mdzad de /
translated: By abiding in that state, one arises as the nature of great compassion and thus acts for the welfare of beings just as it is.

original: 'jig rten pa'i 'du shes rnam pa gsum yid la byed pa lta bu ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i 'du shes rnam pa gsum yid la byed pa lta bu ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not like the attention of the three worldly perceptions.

original: so so kun du rtog pa'i ye shes kyis chos spyi'i mtshan nyid stong zhing bdag med par yang mkhyen pas ye shes chos kyi dbyings la chags la /
analyzed: so so kun du rtog pa'i ye shes kyis chos spyi'i mtshan nyid stong zhing bdag med par yang mkhyen pas ye shes chos kyi dbyings la chags la /
translated: Since the gnosis of individual knowledge knows the empty, selfless general characteristics of phenomena, it is attached to the dharmadhātu of gnosis.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid ma 'dres par mkhyen pas thugs rjes 'gro ba'i don la chags pa'ang de kho na yin no //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid ma 'dres par mkhyen pas thugs rjes 'gro ba'i don la chags pa'ang de kho na yin no //
translated: Since it knows the individual characteristics without mixing them, it is also attached to the welfare of beings with compassion.

original: zhus tshig bcu drug pa //
analyzed: zhus tshig bcu drug pa //
translated: The sixteenth reply:

original: pradzny'a dhrika kyang ji ltar lags //
analyzed: pradzny'a dhrika kyang ji ltar lags //
translated: What is Prajñādhṛk?

original: zhes bya @87b ba'i lan du /
analyzed: zhes bya @87b ba'i lan du /
translated: The reply:

original: rnam shes rab tu gsal phyed pa //
analyzed: rnam shes rab tu gsal phyed pa //
translated: The consciousness that is very clear and discerning

original: ji bzhin shes rab zhes su bshad //
analyzed: ji bzhin shes rab zhes su bshad //
translated: Is explained as wisdom that knows things as they are.

original: 'du byed sems kyi gzhi yin pas //
analyzed: 'du byed sems kyi gzhi yin pas //
translated: Since mental formations are the basis of the mind,

original: shes rab 'dzin pa zhes su bshad //
analyzed: shes rab 'dzin pa zhes su bshad //
translated: Wisdom is explained as the apprehender.🔽Consciousness has the characteristic of being able to discern all things.🔽With it, one is able to clearly distinguish all objects.

original: ces gsungs te rnam par shes pa dngos po thams cad rab tu rnam par 'byed nus pa'i mtshan nyid can gyis yul thams cad so sor gsal bar gcod nus pa des dmigs bya'i yul bcad cing rang rang gi mtshan nyid ji lta ba bzhin du gtan la 'bebs
analyzed: ces gsungs te rnam par shes pa dngos po thams cad rab tu rnam par 'byed nus pa'i mtshan nyid can gyis yul thams cad so sor gsal bar gcod nus pa des dmigs bya'i yul bcad cing rang rang gi mtshan nyid ji lta ba bzhin du gtan la 'bebs
translated: It is this that defines the observed object and determines its individual characteristics just as they are.

original: par byed pa ni shes rab ces bya ste /
analyzed: par byed pa ni shes rab ces bya ste /
translated: This is called wisdom.

original: ye shes kyi rgyur gyur pa ni shes rab bo //
analyzed: ye shes kyi rgyur gyur pa ni shes rab bo //
translated: Wisdom is the cause of gnosis.

original: la la ni rnam par shes pa nyid rab tu gsal bar byed nus pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi ye shes su rnam par dag par gyur pa des /
analyzed: la la ni rnam par shes pa nyid rab tu gsal bar byed nus pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi ye shes su rnam par dag par gyur pa des /
translated: Some say that consciousness itself, which has the characteristic of being able to produce clarity, is purified into the gnosis that knows things as they are.

original: ye ji bzhin pa'i don shes pa la shes rab zhes su bshad ces bya ste /
analyzed: ye ji bzhin pa'i don shes pa la shes rab zhes su bshad ces bya ste /
translated: This is explained as wisdom that knows things as they are.

original: 'bras bu ye shes la rgyu shes rab kyi ming nas bos pa'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu ye shes la rgyu shes rab kyi ming nas bos pa'o zhes zer ro //
translated: The result is wisdom, and the cause is called “insight.”

original: 'du byed sems kyi gzhi yin pas //🔽zhes bya ba sems las byung ba'i 'du byed kyi gzhi yin pas de la shes rab 'dzin par zhes bshad par mi gzung gi //
analyzed: 'du byed sems kyi gzhi yin pas // zhes bya ba sems las byung ba'i 'du byed kyi gzhi yin pas de la shes rab 'dzin par zhes bshad par mi gzung gi //
translated: Since formative factors are the basis of mind,🔽Since formative factors are the basis of mental events, it is explained that insight is held there.🔽However, this should not be taken to mean that the basis of mind is the formative factors, because the basis of mind is the wisdom or gnosis that is compassion, love and so forth, which is engaged in benefiting others.

original: gong ma lta bu'i shes rab bam ye shes snying rje dang byams pa la sogs pas gzhan la phan 'dogs par mdzad pa las mngon par 'du byed pa sems kyi gzhi dang bcas pa de bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes yin pas de lta bu'i thabs kyis
analyzed: gong ma lta bu'i shes rab bam ye shes snying rje dang byams pa la sogs pas gzhan la phan 'dogs par mdzad pa las mngon par 'du byed pa sems kyi gzhi dang bcas pa de bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes yin pas de lta bu'i thabs kyis
translated: Since this is the gnosis of accomplishment, it is the means by which one benefits others.

original: gzhan la phan 'dogs par mdzad kyang gzung 'dzin gyi nyes pa dang bal zhing mtshan mar mi g-yo bas /
analyzed: gzhan la phan 'dogs par mdzad kyang gzung 'dzin gyi nyes pa dang bal zhing mtshan mar mi g-yo bas /
translated: However, since one is not affected by the faults of subject and object and does not waver in the face of characteristics,

original: shes rab 'dzin pa zhes su bshad //
analyzed: shes rab 'dzin pa zhes su bshad //
translated: it is explained as “holding insight.”

original: ces bya ste mi rtog pa'i ngang las mi g-yo bas chos nyid kyi don 'dzin la /
analyzed: ces bya ste mi rtog pa'i ngang las mi g-yo bas chos nyid kyi don 'dzin la /
translated: Since one does not waver from the state of nonconceptuality, one holds the meaning of dharmatā.

original: 'gro ba'i don mi 'dor bas sems can gyi don 'dzin pa'i shes rab dang ldan pas de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i don mi 'dor bas sems can gyi don 'dzin pa'i shes rab dang ldan pas de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Because it does not abandon the welfare of beings, it is endowed with the wisdom that holds the welfare of beings.

original: zhus tshig bcu bdun pa /
analyzed: zhus tshig bcu bdun pa /
translated: The seventeenth request:

original: de bzhin rigs ni ji ltar lags //
analyzed: de bzhin rigs ni ji ltar lags //
translated: How is the family like that?

original: zhes zhus pa'i lan du /
analyzed: zhes zhus pa'i lan du /
translated: The reply:

original: rigs ni gnyis su med bstan te //
analyzed: rigs ni gnyis su med bstan te //
translated: The family is taught to be nondual,

original: gnyis med thog ma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis med thog ma zhes bya'o //
translated: nondual is called the beginning.

original: mi skye mi 'jig gang yin pa //
analyzed: mi skye mi 'jig gang yin pa //
translated: That which is unborn and unceasing

original: de ni gtso bor rab tu bshad //
analyzed: de ni gtso bor rab tu bshad //
translated: is fully explained to be the principal.

original: ces sogs gsungs te /
analyzed: ces sogs gsungs te /
translated: And so on.

original: de la rigs zhes bya ba ni gcig tu nges pa la bya bar zad kyi //
analyzed: de la rigs zhes bya ba ni gcig tu nges pa la bya bar zad kyi //
translated: Here, “family” is used for something that is definitely one.

original: gnyis dang gsum la sogs pa du mar gyur na rigs zhes bya ba'i ming du thogs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gnyis dang gsum la sogs pa du mar gyur na rigs zhes bya ba'i ming du thogs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If it were many, such as two or three, it would not be called a “family.”

original: @88a * // dper na 'jig rten na yang bram ze'i rigs gcig pur nges pas bram ze'i rigs zhes 'dogs kyang gcig pur zad kyi /
analyzed: @88a * // dper na 'jig rten na yang bram ze'i rigs gcig pur nges pas bram ze'i rigs zhes 'dogs kyang gcig pur zad kyi /
translated: For example, in the world, because the brahmin caste is definitely one, it is designated as the brahmin caste.

original: rgyal rigs la sogs pa du ma'i rigs dang mi ldan la bram ze dang / rgyal rigs zhes bya ba la sogs pa du mar 'dogs pa'ang bram ze'i rigs gcis pur mi 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal rigs la sogs pa du ma'i rigs dang mi ldan la bram ze dang / rgyal rigs zhes bya ba la sogs pa du mar 'dogs pa'ang bram ze'i rigs gcis pur mi 'grub pa'o //
translated: The brahmin caste, for example, is not endowed with many castes such as the kṣatriya caste, and the designation of many such as the kṣatriya caste is not established as the single brahmin caste.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang rdo rje'i rigs zhes bya bar nges pa gcig pu la rdo rje'i rigs zhes 'dogs par zad kyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang rdo rje'i rigs zhes bya bar nges pa gcig pu la rdo rje'i rigs zhes 'dogs par zad kyi /
translated: In the same way, here too, the vajra caste is exhausted in the single determination called vajra caste.

original: de la rin po che dang padma'i rigs la sogs pa du ma dang ldan pas gzhan du mi 'dogs la /
analyzed: de la rin po che dang padma'i rigs la sogs pa du ma dang ldan pas gzhan du mi 'dogs la /
translated: Since it is endowed with many such as the jewel caste and the lotus caste, it is not designated as other.

original: gal te du ma dang ldan du zin na ni rdo rje'i rigs su mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: gal te du ma dang ldan du zin na ni rdo rje'i rigs su mi 'grub bo //
translated: If it were endowed with many, it would not be established as the vajra caste.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rigs ni nges pa can la bya la /
analyzed: rigs ni nges pa can la bya la /
translated: A caste is a determination.

original: nges pa ni gcig tu zad pas de la 'dogs su rung gi du mar gyur na gcig tu ma nges pa yin pas rigs su mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges pa ni gcig tu zad pas de la 'dogs su rung gi du mar gyur na gcig tu ma nges pa yin pas rigs su mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since a determination is exhausted in a single thing, it is suitable to designate it as that. If it were many, it would not be determined as a single thing, and therefore it would not be established as a caste.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: rigs ni gnyis su med bstan te //🔽zhes bya ste ;
analyzed: rigs ni gnyis su med bstan te //🔽zhes bya ste ;
translated: the caste is taught as nondual.

original: rigs su 'dogs pa ni gcig tu nges pa rdo rje rigs su bya ba lta bu yin te /
analyzed: rigs su 'dogs pa ni gcig tu nges pa rdo rje rigs su bya ba lta bu yin te /
translated: Ascertaining the family is like ascertaining the vajra family as one of the families.

original: rdo rje dang rin po che'i rigs gnyis ka gang yin zhes byar mi btub pas na /
analyzed: rdo rje dang rin po che'i rigs gnyis ka gang yin zhes byar mi btub pas na /
translated: It is not possible to say that it is both the vajra and jewel families.

original: gnyis su med pa bstan te zhes bya'o //🔽de ltar gnyis su med pa bstan pa gang yin pa de ni tha snyad du rigs zhes bya bar thogs pa'i bzhi 'am ngo bo yin pas thog ma zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa bstan te zhes bya'o // de ltar gnyis su med pa bstan pa gang yin pa de ni tha snyad du rigs zhes bya bar thogs pa'i bzhi 'am ngo bo yin pas thog ma zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, it is said that nonduality is taught.

original: rigs su thogs ba'i dang po'i mu yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rigs su thogs ba'i dang po'i mu yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: That nonduality that is taught is the first limit of the designation of family because it is the first limit of the designation of family, which is the nature of the four extremes of the designation of family.

original: 'o na rigs ni nyon mongs pa lnga las re re gnas su dag par rtogs pa las rigs su gyur pa yin na /
analyzed: 'o na rigs ni nyon mongs pa lnga las re re gnas su dag par rtogs pa las rigs su gyur pa yin na /
translated: If the family is the realization of the purification of each of the five afflictions in their own place, from what is the family?

original: 'dir gang la bya zhe na /🔽mi skye mi 'jig gang yin pa //
analyzed: 'dir gang la bya zhe na / mi skye mi 'jig gang yin pa //
translated: What is it that is referred to here?

original: zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ste /
translated: It is said, “That which does not arise and does not perish.”

original: nyon mongs pa rnam pa lnga mtshan nyid so sor phye nas tha mi dad par rtogs pa'i de dag gcig tu 'dus nas dbyer med par gyur pa de gnyen po med pas ni mi skye /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnam pa lnga mtshan nyid so sor phye nas tha mi dad par rtogs pa'i de dag gcig tu 'dus nas dbyer med par gyur pa de gnyen po med pas ni mi skye /
translated: Having distinguished the characteristics of the five afflictions individually, they are realized to be undifferentiated, and they are gathered into one, becoming inseparable. Since they do not arise without an antidote,

original: gnyen po bsten pas mi 'jig rang gi rang bzhin gyis mnyam par gnas su dag par rtogs pa mngon du gyur pa gang yin pa de ni gtso bor rab tu bshad ces bya ste /
analyzed: gnyen po bsten pas mi 'jig rang gi rang bzhin gyis mnyam par gnas su dag par rtogs pa mngon du gyur pa gang yin pa de ni gtso bor rab tu bshad ces bya ste /
translated: they are not destroyed by relying on an antidote. The realization that they abide in their own nature as pure equality is actualized. That is called the principal explanation.

original: rigs dang ye shes thams cad 'dus pa'i ngo bo bas lha thams cad kyi bdag po'ang yin la gtso bor gyur pa'ang yin no //
analyzed: rigs dang ye shes thams cad 'dus pa'i ngo bo bas lha thams cad kyi bdag po'ang yin la gtso bor gyur pa'ang yin no //
translated: Since the nature of the essence of all the families and all pristine consciousnesses is gathered, it is also the lord of all deities and the principal one.

original: dngos su na rdo rje 'dzin chen po la bya'o //🔽rigs phyi ma rnams ni rigs kyi ngo bo nyon @88b mongs pa re re nas gnas su gyur pa las ni rigs su grub la /
analyzed: dngos su na rdo rje 'dzin chen po la bya'o // rigs phyi ma rnams ni rigs kyi ngo bo nyon @88b mongs pa re re nas gnas su gyur pa las ni rigs su grub la /
translated: In actuality, it is the Great Vajradhara.🔽The latter families are established as families from the individual afflictions that are the nature of the families.

original: phung po re re gnas su dag pa las ni skur grub /
analyzed: phung po re re gnas su dag pa las ni skur grub /
translated: They are established as kāyas from the individual pure aggregates.

original: rnam par shes pa re re gnas su dag pa las ni ye shes su grub pas rigs lnga sku lnga ye shes lnga dang ldan pa'i rgyal ba rigs lnga yin par bshad pa las so sor spyan drang ba'i sngags dang / ye shes kyi don dang /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa re re gnas su dag pa las ni ye shes su grub pas rigs lnga sku lnga ye shes lnga dang ldan pa'i rgyal ba rigs lnga yin par bshad pa las so sor spyan drang ba'i sngags dang / ye shes kyi don dang /
translated: The mantras for individually invoking them, the meaning of pristine consciousness,

original: de bzhi la ni phrin las kyang sngar bshad nas /
analyzed: de bzhi la ni phrin las kyang sngar bshad nas /
translated: and the activities of those four have already been explained.

original: da ni mar ni rigs kyi ngo bo dang / sku'i ngo bo gang yin pa'i mtshan nyid rim par bstan te /
analyzed: da ni mar ni rigs kyi ngo bo dang / sku'i ngo bo gang yin pa'i mtshan nyid rim par bstan te /
translated: Now, the essence of the family and the characteristic of the essence of the kāya will be explained in order.

original: de la zhu ba'i dus su ni zhus tshig bco brgyad pa dang por /
analyzed: de la zhu ba'i dus su ni zhus tshig bco brgyad pa dang por /
translated: In the section on the time of melting, the first of the eighteen lines of inquiry

original: gti mug ces bgyi ji ltar lags ;
analyzed: gti mug ces bgyi ji ltar lags ;
translated: is “What is called ‘ignorance’?

original: / zhes zhus nas /
analyzed: / zhes zhus nas /
translated: Having made this request,🔽🔽

original: bcu dgu pa zhe sdang ji ltar lags zhes zhus pa las //
analyzed: bcu dgu pa zhe sdang ji ltar lags zhes zhus pa las //
translated: After that, the nineteenth line of inquiry is “What is called ‘aversion’?”

original: lan ni gnas skabs su ni zhus tshig bcu dgu par /
analyzed: lan ni gnas skabs su ni zhus tshig bcu dgu par /
translated: In the reply, the nineteenth line of inquiry

original: zhe sdang zhes bgyi ji ltar lags //
analyzed: zhe sdang zhes bgyi ji ltar lags //
translated: is “What is called ‘aversion’?”

original: zhes bya ba lan dang por bshad de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba lan dang por bshad de /
translated: The first reply is given.

original: de la rnam shes zhe sdang zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de la rnam shes zhe sdang zhes bstan to //
translated: In that, consciousness is taught to be aversion.

original: rgyu zhes bya ba gnyis su grags //🔽zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rgyu zhes bya ba gnyis su grags // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The cause is known as twofold.

original: rnam shes zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i phung po ste tshogs brgyad la bya'o //
analyzed: rnam shes zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i phung po ste tshogs brgyad la bya'o //
translated: The so-called consciousness aggregate is the aggregate of consciousness, which is to be understood as the eight collections.

original: zhe sdang zhes bya ba ni sems las byung ba'i phyin ci log gi zhe sdang mnar sems pa dgu dang ldan pas gzhan 'joms shing 'jig par byed pa'i mtshan nyid can la bya'o//
analyzed: zhe sdang zhes bya ba ni sems las byung ba'i phyin ci log gi zhe sdang mnar sems pa dgu dang ldan pas gzhan 'joms shing 'jig par byed pa'i mtshan nyid can la bya'o//
translated: The so-called hatred is the mental factor of the distorted hatred, which is characterized by the nine states of malice that destroy and annihilate others.

original: de la ; rgyu zhes bya ba gnyis su grags //
analyzed: de la ; rgyu zhes bya ba gnyis su grags //
translated: The cause is known as twofold.

original: zhes bya ba ni rgyu rnam par shes pa'i phung po gnas su dag pa las ni 'bras bu rdo rje rigs kyi skur grub pa yin la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rgyu rnam par shes pa'i phung po gnas su dag pa las ni 'bras bu rdo rje rigs kyi skur grub pa yin la /
translated: The cause, the aggregate of consciousness, when purified in its own place, is the result, the accomplishment of the vajra family’s body.

original: rgyu phyin ci log gi zhe sdang gnas su dag pa'i 'bras bu yang dag pa'i zhe sdang chen por gyur pa ni rdo rje'i rigs zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rgyu phyin ci log gi zhe sdang gnas su dag pa'i 'bras bu yang dag pa'i zhe sdang chen por gyur pa ni rdo rje'i rigs zhes bya ste /
translated: The result of the purification of the cause, distorted hatred, is the transformation into the great, authentic hatred, which is called the vajra family.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: zag pa can gyi phung po zag pa med par gyur pa ni //
analyzed: zag pa can gyi phung po zag pa med par gyur pa ni //
translated: The defiled aggregates become undefiled.

original: rdo rje'i rigs kyi sku'i ngo bor grub pa yin la /
analyzed: rdo rje'i rigs kyi sku'i ngo bor grub pa yin la /
translated: It is the essence of the vajra family's enlightened body.

original: sems can gyi dus na phyin ci log gi zhe sdang gis gzhan 'joms shing 'jig par byed pa bzhin du /
analyzed: sems can gyi dus na phyin ci log gi zhe sdang gis gzhan 'joms shing 'jig par byed pa bzhin du /
translated: When one is an ordinary being, one's anger is distorted, and one destroys and harms others.

original: de gnas su dag pa rdo rje'i rigs su gyur pa'i dus na yang gzung 'dzin la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang nyes pa thams cad phar ni 'joms shing 'jig la /
analyzed: de gnas su dag pa rdo rje'i rigs su gyur pa'i dus na yang gzung 'dzin la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang nyes pa thams cad phar ni 'joms shing 'jig la /
translated: When that is purified in its own place, and one becomes a member of the vajra family, one destroys and eliminates all concepts and faults, such as dualistic perception.

original: tshur ni gang gis kyang mi tshugs te //
analyzed: tshur ni gang gis kyang mi tshugs te //
translated: And nothing can harm one in return.

original: rdo rje lta bur sra zhing brtan pa dang / 'dus ma byas pa dang dbyer med pa'i don dang ldan pa'i phyir na rdo rje'i rigs zhes bya ste /🔽de las byung zhing skyes @89a * //
