analyzed: rdo rje lta bur sra zhing brtan pa dang / 'dus ma byas pa dang dbyer med pa'i don dang ldan pa'i phyir na rdo rje'i rigs zhes bya ste / de las byung zhing skyes @89a * //
translated: Because it has the meaning of being as solid and stable as a vajra, and of being uncompounded and indivisible, it is called the vajra family.

original: pa thams cad rdo rje'i rigs so //
analyzed: pa thams cad rdo rje'i rigs so //
translated: Everything that arises from it is the vajra family.

original: de bas na rgyu zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i phung po dang nyon mongs pa'i zhe sdang gnyis su grags la /
analyzed: de bas na rgyu zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i phung po dang nyon mongs pa'i zhe sdang gnyis su grags la /
translated: Therefore, the cause is known as the aggregate of consciousness and the affliction of anger.

original: de gnas su dag pa'i 'bras bu ni sku dang rigs gnyis su grags zhes 'bras bu'i ming du ma smos kyang zlas drangs pas mngon no //
analyzed: de gnas su dag pa'i 'bras bu ni sku dang rigs gnyis su grags zhes 'bras bu'i ming du ma smos kyang zlas drangs pas mngon no //
translated: The result of its purification is the two bodies and the two buddha families.

original: zhus tshig bco brgyad pa /
analyzed: zhus tshig bco brgyad pa /
translated: The eighteen questions

original: gti mug ces bgyi ji ltar lags //
analyzed: gti mug ces bgyi ji ltar lags //
translated: What is called “ignorance”?

original: zhes pa'i lan du /
analyzed: zhes pa'i lan du /
translated: The reply to that is:

original: gzugs ni gti mug tu bstan pa //🔽glen pas bcings pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: gzugs ni gti mug tu bstan pa // glen pas bcings pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: Form is taught as ignorance.

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: It is the nature of the bondage of fools.🔽Form refers to the aggregate of form, which is the fifteen with form.

original: gzugs ni gzugs kyi phung po gzugs can bco lnga la bya la de yang bems po shes pa med pas gti mug gi rang bzhin du bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: gzugs ni gzugs kyi phung po gzugs can bco lnga la bya la de yang bems po shes pa med pas gti mug gi rang bzhin du bstan pa yin la /
translated: Since that is an insentient, unconscious matter, it is taught to be the nature of ignorance.

original: de gnas su dag pa'i 'bras bu ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs kyi sku dngos su snang ba'i ngo bor grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de gnas su dag pa'i 'bras bu ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs kyi sku dngos su snang ba'i ngo bor grub pa yin no //
translated: The result of its purification is the accomplishment of the nature of the apparent body of the buddha family.

original: glen pas bcings pa'i ngo bo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: glen pas bcings pa'i ngo bo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The nature of the bondage of fools refers to

original: nyon mongs pa'i gti mug la bya ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i gti mug la bya ste /
translated: afflictive ignorance.

original: de ni mig gi sgo gsum glen pas bcings nas rmongs pa dang 'dra bar phyin ci log gi gti mug gis yang dag pa'i don mthong ba la sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: de ni mig gi sgo gsum glen pas bcings nas rmongs pa dang 'dra bar phyin ci log gi gti mug gis yang dag pa'i don mthong ba la sgrib pa'o //
translated: It is like a blind man who is bound by the three doors of the eyes and is deluded. In the same way, the error of delusion obscures the seeing of the truth.

original: de gnas su dag pa'i 'bras bu ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs zhes bya ba'i ngo bor grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de gnas su dag pa'i 'bras bu ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs zhes bya ba'i ngo bor grub pa yin no //
translated: The result of its purification in its own place is the accomplishment of the essence called the Tathagata family.

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyi bdag nyid du rtogs nas spros pa med pa'i ngang du rmongs te gang du yang mi rtogs par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyi bdag nyid du rtogs nas spros pa med pa'i ngang du rmongs te gang du yang mi rtogs par gnas pa yin no //
translated: Having realized that all phenomena are of the nature of emptiness, one is deluded in the state of non-elaboration and abides without any realization whatsoever.

original: zhus tshig nyi shu pa /
analyzed: zhus tshig nyi shu pa /
translated: The twenty-first question:

original: nga rgyal zhes bgyi ji ltar lags //
analyzed: nga rgyal zhes bgyi ji ltar lags //
translated: What is called pride?

original: zhes pa'i lan du /🔽tshor ba 'dod pas myos bstan pa //🔽nga rgyal gyi ni ngo bo'o //
analyzed: zhes pa'i lan du / tshor ba 'dod pas myos bstan pa // nga rgyal gyi ni ngo bo'o //
translated: The reply:

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: The nature of pride is taught to be the intoxication of craving for sensation.

original: tshor ba ni mig gi 'dus te reg pa la sogs pa bco brgyad bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang btang snyoms gsum gyis bsdus pa'i tshor ba'i phung po ni bde ba nyams su myong bar 'dod pas chags shing de'i ros myos par phongs shing gtong mi phod
analyzed: tshor ba ni mig gi 'dus te reg pa la sogs pa bco brgyad bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang btang snyoms gsum gyis bsdus pa'i tshor ba'i phung po ni bde ba nyams su myong bar 'dod pas chags shing de'i ros myos par phongs shing gtong mi phod
translated: Since feeling is the desire to experience pleasure, it is attachment and the🔽intoxication of its taste. The essence of pride is the desire to be separated

original: pa'i nga rgyal dang / tshor ba'i sdug bsngal phrad nas bral bar 'dod nas nga rgyal gyi ngo bo yin la /
analyzed: pa'i nga rgyal dang / tshor ba'i sdug bsngal phrad nas bral bar 'dod nas nga rgyal gyi ngo bo yin la /
translated: from the suffering of feeling, and not to be able to give it up.🔽The result of🔽purifying that is the essence that appears as the actual body of the family

original: de gnas su dag pa'i 'bras bu ni rin po che'i rigs kyi sku dngos su snang ba'i ngo bor grub pa yin la /
analyzed: de gnas su dag pa'i 'bras bu ni rin po che'i rigs kyi sku dngos su snang ba'i ngo bor grub pa yin la /
translated: of jewels.🔽The pride of affliction is also the same as the pride of feeling,

original: nyon mongs pa'i nga rgyal yang nga rgyal rnam pa bdun dang ldan pa tshor ba'i nga rgyal nyid dang mtshungs shing dbyer med pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i nga rgyal yang nga rgyal rnam pa bdun dang ldan pa tshor ba'i nga rgyal nyid dang mtshungs shing dbyer med pa ste /
translated: endowed with the seven types of pride.🔽The result of purifying that pride

original: de yang dag pa'i nga @89b rgyal chen po gnas su dag pa'i 'bras bu ni rin po che'i rigs zhes bya ba'i ngo bor grub pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang dag pa'i nga @89b rgyal chen po gnas su dag pa'i 'bras bu ni rin po che'i rigs zhes bya ba'i ngo bor grub pa yin te /
translated: is the essence that is called the family of jewels.

original: che ba'i yon tan thams cad kyis gzhan zil gyis gnon cing chos thams cad la khyad par 'phags pa'i nga rgyal dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: che ba'i yon tan thams cad kyis gzhan zil gyis gnon cing chos thams cad la khyad par 'phags pa'i nga rgyal dang ldan pa ste /
translated: One has the pride that is superior to all others in all great qualities and is exalted above all phenomena.

original: dper na rin po che lta bu'i yon tan 'thob pa'i rigs su gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: dper na rin po che lta bu'i yon tan 'thob pa'i rigs su gyur pa yin no //
translated: For example, one is born into the family of those who attain the qualities of a precious gem.

original: da ni zhus tshig nyi shu gcig pa /
analyzed: da ni zhus tshig nyi shu gcig pa /
translated: Now, the twenty-first question:

original: 'dod chags zhes bgyi ji ltar lags //
analyzed: 'dod chags zhes bgyi ji ltar lags //
translated: What is called “desire” is what?

original: zhes bya ba'i lan du /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i lan du /
translated: The answer:

original: 'du shes 'dod chags bdag nyid ni /
analyzed: 'du shes 'dod chags bdag nyid ni /
translated: The nature of perception and desire

original: dngos po la ni chags pa'i mtshan //🔽zhes gsungs te /🔽de la 'du shes ni rgya chung ba dang rgya che ba dang tshad med pa ste 'du shes kyi phung po ni dkar po la sogs pa'i mtshan ma dang mngon rtags su bzung nas dngos po de la chags shing zhen pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pas nyon mongs
analyzed: dngos po la ni chags pa'i mtshan // zhes gsungs te / de la 'du shes ni rgya chung ba dang rgya che ba dang tshad med pa ste 'du shes kyi phung po ni dkar po la sogs pa'i mtshan ma dang mngon rtags su bzung nas dngos po de la chags shing zhen pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pas nyon mongs
translated: is the sign of attachment to things.

original: pa 'dod chags nyid dang mtshan nyid mtshungs shing dbyer med pa ste /
analyzed: pa 'dod chags nyid dang mtshan nyid mtshungs shing dbyer med pa ste /
translated: In this regard, perception is limited, vast, and limitless. The aggregate of perception is the characteristic of attachment to and clinging to things, having apprehended the signs and indications of white, etc. Therefore, it is similar in characteristic to the affliction of desire and is inseparable from it.

original: de lta bu'i 'du shes kyi phung po gnas su dag pa'i 'bras bu ni padma'i rigs kyi sku dngos su snang ba'i ngo bor grub pa yin la /
analyzed: de lta bu'i 'du shes kyi phung po gnas su dag pa'i 'bras bu ni padma'i rigs kyi sku dngos su snang ba'i ngo bor grub pa yin la /
translated: The result of the purification of the aggregate of perception in this way is the accomplishment of the essence that appears as the form of the lotus family.

original: phyin ci log gi 'dod chags zhen pa'i mtshan nyid can yang dag pa'i 'dod chags chen po gnas su dag pa'i 'bras bu ni padma'i rigs zhes bya ba'i ngo bor grub pa yin la /
analyzed: phyin ci log gi 'dod chags zhen pa'i mtshan nyid can yang dag pa'i 'dod chags chen po gnas su dag pa'i 'bras bu ni padma'i rigs zhes bya ba'i ngo bor grub pa yin la /
translated: The result of the purification of the great passion of attachment to distorted passion is the accomplishment of the essence called the lotus family.

original: ye shes dang thugs rjes chos nyid dang sems can la chags pa ste /
analyzed: ye shes dang thugs rjes chos nyid dang sems can la chags pa ste /
translated: It is the passion for the nature of reality and sentient beings through pristine awareness and compassion.

original: dpe padma 'dam las skyes kyang 'bum gyi nyes pas ma gos pa lta bur gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: dpe padma 'dam las skyes kyang 'bum gyi nyes pas ma gos pa lta bur gyur pa yin no //
translated: It is like the example of a lotus that is born from the mud but is not sullied by the faults of the hundred thousand petals.

original: zhus tshig nyi shu gnyis pa /
analyzed: zhus tshig nyi shu gnyis pa /
translated: The twenty-second reply to a question🔽is the response to the question,

original: phrag dog zhes bgyi ji ltar lags //
analyzed: phrag dog zhes bgyi ji ltar lags //
translated: “What is called ‘jealousy’?”

original: zhes pa'i lan du /
analyzed: zhes pa'i lan du /
translated: The reply is:

original: 'du byed rtag tu phrag dog ste //🔽rtse gcig bdag nyid gtong ba'o //
analyzed: 'du byed rtag tu phrag dog ste // rtse gcig bdag nyid gtong ba'o //
translated: “Formations are always jealous,

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: but one-pointedness is the giving of oneself.”

original: 'du byed ni sems dang ldan pa'i 'du byed lnga bcu rtsa gcig dang / sems dang mi ldan pa bcu bzhis bsdus pa ni 'du byed kyi phung po ste /
analyzed: 'du byed ni sems dang ldan pa'i 'du byed lnga bcu rtsa gcig dang / sems dang mi ldan pa bcu bzhis bsdus pa ni 'du byed kyi phung po ste /
translated: This is the aggregate of formation.🔽This is always envy.

original: de ni rtag tu phrag dog ces bya ba 'du byed sems pas bskyod nas lnga kun du 'gro ba dang 'grogs te lnga yul so sor nges par yul ma 'dres par rtse gcig tu bdag nyid gtong bas 'du byed dang nyon mongs pa phrag dog mtshungs shing dbyer🔽med pa ste //
analyzed: de ni rtag tu phrag dog ces bya ba 'du byed sems pas bskyod nas lnga kun du 'gro ba dang 'grogs te lnga yul so sor nges par yul ma 'dres par rtse gcig tu bdag nyid gtong bas 'du byed dang nyon mongs pa phrag dog mtshungs shing dbyer med pa ste //
translated: The five omnipresent mental formations and the five object- determining mental formations are similar to and inseparable from the afflictive emotion of envy, because they are all formations that are moved by the formation of intention and they are all formations that give up their own individual objects without mixing them.

original: de la 'du byed kyi phung po gnas su dag pa ni las kyi rigs kyi sku dngos su snang ba'i ngo bor grub pa yin la /🔽nyon mongs pa'i phrag dog @90a * //
analyzed: de la 'du byed kyi phung po gnas su dag pa ni las kyi rigs kyi sku dngos su snang ba'i ngo bor grub pa yin la / nyon mongs pa'i phrag dog @90a * //
translated: The aggregate of formation is purified in its own place as the accomplishment of the essence that appears as the body of the karma family.

original: gzhan gyi phun sum tshogs pa la 'khrul pa /
analyzed: gzhan gyi phun sum tshogs pa la 'khrul pa /
translated: The afflictive emotion of envy is the delusion about the excellence of others.

original: gnas su dag pa'i 'bras bu ni las kyi rigs kyi ngo bor grub pa yin te /
analyzed: gnas su dag pa'i 'bras bu ni las kyi rigs kyi ngo bor grub pa yin te /
translated: The result of purifying that in its own place is the accomplishment of the essence of the karma family.

original: yang dag pa'i phrag dog 'phags pa mchod pa dang / sems can gyi don bya ba'i las kun bdag gcig po 'ba' zhig gis bya'i /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i phrag dog 'phags pa mchod pa dang / sems can gyi don bya ba'i las kun bdag gcig po 'ba' zhig gis bya'i /
translated: The right kind of envy is to think, “I alone, all by myself, will make offerings to the noble ones and perform all the activities that benefit sentient beings.

original: gzhan gyis byar mi gzhug go bsam pa de ltar gyur to //
analyzed: gzhan gyis byar mi gzhug go bsam pa de ltar gyur to //
translated: I will not let anyone else do it.”

original: de la mtshan nyid kyi theg pas phung po lnga dang nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid so sor ston te /
analyzed: de la mtshan nyid kyi theg pas phung po lnga dang nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid so sor ston te /
translated: In the Vehicle of Characteristics, the characteristics of the five skandhas and the afflictions are taught individually.

original: nyon mongs pa sems las byung bar bshad la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa sems las byung bar bshad la /
translated: The afflictions are explained to be mental factors.

original: theg pa'am rgyud 'di'i bzhed kyis kyang de skad bshad pa'i skabs kyang yod na /
analyzed: theg pa'am rgyud 'di'i bzhed kyis kyang de skad bshad pa'i skabs kyang yod na /
translated: In this vehicle or tantra, there are also occasions when it is explained in that way.

original: spyir phung po lnga dang nyon mongs pa lnga mtshungs shing tha mi dad par bshad de /
analyzed: spyir phung po lnga dang nyon mongs pa lnga mtshungs shing tha mi dad par bshad de /
translated: In general, the five skandhas and the five afflictions are explained to be the same and not different.

original: de'i gtan tshigs rgyud phyi ma 'di las 'di skad gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i gtan tshigs rgyud phyi ma 'di las 'di skad gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The reason for that is stated in the Later Tantra:

original: rigs kyang rgyu'i dbang du byas nas ni gti mug gi rigs zhes bya bar brjod la /
analyzed: rigs kyang rgyu'i dbang du byas nas ni gti mug gi rigs zhes bya bar brjod la /
translated: Also, from the perspective of the cause, the family is called the “family of delusion.”

original: 'bras bu rnam par dag pa'i dbang du byas nas ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs zhes bya bar brjod do //
analyzed: 'bras bu rnam par dag pa'i dbang du byas nas ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs zhes bya bar brjod do //
translated: From the perspective of the pure result, it is called the “family of the tathāgatas.”🔽These are also explained in the first chapter, in the section on the emergence of the maṇḍala, as “the supreme of the supreme families of delusion” and so on.

original: 'di dag kyang le'u dang po las dkyil 'khor 'thon pa'i skabs su gti mug gi rigs mchog gi yang mchog ces bya ba dang / de bas na nyon mongs pa gti mug gcig pu gnas su dag pa las yang dag pa'i gti mug de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs gcig pur gyur du zad kyi nyon mongs pa gti mug kyang nyon mongs pa 'dod chags la sogs pa gzhan du ma'i ngo bor gnas🔽pa ma yin la /
analyzed: 'di dag kyang le'u dang po las dkyil 'khor 'thon pa'i skabs su gti mug gi rigs mchog gi yang mchog ces bya ba dang / de bas na nyon mongs pa gti mug gcig pu gnas su dag pa las yang dag pa'i gti mug de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs gcig pur gyur du zad kyi nyon mongs pa gti mug kyang nyon mongs pa 'dod chags la sogs pa gzhan du ma'i ngo bor gnas pa ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, since the single affliction of delusion is purified in its own place, it is the single family of the tathāgatas, the correct delusion. The affliction of delusion is not established as the essence of the many other afflictions, such as desire.

original: de rnam par dag pa'i rigs kyang rnam pa du mar 'gyur ba 'grub pa ma yin pas na /
analyzed: de rnam par dag pa'i rigs kyang rnam pa du mar 'gyur ba 'grub pa ma yin pas na /
translated: Also, the family that is its purification is not established as many aspects.

original: rigs ni gnyis su med bstan te //
analyzed: rigs ni gnyis su med bstan te //
translated: Therefore, the family is explained as nondual.

original: zhes bya ba'i don yang rigs lnga kun la sbyar te bshad la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don yang rigs lnga kun la sbyar te bshad la /
translated: The meaning of that is applied to all five families.

original: rgyu zhes bya ba gnyis su grags //
analyzed: rgyu zhes bya ba gnyis su grags //
translated: The cause is renowned as two.

original: zhes bya ba'i don yang rigs lnga kun la sbyar te bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don yang rigs lnga kun la sbyar te bshad par bya'o //
translated: The meaning of this should be explained as applying to all five families.

original: rgyu ma dag pa gnyis dang 'bras bu dag pa rnam gnyis te /
analyzed: rgyu ma dag pa gnyis dang 'bras bu dag pa rnam gnyis te /
translated: There are two impure causes and two pure results.

original: rgyu yang sku'i rgyu dang rigs kyi rgyu'o //
analyzed: rgyu yang sku'i rgyu dang rigs kyi rgyu'o //
translated: The causes are the cause of the body and the cause of the family.

original: 'bras bu yang sku'i ngo bo dang rigs kyi ngo bor grub pa'i 'bras bur rig par bya'o //🔽'o na lha gcig gi rgyud la yang rigs gsum dang lnga tshang bar gsungs na /
analyzed: 'bras bu yang sku'i ngo bo dang rigs kyi ngo bor grub pa'i 'bras bur rig par bya'o // 'o na lha gcig gi rgyud la yang rigs gsum dang lnga tshang bar gsungs na /
translated: The results are the result of the body and the result of the family.

original: 'dir 'di ltar bstan pa /
analyzed: 'dir 'di ltar bstan pa /
translated: Well then, if it is taught that the three or five families are complete in the continuum of a single deity,

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: why is it taught in this way?

original: bsdu ba'i dbang du bshad pa'i dus na rigs gcig la mang po tshang zhing 'du bar yang bshad la /
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dbang du bshad pa'i dus na rigs gcig la mang po tshang zhing 'du bar yang bshad la /
translated: When explained from the perspective of inclusion, it is explained that many are complete and included in a single family.

original: rnam par phye @90b ba'i dbang du bshad na /
analyzed: rnam par phye @90b ba'i dbang du bshad na /
translated: When explained from the perspective of differentiation,

original: sku gsung thugs la sogs pa so sor phye nas re rer bgrangs te bstan pa yang yod pas de ltar bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: sku gsung thugs la sogs pa so sor phye nas re rer bgrangs te bstan pa yang yod pas de ltar bstan pa yin la /
translated: it is taught by counting each individually, differentiating body, speech, mind, and so on.

original: 'di'i skabs su rigs lnga dang / rigs kyi bdag po'am /
analyzed: 'di'i skabs su rigs lnga dang / rigs kyi bdag po'am /
translated: In this context, there are the five families, the lords of the families,

original: dang po rigs kyi khungs bya ba de dang drug tu bzhed pas de'i gzhung sgrub pa'i don tu 'di ltar bstan te /
analyzed: dang po rigs kyi khungs bya ba de dang drug tu bzhed pas de'i gzhung sgrub pa'i don tu 'di ltar bstan te /
translated: Since it is asserted that there are six, this is explained in order to establish the text.

original: gzhan gyi skabs su bsdu ba dang dbye bar 'dod pa 'byung ba'i tshe na yang gang ltar 'dod pa de'i dbang du byas nas bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi skabs su bsdu ba dang dbye bar 'dod pa 'byung ba'i tshe na yang gang ltar 'dod pa de'i dbang du byas nas bshad par bya ste /
translated: When it is desired to include or divide the other topics, one should explain according to the desire of the individual.

original: 'dis bkag pa med do //
analyzed: 'dis bkag pa med do //
translated: There is no contradiction with this.

original: da ni zhus tshig nyi shu gsum pa /
analyzed: da ni zhus tshig nyi shu gsum pa /
translated: Now, the twenty-third reply to the question

original: rdo rje'i sngags ni ji ltar lags //
analyzed: rdo rje'i sngags ni ji ltar lags //
translated: is, “What is the vajra mantra?”

original: zhes zhus pa'i lan du ;🔽srid pa 'byung ba thams cad du //
analyzed: zhes zhus pa'i lan du ; srid pa 'byung ba thams cad du //
translated: The reply to that is🔽“The nature of bodhicitta

original: byang chub sems kyi rang bzhin no //🔽'dod chags zhe sdang ldan pa yi //
analyzed: byang chub sems kyi rang bzhin no // 'dod chags zhe sdang ldan pa yi //
translated: is in all the appearances of existence.”🔽“Desire is said to be the mind

original: 'dod pa sems su gsungs pa ste //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dod pa sems su gsungs pa ste //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: that possesses attachment and anger.”

original: de la srid pa 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa lnga dang / phung po rnam pa lnga po skye bar srid pa dang gnas par srid pa dang / 'chi bar srid pa gsum gyi dngos por skye zhing 'byung ba 'di dag thams cad chos nyid skye ba med pa'i ngag du rig pa ni byang chub sems kyi rang bzhin yul chos kyi dbyings su gnas pa yin la /
analyzed: de la srid pa 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa lnga dang / phung po rnam pa lnga po skye bar srid pa dang gnas par srid pa dang / 'chi bar srid pa gsum gyi dngos por skye zhing 'byung ba 'di dag thams cad chos nyid skye ba med pa'i ngag du rig pa ni byang chub sems kyi rang bzhin yul chos kyi dbyings su gnas pa yin la /
translated: The arising of existence refers to the five afflictions and the five aggregates. The arising and occurrence of all these things, which arise as the three existences of existence at birth, existence in the present, and existence at death, are recognized as being of the nature of nonarising dharmatā.

original: 'dod chags zhe sdang bya ba 'dod pa lnga la sogs pa'i yul yid du 'ong ba la chags shing zhen te /
analyzed: 'dod chags zhe sdang bya ba 'dod pa lnga la sogs pa'i yul yid du 'ong ba la chags shing zhen te /
translated: Attachment and aversion are attachment and clinging to desirable objects such as the five objects of desire.

original: blang zhing zhen na /
analyzed: blang zhing zhen na /
translated: If one clings to what is taken up,

original: blang zhing dbang du bya bar 'dod pa ni dbang du bya ba'i las so //
analyzed: blang zhing dbang du bya bar 'dod pa ni dbang du bya ba'i las so //
translated: the desire to take up and control is the activity of controlling.

original: dgra la sogs pa yul yid du mi 'ong ba la zhe sdang ba 'joms shing 'jigs pa'am spang bar 'dod pa'i sems ni drag po mngon spyod kyi las te las bzhi dang phra mo tha dad pa mang po rnams kyang yul bzang ngan la chags sdang rnam pa🔽gnyis skye ba blang dor gyi dbang du gsungs te /
analyzed: dgra la sogs pa yul yid du mi 'ong ba la zhe sdang ba 'joms shing 'jigs pa'am spang bar 'dod pa'i sems ni drag po mngon spyod kyi las te las bzhi dang phra mo tha dad pa mang po rnams kyang yul bzang ngan la chags sdang rnam pa gnyis skye ba blang dor gyi dbang du gsungs te /
translated: The mind that wishes to destroy and eliminate aversion to unpleasant objects such as enemies and so on is the wrathful activity of direct action.🔽The many subtle different activities are taught to be under the power of adopting and rejecting, the two that arise from attachment and aversion to good and bad objects.

original: 'di gnyis su 'du ba la de ltar 'dod chags zhe sdang dang ldan pa'i bsam pas spong len du 'dod pa de ni yul las sdang bas sems su gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di gnyis su 'du ba la de ltar 'dod chags zhe sdang dang ldan pa'i bsam pas spong len du 'dod pa de ni yul las sdang bas sems su gsungs pa ste /
translated: The mind is said to be averse to objects because of the desire to adopt and reject with a thought that possesses attachment and aversion.

original: ye shes kyi rang bzhin du rig par bya'o //🔽don dbyings dang ye shes de ltar yin pa las kyang mi mnga' la de yang gcig gi ngo bor gcig gnas pa las mi 'da' ba dang / de'i rtags yab yum thabs dang shes rab zung du 'brel pa'i skur snang ba @91a * //
analyzed: ye shes kyi rang bzhin du rig par bya'o // don dbyings dang ye shes de ltar yin pa las kyang mi mnga' la de yang gcig gi ngo bor gcig gnas pa las mi 'da' ba dang / de'i rtags yab yum thabs dang shes rab zung du 'brel pa'i skur snang ba @91a * //
translated: It should be known to be the nature of pristine consciousness.🔽The meaning of the dhātu and pristine consciousness is also not possessed in that way.

original: las mi 'da' bas na dam tshig ces bya /
analyzed: las mi 'da' bas na dam tshig ces bya /
translated: Since it never goes beyond the nature of one abiding as one, and the sign of that is the appearance of the kāya of the method and wisdom of the male and female in union, it is called “samaya.”

original: sna tshogs 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sna tshogs 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The line “the various appearances are similar”

original: yul sna tshogs par snang ba ni chos kyi dbyings kyi gzugs brnyan /
analyzed: yul sna tshogs par snang ba ni chos kyi dbyings kyi gzugs brnyan /
translated: means that the various appearances of objects are the reflections of the dharmadhatu.

original: dam tshig gi phyag rgya shes rab yum gyi sku snang la /
analyzed: dam tshig gi phyag rgya shes rab yum gyi sku snang la /
translated: The appearance of the body of the pledge seal, the wisdom consort,

original: sems kyi rnam pa sna tshogs par skye ba ni ye shes kyi gzugs brnyan /
analyzed: sems kyi rnam pa sna tshogs par skye ba ni ye shes kyi gzugs brnyan /
translated: and the various appearances of the mind arising are the reflections of wisdom.

original: yab thabs kyi phyag rgya chen por snang ste /
analyzed: yab thabs kyi phyag rgya chen por snang ste /
translated: The appearance of the father, the great seal of method,

original: sems yul la 'jug pa ni thabs dang shes rab zung du 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: sems yul la 'jug pa ni thabs dang shes rab zung du 'brel pa'o //
translated: and the mind engaging with objects are the union of method and wisdom.

original: de ltar na don dbyings dang ye shes dbyer med par 'dra zhing mtshungs shing rtags thabs dang shes rab kyang 'dra zhing mtshungs pas na de lta bu'i rtog pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang ldan na /
analyzed: de ltar na don dbyings dang ye shes dbyer med par 'dra zhing mtshungs shing rtags thabs dang shes rab kyang 'dra zhing mtshungs pas na de lta bu'i rtog pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang ldan na /
translated: Thus, the meaning is that the dhatu and wisdom are similar and equal, and the signs, method and wisdom, are also similar and equal.

original: mngon par phyogs pa las skyes 'bras //
analyzed: mngon par phyogs pa las skyes 'bras //
translated: The result born from the approach

original: zhes te / don dbyings dang ye shes la mngon par phyogs pa las skyes pa'i 'bras bu ni rtags thabs dang shes rab zung du 'brel par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes te / don dbyings dang ye shes la mngon par phyogs pa las skyes pa'i 'bras bu ni rtags thabs dang shes rab zung du 'brel par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the result born of the mind that is directed toward the object, the expanse and pristine awareness, is the sign, the accomplishment of the union of means and knowledge.

original: 'dod chags dang ldan pa'i sems kyi dbang gis las la mngon par phyogs pa las skyes pa'i 'bras bu ni yid du 'od ba bdag gir byas nas dang du len par 'grub par 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang ldan pa'i sems kyi dbang gis las la mngon par phyogs pa las skyes pa'i 'bras bu ni yid du 'od ba bdag gir byas nas dang du len par 'grub par 'gyur la /
translated: The result born of the mind that is directed toward action out of desire is the accomplishment of the acceptance of what is pleasant, having made it one's own.

original: zhe sdang dang ldan pa'i sems kyis drag po'i las la mngon par phyogs pa las skyes pa'i 'bras bu ni yul yid du mi 'od ba 'joms shing 'jig par byas nas spong zhing dor du yod pa'i las grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhe sdang dang ldan pa'i sems kyis drag po'i las la mngon par phyogs pa las skyes pa'i 'bras bu ni yul yid du mi 'od ba 'joms shing 'jig par byas nas spong zhing dor du yod pa'i las grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: The result born of the mind that is directed toward violent action out of hatred is the accomplishment of the action of abandoning and rejecting, having destroyed and annihilated the unpleasant object.

original: gnyis med chos kyi ye shes la //
analyzed: gnyis med chos kyi ye shes la //
translated: In the pristine awareness of nondual Dharma

original: zhes bya ba de ltar thabs dang shes rab chags sdang spong len du lta ba gnyis su med de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba de ltar thabs dang shes rab chags sdang spong len du lta ba gnyis su med de /
translated: Thus, the view of means and knowledge as desire and hatred, as abandonment and acceptance, is nondual.

original: chos nyid mtshan ma med pa'i dad las ma g-yos pas ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes su gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: chos nyid mtshan ma med pa'i dad las ma g-yos pas ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes su gyur pa yin la /
translated: Since one does not waver from the faith of signless dharmatā, one becomes the gnosis of the dharmadhātu.

original: de'i dus na phyi rol gyi yul la chags sdang gi dbang gis nga rgyal du spyad kyang mngon par zhen pa'i rtog pa med pas yul sems dbyings dang ye shes su rtogs pas ye shes chos kyi dbyings las mi g-yo mi rtog pas /
analyzed: de'i dus na phyi rol gyi yul la chags sdang gi dbang gis nga rgyal du spyad kyang mngon par zhen pa'i rtog pa med pas yul sems dbyings dang ye shes su rtogs pas ye shes chos kyi dbyings las mi g-yo mi rtog pas /
translated: At that time, although one engages in pride through the power of attachment and aversion to external objects, since there is no concept of clinging, one realizes objects and mind as the dhātu and gnosis, respectively.

original: chos nyid mi rtog pa'i dad du rmongs pas yang dag pa'i gti mug chen po zhes bya ste /🔽chos kyi sku 'thob po drag po'i las kyi dus su yul sems mi mthun pa thug pa ni dbyings dang ye shes phrad pa ste /
analyzed: chos nyid mi rtog pa'i dad du rmongs pas yang dag pa'i gti mug chen po zhes bya ste / chos kyi sku 'thob po drag po'i las kyi dus su yul sems mi mthun pa thug pa ni dbyings dang ye shes phrad pa ste /
translated: Since one does not waver from the gnosis of the dharmadhātu, one is called “the great, utterly pure delusion” because of being deluded by the faith of nonconceptual dharmatā.🔽At the time of the karma of wrath, the meeting of incompatible objects and mind is the meeting of the dhātu and gnosis.

original: drag po'i las rtsom pa ni yul sems su rtog pa'i mtshan ma la khro bas de la ni tha snyad du //
analyzed: drag po'i las rtsom pa ni yul sems su rtog pa'i mtshan ma la khro bas de la ni tha snyad du //
translated: The composition of wrathful karma is the anger toward the signs of conceptual mind and objects.

original: @91b zhe sdang zhes ni bstan pa yin //
analyzed: @91b zhe sdang zhes ni bstan pa yin //
translated: That is called “anger” conventionally.

original: zhes bya ba ste yang dag pa'i zhe sdang chen po'i rang bzhin chos kyi skur grub pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste yang dag pa'i zhe sdang chen po'i rang bzhin chos kyi skur grub pa'o //
translated: Thus, the nature of right great hatred is established as the dharmakāya.

original: dbang gi las brtsams pa'i dus su yul sdug pa bdag gir bya bar 'dod nas zhen cing chags pa ni ye shes chos kyi dbyings la chags pas de'i dang las mi g-yo ba ste ;
analyzed: dbang gi las brtsams pa'i dus su yul sdug pa bdag gir bya bar 'dod nas zhen cing chags pa ni ye shes chos kyi dbyings la chags pas de'i dang las mi g-yo ba ste ;
translated: When one begins the rite of subjugation, desiring to take possession of a beautiful object, attachment and desire are the attachment to the wisdom dharmadhātu, and the action of that is immovability.

original: de la ni tha snyad du /
analyzed: de la ni tha snyad du /
translated: Conventionally,

original: mtshan nyid 'dod chags kun zhes pa //
analyzed: mtshan nyid 'dod chags kun zhes pa //
translated: it is called “the desire of all desires.”

original: zhes bya ste yang dag pa'i 'dod chags chen po'i rang bzhin sprul pa'i skur grub pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ste yang dag pa'i 'dod chags chen po'i rang bzhin sprul pa'i skur grub pa'o //
translated: Thus, the nature of right great desire is established as the nirmāṇakāya.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ye shes 'di ni rdo rje ste //🔽zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ye shes 'di ni rdo rje ste // zhes bya ste /
translated: This wisdom is a vajra.🔽Thus,

original: de ltar yul du snang ba thams cad ni chos kyi dbyings /
analyzed: de ltar yul du snang ba thams cad ni chos kyi dbyings /
translated: all appearances as objects are the dharmadhātu.

original: sems su 'dzin pa thams cad ni rig pa'i ye shes zhe sdang drag po'i las kyis yul sems thug pa ni dbyings dang ye shes su phrad pa drag po'i las rtsom pa ni dbyings dang ye shes gnyis su med pas mtshan ma'i rtog pa la khro ba dbang
analyzed: sems su 'dzin pa thams cad ni rig pa'i ye shes zhe sdang drag po'i las kyis yul sems thug pa ni dbyings dang ye shes su phrad pa drag po'i las rtsom pa ni dbyings dang ye shes gnyis su med pas mtshan ma'i rtog pa la khro ba dbang
translated: vidya. The karma of anger toward conceptual signs is the wrathful🔽activity.🔽The mind that clings to the object of karma is attached to the dhatu of🔽dharmata.🔽This pristine consciousness that is known and realized without🔽moving from that state is the essence that is inseparable from the three

original: gi las kyi yul la sems zhen pa ni ye shes chos kyi dbyings la chags pas de'i ngang las mi g-yo bar rig cing rtogs pa'i ye shes 'di ni sku gsum dang dbyer med pa'i ngo bor grub pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i skyon du mi 'gyur bas gnod pa gzhan gyis tshur mi tshugs pas na rdo rje zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gi las kyi yul la sems zhen pa ni ye shes chos kyi dbyings la chags pas de'i ngang las mi g-yo bar rig cing rtogs pa'i ye shes 'di ni sku gsum dang dbyer med pa'i ngo bor grub pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i skyon du mi 'gyur bas gnod pa gzhan gyis tshur mi tshugs pas na rdo rje zhes bya ste /
translated: kayas. Since it is not subject to the faults of affliction, it is called🔽vajra because no one can harm it.🔽If one understands it in that way, one will not be bound, but will be

original: rdo rje'i sngags kyis dmigs te de ltar shes nas mi 'ching zhing grol ba dang grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdo rje'i sngags kyis dmigs te de ltar shes nas mi 'ching zhing grol ba dang grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: liberated and accomplished.

original: da ni zhus tshig nyi shu bzhi pa /
analyzed: da ni zhus tshig nyi shu bzhi pa /
translated: Now, the twenty-fourth reply:

original: 'di yi dga' ba ji ltar lags //
analyzed: 'di yi dga' ba ji ltar lags //
translated: What is the joy of this?

original: zhes pa'i lan du /
analyzed: zhes pa'i lan du /
translated: The reply:

original: bud med yang dag bde ba'i mchog / dga' bas shin tu longs spyod rdzogs //🔽zhes gsungs te /🔽'byung ba bzhi gnas su dag pa /🔽tshad med pa bzhi bsgoms pa'i ting nge 'dzin las su rung ba'i bag chags kyis bslang pa chos kyi dbyings kyi gzugs brnyan /
analyzed: bud med yang dag bde ba'i mchog / dga' bas shin tu longs spyod rdzogs // zhes gsungs te / 'byung ba bzhi gnas su dag pa / tshad med pa bzhi bsgoms pa'i ting nge 'dzin las su rung ba'i bag chags kyis bslang pa chos kyi dbyings kyi gzugs brnyan /
translated: the complete enjoyment through ecstasy.🔽The four goddesses who are the pledge seal, the supreme object of pristine awareness, are the reflection of the ultimate dimension of reality,

original: ye shes kyi yul dam tshig gi phyag rgya lha mo bzhir snang ba ni /
analyzed: ye shes kyi yul dam tshig gi phyag rgya lha mo bzhir snang ba ni /
translated: arisen from the habitual propensities of the serviceability of meditative absorption that comes from cultivating the four immeasurables.

original: 'jig rten pa'i las kyis bskyed pa'i bu mo rnams las khyad par du 'phags pas bud med yang dag ces bya /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i las kyis bskyed pa'i bu mo rnams las khyad par du 'phags pas bud med yang dag ces bya /
translated: They are called “perfect women” because they are superior to the girls produced by mundane ritual.

original: de dag dang gnyis su med par sbyor ba ni nyan thos chags pa spangs pa las ltos na ni bde la /
analyzed: de dag dang gnyis su med par sbyor ba ni nyan thos chags pa spangs pa las ltos na ni bde la /
translated: Their union with the practitioner, who is nondual with them, is bliss in comparison with the shravakas’ abandonment of desire,

original: so so'i skye bo chags pa rang dgar spyod pa las ltos na ni mchog ste /🔽mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin nam rang bzhin du gyur pas @92a * //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo chags pa rang dgar spyod pa las ltos na ni mchog ste / mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin nam rang bzhin du gyur pas @92a * //
translated: and it is supreme in comparison with the ordinary person’s self-indulgent enjoyment of desire.

original: na bde ba'i mchog ces bya'o //
analyzed: na bde ba'i mchog ces bya'o //
translated: It is called “supreme bliss” because it is the nature of nirvana or has become the nature of nirvana.

original: de'i dus na chos nyid dang ye shes sbyor bas don gyi dga' ba dang / thabs dang shes rab tu sbyor bas 'phral du dga' ba dang / rdo rje dang padmor sbyor bas nyams dga' ba'i ro myang ste /
analyzed: de'i dus na chos nyid dang ye shes sbyor bas don gyi dga' ba dang / thabs dang shes rab tu sbyor bas 'phral du dga' ba dang / rdo rje dang padmor sbyor bas nyams dga' ba'i ro myang ste /
translated: At that time, since the ultimate nature and pristine consciousness are united, there is the joy of the object; since method and wisdom are united, there is immediate joy; and since the vajra and lotus are united, there is the experience of the taste of joy.

original: de'i nang du phyi nang gsang ba'i mchod pa dang / sa dang pha rol du phyin pa dang / bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs la sogs pa ma lus par rdzogs shing tshang ste /
analyzed: de'i nang du phyi nang gsang ba'i mchod pa dang / sa dang pha rol du phyin pa dang / bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs la sogs pa ma lus par rdzogs shing tshang ste /
translated: Within that, all outer, inner, and secret offerings, the stages, perfections, accumulations of merit and wisdom, and so on are complete and perfect.

original: 'khor bar 'ching ba'i nyes pa med cing rnam par grol ba mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i ngo bor gnas pas sam /
analyzed: 'khor bar 'ching ba'i nyes pa med cing rnam par grol ba mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i ngo bor gnas pas sam /
translated: Since there is no fault of being bound in samsara and one abides in the essence of nonabiding nirvana,

original: de'i rang bzhin du 'gyur bas na ;🔽dga' bas shin tu longs spyod rdzogs //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin du 'gyur bas na ; dga' bas shin tu longs spyod rdzogs //
translated: one becomes the nature of that.🔽Since one is delighted, it is the sambhogakaya.

original: zhes bya ste yum dga' ba ma bzhi la nye bar longs spyod pas dgos pa thams cad tshad zhing rdzogs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ste yum dga' ba ma bzhi la nye bar longs spyod pas dgos pa thams cad tshad zhing rdzogs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Since one enjoys the four joys of the mother, all purposes are complete and perfect.

original: gnyis su na don gyi dbyings dang ye shes gnyis su med pa'i rtags /
analyzed: gnyis su na don gyi dbyings dang ye shes gnyis su med pa'i rtags /
translated: Second, the sign of the nonduality of the basic space of phenomena and timeless awareness is

original: yab yum thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med par sbyor ba'i dus na /
analyzed: yab yum thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med par sbyor ba'i dus na /
translated: that the male and female deities are in union, method and wisdom in nonduality.🔽When the male and female deities are in union,

original: yab yum gcig la gcig 'khyud pa ni mo ha ra ti ste sangs rgyas spyan gyi rang bzhin /
analyzed: yab yum gcig la gcig 'khyud pa ni mo ha ra ti ste sangs rgyas spyan gyi rang bzhin /
translated: the male and female deities embracing each other is moharati, the nature of Buddhalocana.🔽The union of the vajra and lotus is dvesharati, the nature of Mamaki.🔽The union of the faces, the enjoyment of the great bliss, is ragarati, the nature of Pāṇḍaravāsinī.

original: rdo rje dang padma sbyor ba ni dve sha ra ti ste m'a ma k'i'i rang bzhin bde ba chen po'i rol chags nas zhal sbyor ba ni r'a ga ra ti ste gos dkar mo'i rang bzhin bde ba chen po'i mtshan nyid la chags nas phyag rgya chen po'i🔽zhal sbyor du gnas pa ni badzra ra ti ste sgrol ma'i rang bzhin /
analyzed: rdo rje dang padma sbyor ba ni dve sha ra ti ste m'a ma k'i'i rang bzhin bde ba chen po'i rol chags nas zhal sbyor ba ni r'a ga ra ti ste gos dkar mo'i rang bzhin bde ba chen po'i mtshan nyid la chags nas phyag rgya chen po'i zhal sbyor du gnas pa ni badzra ra ti ste sgrol ma'i rang bzhin /
translated: The union of the faces, abiding in the great seal, is vajrarati, the nature of Tārā.

original: bde ba chen po mkha' la babs pa'i ro la zhen pa ni rang bzhin no //
analyzed: bde ba chen po mkha' la babs pa'i ro la zhen pa ni rang bzhin no //
translated: The enjoyment of the great bliss that has descended into space is the nature.

original: de lta bu'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos nyid la dga' ba chen po'i yon tan thams cad sdud pa'o ;
analyzed: de lta bu'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos nyid la dga' ba chen po'i yon tan thams cad sdud pa'o ;
translated: In that way, the great joy of the transcendent reality is the gathering of all the qualities.

original: / la la na re gong du gsungs pa'i gnyis med chos kyi ye shes la bya ba ni mo ha ra ti /
analyzed: / la la na re gong du gsungs pa'i gnyis med chos kyi ye shes la bya ba ni mo ha ra ti /
translated: Some say that the nondual wisdom of phenomena mentioned above is called moharati.

original: phan tshun thug pa ni bya ba ste dve sha ra ti /
analyzed: phan tshun thug pa ni bya ba ste dve sha ra ti /
translated: The mutual contact is called dvesharati.

original: mtshan nyid 'dod chags bya ba r'a ga ra ti /
analyzed: mtshan nyid 'dod chags bya ba r'a ga ra ti /
translated: The characteristic of desire is called ragarati.

original: ye shes de ni rdo rje bya ba badzra ra ti zhes zer na /
analyzed: ye shes de ni rdo rje bya ba badzra ra ti zhes zer na /
translated: That wisdom is called vajrarati.

original: de ni snga ma'i tshig don bzhin du rigs kyi lha mo sbyor ba 'thad par ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: de ni snga ma'i tshig don bzhin du rigs kyi lha mo sbyor ba 'thad par ma mthong ngo //
translated: However, I do not see that it is correct to apply those to the goddesses of the families as explained in the previous passage.

original: da ni zhus tshig nyi shu lnga pa /
analyzed: da ni zhus tshig nyi shu lnga pa /
translated: Now, the twenty-fifth question is:

original: phun sum tshogs pa ji ltar bshad //
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa ji ltar bshad //
translated: How is the perfection explained?

original: ces pa'i lan du /
analyzed: ces pa'i lan du /
translated: The reply is:

original: 'dod chags zhe sdang gti mug dag / rtag tu rdo rje dga' la gnas //
analyzed: 'dod chags zhe sdang gti mug dag / rtag tu rdo rje dga' la gnas //
translated: Desire, anger, and delusion always abide in vajra joy.

original: de dag sangs rgyas rnams kyi thabs //
analyzed: de dag sangs rgyas rnams kyi thabs //
translated: Those are the methods of the buddhas.

original: phyag na rdo rje zhes su bshad //🔽ces gsungs @92b te ;
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje zhes su bshad //🔽ces gsungs @92b te ;
translated: They are explained as Vajrapāṇi.

original: 'dod chags de gsung gi bdag nyid padma'i rigs dang / zhe sdang thugs kyi bdag nyid rdo rje'i rigs dang / gti mug sku'i bdag nyid de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs kyis mtshon cing des bsdus pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad spyod lam rnam bzhi rtag par dus bzhir lha mo rdo rje dga' ma bzhi'i mkha' dbyings rnam par dag pa phyi nang gi nam mkha' rnam
analyzed: 'dod chags de gsung gi bdag nyid padma'i rigs dang / zhe sdang thugs kyi bdag nyid rdo rje'i rigs dang / gti mug sku'i bdag nyid de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs kyis mtshon cing des bsdus pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad spyod lam rnam bzhi rtag par dus bzhir lha mo rdo rje dga' ma bzhi'i mkha' dbyings rnam par dag pa phyi nang gi nam mkha' rnam
translated: All the tathagatas who are included in these families are always present in the four modes of conduct in the space of the four goddesses, the pure space of Vajra Laksmi.

original: pa gsum dbyer med pa'i dkyil /
analyzed: pa gsum dbyer med pa'i dkyil /
translated: The mandala of the indivisible three-outer, inner, and essential-🔽is the celestial mansion of wisdom, the nature of the completely pure realm of phenomena.

original: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin ye shes kyi gzhal yas khang dbyibs gru bzhi la phyi mchod rten gyi tshul du grub pa /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin ye shes kyi gzhal yas khang dbyibs gru bzhi la phyi mchod rten gyi tshul du grub pa /
translated: It has the shape of a square and is formed in the manner of an outer stupa.

original: sku gsung thugs kyi ngo bo sum rim du brtsegs pa lta bur byin gyis brlabs pa'i bha ga la /
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi ngo bo sum rim du brtsegs pa lta bur byin gyis brlabs pa'i bha ga la /
translated: The nature of enlightened body, speech, and mind is blessed as a three-tiered structure in the bhaga.

original: rtag tu gsang ba'i rdo rje gsang ba'i padma la gzhag nas gnyis su med pa'i sbyor ba'i dga' ba la gnas te rtsa ba'i rgyud le'u dang po'i skabs su gsungs pa bzhin du /
analyzed: rtag tu gsang ba'i rdo rje gsang ba'i padma la gzhag nas gnyis su med pa'i sbyor ba'i dga' ba la gnas te rtsa ba'i rgyud le'u dang po'i skabs su gsungs pa bzhin du /
translated: Always place the secret vajra in the secret lotus and abide in the joy of nondual union.🔽

original: rdo rje dang padmar sbyor ba'i yon tan rnam grangs mang po dang ldan par bzhugs te /
analyzed: rdo rje dang padmar sbyor ba'i yon tan rnam grangs mang po dang ldan par bzhugs te /
translated: Always placing the secret vajra in the secret lotus, abiding in the joy of nondual union, he abides with many enumerations of qualities of the union of the vajra and lotus, as taught in the first chapter of the root tantra.🔽The bliss of all worldly beings is subsumed, and that which is superior to that is the taste of nondual transcendent bliss, which is experienced in the body.

original: 'jig rten pa'i bde ba thams cad sdud cing de las mchog tu gyur pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bde ba gnyis su med pa'i ro sku nyams su bstar ba dang / 'phags pa rnams kyis so so rang rig pa'i ye shes kyis rig cing nyams su myong ba'i reg pa nyid kyi sku nyams su bstar pa ni phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i bde ba thams cad sdud cing de las mchog tu gyur pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bde ba gnyis su med pa'i ro sku nyams su bstar ba dang / 'phags pa rnams kyis so so rang rig pa'i ye shes kyis rig cing nyams su myong ba'i reg pa nyid kyi sku nyams su bstar pa ni phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The contact that is known and experienced by the wisdom of individual knowledge of the āryas is experienced in the body.

original: ci'i phyir phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya na /
translated: Why is it called “perfect”?

original: yum yang so so'i rigs dang / kha dog dang / gtso po dang / rjes su mthun pa'i yon tan dang / sbyor ba'i yan lag brgyad la sogs pas gtso bo mnyes par byed pa'i phrin las dang bde ba mchog gi ro yab yum gnyi gas thun mong du myong bar nus pa'i rang gi nus pa'i rtsal phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yum yang so so'i rigs dang / kha dog dang / gtso po dang / rjes su mthun pa'i yon tan dang / sbyor ba'i yan lag brgyad la sogs pas gtso bo mnyes par byed pa'i phrin las dang bde ba mchog gi ro yab yum gnyi gas thun mong du myong bar nus pa'i rang gi nus pa'i rtsal phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir te /
translated: The mother is also endowed with the perfect potential to experience the taste of supreme bliss and the activity of pleasing the principal deity through her individual family, color, principal deity, corresponding qualities, eight branches of application, and so forth.

original: de dag sangs rgyas rnams kyi thabs zhes bya ba de lta bur gyur pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa de yang 'khor los sgyur ba'am /
analyzed: de dag sangs rgyas rnams kyi thabs zhes bya ba de lta bur gyur pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa de yang 'khor los sgyur ba'am /
translated: These are called the methods of the buddhas.🔽Such qualities are not established from karma, like the perfect power of a universal monarch or the great worldly gods.

original: 'jig rten pa'i lha chen po rnams kyi dbang phyug phun sum tshogs pa ltar las las grub pa ma yin gyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi ye shes kyi rnam par 'phrul pa dang / sngon gyi smon lam gyi dbang dang / 'phral du 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dus mkhyen pa'i thabs @93a * //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i lha chen po rnams kyi dbang phyug phun sum tshogs pa ltar las las grub pa ma yin gyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi ye shes kyi rnam par 'phrul pa dang / sngon gyi smon lam gyi dbang dang / 'phral du 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dus mkhyen pa'i thabs @93a * //
translated: They are the magical display of the wisdom of the tathagatas, the power of previous aspirations, and the immediate knowledge of the time to tame beings.

original: mkhas pa'i rnam par thar pa nyid de ltar bstan cing snang ba yin te /
analyzed: mkhas pa'i rnam par thar pa nyid de ltar bstan cing snang ba yin te /
translated: The life of a scholar is taught and appears in this way.

original: phyag na rdo rje zhes su bshad //
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje zhes su bshad //
translated: It is explained as Vajrapāṇi.

original: ces pa rdo rje 'dzin chen po nyid kyi ye shes dang ye shes kyi spyod yul las gzhan snang zhing grub pa ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: ces pa rdo rje 'dzin chen po nyid kyi ye shes dang ye shes kyi spyod yul las gzhan snang zhing grub pa ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the Great Vajra Holder himself is not something that appears and is established as something other than the wisdom and the domain of wisdom.

original: da ni zhus tshig nyi shu drug pa /
analyzed: da ni zhus tshig nyi shu drug pa /
translated: Now, in response to the twenty-sixth question,

original: gshin rje mthar phyin ci yi phyir //
analyzed: gshin rje mthar phyin ci yi phyir //
translated: “Why is he called ‘Yama’s Destroyer’?”

original: zhes pa'i lan du /🔽rnam par mi 'jig bdag nyid chos //
analyzed: zhes pa'i lan du / rnam par mi 'jig bdag nyid chos //
translated: it is said:🔽The nature of non-destruction,

original: mi skye ba yi ngo bo ste //
analyzed: mi skye ba yi ngo bo ste //
translated: the essence of non-arising,

original: dngos po kun gyi dam tshig pas //
analyzed: dngos po kun gyi dam tshig pas //
translated: the pledge of all things,

original: des na gshin rje mthar byed do //🔽zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: des na gshin rje mthar byed do // zhes gsungs te /
translated: therefore he is Yama’s Destroyer.

original: dper na / 'jig rten pa rnams kyi dngos po dang / mtshan ma skye 'gag can du rtog pa'i dbang gis skyes shing 'jig par 'gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: dper na / 'jig rten pa rnams kyi dngos po dang / mtshan ma skye 'gag can du rtog pa'i dbang gis skyes shing 'jig par 'gyur ba yin la /
translated: For example, worldly people think that things and signs arise and cease due to the power of arising.

original: de ltar ma rig nas chos kyi rgyal po gshin rjes phung po bshig cing tshe srog bcad pa mthong ba de las bzlog par bstan pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: de ltar ma rig nas chos kyi rgyal po gshin rjes phung po bshig cing tshe srog bcad pa mthong ba de las bzlog par bstan pa'i phyir na /
translated: In order to demonstrate that one should be liberated from the sight of the king of the Dharma, Yama, destroying the aggregates and cutting off life,

original: rnam par mi 'jig bdag nyid chos //
analyzed: rnam par mi 'jig bdag nyid chos //
translated: the nature of non-destruction is taught.

original: zhes bya ste lus sems la sogs pa'i rnam par snang ba mi 'jig par gyur pa ni bdag nyid chos nyid skye ba med pa'i don rtogs nas chos thams cad mi skye bar shes pa'i ngo bo stobs su gyur pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ste lus sems la sogs pa'i rnam par snang ba mi 'jig par gyur pa ni bdag nyid chos nyid skye ba med pa'i don rtogs nas chos thams cad mi skye bar shes pa'i ngo bo stobs su gyur pa ste /
translated: The appearance of the body, mind, and so on is not destroyed. The nature of the meaning of the nonarising dharmata is realized. The essence of knowing that all phenomena are nonarising becomes powerful.

original: dngos po kun gyi rang bzhin de ltar shes na skye 'jig med par 'gyur ba las mi 'da' bas /🔽dngos po kun gyi dam tshig pas //
analyzed: dngos po kun gyi rang bzhin de ltar shes na skye 'jig med par 'gyur ba las mi 'da' bas / dngos po kun gyi dam tshig pas //
translated: If one knows the nature of all entities in that way, one does not transcend the state of being free from arising and destruction.🔽Therefore, it is said, “the samaya of all entities.”

original: zhes bya ba ste gtan tshigs des gshin rje mthar byed ces bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste gtan tshigs des gshin rje mthar byed ces bya ste /
translated: For that reason, it is called “Yama.”

original: gshin rjes phung po bshig cing tshe srog gcod par lta ba de'i mthar phyin par byed de /
analyzed: gshin rjes phung po bshig cing tshe srog gcod par lta ba de'i mthar phyin par byed de /
translated: The view that Yama destroys the aggregates and cuts off life is perfected.

original: de ltar skye 'jig dang bral ba'i rang bzhin dang ldan pa ni ya m'anta krita ces bya ba'i snying po dang / de dang ldan pa'i khro bo de'i rang bzhin du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar skye 'jig dang bral ba'i rang bzhin dang ldan pa ni ya m'anta krita ces bya ba'i snying po dang / de dang ldan pa'i khro bo de'i rang bzhin du bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the essence called Yamāntaka, which is endowed with a nature free from origination and destruction, and the wrathful one endowed with that nature are taught.

original: da ni zhus tshig nyi shu bdun pa /
analyzed: da ni zhus tshig nyi shu bdun pa /
translated: Now, the twenty-seventh reply to the question:

original: shes rab mthar phyin ji ltar lags //
analyzed: shes rab mthar phyin ji ltar lags //
translated: How is the perfection of wisdom?

original: zhes pa'i lan du /
analyzed: zhes pa'i lan du /
translated: In response to this, the following is said.

original: rnam par mi shes bdag nyid chos //
analyzed: rnam par mi shes bdag nyid chos //
translated: The phenomena of the nature of nonrecognition🔽are the pure, supreme syllables.

original: yi ge dam pa rnam par dag / thams cad sems kyi dam tshig pas //
analyzed: yi ge dam pa rnam par dag / thams cad sems kyi dam tshig pas //
translated: Since everything is the commitment of the mind,

original: des na shes rab mthar byed rgyal //
analyzed: des na shes rab mthar byed rgyal //
translated: the victor is the one who perfects wisdom.

original: zhes gsungs te 'jig rten pas sems kyi dran rtog tshig gi smra brjod kyis mtshon nas rang dang rigs mthun pa la sgra'i tha dad kyi bye drag 'byed cing ston shes kyang de la rang bzhin med par ma rig pas chos nyid ji bzhin pa'i don ma rtogs
analyzed: zhes gsungs te 'jig rten pas sems kyi dran rtog tshig gi smra brjod kyis mtshon nas rang dang rigs mthun pa la sgra'i tha dad kyi bye drag 'byed cing ston shes kyang de la rang bzhin med par ma rig pas chos nyid ji bzhin pa'i don ma rtogs
translated: Since the world is illustrated by the words of the thoughts and memories of the mind, it is known that the different classes of sounds are distinguished and taught to those of similar class. However, since they are not recognized to be without a nature, the meaning of the nature of phenomena just as it is is not realized.

original: pas yang dag pa'i don mthong du @93b mi ster ba las bzlog par bstan pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: pas yang dag pa'i don mthong du @93b mi ster ba las bzlog par bstan pa'i phyir na /
translated: The following verse is stated to indicate the opposite of the above, that is, the way in which the reality is revealed.🔽The nature of phenomena is not consciousness.

original: rnam par mi shes bdag nyid chos //
analyzed: rnam par mi shes bdag nyid chos //
translated: The nature of phenomena is not consciousness.🔽The nature of phenomena is not consciousness.🔽The nature of phenomena is not consciousness.🔽The nature of phenomena is not consciousness.🔽The nature of phenomena is not consciousness.

analyzed: zhes bya ste rnam par 'byed mi shes pa ming dang gzugs kyis bsdus pa rnams bdag nyid kyis rang gi mtshan nyid so sor rnam par 'byed pa'i sgo nas rnam par mi gzhig par chos thams cad mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi ngo bor rig nas de'i rang
translated: The nature of phenomena is not consciousness.

original: las mi 'gyur bar gnas pa la ni yi ge zhes bya ste /🔽aaksha ra zhes sgras drangs na 'gyur ba med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: las mi 'gyur bar gnas pa la ni yi ge zhes bya ste / aaksha ra zhes sgras drangs na 'gyur ba med pa zhes bya ste /
