original: zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad ni sems su snang ba yin pas de ltar sems rang bzhin med pas yul du snang ba'i chos thams cad stong par rtogs par byas nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad ni sems su snang ba yin pas de ltar sems rang bzhin med pas yul du snang ba'i chos thams cad stong par rtogs par byas nas /
translated: Since all phenomena are appearances in the mind, in this way, by realizing that the mind is without inherent existence, all phenomena that appear as objects are realized to be empty.

original: de yi ngang la gnas par bya //
analyzed: de yi ngang la gnas par bya //
translated: One should abide in that state.

original: zhes bstan pa de yang yul sems tha dang par brtags pas mi pan te /
analyzed: zhes bstan pa de yang yul sems tha dang par brtags pas mi pan te /
translated: This is taught, but it is not suitable to investigate mind and objects separately.

original: sems rang bzhin med par rtogs nas chos thams cad kyang rang bzhin med par rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems rang bzhin med par rtogs nas chos thams cad kyang rang bzhin med par rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: When one realizes that the mind is without inherent existence, one will realize that all phenomena are without inherent existence.

original: sems kyi spyod yul chos thams cad kyi rnam par snang ba las mi 'da' sems rang bzhin med par rtogs na chos thams cad rang bzhin med par 'gyur ba las mi 'da' bas na dam tshig pas zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sems kyi spyod yul chos thams cad kyi rnam par snang ba las mi 'da' sems rang bzhin med par rtogs na chos thams cad rang bzhin med par 'gyur ba las mi 'da' bas na dam tshig pas zhes bya ste /
translated: The domain of the mind is the appearance of all phenomena. If one realizes that the mind is without inherent existence, one will not go beyond the realization that all phenomena are without inherent existence.

original: gtan tshigs ngas na pradzny'ant'a krita ni shes rab mthar phyin rgyal po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ngas na pradzny'ant'a krita ni shes rab mthar phyin rgyal po zhes bya ste /
translated: The reason is that Prajñāntā Kṛta is the king who has perfected wisdom.

original: sems rang bzhin med par rtogs pa'i shes rab kyis yul shes bya thams cad stong pa nyid du rtogs pa'i mthar phyin par byed pas shes rab thams cad kyi nang na mchog tu gyur pas na rgyal po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems rang bzhin med par rtogs pa'i shes rab kyis yul shes bya thams cad stong pa nyid du rtogs pa'i mthar phyin par byed pas shes rab thams cad kyi nang na mchog tu gyur pas na rgyal po zhes bya'o //
translated: Since the wisdom that realizes the mind to be devoid of intrinsic nature perfects the realization that all objects of knowledge are emptiness, it is the supreme among all wisdoms, and therefore it is called “king.”

original: da ni khro bo snying po'i don dang rang bzhin bstan pa'o //
analyzed: da ni khro bo snying po'i don dang rang bzhin bstan pa'o //
translated: Now, the meaning of the essence of wrath and its nature are taught.

original: da ni zhus tshig nyi shu brgyad pa /
analyzed: da ni zhus tshig nyi shu brgyad pa /
translated: Now, the twenty-eighth reply to the questions

original: padma mthar phyin ji ltar lags //
analyzed: padma mthar phyin ji ltar lags //
translated: is, “How is one perfected in the lotus?”

original: zhes pa'i lan du /
analyzed: zhes pa'i lan du /
translated: The reply is:

original: brjod du med pa'i bdag nyid chos //
analyzed: brjod du med pa'i bdag nyid chos //
translated: The nature of phenomena is inexpressible.

original: ming dang gzugs ldan ngo bo med //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs ldan ngo bo med //
translated: It has no essence that possesses name and form.

original: chos rnams kun gyi dam tshig pas //
analyzed: chos rnams kun gyi dam tshig pas //
translated: Since it is the pledge of all phenomena,

original: des na padma mthar phyin gtso //
analyzed: des na padma mthar phyin gtso //
translated: therefore, it is perfected in the lotus.

original: zhes gsungs te 'jig rten pas chos thams cad rang bzhin med pas brjod du med par mi rtogs te /🔽tshig @94a * //
analyzed: zhes gsungs te 'jig rten pas chos thams cad rang bzhin med pas brjod du med par mi rtogs te /🔽tshig @94a * //
translated: Mundane beings do not realize that all phenomena are inexpressible because they are devoid of intrinsic nature.

original: dang ming dum brjod na gcig la gcig brnga mi phrad pas tshig dang ming du brjod cing mtshan ma'i dngos por 'dzin pas dam tshig dang ming la thug pa med cing mya ngan las 'das pa'i don mi 'thob bo //
analyzed: dang ming dum brjod na gcig la gcig brnga mi phrad pas tshig dang ming du brjod cing mtshan ma'i dngos por 'dzin pas dam tshig dang ming la thug pa med cing mya ngan las 'das pa'i don mi 'thob bo //
translated: If one were to express it in words and names, since one would not meet the other in one, one would express it in words and names and would apprehend it as a thing with characteristics. Therefore, the ultimate would not be met in the name and the purpose of nirvāṇa would not be obtained.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyis chos thams cad stong pa nyid du mkhyen te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyis chos thams cad stong pa nyid du mkhyen te /
translated: The tathāgatas know all phenomena to be emptiness with the gnosis of nonduality.

original: bdag nyid kyi chos thams cad kun brtags kyi rnam pa ming dang gzugs su ldan par snang yang gzugs 'dzin rnam pa gnyis stong bas /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi chos thams cad kun brtags kyi rnam pa ming dang gzugs su ldan par snang yang gzugs 'dzin rnam pa gnyis stong bas /
translated: Although all phenomena of oneself appear as the aspect of the imaginary name and form, since the two aspects that apprehend form are empty,

original: gang gi ngo bor yang grub pa med de /
analyzed: gang gi ngo bor yang grub pa med de /
translated: there is no essence that is established as anything.

original: chos rnams kun gyi mtshan nyid ming dang gzugs kyi mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i ngo bor gnas pa las mi 'da'/
analyzed: chos rnams kun gyi mtshan nyid ming dang gzugs kyi mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i ngo bor gnas pa las mi 'da'/
translated: The characteristic of all phenomena is not beyond the essence that is free from the characteristic of name and form.

original: de ltar yin pa'i don la tshig gi brjod du med pa las mi 'da' bas na /
analyzed: de ltar yin pa'i don la tshig gi brjod du med pa las mi 'da' bas na /
translated: Since that meaning is not beyond being inexpressible in words,

original: dam tshig ces bya ste /
analyzed: dam tshig ces bya ste /
translated: it is called “samaya.”

original: gtan tshigs des na /
analyzed: gtan tshigs des na /
translated: For that reason,

original: pad m'anta krita ni padma mthar phyin rgyal zhes bya ste /
analyzed: pad m'anta krita ni padma mthar phyin rgyal zhes bya ste /
translated: Padmantakrita is the one who has reached the end of the lotus, the Victorious One.

original: tshig gi gsung rnam par 'byed kyang /
analyzed: tshig gi gsung rnam par 'byed kyang /
translated: Even though he analyzes the words of speech,🔽he does not move from the expression of the meaning of speech.

original: don gyi gsung brjod pa las mi g-yo bas rnam par dag pa'i padma lta bur gsung gi rig gi nyes pa med pa'i mthar phyin te /
analyzed: don gyi gsung brjod pa las mi g-yo bas rnam par dag pa'i padma lta bur gsung gi rig gi nyes pa med pa'i mthar phyin te /
translated: Therefore, he has reached the end of the lotus, which is free of the faults of the knowledge of speech, like a pure lotus.

original: gsung rnam par dag pa'i gtso bor gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gsung rnam par dag pa'i gtso bor gyur pa'o //
translated: He is the chief of the pure speech.

original: da ni zhus tshig nyi shu dgu pa /
analyzed: da ni zhus tshig nyi shu dgu pa /
translated: Now, the twenty-ninth reply to the question

original: bgegs mthar phyin pa ji ltar lags //
analyzed: bgegs mthar phyin pa ji ltar lags //
translated: is, “How is one who has reached the end of obstacles?”

original: zhes pa'i lan du /
analyzed: zhes pa'i lan du /
translated: The reply is

original: rnam par mi rtog bdag nyid chos ;
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog bdag nyid chos ;
translated: the Dharma of the nonconceptual nature,

original: / rang bzhin gyis ni zhi ba'i gzugs //
analyzed: / rang bzhin gyis ni zhi ba'i gzugs //
translated: the form of peace by nature,

original: rdo rje kun gyi dam tshig pas //🔽de nas bgegs mthar phyin pa'i gtso //
analyzed: rdo rje kun gyi dam tshig pas // de nas bgegs mthar phyin pa'i gtso //
translated: the pledge of all vajras.

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, he is the chief who has reached the end of obstacles.

original: 'jig rten pa ni gzung 'dzin du rtog pa'i skyon gyis 'dod pa'i dngos po la bar du gcod par byed pa'i bgegs yin par mi shes nas /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa ni gzung 'dzin du rtog pa'i skyon gyis 'dod pa'i dngos po la bar du gcod par byed pa'i bgegs yin par mi shes nas /
translated: Since worldly people do not know that obstacles are the faults of the concepts of subject and object, they are obstacles to the desired object.

original: gzung 'dzin rnam pa gnyis su rtog cing wa dang ne'u le can dang / rnam par 'jig pa dang / so gcig pa dang / de las dgyes pa dang / bi na ya ka glang mgo can la sogs pa yin par blta ba las bzlog pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: gzung 'dzin rnam pa gnyis su rtog cing wa dang ne'u le can dang / rnam par 'jig pa dang / so gcig pa dang / de las dgyes pa dang / bi na ya ka glang mgo can la sogs pa yin par blta ba las bzlog pa'i phyir na /
translated: In order to reverse the view of those who think in terms of the duality of subject and object, who are like foxes and mongooses, who are attached to the idea of disintegration, who are attached to the idea of the thirty-three, who are attached to the idea of the thirty-three gods, who are attached to the idea of the Vinayakas, the elephant-headed god, and so on,

original: rnam par mi rtog bdag nyid chos //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog bdag nyid chos //
translated: it is said, “The Dharma is nonconceptual by nature.”

original: zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ste /
translated: This means that

original: yul sems gzung 'dzin gyi rnam par mi rtog cing /
analyzed: yul sems gzung 'dzin gyi rnam par mi rtog cing /
translated: one does not conceptualize objects and mind as subject and object.

original: bdag nyid kyis chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag cing stong pa nyid kyi ngo bor ngas par rtogs pa zhi ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag cing stong pa nyid kyi ngo bor ngas par rtogs pa zhi ba zhes bya ste /
translated: One realizes that all phenomena are by nature pure and have the essence of emptiness. This is called “peace.”

original: spros pa'i mtha' thams cad dang bral ba'i cha la tha snyad du gzugs zhes gdags te /🔽mtshan ma'i dngos por @94b grub pa'am /
analyzed: spros pa'i mtha' thams cad dang bral ba'i cha la tha snyad du gzugs zhes gdags te / mtshan ma'i dngos por @94b grub pa'am /
translated: In terms of the aspect that is free from all the extremes of conceptual elaboration, it is conventionally designated as “form.”🔽It is not to be taken as something that exists as a thing with characteristics

original: gzhig tu yod pa'i gzugs yin par mi gzung ngo //
analyzed: gzhig tu yod pa'i gzugs yin par mi gzung ngo //
translated: or as form that can be destroyed.

original: de lta bu'i don ni rdo rje ltar 'dus ma byas pa'i chos nyid dang ye shes dbyer med pa ye shes kun gyi bdag nyid /🔽rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi ngang du gnas pa yin pa las gzhan du mi 'da' bas na dam tshig pas zhes pa dang / lam dang / zad pa dang / mi skye ba dang / chos dang / rjes su chos shes pa dang /
analyzed: de lta bu'i don ni rdo rje ltar 'dus ma byas pa'i chos nyid dang ye shes dbyer med pa ye shes kun gyi bdag nyid / rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi ngang du gnas pa yin pa las gzhan du mi 'da' bas na dam tshig pas zhes pa dang / lam dang / zad pa dang / mi skye ba dang / chos dang / rjes su chos shes pa dang /
translated: The meaning of such a statement is that the pledge beings are the nature of all the ten pristine awarenesses, which are the indivisibility of the unconditioned reality and pristine awareness, like a vajra.🔽They are the nature of the ten pristine awarenesses: the pristine awareness of the base, the pristine awareness of the path, the pristine awareness of exhaustion, the pristine awareness of nonarising, the pristine awareness of phenomena, the pristine awareness of the subsequent state of phenomena,

original: kun rdzob dang / pha rol gyi sems shes pa dang / sgra ji bzhin pa'i spyir btang ba'i ye shes bcu'i ngo bor gyur pa /
analyzed: kun rdzob dang / pha rol gyi sems shes pa dang / sgra ji bzhin pa'i spyir btang ba'i ye shes bcu'i ngo bor gyur pa /
translated: the pristine awareness of the conventional, the pristine awareness of the mind of another, and the pristine awareness of the power of total recall.

original: khro bo bcu'o zhes gzhan dag gleng ngo //🔽'on gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor nas gdon pa'i sngags ni /
analyzed: khro bo bcu'o zhes gzhan dag gleng ngo // 'on gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor nas gdon pa'i sngags ni /
translated: They are the nature of the ten wrathful ones.

original: bzhi las ma gsungs na /
analyzed: bzhi las ma gsungs na /
translated: If you wonder why the mantra for expelling the ten wrathful ones from the secret mandala is not mentioned in the four tantras,

original: 'dir bcu tshang bar bstan pa ci dogs shes na /
analyzed: 'dir bcu tshang bar bstan pa ci dogs shes na /
translated: it is because the ten are taught here in this tantra.

original: smras pa bzhi dbyung ba'i sngas bstan pa ni /
analyzed: smras pa bzhi dbyung ba'i sngas bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching of the mantra for expelling the four is as follows.

original: gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor dang phyi'i dkyil 'khor gyi sgo srung du dgod par gsungs la /
analyzed: gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor dang phyi'i dkyil 'khor gyi sgo srung du dgod par gsungs la /
translated: It is said that they are set forth as the door guardians of the secret mandala and the outer mandala.

original: 'dir bcur bstan pa ni srung ba'i 'khor lo'i dkyil 'khor dang / phyi'i dkyil 'khor du dgod pa dang / so so'i rnam par thar pa'i sgor gyur pa'i las dang / sgrub par tha dad pa rtsom par dgongs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir bcur bstan pa ni srung ba'i 'khor lo'i dkyil 'khor dang / phyi'i dkyil 'khor du dgod pa dang / so so'i rnam par thar pa'i sgor gyur pa'i las dang / sgrub par tha dad pa rtsom par dgongs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, they are taught to be ten because they are the mandala of the protection wheel, they are set forth in the outer mandala, they are the activities that are the doors of their individual liberation, and they are intended to be the beginning of the different compositions of the sadhana.

original: 'o na gzhan gyi sgo srung mi rung ngam zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gzhan gyi sgo srung mi rung ngam zhe na /
translated: Well then, is it not suitable for them to be the door guardians of others?

original: smras pa khro bo bzhi ni mngon par rtogs pa'i lha yin pas /
analyzed: smras pa khro bo bzhi ni mngon par rtogs pa'i lha yin pas /
translated: It is said that the four wrathful ones are the deities of the clear realizations.

original: yan lag bzhi gnas su dag pa las gyur pa'i phyir rigs mthun par 'brel te /
analyzed: yan lag bzhi gnas su dag pa las gyur pa'i phyir rigs mthun par 'brel te /
translated: Since they are the purities of the four limbs, they are related as being of the same type.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi gnas skabs na lus kyi yan lag la bsgom pa dang / gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor dang phyi'i dkyil 'khor du yang sgo srung bar rigs la ;
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi gnas skabs na lus kyi yan lag la bsgom pa dang / gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor dang phyi'i dkyil 'khor du yang sgo srung bar rigs la ;
translated: In the context of samadhi, they are cultivated on the limbs of the body, and they are suitable as the door guardians of the secret mandala and the outer mandala.

original: khro bo lhag ma drug ni mngon par rtogs pa'i lhag ma yin te /
analyzed: khro bo lhag ma drug ni mngon par rtogs pa'i lhag ma yin te /
translated: The remaining six wrathful ones are the remainder of the clear realizations.

original: rgyu'i dus na sems las byung ba'i 'du byed kyi ngo bo 'bras bu'i dus na ni lhag pa'i byang chub kyi sems las bskyed kyang ye shes kyi'am byin rlabs las byung bas mngon par rtogs pa'i lha yan lag tu gyur pa yin pas sgo srung du ni mi
analyzed: rgyu'i dus na sems las byung ba'i 'du byed kyi ngo bo 'bras bu'i dus na ni lhag pa'i byang chub kyi sems las bskyed kyang ye shes kyi'am byin rlabs las byung bas mngon par rtogs pa'i lha yan lag tu gyur pa yin pas sgo srung du ni mi
translated: placed as a gate guardian.

original: dgod la / phyi'i dkyil 'khor du spyir dgod cing /
analyzed: dgod la / phyi'i dkyil 'khor du spyir dgod cing /
translated: In general, it is placed in the outer maṇḍala.

original: las dang sgrub pa tha dad pa bya ba dag bcol zhing bsgrub par rigs so //
analyzed: las dang sgrub pa tha dad pa bya ba dag bcol zhing bsgrub par rigs so //
translated: It is suitable to be assigned and accomplish the different activities and attainments.

original: srung ba'i 'khor lo dkyil 'khor du tshang bar bkod pa yang /
analyzed: srung ba'i 'khor lo dkyil 'khor du tshang bar bkod pa yang /
translated: The complete arrangement of the protection wheel in the maṇḍala

original: rtsa ba'i rgyud dang phyi ma 'di gnyis ka las gsungs la /🔽sku mdog la sogs pa'i rim pa ni rtsa @95a * //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rgyud dang phyi ma 'di gnyis ka las gsungs la / sku mdog la sogs pa'i rim pa ni rtsa @95a * //
translated: is taught in both the Root Tantra and this Subsequent Tantra.

original: ba'i rgyud du gsungs la /
analyzed: ba'i rgyud du gsungs la /
translated: The sequence of the colors and so on is taught in the Root Tantra.

original: 'dir zhus tshig med par bcu tshang bar bstan pa yang /
analyzed: 'dir zhus tshig med par bcu tshang bar bstan pa yang /
translated: Here, the ten are taught without the question.

original: le'u dang por ni bzhir bstan /
analyzed: le'u dang por ni bzhir bstan /
translated: In the first chapter, it is taught in four topics.

original: 'og tu ni bcur bstan /
analyzed: 'og tu ni bcur bstan /
translated: Below, it is taught in ten topics.

original: 'di yang de dang mi mthun par bstan cing ci'i phyir zhes ma 'ongs pa'i dus na gzhan the tshom za bar dogs pa bsal pa dang ; gang du yang bcu ka tshang bar dgos pa grangs kyi kha bskang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di yang de dang mi mthun par bstan cing ci'i phyir zhes ma 'ongs pa'i dus na gzhan the tshom za bar dogs pa bsal pa dang ; gang du yang bcu ka tshang bar dgos pa grangs kyi kha bskang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is taught to be different from that, and in order to dispel the doubt that someone in the future might have, “Why?”

original: spyir de ltar yin yang khro bo de dag gi bye brag ngo shes par bya ba'i phyir mu rnam pa bzhir bshad de /
analyzed: spyir de ltar yin yang khro bo de dag gi bye brag ngo shes par bya ba'i phyir mu rnam pa bzhir bshad de /
translated: Although in general it is like that, in order to recognize the particularities of those wrathful ones, the four possibilities are explained.

original: mngon par rtogs pa'i lha ni yin la /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa'i lha ni yin la /
translated: The deity of manifest realization is

original: dkyil 'khor gyi lha ma yin pa ni sa'i snying po la sogs pa drug par bya ste /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi lha ma yin pa ni sa'i snying po la sogs pa drug par bya ste /
translated: not the deity of the maṇḍala. The six, Kṣitigarbha, and so on, are to be made into the sixth.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mig la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gnas su dag pa ni yin la /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gnas su dag pa ni yin la /
translated: The nature of the eyes and so on is pure in its place,

original: phyi rol du gdon pa'i sngags ma gsungs pas phyi'i dkyil 'khor de ltar yin du zin kyang mngon par rtogs pa dang sngags ma gsungs na /
analyzed: phyi rol du gdon pa'i sngags ma gsungs pas phyi'i dkyil 'khor de ltar yin du zin kyang mngon par rtogs pa dang sngags ma gsungs na /
translated: but since the external mantra to be expelled is not mentioned, even though the external maṇḍala is like that, if the manifest realization and the mantra are not mentioned,

original: khor bo yin nam ma yin snyam pa de'i phyir na ;
analyzed: khor bo yin nam ma yin snyam pa de'i phyir na ;
translated: one might wonder, “Is it wrathful or not?”

original: dgug pa'i rgyal po la sogs drug / khro bo zhes su rnam par grags //
analyzed: dgug pa'i rgyal po la sogs drug / khro bo zhes su rnam par grags //
translated: are renowned as wrathful.

original: zhes gsungs te /🔽gang du gsungs pa nyid 'dir 'gugs pa zhes smos pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te / gang du gsungs pa nyid 'dir 'gugs pa zhes smos pa'i phyir /
translated: This is stated in the same place.🔽Here, the meaning of the words “summoning” and so forth is to be understood as the mantras for expelling from the secret mandala the remaining five beginning with the king of desire.

original: 'dod pa'i rgyal po la sogs pa'i sgras lhag ma lnga bsdus pa'i gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor nas phyi rol du 'don pa'i sngags su zin kyang khor bo yin par nges zhes pa'i don du /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i rgyal po la sogs pa'i sgras lhag ma lnga bsdus pa'i gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor nas phyi rol du 'don pa'i sngags su zin kyang khor bo yin par nges zhes pa'i don du /
translated: The meaning of the words “wrathful” is to be understood as the mantras for expelling the remaining five beginning with the king of desire.

original: de bzhin du lhag ma gzhan nas bstan pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: de bzhin du lhag ma gzhan nas bstan pa'i phyir na /
translated: Similarly, the remaining ones are taught in the following:🔽The five beginning with earth,

original: sa la sogs pa lnga dag dang // rdo rje la sogs dam tshig drug /'byung dang 'byung las gyur bstan pa //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa lnga dag dang // rdo rje la sogs dam tshig drug /'byung dang 'byung las gyur bstan pa //
translated: and the six commitments beginning with vajra, are taught as the elements and the derivative,

original: rig pa'i rgyal po yin par grags //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽de la sa la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni gleng gzhi'i le'u las /
analyzed: rig pa'i rgyal po yin par grags // zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / de la sa la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni gleng gzhi'i le'u las /
translated: and are renowned as the kings of awareness.

original: sa rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa lnga la bya'o //
analyzed: sa rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa lnga la bya'o //
translated: Here, the meaning of the words “beginning with earth” is to be understood as the five beginning with earth, which are taught in the nidana chapter:

original: rdo rje la sogs dam tshig ces bya ba ni //
analyzed: rdo rje la sogs dam tshig ces bya ba ni //
translated: Earth is Vajrasattva, and so forth.🔽The meaning of the words “commitments beginning with vajra” is to be understood as the six commitments beginning with vajra, which are taught in the chapter on the commitments:

original: dam tshig rdo rje byang chub sems spang bar dka' ba rdo rje lta bu /🔽sems kyi rgyud la zhen cing dbyi bar mi nus pa dang ldan pa'i sems can thams cad la bdag nyid kyi nyon mongs pa gnas su dag pa'i ye shes kyi rdo rje zhen cing rnam par sbyangs nas /
analyzed: dam tshig rdo rje byang chub sems spang bar dka' ba rdo rje lta bu / sems kyi rgyud la zhen cing dbyi bar mi nus pa dang ldan pa'i sems can thams cad la bdag nyid kyi nyon mongs pa gnas su dag pa'i ye shes kyi rdo rje zhen cing rnam par sbyangs nas /
translated: The pledge of the vajra of enlightened mind, which is difficult to abandon, is like a vajra.🔽The vajra of timeless awareness, which is the natural purity of one’s own afflictive states, is attached to the mind stream of all beings and cannot be removed.

original: sems can de dag thams cad kyi sgo gsum gyi las dang nyon mongs par bcas pa rnam par dag par byed do //
analyzed: sems can de dag thams cad kyi sgo gsum gyi las dang nyon mongs par bcas pa rnam par dag par byed do //
translated: This timeless awareness is the vajra that is attached to and thoroughly purifies the mind streams of all beings, and so it purifies the karmic patterns and afflictive states of all beings, in all their aspects.

original: de @95b ltar sems can thams cad kyi sgo gsum gyi las dang nyon mongs pa dag par byas bas dag pa de las skyes pa'i 'bras bu ni bdag nyid khro bo bgegs mthar byed kyi sku mtshan mar snang ba grub pa yin la /
analyzed: de @95b ltar sems can thams cad kyi sgo gsum gyi las dang nyon mongs pa dag par byas bas dag pa de las skyes pa'i 'bras bu ni bdag nyid khro bo bgegs mthar byed kyi sku mtshan mar snang ba grub pa yin la /
translated: In this way, the result that arises from that purity—the form of one’s own awareness as the wrathful deity Vidarana, the one who brings obstacles to an end—is accomplished, appearing as an identifiable phenomenon.

original: gzhan la yang de lta bu'i skur skyed par byed do //
analyzed: gzhan la yang de lta bu'i skur skyed par byed do //
translated: This is also the way in which the form of the deity is developed in others.

original: de ltar khro bo bzhi'i don zhus nas bshad pas mtshon nas khro bo phyi ma drug kyang ma zhus bzhin du de'i zhor la bshad pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: de ltar khro bo bzhi'i don zhus nas bshad pas mtshon nas khro bo phyi ma drug kyang ma zhus bzhin du de'i zhor la bshad pa'i phyir na /
translated: Having thus requested the meaning of the four wrathful deities, the explanation is given. The remaining six wrathful deities are not requested, but are explained as a supplement.

original: gzung ba dang ni dga' ba dang // de bzhin tshul dang mi g-yo dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu dag dang ni //
analyzed: gzung ba dang ni dga' ba dang // de bzhin tshul dang mi g-yo dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu dag dang ni //
translated: The six, which are apprehended, delight, and likewise, method, immovability, cause, and effect,

original: drug po thugs las yang dag 'byung //
analyzed: drug po thugs las yang dag 'byung //
translated: are truly produced from the mind.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: And so forth.

original: gzung ba ni yul dngos por ma grub pa'i chos nyid la 'dzin pa'i sems ma grub pa'i ye shes kyis gnyis su med par rtogs pa ste 'dod pa'i rgyal bo'o //
analyzed: gzung ba ni yul dngos por ma grub pa'i chos nyid la 'dzin pa'i sems ma grub pa'i ye shes kyis gnyis su med par rtogs pa ste 'dod pa'i rgyal bo'o //
translated: Apprehending is the realization of nonduality by the pristine wisdom of the mind that does not exist apprehending the reality of the object that does not exist as an entity.

original: de'i don la dga' ba ni gtong mi phod par zhen pa ste /
analyzed: de'i don la dga' ba ni gtong mi phod par zhen pa ste /
translated: Delight in that object is attachment that cannot bear to let it go.

original: dbyig pa sngon po can no //
analyzed: dbyig pa sngon po can no //
translated: This is the blue-staffed one.

original: tshul ni de dang rjes su mthun par de la 'jug pa ste stobs po che'o //
analyzed: tshul ni de dang rjes su mthun par de la 'jug pa ste stobs po che'o //
translated: Method is engaging in that in accordance with it. This is Mahakala.

original: mi g-yo ba ni don de mngon du byas pa'i ngan la ngas pa las gzhan du mi g-yo ba ste /
analyzed: mi g-yo ba ni don de mngon du byas pa'i ngan la ngas pa las gzhan du mi g-yo ba ste /
translated: Immovability is not moving from the bliss of the realization of that object.

original: mi g-yo mgon po'o //
analyzed: mi g-yo mgon po'o //
translated: Akṣobhya.

original: de ltar yul sems gnyis su med par rtogs pa'i ye shes de yang rgyud padma lta bur 'khor ba'i nyes pa dag pa las 'khrungs shing byung bas na rgyu de'i ngo bo ni gtsug tor 'khor los sgyur ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar yul sems gnyis su med par rtogs pa'i ye shes de yang rgyud padma lta bur 'khor ba'i nyes pa dag pa las 'khrungs shing byung bas na rgyu de'i ngo bo ni gtsug tor 'khor los sgyur ba'o //
translated: Thus, that pristine consciousness which realizes the nonduality of object and mind arises from the purity of the faults of samsāra, like a lotus. Therefore, the essence of that cause is Uṣṇīṣa Cakravartin.

original: nyes pa dag pa'i 'bras bur gyur pa ni ye shes rnam par dag pa'i thugs su grub pas de lta bu'i 'bras bu'i ngo bo ni gnod mdzes chen po'o //
analyzed: nyes pa dag pa'i 'bras bur gyur pa ni ye shes rnam par dag pa'i thugs su grub pas de lta bu'i 'bras bu'i ngo bo ni gnod mdzes chen po'o //
translated: The result of purity is the mind of pure pristine consciousness. The essence of such a result is Mahābhairava.

original: drug po sems las yang dag 'byung //
analyzed: drug po sems las yang dag 'byung //
translated: The six arise from the mind.

original: zhes bya ba ni khro bo de dag sems las 'byung ba'i chos gnas su gyur pa'i mtshan nyid de ye shes kyi byin rlabs las byung bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni khro bo de dag sems las 'byung ba'i chos gnas su gyur pa'i mtshan nyid de ye shes kyi byin rlabs las byung bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Those wrathful ones arise from the mind, the characteristic of the dharmas that arise from the mind. They should be understood to arise from the blessing of pristine consciousness.

original: zab mo'i dbang du byas te bshad na /
analyzed: zab mo'i dbang du byas te bshad na /
translated: If explained from the perspective of the profound,

original: gtso bo yab yu thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med par sbyor ba'i dus na lag pa g-yas pas dpung pa nas bzung pa lcags kyu'i don te gshin rje gshed kyi rang bzhin /
analyzed: gtso bo yab yu thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med par sbyor ba'i dus na lag pa g-yas pas dpung pa nas bzung pa lcags kyu'i don te gshin rje gshed kyi rang bzhin /
translated: When the principal couple, method and wisdom, are united in nonduality, holding the right arm from the shoulder is the meaning of the iron hook, the nature of Yamāntaka.

original: g-yon pas 'khyud pa zhags pa'i don te gzhan gyis mi thub pa /🔽gsang ba'i dbang po sprod pa sgrog gi don te rta mgrin /
analyzed: g-yon pas 'khyud pa zhags pa'i don te gzhan gyis mi thub pa / gsang ba'i dbang po sprod pa sgrog gi don te rta mgrin /
translated: Embracing with the left is the meaning of the noose, Aparājita.🔽The secret organ is the meaning of the bell, Amṛtakuṇḍali.

original: rdo rje bskyod pa dril bu'i don te bdud rtsi 'khyil pa /🔽yum chags pa'i yul du bzung bas /
analyzed: rdo rje bskyod pa dril bu'i don te bdud rtsi 'khyil pa / yum chags pa'i yul du bzung bas /
translated: The vajra is the meaning of the vajra, Hayagrīva.

original: ting @96a * //
analyzed: ting @96a * //
translated: Since the mother is held as the object of passion,

original: nge 'dzin dam pos mi gtong bas 'dod pa'i rgyal po /
analyzed: nge 'dzin dam pos mi gtong bas 'dod pa'i rgyal po /
translated: the supreme samādhi is not released, the king of desire.

original: gnyis su med pa'i chags pa chen po'i bde ba'i ro la dbyig sngon can /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i chags pa chen po'i bde ba'i ro la dbyig sngon can /
translated: The taste of the bliss of great passion of nonduality is Nīladaṇḍa.

original: gnyis su med pa'i tshul de dang ldan pas stobs chen po /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i tshul de dang ldan pas stobs chen po /
translated: Since one possesses the method of nonduality, it is Mahābala.

original: gnyis su med pa'i ngang las gzhan du mi g-yo bar gnas pas mi g-yo mgon po'o //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i ngang las gzhan du mi g-yo bar gnas pas mi g-yo mgon po'o //
translated: Since one abides without wavering from the state of nonduality, it is Acalanātha.

original: de la gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams so so'i che ba'i yon tan dang bcas pa 'thon la ma thogs pa nyer bsdogs su gnas pa'i ngo bo ni gtsug tor 'khor los sgyur ba /
analyzed: de la gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams so so'i che ba'i yon tan dang bcas pa 'thon la ma thogs pa nyer bsdogs su gnas pa'i ngo bo ni gtsug tor 'khor los sgyur ba /
translated: The essence of the deities of the secret mandala, along with their individual great qualities, is present in the state of access concentration, without obstruction.

original: 'bras bu mngon du 'byung ba'i ngo bor gnas pa ni gnod mdzes chen po'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu mngon du 'byung ba'i ngo bor gnas pa ni gnod mdzes chen po'o //
translated: The essence of the deities of the result mandala, which is present as the actual manifestation of the result, is that of the great Sumbha.

original: drug po sems las yang dag 'byung //
analyzed: drug po sems las yang dag 'byung //
translated: The six are perfect emanations from the mind.

original: zhes bya ba ni khro bo de dag kyang gsang ba byang chub sems kyi rang bzhin don dam pa dang / kun rdzob byang chub sems rnam gnyis dang dbyer med pa las byung zhing 'thon par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni khro bo de dag kyang gsang ba byang chub sems kyi rang bzhin don dam pa dang / kun rdzob byang chub sems rnam gnyis dang dbyer med pa las byung zhing 'thon par bstan pa yin no //
translated: This indicates that these wrathful deities are taught to be emanations and perfect emanations from the two inseparable aspects of bodhicitta: ultimate bodhicitta, which is the secret nature, and relative bodhicitta.

original: gnyis su mi dge ba bcu gnas su dag pa'i 'bras bu yon tan rtags su snang bar yang bshad la /
analyzed: gnyis su mi dge ba bcu gnas su dag pa'i 'bras bu yon tan rtags su snang bar yang bshad la /
translated: It is also explained that the result of the purification of the ten nonvirtues in their two aspects is the appearance of the qualities that are their signs.

original: sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa chen po'i dang du longs spyad nas gnas su dag par bya ba'i phyir phyin ci log gi zhe sdang gi nyes pa zad nas thugs kyi rigs kyi ngo bor gyur pa /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa chen po'i dang du longs spyad nas gnas su dag par bya ba'i phyir phyin ci log gi zhe sdang gi nyes pa zad nas thugs kyi rigs kyi ngo bor gyur pa /
translated: Having enjoyed the great suffering, origin, and cessation, in order to purify the abode, the faults of inverted hatred were exhausted and became the essence of the family of enlightened mind.

original: shes bya'i yul thogs pa med par shes pa'i mthar phyin pas na shes rab mthar phyin yin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shes bya'i yul thogs pa med par shes pa'i mthar phyin pas na shes rab mthar phyin yin zhes bya'o //
translated: Since the object of knowledge is perfected without impediment, it is called the perfection of wisdom.

original: sems ni mthar byed gyur pas na //
analyzed: sems ni mthar byed gyur pas na //
translated: Since the mind is perfected,🔽the mind with subject and object, the conception of self and other, is perfected in the purification of the abode of the arising of attachment and aversion.

original: zhes bya ba ni gzung 'dzin dang bcas pa'i sems bdag gzhan du rtog pa'i chags sdang skye ba gnas su dag pa'i mthar phyin pas khro bo shes rab mthar phyin gyi sku mtshan mar gsal bar grub par gyur pa yin bas gtan tshigs des na nyon mongs mthar
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzung 'dzin dang bcas pa'i sems bdag gzhan du rtog pa'i chags sdang skye ba gnas su dag pa'i mthar phyin pas khro bo shes rab mthar phyin gyi sku mtshan mar gsal bar grub par gyur pa yin bas gtan tshigs des na nyon mongs mthar
translated: Since the perfection of wisdom is perfected, the form of Krodha-Prajnaparamita is accomplished as a clear appearance of the sign.

original: phyin gyur // zhes bya ste gzung 'dzin dang bcas pa'i sems bdag gzhan du rtog pa'i chags sdang skye ba'i nyon mongs pa zad pa'i rnam par dag pa'i mthar phyin par byas pa'o //
analyzed: phyin gyur // zhes bya ste gzung 'dzin dang bcas pa'i sems bdag gzhan du rtog pa'i chags sdang skye ba'i nyon mongs pa zad pa'i rnam par dag pa'i mthar phyin par byas pa'o //
translated: The term gone to the end means that one has gone to the end of the purity that is the exhaustion of the afflictions that arise from the attachment and aversion of conceiving of self and other, which are the mind with subject and object.🔽In order to teach the meaning of the family and the body of Padmanateśvara,

original: de ni padma mthar byed kyi rigs dang sku'i don bstan pa'i phyir na /🔽'dod chags 'dod chags longs spyod pas //
analyzed: de ni padma mthar byed kyi rigs dang sku'i don bstan pa'i phyir na / 'dod chags 'dod chags longs spyod pas //
translated: it is said:🔽By attachment to attachment,

original: 'dod chags zad phyir pad mthar phyin //🔽tshig ni mthar phyin gyur pa na //
analyzed: 'dod chags zad phyir pad mthar phyin // tshig ni mthar phyin gyur pa na //
translated: because of the exhaustion of attachment, he is Padmanateśvara.🔽The term “gone to the end”

original: snyoms 'jug mthar phyin de bzhin no //🔽zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: snyoms 'jug mthar phyin de bzhin no // zhes gsungs te /
translated: means that he has gone to the end of union.🔽The great, correct attachment to the wisdom, compassion, dharmadhātu, and the purpose of sentient beings is attachment.

original: yang dag pa'i 'dod chags chen po ye shes dang thugs rje chos kyi dbyings dang sems can gyi don la chags @96b pas log pa'i 'dod chags yul yid du 'ong ba la zhen cing gtong mi phod pa /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i 'dod chags chen po ye shes dang thugs rje chos kyi dbyings dang sems can gyi don la chags @96b pas log pa'i 'dod chags yul yid du 'ong ba la zhen cing gtong mi phod pa /
translated: The incorrect attachment to the objects that are attractive and cannot be given up

original: gnyen pos ma spangs par yang dag pa'i 'dod chags chen po'i ngang du longs spyad nas /
analyzed: gnyen pos ma spangs par yang dag pa'i 'dod chags chen po'i ngang du longs spyad nas /
translated: is enjoyed in the state of great, correct attachment without being abandoned by an antidote.

original: gnas su dag pas 'dod chags kyi nyes pa zad par byas pas ni padma mthar phyin gyi rigs kyi ngo bor gyur pas /
analyzed: gnas su dag pas 'dod chags kyi nyes pa zad par byas pas ni padma mthar phyin gyi rigs kyi ngo bor gyur pas /
translated: Since the faults of desire are eliminated by purifying the location, the essence of the family of Padmanateśvara is attained.

original: 'dod chags zad phyir bad mthar phyin //
analyzed: 'dod chags zad phyir bad mthar phyin //
translated: Since desire is exhausted, he is Padmanateśvara.

original: zhes bya'o // tshig ni mthar phyin gyur pas na //
analyzed: zhes bya'o // tshig ni mthar phyin gyur pas na //
translated: Since the words are perfected,

original: zhes bya ba ni ye shes dang thugs rje chos kyi dbyings dang / sems can gyi don la chags pa'i ngo bor bzhugs pas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ye shes dang thugs rje chos kyi dbyings dang / sems can gyi don la chags pa'i ngo bor bzhugs pas /
translated: he is called Padmanateśvara.

original: sems phyi'i yul la mi 'jug pas yul mtshon pa'i tshig ge brjod pa mi 'byung ba ste ;
analyzed: sems phyi'i yul la mi 'jug pas yul mtshon pa'i tshig ge brjod pa mi 'byung ba ste ;
translated: Since the mind does not engage in external objects, the words that illustrate objects do not occur.

original: tshig gi gsung rjod par byed pa mthar phyin pas don gyi gsung brjod pa med pa'i ngang la gnas pa'i rtags su padma mthar phyin gyi sku mchan mar gsal ba grub pas tshig gi mthar phyin zhes bya ba /
analyzed: tshig gi gsung rjod par byed pa mthar phyin pas don gyi gsung brjod pa med pa'i ngang la gnas pa'i rtags su padma mthar phyin gyi sku mchan mar gsal ba grub pas tshig gi mthar phyin zhes bya ba /
translated: Since the words that express speech are perfected, the sign of abiding in the state of inexpressible speech is the manifestation of the signless body of Padmanateśvara.

original: gsung brjod ba dang brjod pa med par mthar phyin pa ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: gsung brjod ba dang brjod pa med par mthar phyin pa ji lta ba bzhin du /
translated: Just as the perfection of speech is the perfection of expression and inexpressibility,

original: snyoms 'jug mthar phyin de bzhin no //
analyzed: snyoms 'jug mthar phyin de bzhin no //
translated: the perfection of meditative concentration is the same.

original: zhes bya ste ye shes dang thugs rjes chos kyi dbyings dang sems can gyi don la chags pa'i ngang la snyoms par 'jug pa'i ting je 'dzin yang mthar phyin par gyur pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ste ye shes dang thugs rjes chos kyi dbyings dang sems can gyi don la chags pa'i ngang la snyoms par 'jug pa'i ting je 'dzin yang mthar phyin par gyur pa ni /
translated: Thus, the perfection of the samadhi of equipoise in the state of attachment to the dharmadhatu and the benefit of sentient beings through pristine consciousness and compassion

original: khro bo padma mthar byed kyi sku mtshan mar gsal ba grub pa yin no //
analyzed: khro bo padma mthar byed kyi sku mtshan mar gsal ba grub pa yin no //
translated: is the accomplishment of the clear appearance of the form of the wrathful Padmantakrt.🔽Now, in order to explain the nature of the family of Vighnantakrt and the meaning of the body,

original: da ni bgegs mthar byed kyi rigs kyi ngo bo dang sku'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni bgegs mthar byed kyi rigs kyi ngo bo dang sku'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: it is said:

original: sgrib pa kun zad ye shes pas //
analyzed: sgrib pa kun zad ye shes pas //
translated: Since all obscurations are exhausted through pristine consciousness,

original: bgegs mthar phyin pa zhes su bshad //
analyzed: bgegs mthar phyin pa zhes su bshad //
translated: it is explained as “the perfection of obstacles.”

original: nyon mongs rdo rje zhen sems can //
analyzed: nyon mongs rdo rje zhen sems can //
translated: The vajra of afflictions is the mind of sentient beings,

original: thams cad las ni rnam dag 'gyur //🔽zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: thams cad las ni rnam dag 'gyur //🔽zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: and all are purified from karma.

original: gong du bstan blta bu'i don gyi nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / gzung 'dzin dang gzung 'dzin gyi bag chags dang bcas pa gnyen pos ma spangs par dngos su spyad pas rang bzhin gyi gnas rnam par dag bas /
analyzed: gong du bstan blta bu'i don gyi nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / gzung 'dzin dang gzung 'dzin gyi bag chags dang bcas pa gnyen pos ma spangs par dngos su spyad pas rang bzhin gyi gnas rnam par dag bas /
translated: As explained above, the afflictions and the secondary afflictions, as well as the habitual tendencies of percepts and perceivers, are not abandoned by means of an antidote.🔽

original: thar pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa ma lus pa thams cad zad par byas nas /
analyzed: thar pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa ma lus pa thams cad zad par byas nas /
translated: The afflictions and branch afflictions that were taught above, along with the habitual tendencies of apprehended object and apprehending subject, are not abandoned by means of an antidote. Rather, by directly engaging in them, all the obscurations of liberation and the knowable are exhausted without exception.🔽Having done so, one attains the wisdom that realizes the absence of intrinsic existence, which is unimpeded with regard to the objects of knowledge.

original: shes bya'i yul la chags thogs med pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes shing rang bzhin med pa'i rtogs pa'i ye shes brnyes pas bgegs mthar phyin pa'i rigs kyi ngo bor gyur pas /
analyzed: shes bya'i yul la chags thogs med pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes shing rang bzhin med pa'i rtogs pa'i ye shes brnyes pas bgegs mthar phyin pa'i rigs kyi ngo bor gyur pas /
translated: Thus, one becomes the essence of the family that has reached the end of the impediments.

original: bgegs mthar phyin pa zhes su bshad //
analyzed: bgegs mthar phyin pa zhes su bshad //
translated: This is explained as “reaching the end of the impediments.”

original: ces bya'o // nyon mongs rdo rje'i zhen @97a * //
analyzed: ces bya'o // nyon mongs rdo rje'i zhen @97a * //
translated: Sentient beings are attached to the vajra of the afflictions.

original: sems can // zhes bya ba de ltar bdag nyid gyur par ma zad nyon mongs pa lam dang gnyen pos gzhig cing bya ste /
analyzed: sems can // zhes bya ba de ltar bdag nyid gyur par ma zad nyon mongs pa lam dang gnyen pos gzhig cing bya ste /
translated: Not only does one become that, one also destroys the afflictions with the path and the antidotes.🔽The reason for that is stated in the Vighnāntakṛt

original: gtan tshigs de ni bign'anta krid la /
analyzed: gtan tshigs de ni bign'anta krid la /
translated: The reason is that it is the great bliss of🔽Vajradhara.

original: bgegs mthar phyin pa'i gtso zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bgegs mthar phyin pa'i gtso zhes bya ste /
translated: It is called the principal one that has perfected the obstructors.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis gzung 'dzin gyi rnam par rtog pa zad cing mthar phyin par gsal nus pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis gzung 'dzin gyi rnam par rtog pa zad cing mthar phyin par gsal nus pa ste /
translated: It is able to clarify the exhaustion and perfection of the concepts of percepts and perceivers through nonconceptual wisdom.

original: de ni ye shes kyi bdag nyid du gyur pas gtso zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni ye shes kyi bdag nyid du gyur pas gtso zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Since it has become the nature of wisdom, it is called the principal one.🔽Now, in order to teach the qualities of realizing those topics,

original: da ni don de dag rtogs par gyur pa'i yon tan bstan pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: da ni don de dag rtogs par gyur pa'i yon tan bstan pa'i phyir na /
translated: it is said:🔽Not destroyed, not cognized,

original: mi 'jig rnam par mi shes dang // brjod med rnam par mi rtog pa //
analyzed: mi 'jig rnam par mi shes dang // brjod med rnam par mi rtog pa //
translated: inexpressible, and nonconceptual.

original: sangs rgyas byang chub ye shes 'di //
analyzed: sangs rgyas byang chub ye shes 'di //
translated: This is the wisdom of the buddhas’ enlightenment.

original: shes nas ye shes thob par 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: shes nas ye shes thob par 'gyur // zhes gsungs te /
translated: Having understood it, one attains wisdom.

original: skye ba med pa rtogs pas mi 'jig pa dang / stong pa nyid kyi ngang la gnas pa las gzhan du mi 'gyur bas rnam par mi shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs kyi tha snyad dang bral bas brjod du med pa dang / mtshan ma'i dngos po spangs pas rnam par mi rtog ste /
analyzed: skye ba med pa rtogs pas mi 'jig pa dang / stong pa nyid kyi ngang la gnas pa las gzhan du mi 'gyur bas rnam par mi shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs kyi tha snyad dang bral bas brjod du med pa dang / mtshan ma'i dngos po spangs pas rnam par mi rtog ste /
translated: Since it is realized that there is no arising, it is not destroyed. Since it does not change into anything other than abiding in the state of emptiness, it is not cognized. Since it is free from the conventions of names and forms, it is inexpressible. Since it has abandoned the entities of signs, it is nonconceptual.

original: bzhi po de ni sangs rgyas kyis rtogs pa'i byang chub kyang de yin la //
analyzed: bzhi po de ni sangs rgyas kyis rtogs pa'i byang chub kyang de yin la //
translated: These four are the enlightenment realized by the Buddha, and

original: shes bya mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyang de yin te /
analyzed: shes bya mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyang de yin te /
translated: they are also the gnosis that knows the knowable.

original: de lta bu'i sangs rgyas kyi byang chub dang / ye shes 'di shes shing rtogs na de ltar rtog pa des 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bde ba thams cad spyi'i ngo bo dang / mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i go 'phang thob par 'gyur ro zhes bshad de /
analyzed: de lta bu'i sangs rgyas kyi byang chub dang / ye shes 'di shes shing rtogs na de ltar rtog pa des 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bde ba thams cad spyi'i ngo bo dang / mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i go 'phang thob par 'gyur ro zhes bshad de /
translated: If one understands and realizes this kind of enlightenment and gnosis of the Buddha, by realizing it in that way, one will attain all the mundane and supramundane bliss in general and the state of nonabiding nirvana.

original: de ni khro bo rnams kyi so so'i rang bzhin dang / spyan drangs pa'i sngags kyi don ston pa'o //
analyzed: de ni khro bo rnams kyi so so'i rang bzhin dang / spyan drangs pa'i sngags kyi don ston pa'o //
translated: This explains the individual natures of the wrathful ones and the meaning of the mantras for invoking them.

original: da ni rigs kyi ngo bo dang / sku'i don bstan te /
analyzed: da ni rigs kyi ngo bo dang / sku'i don bstan te /
translated: Now, the nature of the families and the meaning of the body will be taught.🔽To begin with, in order to teach the nature of the Yamântaka family and the meaning of the body,

original: de yang dang po gshin rje rigs kyi ngo bo dang sku'i don bstan pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: de yang dang po gshin rje rigs kyi ngo bo dang sku'i don bstan pa'i phyir na /
translated: it says:

original: gti mug gti mug longs spyod pas //
analyzed: gti mug gti mug longs spyod pas //
translated: Since delusion is enjoyed in delusion,

original: gti mug zang phyir gshin rje gshed //
analyzed: gti mug zang phyir gshin rje gshed //
translated: Yamântaka is for the sake of purifying delusion.

original: gzugs kyi mthar phyin gyur pas na //
analyzed: gzugs kyi mthar phyin gyur pas na //
translated: Since he has perfected the form aggregate,

original: des na shes rab mthar phyin 'gyur //
analyzed: des na shes rab mthar phyin 'gyur //
translated: Therefore, one becomes perfected in wisdom.

original: zhes gsungs te yang dag pa'i gti mug chen po rnam par mi rtog pa'i ngang du rmongs pa /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te yang dag pa'i gti mug chen po rnam par mi rtog pa'i ngang du rmongs pa /
translated: Thus, one is confused in the state of non-conceptual great, authentic delusion.🔽One is confused about the cause and effect of false delusion and the authentic meaning.

original: log pa'i gti mug rgyu dang 'bras bu dang yang dag pa'i don la rmongs pa de dag gnyen pos ma spongs par mi rtog pa'i ngang du longs spyod pas rmongs shing phyin ci log tu shes pa'i gti mug zad cing mthar @97b phyin par bya ba'i phyir na
analyzed: log pa'i gti mug rgyu dang 'bras bu dang yang dag pa'i don la rmongs pa de dag gnyen pos ma spongs par mi rtog pa'i ngang du longs spyod pas rmongs shing phyin ci log tu shes pa'i gti mug zad cing mthar @97b phyin par bya ba'i phyir na
translated: Since one enjoys those without abandoning them with an antidote in the state of non-conceptuality, one becomes perfected in the delusion of mistaken understanding.

original: gshin rje gshed kyi ngo bor grub pa yin la /
analyzed: gshin rje gshed kyi ngo bor grub pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, one becomes perfected in the essence of Yamantaka.🔽Since one becomes perfected in form,

original: gzugs ni mthar phyin gyur pas na //
analyzed: gzugs ni mthar phyin gyur pas na //
translated: one becomes perfected in the aggregate of form.

original: zhes bya ba gzugs kyi phung po zag pa dang bcas pa ma rtag pa dang sdug bsngal dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa'i rang bzhin du shes shing mthar phyen par byas pa las ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gzugs kyi phung po zag pa dang bcas pa ma rtag pa dang sdug bsngal dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa'i rang bzhin du shes shing mthar phyen par byas pa las ni /
translated: One becomes perfected in the aggregate of form by knowing and perfecting the nature of the contaminated, impermanent, suffering, empty, and selfless form aggregate.

original: zag pa med pa'i phung po gshin rje gshed kyi sku mtshan mar snang ba 'grub par 'gyur ba yin bas na /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i phung po gshin rje gshed kyi sku mtshan mar snang ba 'grub par 'gyur ba yin bas na /
translated: The appearance of the signs of the form of Yamantaka, the aggregates free from defilement, will be accomplished.

original: gtan tshigs des na shes bya mthar phyin 'gyur zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gtan tshigs des na shes bya mthar phyin 'gyur zhes bya ste /
translated: For that reason, it is said that the object of knowledge will be perfected.

original: gti mug rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes su gyur pas gzugs rang bzhin med par rtogs pas shes bya'i yul chos spyi dang / rang gi mtshan nyid ji lta ba'am ji snyed pa la mtshan mar mi rtog pas /
analyzed: gti mug rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes su gyur pas gzugs rang bzhin med par rtogs pas shes bya'i yul chos spyi dang / rang gi mtshan nyid ji lta ba'am ji snyed pa la mtshan mar mi rtog pas /
translated: Since delusion has become the nonconceptual wisdom, form is realized to be devoid of intrinsic nature. Therefore, since the object of knowledge, the general and specific characteristics of phenomena, are not conceptualized as signs,🔽the discernment of differentiation does not occur.

original: rnam par 'byed pa'i 'du shes mi 'jug pa'i phyir shes par bya ba mthar phyin /
analyzed: rnam par 'byed pa'i 'du shes mi 'jug pa'i phyir shes par bya ba mthar phyin /
translated: Therefore, the object of knowledge is perfected.

original: mi shes pa med pa'i mthar phyin par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mi shes pa med pa'i mthar phyin par gyur pa'o //
translated: The object of ignorance is perfected.🔽Now, in order to explain the meaning of the nature and body of being invincible,

original: da ni gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i ngo bo dang sku'i don bstan pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: da ni gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i ngo bo dang sku'i don bstan pa'i phyir na /
translated: it is said:

original: nyes pas nyes pa longs spyod phyir /
analyzed: nyes pas nyes pa longs spyod phyir /
translated: In order to enjoy faults as faults,

original: nyes zad shes rab mthar phyin yin //
analyzed: nyes zad shes rab mthar phyin yin //
translated: the perfection of wisdom that exhausts faults

original: sems ni mthar byed gyur pas na //
analyzed: sems ni mthar byed gyur pas na //
translated: is the one that brings the mind to an end.

original: des na nyon mongs mthar phyin gyur //
analyzed: des na nyon mongs mthar phyin gyur //
translated: Therefore, the afflictions are brought to an end.

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: nyes pa ni zhe sdang ste /
analyzed: nyes pa ni zhe sdang ste /
translated: The fault is hatred.

original: de la yang dag pa'i zhe sdang chen po mtha' gnyis la khro bas phyin ci log gi zhe sdang gzung 'dzin du rtog pas mnar sems dgu dang ldan pa gnyen pos ma spangs par yang dag pa'i zhe sdang ba /
analyzed: de la yang dag pa'i zhe sdang chen po mtha' gnyis la khro bas phyin ci log gi zhe sdang gzung 'dzin du rtog pas mnar sems dgu dang ldan pa gnyen pos ma spangs par yang dag pa'i zhe sdang ba /
translated: And the great, perfect hatred is the hatred that is not abandoned by the antidote, which has the nine kinds of malice, the hatred that is the misconception of subject and object, the hatred of anger toward the two extremes.

original: sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa drug go //🔽de dag kyang 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba lnga rnam par dag pa /
analyzed: sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa drug go // de dag kyang 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba lnga rnam par dag pa /
translated: The great being and so forth are the six.

original: sangs rgyas spyan la sogs pa'i yum dang / 'byung ba las gyur zhes bya ba ni dam tshig rdo rje la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams su bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas spyan la sogs pa'i yum dang / 'byung ba las gyur zhes bya ba ni dam tshig rdo rje la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams su bstan pa yin la /
translated: And arising is the five elements, the five mothers such as Buddhalocanā, and arising from the elements are the bodhisattvas such as Samayavajra.

original: yid gnas su dag nas mngon par byang chub pa kun du bzang po ma gtogs so //
analyzed: yid gnas su dag nas mngon par byang chub pa kun du bzang po ma gtogs so //
translated: The mind is the bodhicitta, and purified is the purification of the mind into the state of the five pristine consciousnesses.

original: de dag la ni /
analyzed: de dag la ni /
translated: And arisen is the five buddhas, the five fathers such as Ak˝hobhya.🔽 And arisen from the mind are the bodhisattvas such as Vajraratna.

original: rig pa'i rgyal por rnam par grags //🔽zhes bya ste /

analyzed: de'i rgyal po gyur pa ni yab sems dpa' rnams yin pas de skad grags zhes bya /

original: rdo rje gzugs la sogs pa drug / rdo rje bdag po zhes su bshad //🔽ces bya ba ni gzugs rdo rje'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba la @98a * //

original: sogs pa 'dod pa'i yon tan gyi lha mo rnam pa drug go //
analyzed: sogs pa 'dod pa'i yon tan gyi lha mo rnam pa drug go //
translated: The six goddesses of the sense objects are the Bodhisattva Mahasattva Vajra Form and so on.

analyzed: rdo rje ni ye shes kyi rang bzhin sems dpa' rnams yin la /
translated: The heroes are the nature of intuition,🔽and those who are their lords are Form Vajra and so on.

analyzed: de'i bdag por gyur pa ni gzugs kyi rdo rje ma la sogs pa yin pas de skad ces bya'o //

analyzed: gnyis su na rdo rje ni yab sems dpa' rnams kyi gsang ba'i rdo rje la bya la /

analyzed: de'i bdag po ni gsang ba'i padma dang ldan pa'i sems ma rnams la bya'o zhes bshad do // sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje las //

original: bdag nyid chen po 'byung ba yin //
analyzed: bdag nyid chen po 'byung ba yin //
translated: The great beings arise from the vajras of body, speech, and mind.

original: zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems rdo rje'i sku gsung thugs rdo rje las /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems rdo rje'i sku gsung thugs rdo rje las /
