analyzed: sems dpa' dang sems ma yab yum thabs dang shes rab zung du 'brel ba'i bdag nyid du gnas pa de dag 'byung zhing 'thon pa yin pas gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor du bskyed nas phyi'i dkyil 'khor du spyan 'dren pa'i dus na 'di dag la rang rang gi sngags
translated: who abides as the nature of the heroes and heroines, the union of means and wisdom. Since they emerge and emerge from that, after generating them in the secret maṇḍala, when they are invited into the outer maṇḍala, the mantras of each

original: 'byung ba rnams ni de dngos brjod pas spyan drang la rang sngags gsal bar ma gsungs pa rnams ni rgyud 'chad pa'i ston pa byang chub sems rdo rje'i sku gsung thugs rdo rje rnam pa gsum gyi snying po aom a'a: h'um zhes brjod pas phyung la phyi'i dkyil
analyzed: 'byung ba rnams ni de dngos brjod pas spyan drang la rang sngags gsal bar ma gsungs pa rnams ni rgyud 'chad pa'i ston pa byang chub sems rdo rje'i sku gsung thugs rdo rje rnam pa gsum gyi snying po aom a'a: h'um zhes brjod pas phyung la phyi'i dkyil
translated: of them are recited, and since they are invited by reciting their actual mantras, those who do not clearly recite their own mantras are invited by reciting the essence of the three vajras of the teacher who explains the tantra, the vajra body, speech, and mind of the bodhisattva Vajra: oṃ āḥ hūṃ.

original: 'khor du so so'i gnas gang yan par gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: 'khor du so so'i gnas gang yan par gzhag par bya'o //
translated: They should be placed in their respective places in the outer maṇḍala.

original: da ni zhus tshig sum cu pa //
analyzed: da ni zhus tshig sum cu pa //
translated: Now, the thirtieth reply:

original: mgon po kun du spyod pa ci //
analyzed: mgon po kun du spyod pa ci //
translated: “What is the conduct of the protector?”

original: zhes pa'i lan du /
analyzed: zhes pa'i lan du /
translated: In response to that,

original: shes rab thabs las phung po 'byung //
analyzed: shes rab thabs las phung po 'byung //
translated: the aggregates arise from wisdom and method.

original: khams dang skye mched gnyis kyis gzugs //🔽rdzogs dang rim par sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: khams dang skye mched gnyis kyis gzugs // rdzogs dang rim par sbyor ba yis //
translated: The elements and sense bases are the form.🔽The yogi/nī of mantra should be produced

original: sngags pa rnal 'byor dbyung bar bya //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sngags pa rnal 'byor dbyung bar bya // zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: by the complete and sequential union.🔽In that,

original: de la / shes rab thabs las phung po 'byung //
analyzed: de la / shes rab thabs las phung po 'byung //
translated: the aggregates arise from wisdom and method.

original: zhes bya ba ni shes rab spros pa dang bral ba dang thabs mi dmigs pa'i thugs rje chen po zung du 'brel ba las phung po lnga gnas su dag pa yab lnga'i sku dang / 'byung ba lnga gnas su dag pa ni yum lnga'i snang ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni shes rab spros pa dang bral ba dang thabs mi dmigs pa'i thugs rje chen po zung du 'brel ba las phung po lnga gnas su dag pa yab lnga'i sku dang / 'byung ba lnga gnas su dag pa ni yum lnga'i snang ba'o //
translated: The five aggregates purified in their own place are the bodies of the five male fathers, and the five elements purified in their own place are the appearances of the five female mothers.

original: de lta bu'i yab yum de gnyis kyi khams bco brgyad dang skye mched bcu gnyis kyi ngo bo ni sems dpa' dang sems ma'i gzugs phyag rgya chen po thabs dang shes rab zung du 'brel bar snang ba ste /
analyzed: de lta bu'i yab yum de gnyis kyi khams bco brgyad dang skye mched bcu gnyis kyi ngo bo ni sems dpa' dang sems ma'i gzugs phyag rgya chen po thabs dang shes rab zung du 'brel bar snang ba ste /
translated: The essence of the eighteen elements and twelve sense bases of those two male and female fathers and mothers is the form of the male and female bodhisattvas, appearing as the couple of method and wisdom, the great seal.

original: de yang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa rnam par dag pa @98b ni sems dpa' des spyad par bya ba'i yul du snang ba ni sems ma ste /
analyzed: de yang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa rnam par dag pa @98b ni sems dpa' des spyad par bya ba'i yul du snang ba ni sems ma ste /
translated: Moreover, the pure sense organs and consciousnesses are the appearance of the object to be experienced by that bodhisattva, and the mind is the female.

original: rgyu'i dus na yul sems chos nyid kyis 'brel ba de 'bras bu'i dus na rang bzhin gyis thabs dang shes rab zung du 'brel bar gnas par zad kyi /
analyzed: rgyu'i dus na yul sems chos nyid kyis 'brel ba de 'bras bu'i dus na rang bzhin gyis thabs dang shes rab zung du 'brel bar gnas par zad kyi /
translated: At the time of the cause, the object and mind are related by the nature of reality. At the time of the result, they are related as method and wisdom by nature.

original: gzhan gyis nan gyis 'brel ba lta bu ni ma yin no //🔽rdzogs dang rim par sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: gzhan gyis nan gyis 'brel ba lta bu ni ma yin no // rdzogs dang rim par sbyor ba yis //
translated: They are not related by the force of another.🔽The mantra practitioner should generate

original: sngags pas rnal 'byor dbyung bar bya //
analyzed: sngags pas rnal 'byor dbyung bar bya //
translated: yoga with the complete and sequential.

original: zhes bya ba ni lha mo de dag kyang phyag rgya chen po yan lag dang nying lag yongs su rdzogs pa /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni lha mo de dag kyang phyag rgya chen po yan lag dang nying lag yongs su rdzogs pa /
translated: The goddesses are the great seal, complete with major and minor limbs.

original: gtso bo nas 'khor gyi rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du yab yum thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med par sbyor ba gnyi ga'i phyi nang gi skye mched lha dang lha mo'i dkyil 'khor du gnas pa yang gnyis su med par zhal sbyor bar bzhugs par rig
analyzed: gtso bo nas 'khor gyi rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du yab yum thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med par sbyor ba gnyi ga'i phyi nang gi skye mched lha dang lha mo'i dkyil 'khor du gnas pa yang gnyis su med par zhal sbyor bar bzhugs par rig
translated: One should understand that the principal and retinue, in the manner of the sequence of the retinue, are the nondual union of method and wisdom, the male and female, abiding in the maṇḍala of the male and female deities of the outer and inner sources, also abiding in nondual union.

original: par bya'o // de yang gang gis she na /
analyzed: par bya'o // de yang gang gis she na /
translated: Moreover, by what?

original: sngags pas rnal 'byor dbyung bar bya //🔽zhes te gsang ba'i theg pa 'am /
analyzed: sngags pas rnal 'byor dbyung bar bya // zhes te gsang ba'i theg pa 'am /
translated: The mantra practitioner should generate the yoga.

original: rgyud 'di'i dam tshig la gnas pa'i sngags pas rang gi shes rab dang ting nge 'dzin gyis de lta bu'i dkyil 'khor rnal 'byor bzhi dang ldan par dbyung bar bya'o //
analyzed: rgyud 'di'i dam tshig la gnas pa'i sngags pas rang gi shes rab dang ting nge 'dzin gyis de lta bu'i dkyil 'khor rnal 'byor bzhi dang ldan par dbyung bar bya'o //
translated: The mantra practitioner who abides in the pledge of this tantra should generate such a maṇḍala endowed with the four yogas with his wisdom and samādhi.

original: de la rnal 'byor rnam pa bzhi ni rang bzhin gyi rnal 'byor ni rdo rje 'dzin chen po'o //
analyzed: de la rnal 'byor rnam pa bzhi ni rang bzhin gyi rnal 'byor ni rdo rje 'dzin chen po'o //
translated: The four yogas are as follows: The natural yoga is the great vajra holder.

original: grub pa'i rnal 'byor ni rigs lnga dang sems dpa' rnams so //
analyzed: grub pa'i rnal 'byor ni rigs lnga dang sems dpa' rnams so //
translated: The accomplished yoga is the five families and the heroes.

original: rjes su mthun par 'jug pa'i rnal 'byor ni yul lnga dang sems ma rnams so //
analyzed: rjes su mthun par 'jug pa'i rnal 'byor ni yul lnga dang sems ma rnams so //
translated: The yoga of engagement in accordance with the result is the five objects and the five mind-generated goddesses.

original: gnyis su na rigs lnga yab yum dang / sems dpa' dang sems ma la sogs pa zhes yab yum zung du 'brel gyi rim par sbyor bar bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis su na rigs lnga yab yum dang / sems dpa' dang sems ma la sogs pa zhes yab yum zung du 'brel gyi rim par sbyor bar bya'o //
translated: In another way, the five families, the male and female, the male and female bodhisattvas, and so forth are the male and female in union.

original: dam pa gnas pa'i rnal 'byor ni de las gzhan pa'i 'khor thams cad do //
analyzed: dam pa gnas pa'i rnal 'byor ni de las gzhan pa'i 'khor thams cad do //
translated: The yoga of abiding in the supreme is all the retinue other than that.

original: kha cig na re shes rab kyi rang bzhin 'byung ba lnga yum du snang ba dang / thabs kyi rang bzhin phung po lnga yab tu snang ba dang / khams dang skye mched kyi gzugs sems dpa' dang / sems ma'i snang ba'i rang bzhin du rtag par gnas par bsgom ba dang ;
analyzed: kha cig na re shes rab kyi rang bzhin 'byung ba lnga yum du snang ba dang / thabs kyi rang bzhin phung po lnga yab tu snang ba dang / khams dang skye mched kyi gzugs sems dpa' dang / sems ma'i snang ba'i rang bzhin du rtag par gnas par bsgom ba dang ;
translated: Some say that the nature of wisdom appearing as the five female consorts of the elements, the nature of method appearing as the five male aggregates, and the forms of the elements and sense bases are meditated upon as always abiding in the nature of the male and female bodhisattvas.

original: blo 'bring gis rdzogs pa'i skad cig tsam gyis lha yab yum so sor gsal ba 'am /
analyzed: blo 'bring gis rdzogs pa'i skad cig tsam gyis lha yab yum so sor gsal ba 'am /
translated: Those of medium intelligence meditate on the individual appearances of the male and female deities in a single instant of completion.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyis bsam mi dgos par de dag gi rang bzhin du rtag par gnas par bsgom mo //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyis bsam mi dgos par de dag gi rang bzhin du rtag par gnas par bsgom mo //
translated: Or, without needing to imagine them through concentration, they meditate on always abiding in their nature.

original: sbyor ba de lha so so'i snying po brjod pa tsam gyi sbyor bas bsgom pa'am /🔽blo tha @99a * //
analyzed: sbyor ba de lha so so'i snying po brjod pa tsam gyi sbyor bas bsgom pa'am / blo tha @99a * //
translated: The performance is the meditation by the mere recitation of the essence-mantra of each deity,

original: mas so so'i snying po dang / phyag mtshan la sogs pa'i 'phro 'du'i rim pas bskyed pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: mas so so'i snying po dang / phyag mtshan la sogs pa'i 'phro 'du'i rim pas bskyed pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis bsgom par bya'o //
translated: or by the meditation of the concentration which generates by the process of emanating and gathering the individual essence-mantras, hand-symbols, etc.

original: sngags pas de lta bu'i lha'i dkyil 'khor mtshan ma dang mtshan ma med pa dbyer med pa'i rnal 'byor pa dbyung bar bya'o zhes zer na dkyus la sbyar thabs tsam las don snga ma dang mi mthun pa med do //
analyzed: sngags pas de lta bu'i lha'i dkyil 'khor mtshan ma dang mtshan ma med pa dbyer med pa'i rnal 'byor pa dbyung bar bya'o zhes zer na dkyus la sbyar thabs tsam las don snga ma dang mi mthun pa med do //
translated: If one says that the mantrin should generate the yoga of the indivisibility of the sign and signlessness of the mandala of such a deity, it is only a method of application to the text, and there is no disagreement with the previous meaning.

original: thams cad dag par mos pa yis //
analyzed: thams cad dag par mos pa yis //
translated: With the conviction of the purity of everything,

original: 'jigs pa thams cad spangs nas su //
analyzed: 'jigs pa thams cad spangs nas su //
translated: having abandoned all fears,

original: dogs pa med pa'i sems kyis ni //
analyzed: dogs pa med pa'i sems kyis ni //
translated: with a mind free of doubts,

original: sngags pa seng ga bzhin du rgyu //
analyzed: sngags pa seng ga bzhin du rgyu //
translated: the mantrin moves about like a lion.

original: zhas bya ba ni de lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis bdag nyid kyi phung po dang skye mched lha'i dkyil 'khor du bsgoms pas //
analyzed: zhas bya ba ni de lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis bdag nyid kyi phung po dang skye mched lha'i dkyil 'khor du bsgoms pas //
translated: This means that by such a concentration, one meditates on one's own aggregates and sense-spheres as the mandala of deities.

original: yul sems gzung 'dzin du lta ba'i nyes pa'i dri ma thams cad ma lus par dag nas rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi ngang la gnas par mos pa'i sngags pa yes //
analyzed: yul sems gzung 'dzin du lta ba'i nyes pa'i dri ma thams cad ma lus par dag nas rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi ngang la gnas par mos pa'i sngags pa yes //
translated: Imagine that all the stains of the faults of viewing the object and mind as subject and object are completely purified and that you abide in the state of nonconceptual wisdom.

original: dogs pa med pa'i sems kyis ni //
analyzed: dogs pa med pa'i sems kyis ni //
translated: With a fearless mind,

original: bya ba 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga ma spangs shing bdud rtsi lnga dang lcags kyu lnga la sogs pa'i dam rdzas la spyod /
analyzed: bya ba 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga ma spangs shing bdud rtsi lnga dang lcags kyu lnga la sogs pa'i dam rdzas la spyod /
translated: without abandoning the five sense pleasures, enjoy the pledge substances such as the five nectars, the five hooks, and so on.

original: sgo gsum ji ltar spyod kyang thabs mkhas pa'i lta ba de lta bus rtog pa'i rtsa ba bcad pas /
analyzed: sgo gsum ji ltar spyod kyang thabs mkhas pa'i lta ba de lta bus rtog pa'i rtsa ba bcad pas /
translated: No matter how you act with your three doors, by cutting the root of conceptualization with such a view of skillful means,

original: des 'khor bar 'ching ba'i 'jigs pa spangs shing ngan song gsum du lhung ba'i dogs pa mad pa yin te /
analyzed: des 'khor bar 'ching ba'i 'jigs pa spangs shing ngan song gsum du lhung ba'i dogs pa mad pa yin te /
translated: you abandon the fear of being bound in samsara and the worry of falling into the three lower realms.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dper na bsreg pa'i bskal pa byung na shing nyid mer 'gyur ba dang / sgron me btegs na mun pa nyid snang bar 'gyur ba bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na bsreg pa'i bskal pa byung na shing nyid mer 'gyur ba dang / sgron me btegs na mun pa nyid snang bar 'gyur ba bzhin du /
translated: For example, when the eon of fire occurs, the trees themselves become fire, and when a lamp is raised, the darkness itself becomes light.

original: rang gi shes rab dang ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis spyod yul byas pas de dag sku dang ye shes kyi bdag nyid du rtogs pas ye shes la ye shes rol lha la lha thim pa yin pas gnod pa'i nges par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi shes rab dang ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis spyod yul byas pas de dag sku dang ye shes kyi bdag nyid du rtogs pas ye shes la ye shes rol lha la lha thim pa yin pas gnod pa'i nges par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Since one has made them the domain of one's wisdom and samādhi, one realizes them to be the nature of the kāyas and pristine consciousnesses. Since pristine consciousness plays in pristine consciousness and the deity dissolves into the deity, there is no certainty of harm.

original: 'jigs pa dang dogs pa med pa de lta bu'i sems kyis ni /
analyzed: 'jigs pa dang dogs pa med pa de lta bu'i sems kyis ni /
translated: With a mind that is free from fear and doubt,

original: sngags pa seng ge bzhin du rgyu //
analyzed: sngags pa seng ge bzhin du rgyu //
translated: the mantrin moves like a lion.

original: zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ste /
translated: As such,

original: dper na / gcan gzhan gyi rgyal po seng ge gnas gcig nas gcig tu'am gang dang gang du bgrod par 'dod pa'i gnas bsnyag cing lam na 'gro na yang skad phyung ba tsam gyis gcan gzhan phra mo thams cad zil gyis mnan cing skrag par byed la /
analyzed: dper na / gcan gzhan gyi rgyal po seng ge gnas gcig nas gcig tu'am gang dang gang du bgrod par 'dod pa'i gnas bsnyag cing lam na 'gro na yang skad phyung ba tsam gyis gcan gzhan phra mo thams cad zil gyis mnan cing skrag par byed la /
translated: for example, when a lion, the king of beasts, moves from one place to another or wherever it wishes to go, and when it goes on the path, all the other small animals are overwhelmed and frightened by just its roar.

original: rang la tshur gnod pa byed pa med do snyam pa'i sems kyis rgyu'o //
analyzed: rang la tshur gnod pa byed pa med do snyam pa'i sems kyis rgyu'o //
translated: It moves with the thought that there is no harm coming to itself.

original: de bzhin du sngags pa gang du bstan pa lta bu'i shes rab @99b dang ting nge 'dzin gyi gdeng dang ldan pa de yang 'khor ba dang ngan song gi 'jigs pa med pas sgo gsum gyis ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du mi bkag par spyod pa la rgyu
analyzed: de bzhin du sngags pa gang du bstan pa lta bu'i shes rab @99b dang ting nge 'dzin gyi gdeng dang ldan pa de yang 'khor ba dang ngan song gi 'jigs pa med pas sgo gsum gyis ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du mi bkag par spyod pa la rgyu
translated: Likewise, a mantra practitioner who has the confidence of wisdom and meditative concentration as taught in the tantras is also free from the fears of samsara and the lower realms. Therefore, the conduct of the three doors is not blocked, and one engages in whatever one wishes.🔽This is called the cause.

original: zhes bya'o // de nyid kyi phyir na /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // de nyid kyi phyir na /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: 'di la mi bya ci yang mad //
analyzed: 'di la mi bya ci yang mad //
translated: There is nothing that should not be done.

original: de bzhin mi bza' ba yang med //🔽smra ba mi bya cung zad med //🔽rtag tu mi bsam pa yang med //
analyzed: de bzhin mi bza' ba yang med // smra ba mi bya cung zad med // rtag tu mi bsam pa yang med //
translated: There is also nothing that should not be eaten.🔽There is nothing at all that should not be said.

original: ces gsungs te /🔽gsang ba'i theg pa 'di'am //
analyzed: ces gsungs te / gsang ba'i theg pa 'di'am //
translated: There is also nothing that should not be thought.🔽The yogin who enters this secret vehicle

original: rgyud 'di'i don la zhugs pa'i rnal 'byor pas lus kyi bsgul bskyod ci byas kyang phyag rgya yin pas ci 'ang bya /
analyzed: rgyud 'di'i don la zhugs pa'i rnal 'byor pas lus kyi bsgul bskyod ci byas kyang phyag rgya yin pas ci 'ang bya /
translated: or the meaning of this tantra should do anything at all, since any movement of the body is a mudra.

original: de bzhin du bza' ba dang bca' ba dang btung ba ci zos kyang dam rdzas te phyi nang gi dkyil 'khor thams cad mnyes par 'gyur ba'i nang gi sbyin sreg pas gang 'dod pa bza' btung bya /
analyzed: de bzhin du bza' ba dang bca' ba dang btung ba ci zos kyang dam rdzas te phyi nang gi dkyil 'khor thams cad mnyes par 'gyur ba'i nang gi sbyin sreg pas gang 'dod pa bza' btung bya /
translated: Likewise, whatever you eat, drink, or consume is the pledge substances, and since it is the inner fire offering that pleases all the outer and inner mandalas, eat and drink whatever you wish.

original: ngag gi smra brjod ci byas pa thams cad sngags su gyur pa las gzhan ma yin pas ngag gis gang 'dod pa bzhin du tshig smra /
analyzed: ngag gi smra brjod ci byas pa thams cad sngags su gyur pa las gzhan ma yin pas ngag gis gang 'dod pa bzhin du tshig smra /
translated: Since all your speech is mantra and nothing else, speak whatever words you wish.

original: sems kyi dran rtog thams cad kyang ma bcos par de bzhin du btang yang ting nge 'dzin las gzhan ma yin pas /
analyzed: sems kyi dran rtog thams cad kyang ma bcos par de bzhin du btang yang ting nge 'dzin las gzhan ma yin pas /
translated: Since all your mental thoughts are not other than meditative concentration,

original: thams cad bsams te de ltar byas kyang sgo gsum la'am /
analyzed: thams cad bsams te de ltar byas kyang sgo gsum la'am /
translated: even if you think and do everything,

original: sgo gsum gyi nyes pas mi gos so //
analyzed: sgo gsum gyi nyes pas mi gos so //
translated: your three doors will not be tainted by the faults of the three doors.

original: mnyam gzhag med pa'i tshul gyis ni //
analyzed: mnyam gzhag med pa'i tshul gyis ni //
translated: In the manner of nonmeditation,🔽you are always in meditative equipoise.

original: rtag pa nyid du mnyam par gzhag / thams cad sems las gang spyod pa //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid du mnyam par gzhag / thams cad sems las gang spyod pa //
translated: Whatever you experience with your mind

original: kun du spyod par bstan pa yin //
analyzed: kun du spyod par bstan pa yin //
translated: is taught to be omnipresent conduct.

original: zhes bya ba ni gong ma ltar bstan pa'i don de ltar ma yin pa zhig la ting nge 'dzin gyis nan sgyur byas nas de ltar sgrub pa ma yin /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gong ma ltar bstan pa'i don de ltar ma yin pa zhig la ting nge 'dzin gyis nan sgyur byas nas de ltar sgrub pa ma yin /
translated: This is not to say that the meaning of the above is not so, and that one should not practice it by exerting oneself in meditative concentration.

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis de lta bur gnas pa la rnal 'byor pas mnyam par gzhag par bya'i /
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis de lta bur gnas pa la rnal 'byor pas mnyam par gzhag par bya'i /
translated: The yogin should rest in equipoise on the fact that all phenomena abide by nature in this way.

original: rtog pa med pa'i tshul gyis dus dang gnas skabs rtag tu ting nge 'dzin la mnyam par bzhag ste ma rtogs pa'i don rtogs par bya ba dang / rtogs pa'i don mngon du 'gyur bar bya'o //
analyzed: rtog pa med pa'i tshul gyis dus dang gnas skabs rtag tu ting nge 'dzin la mnyam par bzhag ste ma rtogs pa'i don rtogs par bya ba dang / rtogs pa'i don mngon du 'gyur bar bya'o //
translated: By means of nonconceptualization, one should rest in equipoise in meditative concentration at all times and in all situations, so that one may realize the meaning that has not been realized and so that one may actualize the meaning that has been realized.

original: de ltar shes na sgo gsum gyi spyod pa ci spyod pa thams cad rang gi sems kyi khyad par la spyod par zad de /
analyzed: de ltar shes na sgo gsum gyi spyod pa ci spyod pa thams cad rang gi sems kyi khyad par la spyod par zad de /
translated: If one understands it in this way, all the conduct of the three doors is nothing but the conduct of the special mind.

original: rnal 'byor pa gang yang rung ba'i sems la de ltar spyod pa ni /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa gang yang rung ba'i sems la de ltar spyod pa ni /
translated: The conduct of the mind of any yogin is

original: de ni dus dang gnas skabs kun du sangs rgyas kyi spyod pa dang dbyer med pa'am mtshungs par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni dus dang gnas skabs kun du sangs rgyas kyi spyod pa dang dbyer med pa'am mtshungs par bstan pa yin no //
translated: taught to be always and in every situation inseparable from or equal to the conduct of the buddhas.

original: da ni zhus tshig sum cu gcig pa /
analyzed: da ni zhus tshig sum cu gcig pa /
translated: Now, the thirty-first verse of request:

original: de bzhin sngags kyi spyod pa ci //
analyzed: de bzhin sngags kyi spyod pa ci //
translated: What is the conduct of mantra like?

original: zhes pa'i lan du /
analyzed: zhes pa'i lan du /
translated: In response to that, it is said:

original: gang dag rgyu rkyen las byung @100a * //
analyzed: gang dag rgyu rkyen las byung @100a * //
translated: Whatever arises from causes and conditions

original: ba ; / yul dang dbang po yin par dgongs //
analyzed: ba ; / yul dang dbang po yin par dgongs //
translated: is considered to be objects and faculties.

original: de dgongs kun du bstan pa yin //
analyzed: de dgongs kun du bstan pa yin //
translated: That is taught to be the intention.

original: tra zhes bya ba skyob pa'i don //
analyzed: tra zhes bya ba skyob pa'i don //
translated: The syllable tra has the meaning of protection.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: And so forth.

original: spyir rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug gang yang rung ba re re zhing yang rkyen rnam pa bzhi bzhis bskyed de /
analyzed: spyir rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug gang yang rung ba re re zhing yang rkyen rnam pa bzhi bzhis bskyed de /
translated: In general, each of the six collections of consciousness is generated by four kinds of conditions.

original: gang zhen ; rgyu'i rkyen ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa /🔽bdag po'i rkyen ni dbang po /
analyzed: gang zhen ; rgyu'i rkyen ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa / bdag po'i rkyen ni dbang po /
translated: What are they? The causal condition is the ālaya consciousness.🔽The dominant condition is the faculty.

original: dmigs pa'i rkyen ni yul /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rkyen ni yul /
translated: The objective condition is the object.

original: de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni drug po 'gags ma thag pa'o //
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni drug po 'gags ma thag pa'o //
translated: The immediately preceding condition is the six [consciousnesses] that have just ceased.

original: de la 'dir /
analyzed: de la 'dir /
translated: Among those, here it is said:

original: gang dag rgyu rkyen las byung ba //
analyzed: gang dag rgyu rkyen las byung ba //
translated: Whatever arises from causes and conditions

original: zhes bya ba ni phyi nang gi skye mched rnams te 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug po de dag gang dang gang yang rung ba de dag gi rgyu ni so so'i dbang po rnams la bya la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni phyi nang gi skye mched rnams te 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug po de dag gang dang gang yang rung ba de dag gi rgyu ni so so'i dbang po rnams la bya la /
translated: The causes of those are the individual faculties.

original: rkyen ni de dag gi yul rnams so //
analyzed: rkyen ni de dag gi yul rnams so //
translated: The conditions are their objects.

original: rgyu rkyen de dag tshogs pa las byung ba ni rnam par shes pa rnams so //
analyzed: rgyu rkyen de dag tshogs pa las byung ba ni rnam par shes pa rnams so //
translated: The consciousnesses arise from the assembly of those causes and conditions.

original: yul dang dbang po yin par dgongs //
analyzed: yul dang dbang po yin par dgongs //
translated: The objects and faculties are considered.

original: zhes bya ba ni yul drug tu snang ba ni gzugs kyi rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i lha mo drug go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni yul drug tu snang ba ni gzugs kyi rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i lha mo drug go //
translated: The appearance of the six objects is the six goddesses, beginning with Rūpavajrā.

original: dbang po drug ni sems dpa' la sogs pa lha pho drug yin par bsam pa la ni dgongs zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dbang po drug ni sems dpa' la sogs pa lha pho drug yin par bsam pa la ni dgongs zhes bya ste /
translated: The six faculties are the six male deities, beginning with Sattvavajra.

original: rnam par shes pa ni de dag so so'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni de dag so so'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The consciousnesses are the individual pristine awarenesses that have the nature of those.

original: de dgongs kun du bstan pa yin //
analyzed: de dgongs kun du bstan pa yin //
translated: That is the consideration that is taught.

original: zhes bya ba ni de ltar bsam pa de yang lan 'ga' tsam ma yin /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de ltar bsam pa de yang lan 'ga' tsam ma yin /
translated: That consideration is not just once.

original: dus dang gnas skabs kun du bsam par bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: dus dang gnas skabs kun du bsam par bstan pa yin te /
translated: This verse shows that you should reflect on this topic at all times and in all situations.
